It will cover not only your admission to the tower climb, but most all of the other museums you will want to see in Paris. Second, you must be in fairly good physical condition to do this climb without undue effort. There are 423 (or so) steps to the top of the tower. You climb about 3/4 of the way up then stop at a walkway between the two towers. At this point, you can either continue on up to the top of one tower or go back down. The climb from there on up is steep and windy, a person of size would have a fair amount of difficulty making this climb comfortably. Also, once you start up, you must continue on to the point of the walkway between the towers. Now, once you are up, the views are magnificent! It is definitely worth the effort. Once you come down, you can go inside and see the beautiful cathedral itself.
Check it out. A famous church that you just must see for yourself. Pictures don't do it justice. If you're in Paris, this has to be on your list.

Visit on the hour to hear the bells!. Everyone knows the Notre Dame Cathedral from the iconic book and subsequent movies. Get over there with your zoom lens because the gargoyles are so cool! If you visit on the hour, you will hear the bells chime the longest but something does chime every 15 minutes. At night, it is even more stunning. If you did plan to visit inside and climb the stairs, go around the time of sunset because the skies are fabulous. The plaza in front of it is always filled with people and performers.

Gorgeous Cathedral. This is definitely a visit, but be prepared for long lines, tons of tourists and the folks who butt in at the entrance door. Once that is aside move quickly past the first part, as it is bogged down with tourists taking tons of pictures. The inside is so beautiful and just a bit overwhelming. Take a seat and just rest in the calm middle part of the church.
very beautiful. Don't miss the opportunity to visit Notre Dame while you are in Paris! It is very beautiful inside and outside.

Gorgeous church. Even if you are unable to get into the church itself due to long tourist lines - pay a visit to see the outside as it is more than worth the visit! The structure itself is amazing and the detail in it unreal! The gargoyles, the reliefs, the height and size is just amazing! Beautiful piece of Paris' history!
Must Do!. hand out with the gargoyles, chimeras and the bell, and take in the great views. Feels like you're in the heart of the city up there.

A must do in Paris. In my previous visits to Paris the mines were crazy so i didn't go up the tower. This time we got there well before opening an were amongst the first up. Well worth it. No residual crowds up the tower and the sites were fantastic. A must do but arrive about 0900 (opens 10). There is a coffee shop across the street that does a great trade in coffee and croissant!

Enormous Cathedral in the central Paris. It is a full of history, religion and architecture. Notre Dame is located in the heart of Paris. From Lourve Museum, Jardin De Luxemburg or The Patheon you can walk here. also you can be here easily by train. and it is very close to the Seine river. Cruising is a good choice.
Impressive. A must see. Be careful which time you visit, the queues to get in can be quite long. I went about 40 mins before closing time.

Long lines but worth the wait. The lines are long but the wait is well worth it. Beautiful old church, architecture is just stunning. The church is wonderful to go and walk around and just have a relaxing day
Be in shape!. Rough climb if you aren't in shape and if you don't like closed in spaces! View was awesome but so many people make you just want to get down quickly.
Well worth the long line. One of the masterpiece of archetectural feat of Paris. Well worth the long lines to go visit the towers.

If you value your hearing you won't do this. I get it. Some people love to climb up things and look around. So do I. But the bells on this church ring for one reason or another at very regular times. If you are up here, there is a good chance you are going to be exposed to a lot of loud noise while here. In addition you are going to stand in line a long time to get up here. But yes the view is pretty cool.
Sunday Mass Offered. Of course, it is beautiful and full of history. We went on a Sunday and were able to attend Mass. It was a very nice experience.

Worth the aching muscles. The gargoyles are so fun, and the view is my favorite in Paris because you can see everything. (You don't get to see the Eiffel Tower not he Eiffel Tower, obviously, so this is a better view in my opinion).
A long line...but worth it.. Do this, but go early or late. Mid day is very busy.There are no elevators so be prepared for 300 plus steps, but it is a very cool experience.

There Is Only One Notre Dame. Sitting in its mid-river [the Seine] location the centrally located cathedral is simply a remarkable example of Gothic-architecture. From the organ to the stained-glass windows and various sanctums within the cathedral, it acts as a magnet to the faithful, those who appreciate architecture, history and the magnitude of her place - both in Paris and the world.Naturally, the cathedral is a magnet for tourist and is best seen in the early morning before the throngs of tourists descend upon it. The best time of year is also when it's low tourist-season.

Gorgeous views. Beautiful views of the city from the bell towers. Very ornate carvings and craftsmanship on the double steeples. Very old structure - fascinating piece of architecture. Incredible height.
Beautiful . It's a beautiful cathedral and the entrance is free since it's still used everyday by devotees. There are lots of street music and entertainment outside.
Straight out of fiction!. Think of all of the novels which include this landmark! I have visited the interior previously, but this time I just saw it from outside. It's always a pleasure.

Beautiful church. Notre Dame is indeed an impressive 'Dame' with state-of-the art architecture. The beautiful front with its depiction of biblical figures is very detailed and artistic. You might encounter long lines to enter as they control the amount of people going in at one certain time.

WOW! There's a lot of stairs!. People must have been tiny long ago, those stairs are tight! It was worth the climb, to see Paris laid out below from between the gargoyles is an amazing experience. Highly recommended!

great, but loooong line. You must be physically fit and what is more - patient. the line goes sooooo sloooowly - even though we came 30 minutes prior to opening, we stood in the line for 2 hours - because the staff didn't come in time in the morning! but the view, the architecture are fantastic

Must visit!. You have to visit this amazing cathedral, personally I like all the details and all the time it took to be completed was completely worth it, you can take a tour by the river but you will not appreciate all the beauty of this building, this is the second time I visit, last time I went upstairs to see the chimeras (not gargoyles as everybody call them) and it is a beautiful sight
Beautiful Church!. This church is so original in its architecture and in it's essence that I went a couple of times to get more pictures, is an impressive piece of art, is a must see.

A must see. The surroundings itself is enough to take your breath away...take you time and immerse yourself in the outside surroundings. This church gave me goosebumps....so elaborate....We did not pay for the tour - but we enjoyed ourselves just slowly walking in and around the church....
Climb to the top and bring home the gargoyles pictures.. This is a must see and climbing up the stairs is worth it but don't ding the giant bell, even a little bit because it annoys the guards.
Wonderful Place to Visit. It had been almost 30 years since my last visit but it is worth the long lines and crowds to see this place. An amazing work of art.
interesting. was good to see the bells and view of Paris a fun thing to do with children or your partner beautiful building

Europe vacation . A must see awesome. We did a tour on our own and did not do the audio tour for extra $5 e. We visited around 3pm the line was long but moves quickly. The line for the tower was long and moving slow so we decided not to do it. We walked the area and found an outside market for browsing.
What incredible history and views!. Beautiful sights of the city, as well as great history! The time is line is definitely worth the views!

Wow. This is definitely worth going up on. The tower you go up on is on your left hand side as you face the church.The waiting line starts on the sidewalk along the church ground. The tower opens at 9:00 am I believe. Get there early. We waited in line for 1 hour but it was worth it.Be aware that climbing up is about 435 steps; narrow stairway but there is a railing. Coming down is about 365 steps. If you are unable to handle these steps do not try but if you do the view from the top is worth the wait in line.
Majestic. Truly magnificent. Please take the time to visit Notre-Dame it was exquisite in everything from the architecture to the interior.
Beautiful architecture. This is worth a visit, even if you don't queue to go inside. Go close to the cathedral to see the impressive and detailed architecture, it's stunning!
Must see. This is a MUST SEE place. Located in the center of Paris, this cathedral is simply splendid. Make sure you go in and take time to look upward and towards all the mozaique. Incontournable.
Heritage. Another beautiful church, was there in early sprig and schools out so we skip the tour as line was so long

Very Nice. Very good place to visit, Cathedral is really a place to go and spend a few hours in the area since there is a lot to see around the area. The Cathedral is really a nice place to see and just sit and pray. Very nice.
beautiful. I love my country very much, but I just love traveling outside of the USA....so much culture and the people are so nice and a lot of them go out of their way for you....
Five days in Paris. We visited Notre-Dame cathedral on a morning. Not so crowded. We used Rick Steves audio tour on his app as a guide. A must see in Paris.

Nice views but long wait!. Wonderful to do if you have the patience! The line was not only horrifically long but even worse, the slowest almost non moving line that I have ever seen. I could do without next time. My suggestion....go when they first open and then it would be worth it!

BEST View in Paris. So I donate to say I have not done my research on the best views in Paris but we went to the top for the first time after going to Paris on 3 previous visits and I am SO happy I went to the top. My girls got their first views of the Eiffel Tower and they were amazing!!! It is well worth the money and the time to make the climb!!!
More beautiful than inside the Cathedral. Towers are a beautiful architecture and one can tr to get the full tower in frame from different angle. We spent more time outside than the inside.

Unnecessarily long queues. Wanted to climb the notre dame towers so decided to brave the queue and get it done. Two hours later we finally got to get to the tower and, whilst it was great to get the views from the top I can't help but feel the whole thing is very poorly organised with their being rather long waits to get to each section during the tour, which explains the reason for the very long queues. Wouldn't do this tour again.

Great view. There are 2 lines: one for the towers and the other one to enter the cathedral. We didn't wait long for the towers (May 2016) using Paris Passlib. The climb up is through a narrow circular staircase (approx. 8 stories high) and can be quite taxing if you're not physically fit. Once you're at the top, the space is very narrow, but the view of Paris is quite amazing. I imagine it could get uncomfortable at the top if there is a crowd.
The Towers. A must see in Paris long lines are to be expected but it is worth the wait. If you love art and Christianity then you must go to Notre-Dome

Not worth the wait!. There are many other better attractions to see than wasting your time to get into the Notre Dame bell towers. Our wait was about 1 hour. Line moved slowly. There are approximately 387 narrow steps to get to the top. When you get to the top, the space is very narrow and its extremely crowded. There is a net all around for safety. If you're looking for a good view of Paris, nothing beats the Arc de Triomphe. The gargoyles were cool and that was pretty much it.Tip #1- Carry a water bottle when climbing the steps.Tip #2- Skip the bell towers all together and see the inside of the Notre Dame Cathedral (free of charge). We did not have to wait in line.

Impressive. An impressive piece of architecture, with an overwhelming interior. There is a very interesting short history of how the cathedral was built on the inside, visually laid out from the very beginnings. Not necessary to be a believer (I'm not) to appreciate the structure.
Iconic notre dame. Even from a car you would recognize the towers Of notre dame. The view from the towers is spectacular

Worth the climb...great views and statues!. Recommend getting in line at least 1/2 hour before opening to minimize the wait (you can grab food/water right across the street), or book a skip-the-line tour. Museum pass DOES NOT allow you to skip the line. Lots of stairs, so wear walking shoes. Best to do this on a clear day, as the views of the Paris skyline are a big part of the experience, in my opinion. You see some neat areas, including close-ups of statues and the famous gargoyles, plus you can get right under the tower bells, which is pretty neat too. Think about how this cathedral was constructed without modern tools while you walk around - quite a feat!
spectacular!. The greatest example of Gothic architecture, any visit to Paris should include a trip to Notre Dame. The view up at the towers and gargoyles is mesmerizing.

Probably among the top five landmarks in Paris.. We visited on a cold but sunny day in Paris. We did not take the inside tour as the waiting lines were far, far too long even on this chilly off season day. But just walking around it is spectacular. The plaza in front is seemingly always very busy with tourists, locals and others trying to make some money or just interact with strangers. We had three French college students approach and wanted to interview and videotape us. I also was instructed to make a drawing of my experience there all on camera. It was fun.

Is definitely worth a visit. Norte-Dame is a magnificent building and should be on everyone's bucket list if visiting Paris for the first time.the history and architure are fascinating. Go early to avoid the queues as it is a popular attraction.
not so good. i am not a history lover so my review is not for history lovers... i did not like it at all in my opinion spending a day at luxembourg gardens or eiffel towers will be better than this
a must to see in paris. be there in early morning, for there will be a long line up almost 1 hr standing before you can enter the cathedral, but it's a beautiful place
Most beautiful Cathedral. Was a bit difficult to get in if you are a wheelchair user because of a few large steps! but the staff we're helpful and inside was just as beautiful as the outside
Beautiful!. Kinda weird to be in from of the actual Notre Dame Cathedral. We met our tour guide there, he explained every statue and every piece of artwork.
Notre Dame Cathedral. Our second visit to Paris and to this Cathedral. I hope everyone who visits Paris comes to see this Cathedral because it is beautiful.

A long way to the top. 400+ steps but there was one stop mid-way for viewing which helped with the climb. Tour guide was very informative and worth the view once up top. The only disappointment was this tour did not include going into Notre Dame, so we had to do a return visit.

Beautiful church. So much history in a stunning church, get in early as crowds build up during the afternoon.
Do prepare and research before you arrive to get the full value of the visit.

Guide tour a must...best attraction in Paris. We booked a half day Notre Dame tour including skip the line tower entrance and Ile de la Citie tour through Viator. Very easy to find meeting place. Guide sets you up with headsets so you can hear him clearly. Wow, did he know his stuff! Walked through Ile de la Citie first, then continued to Notre Dame. The history that he tells you is amazing and certainly makes your visit special. You watch other people just wandering thru and think they really are missing out. The Crown of Thorns are in the Cathedral and most people pass them by. We wouldn't have seen them except for our guide pointing them out. You really need the skip the line tower ticket or you could be waiting hours. The guide takes you up into the shop and then you are free to continue up all the stairs to the top. There is no lift. Nearly 400 stairs up and then back down. But it's worth it. The view is spectacular. This tour is a MUST DO.

Don't just see the cathedral from outside..get inside the towers!. The cathedral is a beautiful architecture..but you must not miss getting inside the towers..You have to climb quite a few stairs but its very interesting to see the Belfry, the top portion of the cathedral and the view of the Swine..and the old city as they cAll it.While entry to the cathedral is free..this has a ticket. One suggestion is to explore buying the Paris museum pass..though its called a museum pass..it covers a lot of places like this one..the towers..entry into arc de triomphe..other beautiful places like the Pantheon..

Night scene. We took in the night scenes, and we stopped here. Took picture and learnt about the great cathedral...where many famous names were interred here. eg. Marie Curie...Took photo on the back lit cathedral AND on the spot/heart of Paris

do not hesitate to climb the towers!. Almost 400 steps..if I was able to do it, you will also! just have a cup of coffee before do it! no possibility to return if you are tired! You will have the best views of Paris because you will at the middle of the city, then visit the church and do a tour of I'Ile St Louis.a note:of course you will also have to climb to the top floor of the Tour Eiffel (buy the ticket online and choose the sunset time).

beutiful Church of our Lady. visit during the day and during the night, spectacular at any time of the day... a must visit landmark in Paris. go up its towers, it has a spectacular view and the excersize was good for me... don't miss it!
Stunning. Once again we were lucky to visit when an actual service was being carried out, this building is absolutly stunning.

Can't go to Paris and not see this. Don't just look outside at the front of Notre Dame. Be sure to go inside to see the architectural beauty of this famous cathedral. Also, be sure you go around the sides to see the buttresses.

Impressive. Having approached the Notre Dame Cathedral by walking alongside the Seine we were impressed by the beauty of the Cathdral and the enormity and majesty of the Cathedral Towers. We have previously been inside this wonderful Cathedral.

Notre dame cathedral. The big bus will stop just across the cathedral. I advice to come early as the que in the afternoon is horrific going to the top of the cathedral. The cathedral can get too crowded even on December. I highly recommend an early visit

Worth the wait in the queue.. We waited for about 45 minutes in the queue but it was worth the wait. Groups are small so there is plenty of time to take photos and admire the views. The gargoyles are fabulous. Great views of Paris. This is the second time I have been up the tower and it was just as good the second time.
A site to see. This is breath taking and so amazing to take pics in front of. The architecture is really something to see.

In awe of the construction and detail. Notre Dame is one of Europe's most famous church's. I try to put myself back over 700 years wonder how to go about building it. Truly remarkable. A must see when you're in Paris.
Gorgeous architecture !. The architecture of this building is very unique and exceptionally gorgeous. It is a place you have to see.
Enchanting!. We really enjoyed our visit to the Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. The history, architecture and exhibits were gorgeous and fascinating. This is a must-see on your visit to Paris!

Impressive !. A must see in Paris - architecture is superb and this is a beautiful spiritual location. I would prefer to see some of the commercial aspects hidden from view for those want to use Notre Dame as a house of God.
Unable to go inside. My husband and i were both carrying rucsacs and because of very high security we unable to go inside.which was ver y disappointing.

Beautiful. The vitros are magnificent. Also the statues and statuets on the outside of the cathedral. It is worth visiting inside as well as taking the trouble to walk all around it cause each part of it is a masterpiece of arts.

Worth the wait!. The line is long, and you will most likely have a long wait. But it is truly worth it. The views & architecture are amazing.
Plus, there are some nice places to run to to grab a coffee across the way.

My favourite place in Paris. Very pleasant place, specially during summer time. The Cathedral is amazing and FREE (of course), by the Cathedral you'll find a wonderfull cute garden by the Seine, where you can sit or observe the boats with an amazing scenery. I recommend

Wow and Wow. Absolutely worth the cue to get up here!!! Stunning views and architecture. Time - cue can be a little long but stick it out and plan ahead must see.Helpful tip- even with Paris pass still need to cue but free. Also be aware a lot of steps!!! I mean a lot 400 of the blighters. So please make sure you get step aerobics going before your trip. The older generation could struggle I'm afraid.This was my favorite building in Paris for the pure unexpected view and beautiful looks at the top. Bells- quazy modo ( hope that's spelt correct) wow!! Don't miss this it's through a little door hatch on top out of sight don't walk passed by accident

A line to get in, but well worth the wait. I'm not a big fan of waiting in line to get into a place, but this is an exception. The view from the towers is the most impressive sight in Paris (not counting the paintings in the Orsay). Attend a service here (that part's easy), but don't fail to see the towers.
Beautiful historical church. A must see in Paris, historical and beautiful, if you like photography it is definitely a must! Convenient to get to.

Beautiful. Take the time to study these towers before you enter this giant and spectacular facility. Go online to learn what is there your experience will be enhanced if you know about the sculptures of many great religious men.
A must see. Spent hours here , walking, sitting , meditating. The architecture and art is amazing. This was a highlight of my time in Paris- extraordinary !

Worth the Climb.. Close up with gargoyles and experiencing the bells at 11:45 was a treat. YES, there are a lot of steps but you get to take a break after 100 steps or so in the gift shop. We got there just before it opened and still had to wait 1 1/2 hours. We met a couple from Australia and the time passed quickly.

impressive and free. This is an amazing building and well worth a visit. It's free to visit, but do leave a donation or buy some items to help fund it. The queue was huge but it goes very quickly and, although there is a lot to see it shouldn't take more than 30 mins. They have priests, who speak different languages and take confession if you want to do that while there.

Great insightful visit. We decided to get a jump the queue pass for Notre-Dame that included a walk around the island first to find out more about it's history and significance. we booked a 2 hour trip with viator The tour even included a walk up the famous bell towers, where you will perch amongst the gargoyles for a splendid view of Paris.One thing to watch around Notre-Dame...... Pick Pockets!!!!!! BEWARE!

A must see. So much in Paris is beautiful but the Towers of Notre-Dame really are something of their own. We chose a cafe across the street with a view of the Cathedral and spent a couple hours admiring it's beauty. Then we walked around it and through its gardens to see it from every angle. We chose not to enter since the line was soooo long, however seeing it's beauty from the outside is still something wonderful to experience.
beautiful. this is one of those attractions you must see early in the morning, otherwise you can't walk with too many people around you.
a wonderous Cathedral. the view from the top is spectacular, prepare to climb over 300 steps and experience a beautiful church.
Lovely cathedral!. Loved this cathedral and enjoyed listening to Alberto's (From Sandeman) fascinating stories related to this church. would love to visit it again!
AMAZING. Sadly would have liked to have gone inside,,, but that was not allowed,,,,,we did get rather side-tracked on the day we visited as their was a bread fair,,,,,, very tasty

Must see if in Paris. Where to begin? the stained glass was incredible, the view from the bell tower was one of the most breathtaking I've ever experienced, and the quiet time in front of the crown of thorns was a bucket list item.
A landmark. You can't miss this when walking along the Seine. Beautiful! There is so much to see near Notre Dame, and well worth the time and walk.

Cost a few Euros AND if your in ok health, this is a must do!. I have RA and a mobility scooter which I left back at the hotel on purpose as I knew I would make an attempt to reach the top. It costs a few Euros or get a pass from the tourist department several blocks away the allows you a pass for several sights and museums in Paris and a travel pass and the towers are free. I made it to the top and the views and bells were amazing. You get face to face with the gargoyles and statues. It was worth it. If you go ALL the way up the bell tower, you will have an amazing view of the city. This was a person challenge that was TOTALLY worth it.
Better than the Effiel Tower - and free.. I truly felt so happy to see this in real life and on a sunny day the cathedral gives much needed shade. Very strong Hunchback of Notre Dame vibes.

Not worth the wait; not much to see. Since I often stay in Paris near the Notre Dame, I pass by the entrance to the Towers almost on a daily basis on my way to and from work. The queues for visiting the towers tend to be long as are the waiting times. I finally gave in and decided to see what it's all about. In my opinion, it's not worth the wait. Not much to see except a relatively decent view of central Paris from above. But, you will get a better view if you go either to Montmartre or take the escalators up to the top of the Centre Pompidou (both of these are free).
Beautiful building. Stunning. Would go again! I was really taken back when I first arrived. Inside and out, this it simply stunning.

Arrive Early. We got in line 35 minutes before opening time, were 2nd in line, so were assured a quick entry when the doors opened. By then, the line was really long, and the very top of the towers allows only a very few people at a time, so it goes slowly. The climb is arduous, so be ready for it. But once at the first level, the views are spectacular! Gargoyles and other creatures are your companions while viewing the sights of Paris from above.The bell tower evokes images of Quasimodo. The view from the very top provides even more vistas.

Amazing to see. We arrived early in the morning to not much of a crowd, so we were able to take some great pictures. The building is really worth seeing and the detail is amazing.I would recommend going all the way around the building to appreciate it in full. Also taking pictures from the other side of the Seine River makes for a great photo too.We did a quick tour of the inside which we were very impressed by. We did not go up the tower, because by that time there was a long line. We visited on a Saturday morning and there was a wonderful, massive tent sent up in the front of the cathedral that was selling fresh baked pastries. The smell was fantastic and you couldn't help but go in a buy a croissant or baguette, then sit on a bench eating the fresh baked goods and admire the cathedral. Great experience.

Got to Love Gothic Architecture. Did not get inside due to weather, queue and schedule but was more than happy to witness the beautiful towers. We sort of walked around the building when leaving and couldn't help but marvel at the details with the gargoyles topping it all off. Stunning.

Get in line early!. Get here by 9:30. The line is long and moves slowly. The climb to the top is long and narrow. The sights from the top are worth the wait and the climb. The Paris Pass gets you in but does not allow you to skip the line.
Best view of Paris. To be with the gargoyles keeping a watchful eye over Paris. The views were stunning. We were in another world. Totally loved it up there.

The view you have to see. From here you can look out over the whole of Paris and enjoy view over the Seine and its bridges.
Practical info:
Visit takes on average: 50 min.
Visitors may ascend the towers in groups of 20 every 10 min or so.
No toilet facilities.
Come 30 min before opening, to avoid being the last in a long-long queue.

Beautiful. The architecture is outstanding. We did not go inside as there were big queues but it was awesome just to stand outside and walk round the building. Pictures do not do it justice. Well worth a visit even if you do not see inside. The attention to detail is breath taking and there are great photos to be had at any point of the building. The view from the river is also beautiful.

Book A Skip The Queue Tour . We went as part of a tour group. We skipped right past the queues of people. Our guide informed us that you can wait up to four hours. You enter at the side, not the main entrance. You do not pay for entry to Notre Dame but you pay for entry to the towers. There are a lot and lots of steps. There is a rest point on the 1st floor at the gift shop but the steps to this point aren't too bad. The next set of steps are a little steeper with one doorway about half way up that 1 or 2 people could stop to rest in if required. Your next stop leads to the bell towers and has some beautiful views. There is an area with two bells, which have an open wooden staircase but it is only a short distance. All other stairs are stone and enclosed. Once viewing the bells, which is optional, you then have the choice to exit or go to the top. You have to queue as numbers are restricted at any one time on the top level. The staff control this. If you want to exit go up to the rope and let the staff know, so you aren't stuck in the queue. The stairs to the top floor are very winding and steep with no rest point. I wouldn't be very fit and I managed it, my legs did feel like jelly for around an hour after. I wouldn't recommend for anyone with fear of heights or mobility issues. You are surrounded by safety fences. Some of the turns around the corners are quite tight but perfectly safe. Don't forget, once you get to the top, you then have to go all the way back down.

Must go to.. The Notre-Dame Cathedral is must go to, it's history which is explained inside is interesting, free to get in, even if you are not religious this place has a lot to offer, one of our favourite places in Paris.

Great view of Paris from abouve. The view from the towers is great,worth the climbing all the stairs. Since theirs a limits to the number of people at the towers you have to wait at least half an hour (at morning).recommend to do the cathedral and tower together (do first the towers since they close earlier then the cathedral)
How could you skip Notre Dame?!. Again its a must on any trip to Paris, and finding Notre Dame is part of the charm. Light a candle, make a donation and take a moment to appreciate the history.
A lot of stairs but worth it. Just go up there, watch the amazing towers, the gargoyles and the amazing view of paris and its roofs. The sounds of the bells are heavenly.

Worth the climb if you are able !!. We arrived at Notre Dame about 30 minutes before it opened for tourists. The was a little confusion which line to get into...the church or the tower. We decided on the tower and it took about 40 minutes to get into the tower. The climb was okay for me (age 62) but I am in pretty good shape. Once you arrive at the top, there are wonderful views of Paris including the Eiffel Tower. You can also go inside the Bell tower. Overall, I would suggest giving yourself at least 2 hours for this tour.

Magnificient Historic Building. In touring the building that is free to the public, you learn how over more than 100 years this cathedral developed. To see the stained glass windows alone is incredible. a great feeling experience in its grandiose style.
Wet weather paris . We had a nice indoor trip bells and organ playing. All very atmospheric. Had to que and no nearby toilets. Choir nice. Que did move quickly. 400+ steps to tower.

Always Inspiring. I feel that no visit to Paris is complete without a visit to Notre Dame Cathederal. The old construction is a testament to great design particularly for its acoustics. The organ is powerful and the choir voices are heavenly. A must see that is even better if you can get there for a mass on Sundays.
Worth a look.. What a building. Amazing history about it. It is worth your time researching this building and all it has seen over the years.

Grand attraction. It was a hot summer evening, when I reached there. i got down from the hop on hop off bus and wanted to go inside. But it was already 8 pm and I had to go back, otherwise I had to walk long to reach my hotel. Wish to visit there again.

The Bells of Notre-Dame. Notre-Dame Cathedral is just amazing and the chimming of the bells echo throughout the area. There are many views to this beautiful structure. Just be very careful because this area is very popular among pick pocketers. Young children between 8-16 are used to distract by presenting you with a clipboard asking for your signature. While the one uses the clipboard to block your view the other is busy taking your wallet. Just be aware and on guard in this area as well as other popular sites.

Long wait... worth it if you are allowed to reach roof. All has been said already, so here are our tips:- BE IN LINE EARLY... even if the attraction only opens at 10:00... we were in line at 8:50 and we weren't the first in line. They let in about 20 people every 15 mins... so do the maths of how long you might wait.... long !- For people who are scared of heights, this one is suitable as there is a high rampart and fence all along the outside areas... and the snail staircase has a middle-filled post.- You might have an unpleasant surprise close to the opening though. as the access to the bell tower and roof are weather-permitting. If it's too windy (not street-level wind conditions), these areas are closed. The issue is that, contrary to the church itself, personnel of the towers don't install fences nor boards with daily info until about 9:50... so you might have waited for a while and still not have access to it all. This is really something they should improve on.- There are NO options to buy tickets ahead of time

You have to do the towers! . If you go to Notre Dame you have to do the tower! Lots of stairs on a spiral staircase, but the view is tremendous and the gargoyles are fascinating! Well worth the 10 Euros each for adults and the line moves fast.
go up!. Already reviewed the church. Worth a wait in the queue and good exercise for the hardy to climb up. Great views, but through nets and screens.

absolutely stunning inside and out.. It would have been rude to not have visited notre dame on our trip to paris. A stunning building both inside and out and a prime example of the gothic architecture of the period. To visit the inside of notre dame there is a cost but in my opinion it is well worth it. I would highly recommend visiting it both during the day and then at night when it is lit up as it is equally beautiful.

Love it,Gargoyles and All.... A magic place, much more than just an amazingly beautiful cathedral. Magic because haunted. That's right, haunted. Walk through its nave, its transept, its ambulatory and Esmerelda, Quasimodo flit before your eyes, the cries of the French revolutionaries are not far behind, also the victory mass of 1944. Among other évents. The visitor senses that they have touched a particular stream of History bespeaking France and no other country. ND is the quintessence of Paris, and France, even more than the Eiffel Tower which was Gustave Eiffeĺs bold experiment in iron structures erected for expo universelle in1887 and Montmartre of Eastern inspiration. Notre Dame stands haughtily above architectural endeavors/mere tourist attractions or slightly corny 19th century notions of sultanś palaces. Here is the real thing. Gargoyles and all. During the spring and summer, lines are painfully long and security is tight. The esplanade or le parvis in French, is very lively with street artists and performers.
Simply amazing. Any visitor to Paris must visit the Notre-Dame. The 'feeling' you get entering this religious site is indescribable. And, entry is by 'donation'.

Arrive early to get excellent views!. This is an event where you definitely want to arrive early, because the crowds and lines get bad in the afternoon. I recommend trying to arrive by 9AM. Closest metro stops to Notre Dame are Cite, Hotel de Ville, and St Michel, each just a short walk away. The line for the tower climb is on the side of the cathedral (outside) facing the street. If you bought the museum pass, the tower climb is included. Definitely recommend, this was one of the highlights of my Paris adventures.

Well worth a visit.. Fantastic stained glass in mammoth proportions. Entry is free and although the queue seem very long it took no time to get inside this enormous Cathedral and we really enjoyed it.

Impressive & worth a visit every time you can. Every time i'm in Paris i take the chance to go to Notre-Dame. I find it impressive, magical & superb in every single detail. Either if you only have the chance to walk around and see it from the outside or if you have time to enter, sit down & feel the ambiance, it's definitively worth the visit.

Wasn't prepared for the lines. Just a heads up the lines are pretty long and disorganized. At first I didn't want to deal with the lines but after I thought for awhile I taked myself into it. Absolutely stunning inside.
Free and Glorious. This is the nicest 20 minutes to spend for free in Paris. Just a lovey building inside and out and 800+ years of history. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised.

Well worth the climb. Walking up the stone stairs to the bell tower will make you feel like you are in a movie. Only attempt the steps if you are reasonably fit as they are steep and there are over 400 up and 400 down. I definitely felt my legs shaking the rest of the day after doing it! But the views from up there make it totally worth it. The gargoyles have to be seen. Pictures don't do them justice. Do the skip the line tour of Notre Dame including the Bell Tower for the best value. You will have a short walk from the Cite Metro line over the bridge and to the cathedral. The guide will tell you wonderful stories about the history of the area and the towers.

Stunning . The architecture is breathtakingly beautiful. I did not go inside but I didn't feel the need. The outside was so stunning I just sat and viewed the details of this magnificent building from afar. The area around it is one of my favorite places in Paris. Good shopping and food. Perfect for a day out in Paris.

Good place to hang out. A good place to hang out when the weather is good. You can feed pigeons. Not sure why there were so many locks hanging on the grills. I guess something similar to throwing pennies in water.

Please take the climb - even if you are afraid of heights. Seeing the gargoyles, statues and the roof of Notre Dame would be enough to make me recommend the climb. You also have access to the inside of the bell tower - very cool. Then turn around and take in the panoramic views of historic Paris. Great perspective of the area and the city. The steps are actually divided into three stages so it is less taxing than the number of stairs might suggest. The tourist areas are securely protected and felt safe. This helped reduce my fear of heights.Even with wobbly knees this was a great memory of Paris. Well worth the wait. Access is not at through the main doors, but is on the north side of the building (so the left side if you are looking at the front doors).

Lovely French monument. A must see for its beautiful building , and the glass windows with several colour glasses framed onto a beautiful design . A must visit in Paris . can be seen by the bus city tours which take u there

Not worth the climb. After seeing the outer side of the Cathedral and its interior I don't think the towers are worth the climb. The hundred of narrow old stair steps is another point to make this climb discouraging.
Stunning. The lines are long but they move quickly. Located on an island in the Seine, it's centrally located and easy to get to. A must see.

Go to mass on Sunday morning.. It's open to all and an experience you'll appreciate for life. Even if there are services, you can still walk through the sanctuary which is obviously massive and beautiful.
Beautiful place. its was an amazing tour inside the church...very old one and the best that u can read how they constructed from 1186 till now
Good church. Gothic style and really cool to see. Be mindful of the photos with flash and sometimes the father is there talking to people hehe
Marvellous architecture - must visit. Even if you are not able to get inside, please make sure to pass by and appreciate the iconic cathedral exterior designs.
Beautiful and a must see. You have to see it and go to listen a mess. It is incredible. The voice of the chorus is amazing. Do not miss it.
Worth the wait. It was a one hour wait to climb, even with the Paris pass. The seemingly never ending spiral staircase is an absolute killer, but the views are absolutely amazing. So very worth it
Fantastic view and architecture. Beautiful and serene. Feels really calm and peaceful being in there. You can also see the various pulpits of famous priests

One of the most beautiful cathedrals in all of Europe!. If you only have a short amount of time in Paris let this be one of the few things on your list...it is stunning and when the bells chime on the hour it's worth the wait. You can walk up the stairs to the bell tower for a small fee. Visit it during the day and at night you'll thank me later.

AMAZING TOWERS OF NOTRE-DAME CATHEDRAL. The cathedral by itself is magnificent inside and out. The paintings of the glass panes that adorned the walls are awesome to look at and the altar is so grand, You don't have to be religious to appreciate the work of art within its confines. It also helps in appreciating the place that it was the backdrop used in "The Hunchback of Notre Dame".
Definitely haunted.. This place is amazing and beautiful. Pretty sure it's haunted though. The 'shhhhh' over the loud speaker almost sent me into utter panic as I was sure it was the voice of God.

If you have the energy. It's over 400 steps but once again the view is worth the calories burnt in the process. It costs to go up but if you just want to go inside and see the downstairs floor it's free. It's the most visited monument in Paris.
Paris at it's best.. Once again Grand architecture and history, Paris has it all, I loved my visit and you will too I'm sure
Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. The towers are facing the Seine. You walk up and people are sitting all around the main entrance. It's a beautiful place for pictures.

Beautiful once you get to the top. I have climbed the 387 steps to the top of Notre Dame twice now. The first time, we went a lot earlier in the day and only waited for about 40 minutes. The second time, we went around the middle of the day and waited for about 2 and half hours. It is my all time favorite view of Paris because you can see all of the monuments, including the Eiffel Tower, and the gargoyles are very cool. I would definitely recommend going earlier or later when the line is not as long because it ends up taking up a lot of your day if you are waiting in line for hours. Once you get in, there is a ticket booth to buy tickets to go to the top, we got in free as students with a visa from Italy. It is not actually that bad of a climb and the view is worth the money and time (maybe not 2 and a half hours, but definitely an hour or less).

Pretty awesome - and free for EU citizens under 26!. We visited the Notre Dame recently and loved it! We went inside and to the top and the whole thing is breath taking Also made better as its free to go to the top if your an EU citizen under 26 (we had to show our driving licence to proove it though)

Good recommendation for a guided tour.. Our tour included a walking tour of the area around the Cathedral as well as the Cathedral, both outside and inside. Our guide was knowledgeable and easy to understand.

Stunning Architecture. It was good to see the outside of the cathedral, especially having seen the plans and information on the building on the inside. Watch out for pickpockets, panhandlers and peddlars!
So cool!. As with many of the sites in Paris, the towers of Notre Dame are breathtaking. Rather tough to get a decent picture of them with so many people around though. Worth seeing! :)

Must see.. It is beautiful, but go early as it can get crowded quickly. The architecture and windows are so amazing. You can take the tour of some of the treasures of the church, a small collection but the history is amazing. There is an entrance to the top of the tower walkway. You pay extra to see that part of the church. We did not as the line was so long. Worth visiting once, you can't go to Paris and not see this beautiful landmark.

Be prepared to wait. Be prepared to wait to get in. I went around 3:30 and waited about 30 min (overall...not bad). Ascent while steep, there were areas where you leveled off so you could regain your breath while rethinking your sanity about doing this! Keep going, you will not regret it. The views are absolutely astounding. Look at the bell tower and up the south tower,just be prepared to wait to make the descent from the south tower....there is only one narrow stairwell that serves going up and down. Would have liked the "gift" shop to have been at the end, no one could assist as they were all focused on selling tickets and I was unable to find what I had seen that I was interested in in the cathedral.

A must in Paris with stunning views of the city. This is the paid attraction and the entrance is to the side of the church. You can knock two things out in one go. We stood in line for about 40 mins or so and were let inside. Went up several steps until we reached the office to purchase tickets. From there you wait a moment before you proceed upwards. It is a climb and if you have health issues climbing stairs then this is not for you. Once you reach the top, the view and architecture is stunning! Plenty of opportunities to take pictures/selfies/etc. They have fence like barriers so no one can fall off, but there are parts cut out for a good photo.Here is the strange part, if you want souvenirs, buy them when getting the tickets. Because when you are leaving you will not see the souvenir shop in this church again - unless we missed it somehow.
Best View of the City. It's 300 steps to climb but it is by far the best view of the city. I would recommend this location over The Eiffel tower or Arc de Triomphe.

Beautiful and peacful. Beautiful and peacful, good crowd management and can bring in stroller. Loved the Windows. Only downside the bathrooms were all closed. No idea why. Had to go to a nearby restaurant to get some drinks and use the Lott.

Very cool. Bring walking shoes . My husbands favorite attraction. If possible take a tour to get more out of the experience. Walk to the top and you get to see the bells. Check out all the interesting gargoyles.

Stunning. A great attraction for photos. When I was there, it was packed with tourists! Beware of the peddlers selling their goods. They offered me 5 small key chains for 1 Euro, which is way more expensive. I was not surprised to see some Chinese websites selling them for only a fraction of the price.
Dramatic Cathedral. It suddenly appears when yi turn the corner - at least that was our experience. Make sure you tick it off your bucket list of things to-see in Paris.

Tourists . Spent a wonderful morning exploring the Cathedral and bell tower as part of a guided walking tour in early May. I can recommend the skip the line options offered by a number of companies as this probably saved us several hours of time. It might cost a bit more but a competent tour guide speaking your own language makes the experience so much better. If you are physically able to climb tight circular stairs then adding this option into your tour will is a great bonus. I think it's 420 up and the same down. I loved getting up close to the gargoyles and the views over the city were really good.While we were enjoying the view the bells rang out really loudly, what an experience! They only let limited numbers climb at a time so its not too crowded. There are limited catch your breath spots during the climb but we did find a couple of chairs outside the bells.The morning we visited 5 May 2016 they had a full mass so there was a lot of atmosphere inside the church as well.Recommend this as a must do attraction.
... and a walk behind them.. To me, the treat is to enjoy a walk around and through the park-garden behind them. Buy some crepes and eat them sitting on a bench.
Must see. Lovely architecture and wonderful ancient part of Paris. Must see for every visitor to Paris. Both the inside and outside of the structure are a feast for your eyes.

Lots of steps, but worth the view.. I have always wanted to see the gargoyles up close and this trip made that happen. Amazing view....But be prepared, it is a lot of steps to the top and then you have to walk down...

Long wait. It was a very long wait. Took us more than 2.5 hours to get in. The stair is only one way up or down. Therefore the process is very slow. My wife actually ran out of breath even though she is supposed to do be the fit one. It is worth the wait. The view is awesome.

One should always see Notre-Dame!. When we visited Notre-Dame Cathedral, we were lucky inasmuch as very few people were in line. There are beautiful stained glass windows and imposing statues. Look at the gargoyles on the exterior of the Cathedral.
Awesome Building.. Went in here it was beautiful inside, sat there on the seats just mesmorized by the gorgeous stained glass windows.

too long to wait. We stood in line for nearly 2 hours to walk up the many many steps of the tower and I really didn't think it was worth the wait, the steps are very steep and when you get up there there is a netting that stops you from getting good photos from the top

the details!!. absolutely love this cathedral.. i could spend days and hours on it.. it was absolutely gorgeous.. the details on it are mesmerizing.. definitely recommend you to visit there.. the taxi stands are right next to it so it's easy to get there and around.

Lovely place to visit if you have never been there before.. Been here a few times and lovely to see it again. It is a lovely church with beautiful stain glass. Entrance fee is free but if you want to climb the towers then you need to pay.

this is the best. to go up the tower s was the best ever experiance could do it over and over again so much to see and look at and then the veiws and touching the bells and hearing them is unforgettable

Not worth the wait and fuss . 30 to 45 minute queues to see a view that it not one of the best makes this a waste of time in my humble opinion. Rather go to the Arc De Triomphe in the morning and you'll get a better view, you can use the Museum Pass as well and best of all - you won't wait in long queues.

Absolutely beautiful cathedral. Notre Dame is fantastic. The feeling of peace and calm inside the cathedral is excellent, despite hundreds of visitors and highly recommend paying to ascend the towers (all 387 steps). Hard climb but worth it for the views over Paris and the Seine
my old dream. it's very very nice place with wonderful style takes you back to many years before. you can see the historical building, the tower and many wonderful drawings

Gothic Beauty and Place of Worship. The architecture and the art inside are well worth the visit and it is free to enter. But please remember to take your hat off men, be silent, do not go snapping photos in roped off areas reserved for prayer, show respect as this is a church not a museum. People still worship here as they have done for centuries.

the climb. Climbing to the top of the towers was fantastic! Being so close to the gargoyles was such fun and the views were just beautiful. The climb is a bit difficult and you can get a little dizzy with the spiral stairs but so worth it. You need to go to the side of the church to get in the line for the towers.
Breathtaking. Words can not describe the experience of seeing the Cathedral with ones own eyes. The stain glass windows, the towers and the ornate interior and exterior are just breathtaking.

Amazing History. Wonderful stain glass windows and architecture. For the brave you can take the stairs to the top of the tower. Check out the church bells. Main entry is free, had a line but it moved quickly.

Wonderful to see.. Lucky for us we got there reasonably early and pretty much went straight in. Just beautiful inside, easy to move around. It was very nice to see all the tourists being quiet and respectful. Souvenirs were good price. We didn't go up to the top, as the line went for miles, and we had other things to see.

A must see ! . Phenomal church, try to come during a service so you can enjoy the power of the acoustic inside the church and to have time to enjoy one of the best view of Paris from the top.. Wear some easy shoes .. Stairs are many and narrow ladies !
Quite stunnng. Amazing architecture and a must see if visiting Paris. It can get quite crowded though so try to research a good time to visit
Sunday visit. They are really magnificent, especially all the different types of animals on the towers. They are a little frightening.

Wow . For picture lovers you will be blown away cuz any picture you take here will leave you speechless and will make you want to stay longer than planned. Had fun and there's security lots of police and all those military for security reasons.

Amazing Views from the top. The entrance to the towers in on the north side of the cathedral in the NW corner. Walked by it the first time before I realized what it was. Went on a Friday around 1200 and the line was about 30 minuets long. Was able to go all the way to the very top of the tower and got to see the bell.
Amazing architecture. Outside and inside is stunning! Real history to check out, almost unreal. There are amazing glass windows with brilliant colors and the inside architecture is just breathtaking!

Plan a tour. This French gothic cathedral is breathtaking. We made the mistake of not planning a tour of it and ran out of time to go inside because of the long lines but it is on the top of my list for my next trip. It was unbelievable to view from the river at night.
Beautiful church. Amazing church to see from inside and outside, totally worth the visit. It is beautifully located in the intersection of the rivers and in the heart of Paris.
Beautiful. All the churches in Paris are magnificent so try to see as many as you can. This one is famous and no excepiion.
A must do in Paris. The cathedral is simply beautiful, definitely worth the visit. Try to visit before 10:00am because after that you need to wait a lot to get in.

Pretty. In the summer time there are generally pretty long queues to get in. I've always preferred the outside anyway, with all the gargoyles, and the nice courtyard out front to enjoy your morning croissants.
very busy but beautiful. there were lots of beggers here and it was very busy. Inside is very beautiful. we went during mass but you could still walk around so long as you were quiet.
Love the outdoors view. True that the cathedral is very nice, however I enjoyed sitting outside beside the river and looking at it, very beautiful.

Climb the tour. When you visit Paris and the Notre DAme, make sure you start with climbing the tour.
Great view. Nice to see this building from another perspective.

Notre Dame - Of course. You have to go to Notre Dame. I've been there several times, but haven't ever had the guided tour which I'm sure is much better. There are a lot of nice bars and eateries close by as well. Great place to walk around.

Up Close and Personal with Gargoyles. The classic view of gargoyles on the top of Notre Dame's towers can be seen by climbing up the tower steps to the stone balcony. The entrance is on the left side of the building. The steps leave even the fit gasping a bit but the view of Paris is extraordinary. The Carte Musee gets you in for free.
Great views. Enjoyed our visit here but if you are going to go up the towers, be prepared to wait. The line took over an hour but it was worth it.
as beautiful as you think.. Do not miss this outstanding church. It is spectacular. The architecture, art, size and majesty were overwhelming.
Amazing. If you love history and architecture, this is a must! Best to go early to beat the huge crowds. Leave the kids at your hotel!
Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. Just toured around the outsides of this and it is again breath taking. Something you should definitely see while touring Paris.
A must do.... Each time in Paris we go to the top. There is something magical about standing among the gargoyles and looking over Paris. Our kids loved it as well.
Worth climbing. Very long queue. Really a lot of steps. High entrance fee. But the view is worth all of it. Be there in the morning (they open at 10).
Very Crowded!. Again long queues during the holiday season and beware of thieves and pickpockets as it is always very crowded

Awesome, even if you're not Christian. Pretty awesome structure. Take an hour to stroll through, but easy to spend more time if you like details. Nice exhibit on its construction. To avoid crowds and relax, check out the park in the back. While back there, café Esméralda is a nice place to take a break with a view of the park.

Great for Kids. One of my son's favorite activities. Line up on the left side of the church as facing the entrance just around the corner. 25 people are let in every 10 minutes but totally worth the wait and small price (paid once you are inside.) View is great but it's the narrow staircase and being up close to the gargoyles that my son loved.

Symbolic place center of Paris. After a long meditation spiritual inside go to the top , for the best view of Paris , go back downstairs and behind the cathedral they're is a garden wher they used to hang the Jew in 800 that's crazy story but real.
Magnificent . Great landmark with no entrance fees. The exterior is amazing but the interior is even more magnificent. Queue is always there but moves very quickly.
Amazing . The towers and the architecture is always great. The location is not bad either. Couple of other things to do close by also. Don't fur get to be respectful while visiting these places.

Worth the Climb to the 387-step Tower. Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris (巴黎聖母院, "Our Lady of Paris”) is a medieval Catholic cathedral on the eastern part of the Île de la Cité (西堤島) in the fourth arrondissement of Paris, France. The Notre-Dame Cathedral celebrated its 850th anniversary of laying the first building block for the cathedral on December 12, 2012. The North Tower on top of Cathédrale Notre-Dame was completed in 1240 and the South Tower in 1250.  We tried to visit the towers after we visited the Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris. We arrived around 5 pm, but it was too late although the official time of the visit is 10 am to 6:30 pm in April. We tried again next morning before 10 am, but there already had 20 people in the line. After waiting for about 30 minutes, we were able to start our journey to the top of Cathédrale Notre-Dame. It was a narrow 387-step (69 m / 226 ft) climb up the spiral staircase. The first stop was the upper room of the North Tower where the ticket counter and souvenir shop were located. We also noticed an elegant small spiral staircase inside the upper room. We continued the climb to the Chimera gallery after a short rest. You can see not only the magnificent views over Paris, but also lots of strange beasts known in French as ‘Les Chimères‘ that are located here. Those Chimera creatures looked like birds or monsters were looking down to the city, observing all the people in Paris for several hundred years. We could even see the Sacré-Coeur from a distance. This was not the end of the tour -- we continued our climb to the top of South Tower. There were many gargoyles on top of the North and South Towers. These decorated waterspouts were designed to deliver water from the roof and keep the water away from the cathedral. On the top of cathedral, we saw all the famous landmarks and enjoyed a 360 degree view of Paris. Don’t miss the opportunity to go inside the small wooden door. Behind the door is the famous, oldest and largest 13,271 kg (29,258 lb) Emmanuel bell, which has been a part of the building since 1681.  One thing I could not believe was there were so many smokers in Paris. They smoke even when they are walking. When we queued up at the entrance of the Tower Tour, they smoke regardless non-smokers and children. The French advocate freedom, but they should also respect others. The entrance for the visit of the tower is located outside of the cathedral on the left-hand side of the façade, on Rue du Cloître Notre-Dame. It costs €8.5 for an adult.
Beautiful. Beautiful historic building to see. You do not need to go inside to appreciate it's beauty. I would recommend this iconic Parisian landmark to any visitors!
Very fun!. The whole family had a great time her and was fascinated by the history and architecture. Great and fun for everyone.

Got to check out the gargoyles. Line to climb the tower is on the left side as you face the church. We got there about five after nine and there was no line. So we walked around the building and then came back to get in line at 9:35 and there were 20 people in front of us. They let in 20 at a time every 10 minutes. But they let in groups also. Was the perfect time to be up there. Sun was nice for photographing. You're not rushed around. There is a little bit of a bottleneck coming down from the high roof with people also coming up. Very enjoyable visit.

Highlight of Paris. I can't recommend this enough. We saw Paris from the top of so many buildings and towers but this one was the best. Face to face with the famous gargoyles and the bell! We waited about 20minutes to get in around lunch time. The climb isn't too bad because you do it in stages. The entire experience was about an hour. Top of our list!

Impressive and beautiful. Well worth taking the time to walk around this impressive church, we just happened to visit Sunday afternoon and sat through a service. The organ just sends shivers through your body. Keep an eye on your bags.

Great photobombing opportunities. Tons of people with selfie sticks pose in front of this landmark and you can have hours (well ok, maybe not hours) of fun bombing there carefully posed for pictures! In my experience if Asian people catch you they'll laugh, and if Russian people catch you they will chase you down and beat you to death.
Hear the bells. It was 1817 and the bells started to ring. They got louder and just overwhelmed you telling you there was something more to life. It was inspiring to hear them and just to be there.

If you come here - please make sure to climb the towers!. Everyone coming to Paris will no doubt make the Notre Dame a mandatory stop. However, the more interesting visit is to climb up the church tower. You must queue up at the side of the church and pay for the ticket - or get the Museum Pass - which is super value and a must buy for anyone visiting Paris. Why climb up the church? You will get magnificent views of Paris and marvel at the church spires and gargoyles. They have an app now where you register so you do not need to wait there for hours. Just come back at the appointed time. I wished more attractions use this system.
Notre Dame. In the heart of the city, very close to Latin quarter, walk along the river - simple must see - especially from inside.

The best thing we did in Paris. It took some coaxing by me to get my wife to wait in line to go up into the towers, but afterwards she (more than once) conceded it was way way worth it and the best thing we did in Paris as far as a tourist attraction. The belfry was awesome, seeing the Gargoyles up close was phenomenal, and the views were great. I would NOT recommend it for anyone who can't handle stairs, because there are 422 of them (or so). This was just a great attraction. TOTALLY happy we did it!

Another MUST!. Wow ... what a beautiful cathedral. It boggles the mind and is truly magnificent to visit and see the amazing stained windows, works of art and the sheer grandness of this church. Unfortunately, the visitors are a bit noisy and so sitting in the pews in the hope of some quiet contemplation is unlikely, but still worth a try.
Great place to visit and it is free to the everyone!. You will be very delighted...... A must if you are visiting Paris. Go in the morning hours to avoid the crowd!

Great views. Loved the views from the top of Notre Dame. There are a lot of steps and it's a small stairwell, so be prepared. Hubby didn't like the height or the close quarters when you reach the top, so keep that in mind.

Must visit !. Must visit while in ParisWaited about 30 minutes to get in (sometimes line is crazy and you' ll have to wait an hour ) but it's worth it !!! View from the top of the cathedral is amazing. Seeing old bells, gargoyles, Seine and Eiffel will make you forget that you climbed 387 steps to the top. Even on rainy day it is worth of visit. Towers open at 10:00 and tickets you can purchase online or once you are inside tower.

reverent place to see!. This was our first visit to France and the beautiful Notre Dame Cathedral. For the most part people were very respectful of their surroundings. Some disregarded the signs that forbid pictures with flash. Some took photos of areas they shouldn’t have. But I found the place to be very sacred and lovely. My wife and I really enjoyed seeing this work or art and reading about the history behind it! A must see when you visit Paris!

Notre-Dame - Impressive Architecture. Experience this beautiful church when there's mass. Check their website for Mass information, they also have an International Mass - in English - Download Rick Steve's Audio Europe, listen to the Notre-Dame tour, it is full of details that I did not know, such as the story of the Saint holding his own head on the outside of the church, or the bored gargoyle.

Must go upstairs . I was going to skip the visit knowing that there were so many stairs to climb but I am glad I decided not to. After all I am never going to be as young as today so we went with all six of us stopping for a quick rest on the way up. Having watched The Exorcist as a teen and being terrified by the gargoyles, I was overwhelmed by the seeing all of them watching over the city. I absolutely loved it.
Notre Dame, you continue to fascinate us!. A trip to visit the Cathedral is a must. It is always crowded. If you visit in a tour group, it is so much better...

Don't forget the outside. Visit Paris, visit the Notre-Dame Cathedral! It's fabulous. If you get a chance to know a bit more of it's historical backgrounds, please do so. The inner Cathedral is marvelous. But don't forget the outside! Its front is great, but a walk around the cathedral will astonish you.A highlight in your visit to Paris!
Love it!!!. The beautiful ﻿﻿architecture brings so many tourists everyday, I like to imagine Hugo's novel about the life in this tower, and it brings some fun.
Impressive. Go early to avoid the bus tours. The cathedral is beautiful inside and out. Don't miss the side view from the Left Bank.

A Must See. On the long list of must-sees, this is near the top. Beautiful structure, inside and out. Historically significant. We were disappointed in the number of tourists who ignored the requests that pictures not be taken inside the pew area. Some of the asian tourists were particularly rude - even while a Mass was occurring. The Cathedral itself is truly breathtaking.

Gothic but stunning. This building was simply stunning with different parts of the building dating to different periods which added to its beauty. The rear of the building being the most gothic and this being very close to The Pont de l'Archeveche known as one of the lovers lock bridges locations which makes it a romantic location for couples to visit and whilst the original lovers lock bridge has had its padlocks removed this still has a lots still displayed and I think it's a stunning display of romance and love for all.
Paris must-see. We did not go into the cathederal,the lines were simply too long for our liking. It is still a great attraction to see from the outside with amazing architecture
Nice place. We didn't go inside the Cathedral but beautiful views from outside and a nice place to click pictures and hang out.
Panoramic views. This time the weather was with us & we could see the Paris horizon 360 degrees. A long climb of sometimes very narrow stairs, but worth the effort once you get to the top.

History at its finest!. We hired a guide to help our group understand the history of Paris and the Revolutionary period. It sure paid off...so many interesting facts helped us appreciate both historical periods. We didn't walk up the towers, but we did venture over to the outdoor viewing area on the top floor at the Lafayette Department store. You can see Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower, the La Defense area, and basically all of Paris! It was such a grand experience.
Classic Paris!. Spend some time here to gawk at the incredible craftsmanship and/or to find calm from the tourist crowds of Paris.
Get there early. Worth climbing all those steps for great views over the city. Be there half hour before it opens when the line is the shortest.
Notre Dame. It is beautiful, gothic and great!!!! Make sure you get there early and avoid the lines! Near by are the under ground ruins , make sure you visit those also.

Beautiful Cathedral, but don't miss the back of it, it is even more spectacular!. Seen in many movies and TV, finally got to see it and really loved the view of the rear of the Cathedral, it was beautiful.

Bring your A Game. The walk up the 400 plus steps is worth it! The lineups are caused by the restriction to 20 people at a time but grab a cafe creme and wait. You wont be disappointed I'm sure. Get your tickets when you get off your plane in the airport - the Museum pass etc is a must also the Eiffel Tower pass.. saves a LOT of time by passing the snaking lines. This line at the Notre Dame is only for those who HAVE TICKETS.

Wonderful experience . This is something you have to do if you visit Paris and visit Notre Dame. You should know that there are >400 steps and this is not easy for everyone . (I'm 55 and over weight) I made it to the top but it was quite a challenge. Once at the top the views are spectacular. The close up views of the gargoyles was also very cool.
Great Architecture. Always a treat to see great architecture like this. The stained glass is remarkable. My sister likes it because of the Disney movie so caters to different tastes.

Cannot Miss When in Paris. Probably of of the most visited sites in Paris, it is still nevertheless, absolutely worth going to Notre-Dame Cathedral. The history, alone, is amazing as is the massive structure with its famous flying buttresses. It is a true Parisian architectural gem! Just don't expect Quasimodo to greet you. :-)
I know you will enjoy your visit to this iconic cathedral.
This was spectacular. We'd been to Notre Dame before but never up the towers. Not sure why as it was unreal. Despite the queue, rain and construction on top, this is one trip I would do again.

Nice architecture!. Notre Dame was nice to see from the outside, but if you want to go in, prepare for the neverending line and waiting. I couldnt be bothered to wait in the que so I just admired it from the outside. Must see in Paris, especially if you like gothic architecture.

Don't spend much time. Even though the Notre-Dame Cathedral is on your list, walk the few blocks up the hill and spend more time at the Pantheon. Like Saint Paul and Saint Peter this a large domed Cathedral that is much less crowded and offers a better chance to see the building. The pendulum and the crypts with out people pushing their way around are a must.

Plenty of steps, so beware!. The queue to go up is rather long - we went just after Easter. But it is worth the wait. To be able to see those eponymous views of the city by the side of a gargoyle is great. Just be ready for when the bell so toll
Beautiful Cathedral!. Make sure you walk around the entire Cathedral to get a full appreciation of the size and architecture.

Can I just say WOW?!!!?. This Cathedral is so amazing and stunning, I would definitely recommend going inside because it is just so lovely. Do be prepared to wait in a line to get in, but trust me, if you are a lover of architecture and beautiful churches, DON'T MISS OUT!

nice one!. i liked the church!!is really big and the connection with the fairytale of my childhood was really intense butttt.it wasnt as i thought it would be!i was waiting for something more spectacular!but ok!its a church!Also i know that you can go on the top (free if you are under 26)!you cannot miss that spot when you are in Paris!you own it to your childhood anyway :)
Stunning. Absolutely Breathtaking. The history was so interesting. The inside was gorgeous. I recommend if you are visiting make sure this.is one of your stops. You won't be disappointed.

Definately a highlight of Paris. Plan your arrival carefully as there can be very long lines and the Paris Museum Pass does not give you jump the queue to climb the Towers. Having said that it is absolutely worth it as there are sweeping views of the city with the Eiffel tower in the distance. We specifically visited the towers on a different day to visiting the Cathedral itself so as to split up the visit. I particularly likes the various gargoyle on the edges of the roof.

The center of the city!!!. Interesting!!! Piece of Art!!! History!!! Mistyrious!!! Another place that makes you come back to the city of lights!!! I didn't make it to get to the top and i really regret it!!!I hope next time I can dedicate the respect and admiration it deserves !!!
The Cathedral is special place. but you may have to wait on very long queue, so I recommend wearing a hat or head cover to avoid the sunstroke

Great View and Climb. Definitely enjoyed visiting the cathedral and the towers. The architecture is beyond beautiful and the historical overview was also very nice. We also decided to climb the towers and we were glad to have done so as the views were great. Though, it is unfortunate due to past litter-ers, they have installed mesh netting so people don't throw stuff over. Would recommend though.

THIS BUILDING IS JAW DROPPING. Oh my this building is stunning. We went late afternoon early evening as the lights were dipping so the internal lights were on . As you enter there is a feeling of historic presence of being. The architects again have kept this style of Gothic artistry ( which I do love ). The height of this building shocked me somewhat as i expected it to be smaller ( viewing the top from the other side of the Seine ) The doorway is covered in sculptures too many to list. Inside is what you would expect in décor of such a truly magnificent piece of art. Another very moving visit for me emotionally. We came here for our honeymoon a few years ago and wasn't disappointed.

Beautiful.. We chose to purchase a skip the line ticket to see Notre Dame and climb to the bell tower. It was well worth it. As they say the lines are quite long. The church itself is full of beautiful stained glass windows and sculptures. We just loved the Gothic architecture ! Amazing. If u can climb the 422 stairs to get to the top of the bell tower do it ! We loved it.

The heart of the French world.. Here is where the French say all begins. Look for the brass disk in the middle of the square in front of of the church.Looking at Charlemagne statue enter on the right, easier. Be quiet and respectful in the church. If possible go to mass if catholic For Saturday evening mass and hear the magnificent organ. To get to mass seating, the rope is at the entrance of the church in the center. See the beautiful windows and statuary.
Must see. Stunning building, and worth a visit. Very crowded area though. We didn't go inside as wanted to explore the area, plus queue was too long!
Be Patient. If you don't mind standing in the queue your patience will be rewarded. It is so massive yet peaceful inside that you would wish you could just stay there and pray.

Stunning Cathedral Inside and Out. We had a great time just walking around the outside of the Cathedral, so it was all icing on the cake when we went inside. There was a line to get inside, but it went very quickly. The inside is quite dark (it was a rainy day) but very ornate and beautiful. We wanted to climb to the top of the towers, but the line didn't move for the 30 minutes we waited so we went on to other attractions.

A must see, but crowded. I love churches and this one is magnificent really. It took a little while to go in, but as soon as I did (for my very first time) I cried, and cried. The organ was being played and it was beautiful. Though crowded, it's worth it.
Stand back and take it all in!. Make a point to view at night, as the towers and the rest of the cathedral are lit spectacularly. Take your time to take it all in.

Stunning building. Almost of famous as the Eiffel Tower is Notre Dame cathedral and its towers. Its a stunning building and well worth visit. It can, however, get extremely busy so plan well in advance.
Spell-binding!. We caught this place at 9 o'clock on Monday (18th.)morning as they started choir practice,stayed inside for half an hour ,then spent an hour outside enjoying the views.

Awesome. Got there about 45 min before it opened was 1st in line by time it opened line was quite long so go early. Narrow stairs going up but was easy and I'm 55. Awesome views at top, cool gargoyles, don't miss the 2 bells can be missed very narrow passage to entrance. Wife got a bit dizzy going down but over all a must do.
