Seeing the gargoyles up close is amazing, and you have a 360 view from the North tower.
Do it. Well worth the climb / queues whatever to get the hunchback's eye view of Paris. The city is beautiful from all vantage points and this is just another one of them.

Worth the line. The line into the Notre Dame takes for ever, but it is still worth the wait. The cathedral is magnificient, and of course a must see for any traveller interested in historical landmarks.

A must see point of Interest. I first read about this while reading the Hunchback of Notre-Dame as a teen. So this brings back a time of exploring the world via books. This land mark is awesome, as beautiful as the outside is the inside is awesome and so great. A most see for the visitors of Paris that have never been.
A little disappointing. The quarter around the cathedral is magnificent. But the cathedral in itself is not that amazing, for my part I was a little disappointed. Still beautiful.
Quick Look. Long queque to enter so had to view from the outside as time was running out. Lovely open area to the front to admire the Cathedral from

So beautiful.... I cried when I saw this place. Took the tower tour (long line, the wait is worth it) and saw the gargoyles. I wanted to be like Quasimodo and climb the towers like he did. The cathedral is breathtaking and the organ gave me chills down my spine. Just go. I recommend seeing this more than the eiffel tower. Enough said.

Amazing!!. I didn't get a chance to actually go inside due to the long line but just looking at it from the outside was enough for me. The amount of detail on this building is insane, I must have stood there for at least 15 minutes just staring at it. Must see!

Views from the top trump any other views in Paris.. I climbed Eiffel tower and L'arc de Triumph, but the views did not compare to this ones. Sadly most people miss it. Be sure to go early in the morning to avoid long queues.

Long queues. The queue was so long we decided not to go inside, but having visited before this was not an issue. Instead we strolled around the outside of the building and took time to admire the gargoyles and the intricate details so often overlooked.

Good photo Point. Visited this in May. I haven't been inside the Cathedral but just seen it from outside. It is one of the stops for Big Bus and most other tourist buses. If you are interested in just seeing it from outside, it is a good stop for a few photo shots.

Amazing. If you want to visit some place is historical, cultural and not so far from the city center, Notre Dame is the place the you should check out.I remember when I was there, my attention draw away by this beautiful cathedral. Every little small details on the wall and all the histories behind it, just great. It located on the smal island, which on the river. Just made it even more interesting. There are quite a lot souvenir shops near by. And I did find the price generally cheapper than other places, don't know why, but sure it is great for people who want to get some postcard or fridge magnets. Of course it other many other thing as well. Just check them out.

More than just religious a monument. Notre dame Cathedral is impressive, whether you have a religious view, architectural, historical or just look for beautiful. Hundreds of people queuing to get inside get awarded for their patience.

Worth the 1.5 hour wait in line. I decided to ascend the towers on a cold day in January and had to wait in line for about 1.5 hours. I did not understand what I was in store for, or I would have undoubtedly been more patient. You'll climb nearly 400 steps in winding staircases, but in several portions. I would definitely not recommend this for anyone not prepared to climb the steps. They only allow a certain number of people up to the different stages (for obvious, safety reasons). This is what caused the long wait. However you climb up to the very top eventually, get a panoramic view of Paris, and are able to see the gargoyles and other unique facets of the structure up close.
Cool!. Most people have heard of this beautiful church, and it really is a site to see inside. Climb the stairs - there's a lot of them - but it's worth it...

An experience. You need to have stamina to climb Notre-Dame. It is a real workout. Think about spending half a day on a Stairmaster - can your thighs and lungs handle it? You're walking up about a 20-story building, so be prepared: wear real shoes, don't come in flip-flops or little sandals, and don't come loaded with packages. The walkway at the top is very small and crowded. Put your selfie sticks away before you harm someone.

Admired from the outside. Our hop on hop off bus pick up was close by here. We admired the building from the outside during sunset. The church bells sounded and it was amazing to hear! I'd love to go in one day...

Spectacular building. A gorgeous cathedral which should be visited if visiting Paris. The inside and outside of the cathedral is spectacular and should not be missed if you enjoy photography. Stunning.

I would have liked to give this more. This was my second time up the towers, and it was the thing I wanted to do most in Paris because I had fond memories from my time up in 2006. The view from atop the cathedral is beautiful and the gargoyles are incredible. You can also visit two bells, which is always a nice treat. The architecture of the cathedral is impressive and my memory really didn't let me down: beautiful gargoyles, statues, clocks... everywhere!Even so, I've decided to only give this attraction three stars, and that's because of the overall experience. The towers open at 10 am. We went there at 9.30 and the line was already about as long at the cathedral itself. They only let people in in groups of about 20 because the top is very small.Ten o'clock went by and the line didn't move at all. I left my husband in the line and went to the front to check out what was happening. Some workers went in, gave some surly looks, didn't say anything. Finally, at around 10.30, a worker came out of the towers and hung up a piece of paper saying they were on strike. So we wasted time waiting in line for nothing--and I don't even want to imagine how long the poor people at the very front of the line had been waiting!The strikes alternated: work one day, strike one day. I tried to find a reason for the strikes, but the only news I could find online was from almost a year prior, where it mentioned that the workers had gone on strike to protest against pickpocketers. So that's clever, isn't it? Protest against pickpocketers by leaving the tourists outside like easy prey waiting in line for an attraction that won't open, but tourists don't know it won't open because workers don't declare they're on strike until half an hour after opening time? Fabulous...Despite that, I still really wanted to visit the towers because I knew my husband would love seeing the gargoyles up close. I calculated which day the workers wouldn't be on strike and it was our very last day in Paris. We got in line at 10 am and had to wait for almost two hours. All in all, it was a long wait but I think it could have been worse. The wait is outside and there's absolutely nothing to cover you, so pray for mild weather.Pickpockets thrive around Notre Dame, so beware! The very first thing we saw the day we arrived in Paris was a group of police officers searching a group of girls who clearly looked like professional pickpocketers.While waiting in line for the towers, we were approached the same group of girls we'd seen on our first day. They use the age-old technique of distracting you with a fake petition while they surround you and take everything they can. My husband gave them a rotund "Leave!" when they approached, so they gathered around another tourist a little bit ahead. My blood was boiling because the tourist was so concentrated trying to read the petition--the trick was working--and he was already surrounded. I went over there and shouted out "Ignore them! They want to steal from you!" several times and the girls stuck their tongues out at me and vanished. We didn't see them bothering anyone else in the line that morning.The fee to go up the towers is 8,5€. The moment you finally get into the tower, you have to climb several flights of stairs until you reach a tiny gift shop where you buy your tickets. Then, it's back to the stairs until you reach the first viewpoint where all the gargoyles are. It's beautiful to just stand there and look at all the details, but it can be tricky to take good photos because, apart from the wire fixture encasing the entire gallery, now they've also added a thick black net. It's practically impossible to take a picture of a person and a gargoyle or the views at the same time because the big black net obstructs the views and the statues.After another flight of stairs, you can visit the very top of the tower and there's protective glass. There's a worker up there with you hurrying you along. It turns out there's a sign that says you can only stay up there for maximum five minutes. Once the five minutes are up, the worker starts calling everyone to go back down and leave.The exit leaves you right by entrance of the cathedral, on the other side of the building. It's a real shame that the visit to the towers doesn't connect with the inside of the cathedral. Right at the exit door, there should be access to the cathedral because, after waiting in the cold for two hours, who wants to wait another extra hour to go inside? Plus, entrance to the cathedral is free, so if you've already paid to go into the towers, it would be fabulous if after your visit you could directly access the interior.But that's asking too much, I'm afraid.

GREAT CHURCH OF PARIS. We visited the famous Notre Dame Church of Paris in December, 2015 more precisely on 25.12.2015 when entire paris was celebrating Christmas and glittering with lights. It was really memorable to visit the church. It is stated that The Notre dame Church is most visited place even morethan the fmous Effiel Tower. One should always visit the church when going to Paris without which the journey is inomplete.
BEAUTIFUL!. This is a must see when visiting Paris! So beautiful! Due to time we didn't go inside, however the outside is incredible!

Definitely worth the wait to get to the top. Amazing view from the top & great history to this 800+ year old cathedral. The entrance fee is 9Euros & on a busy day will take min 2 hours just to gain entrance to go up.

Nice view, pity about the queue!. The towers are interesting to visit and provide an interesting view of Paris and its history, however the queue was significant and without cover (watch the weather). This is sadly one of those 'Must Do' visits, but be prepared to wait and then climb lots of stairs ;)

Excellent view of Paris . The gargoyles and view from the top of the tower are amaxing. They are worth seeing and provide a good photo opportunity. We arrived at 9 to queue to go up Notre Dame Tower even though it opens at 10am. We were not the first people there but luckily we were in the first group of 20 to enter the tower. By 10am you were unable to see the end of the line. I definetly recommend getting there early as they only allow groups of 20 access into the tower every ten minutes. Keeping the numbers small at the top of the tower led to a more enjoyable experience as you were able to move around without fighting your way through the crowds. There are alot of stairs and small spaces to fit through so you need to be reasonably fit and not at all claustrophobic to visit the tower. Make sure you buy anything you want from the gift shop before you visit the tower as you can't get back to it.

Awesome!. Get there very early to claim your spot on the line and hope for a clear day. The climb is a bit tough, especially since it is spiral stairs, but there are spots to stop and catch your breath. The views from the top make the climb absolutely worthwhile. Unfortunately, they have placed a metal cage and mesh over the open areas, obviously for safety reasons, but they make it difficult to take pictures of the gargoyles. Nevertheless, it can be done. Don't miss the bell tower and the second climb to the very top.

Fantastic morning out!. This building is stunning! Inside it's magical and if you go up the towers the gargoyles are truly fantastic! Just like you'd imagine from Disney's Hunchback! This was a highlight! A little queue for the tower and many steps, but worth it!!

Majestic grandeur!. Everyone has heard of the Notre-Dame and we all imagine it if we have not seen it but it is really a sight to behold. The looming towers, statues, spires and architectural detailing are truly awesome. Long queues form at the entrance and even if you can't go in the external facades are no less memorable.
A must see attraction. one of the place that is a must to go. Beautifully crafted inside and out. The place is exquisite with river beside it.

Spirituality at its Best. I consider myself a spiritual person (not a religious person). The aura and spiritual power radiating from Notre Dame is mind-blowing. My mom and I stood on the sidewalk looking at the magnificent structure and our tears started to flow. Just standing there we could feel the history of all those who have gone before us - not many places have affected us this much. I was in awe of the power I felt from this cathedral.

Beautiful, grand, great history. Beside having to wait quite some time to get in here, it's worth it (if you appreciate this sort of thing).We enjoyed walking around the outside, then going inside for a look.It's really grand and magnificently built. An amazing structure.Some nice restaurants nearby, few minutes walk. Ask the locals for their pick.

Nice and famous Catherdral, but too much crowded.. It's a "must visit it" if you are in Paris. You must wait in a queue for climbing up to the towers; if you want to visit the cathedral, there are free guided tours granted by history students. Find the one according to your language and the flags they carry. A tip is highly suggested.The tower sight view is nice, but it is not worth the queue.
Wasted time. The view is nice at the top, but not as good as Mt Parnass or the Eiffel Tower. The queue is large (huge delays) and you get to climb a LOT of stairs. NOT for the faint of heart.

Appreciate the Architecture. We went to see this attraction last December 25, 2015. It was packed and well guarded by the police and military. It was a quick in and out for me because I don't like the smell of the old building.

another amazing building. Unfortunately due to safety precautions to go into the towers, we should have lined up for over one hour, so we skipped that. Did visited the Notre-Dame inside and really a must.

Visited as a student in 1968; then later with a HS group from NH.. I learned many things here; among them; that the Crown of Thorns is available for viewing on Good Friday every year. I also learned that many of the windows were removed for safety purposes during WWII. I also visited the top of the Cathedral and learned about the Bells; Awesome!

Underwhelming experience, but worth at least a look-see. Having heard so much about Notre Dame, I honestly found it underwhelming in terms of its size and grandeur. The lines are extremely long for both the cathedral and tower climb. The former's interior looks like any other cathedral (Sacre Couer is more impressive!) while the latter is claustrophobic and a really tiring affair for those older and with injuries / low stamina. Beware also the gypsies who will try to strong-hand you into "donations" - playing on your pity for the deaf etc. Just ignore and walk away.
Impressive Catholic Church & line goes fast. This was my favorite church to visit, I believe it was built in the 1100's and is absolutely stunning inside. I recommend visiting, visitation is free.

Climb to the top!. Even though the line was super long, the view is absolutely worth it! We went there on a windy day and it was 2nd Jan, but you see a stunning view and all the lovely sights of Paris and the seine just below.
Amazing Cathedral. The Notre Dame Cathedral is a beautiful cathedral and and a must watch attraction for all the tourists. The cathedral has a free entry.

Worth the wait. We waited about an hour to get to the towers. It's a low entry fee and a different view of Paris when you get to the top. Whilst there isn't too much to do upstairs, it's another aspect of Paris to be experienced.
A must see. A very spiritual building with a great architectural history. A bit too busy for my liking but that's to be expected I guess. I fell in love with the stained glass windows.

Lines too long & nothing to see. Went on 4th Jan 2016 in the afternoon. There were two line forming in front of the cathedral, the right is for inside of the church & the left for the stairs climb. We went for the latter.Lines for the tower climb were too long. It took us 2 hours out in the cold weather just to get to the entrance gate which is on the left side of the building.Not much to see, some panoramic views of the city, nothing special.Outcome: only the achievement that you climbed over 422 steps because there are no lifts. You will be out of breath & there are no bathroom in. The way up is difficult, but the way down is much easier.Disappointment: thought the rang bell was the historic one, no it's not.One small gift shop is there. Prices as you will expect to be unreasonably high.Inside the shop, you will be asked to pay the stairs entrance tickets fees. It's not free.

A must, some of the best views of paris. If your down in the area visiting Notre Dame, you simply have to take the tower tour as well. The church is beautiful, but the gargoyles and the views are a once in a lifetime experience. Tips-arrive early, most days the towers open at 8. The line is slow and gets long if you wait till later in the day. Plus early sun is better for pictures. -at time of visit admission was €8. -

Wonderful Attraction on Special Days. The bells on Sundays, feasts, and Christmas days. This is the most beautiful aspect of the cathedral. I loved their echo-sounds every time. The neighborhood is very good for a common Parisian walk; with many cafes, diners, and souvenir shops. On holidays, it is very crowded and intimate.

Easy access. Viewing the inside of Notre-Dame had no que, we were straight in after a quick security check. Once inside photography is allowed although no flashes.The Cathedral was not too crowded and it was pleasant looking around.There was a long que, say 1 hr, for access to the catacombs and the rooftop tour.

Masterpiece. Notre-Dame Cathedral was right opposite my hotel. I have never seen so many people thronging to any attraction at any time of the day. One must not just see the place from front but from various angles. It looks different and beautiful.

Lines are long - but they move fast!. We visited shortly after the attacks in Paris. Security was highly evident everywhere there were crowds. All landmarks had additional security checks at the entrances which made the lines longer than normal, but they were very efficient and the lines moved quickly. Once inside we were truly awe struck. We have visited many cathedrals, but the history, architecture, and sense of place you feel being in this building in the very heart of Paris was truly palpable. We were moved.
Once in a lifetime experience. Breathtaking views from the towers of Notre Dame are wonderful, but the 3-hour wait was a bit much. We got to go up in the bell towers.

Stunning!. If there are services going on when you are touring please be respectful and quiet! There was a service going on and I was amazing and ashamed that so many Americans were being loud and talking so much. :( It is mind boggling. But seeing the rose windows from the inside is just amazing.
Go at the end of the night. Go at the end of the night to see the actual mess, but come in time or you cannot go in anymore. Reccommend!

A Must See!. Definitely plan on visiting here with any trip to Paris. It's free to see and the architecture and building itself are amazing. We went on a busy day in October and had to wait in line for roughly 15 minutes.

totally worth the wait. We tried to hit the Towers line early to beat the crowds, but we still waited a good 45 minutes to get in. It's not a terribly taxing climb and the views of the Cathedral and of Paris are incredible. Being able to see the chimera/gargoyles up close is remarkable. Just the sheer size and detail involved in the exterior of Notre Dame is hard to take in without being up in the towers and able to see it more closely. There are some small annoyances like tight spaces and people jumping in front of you to get their selfies in. Also, there are a few times where you are sort of stuck between sections while they wait for people to finish. This is a great crowd control measure, but it feels a bit mysterious since they don't tell you why you can't keep going (or at least I wasn't around when we were told). I thought it was very well-organized, safe, and must-do part of any trip to Paris.

Beautiful Gothic. I use to visit this kind of places on weird (or at least unusual) occasions so, i always cannot complain about lines.I visited Notre-Dame on a cold rainy day and this gave me also an special atmosphere of discomfort as people in old ages should have felt, creating a special atmosphere to the visit
Get a tour. There are a lot of things to see and without a good guide you are just looking at some cool old stones and art work
Magnificent!. Long lines, but worth it. One can go in and walk around without joining a tour. I would think if one was there to attend mass that it would be too distracting with all the tourists.

Do take the time and effort to climb the 387 stairs for unsurpassed views. The north tower of Notre Dame Cathedral is 226 feet high and for an entrance fee of €8.50 you can climb the 387 stairs for magnificent views of Paris. On the first Sunday of the month it is free to climb. The towers were completed in 1250. In 2013 new bells were rung in the towers to commemorate the 850th anniversary of Notre Dame.

Well worth the climb. I am not the fittest person and i really didnt' think I could get to the top, but I did by passing myself and allowing others to go ahead of me. There is more than enough time to get to the top and still look a the view. As the Bell Tower was undergoing maintenance we didn't get to see it, but we did get to up the North tower where we saw graffiti from the 1800's
Go with time and patient to enter. The Cathedral is great from outside, but I couldn't enter it due the long line to enter. Go to back of the it and enjoy also a great view you can see in the park
Notre-Dame is a must see church in Paris. The architecture of this church is unique and the surrounding area is worthwhile a stroll along the Seine and some nearby places.
Peaceful. It is a great place to go at Paris, it is peaceful and has an amazing architecture. The admission is free.

Breathtaking. This is a jewel in the center of one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It is worthwhile staying in line, if there is one, since this historic Cathedral dates back a long time. Attending mass there if you are Catholic it is a treat especially doing the holidays. Do not miss it even if you are not a Catholic, it is a welcoming place to think, pray and enjoy beauty.

Gothic Architecture at its Finest!. You will never be disappointed by this beautiful place! Take your time to savor all the details and beauty of this historical place. Look around outside as well to see the minute details. It's free, so that's a plus.

Beautiful. We stayed at a small boutique hotel right across the street from the Notre-Dame, and everyday we noticed a huge line around 10 a.m. So if you wish to go without all the other tourists and their selfie sticks, do go early avoid the line. The line to up to the top also cue up fast and they only allowed a certain number of people to go up at a time, be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes. It's magnificent at night with all it all lit up.
Very impressive.. Great architecture and a great church. We first got to see this from a boat trip on the Seine. But go on foot as well and enjoy the very impressive building.
Great architecture. The line was long but moved very quickly. The windows are amazing. The only problem is that people talk too loud so you don't get that spiritual feel. Still a must see
huge cathedral. Huge cathedral. You feel its holiness when you go inside. We were lucky t go there on Christmas eve.

Highlight of our visit. We arrived around 9:30 am and were in the first group to climb the tower. It was definitely worth climbing all those stairs. The weather was fantastic and the view fascinating. What a wonderful experience spending the time in the company of all those mythical creatures. It is well organised and they don't let too many people climb at once, so it's safe and you can enjoy the view.

A beautifull diamond in Paris. One of the highlights during our trip to Paris. We visited the Notre-Dame three years ago as well but then it was under construction. Now it has been completely renovatie. This cathedral breathes history and is a real beauty. Please try to have a guided tour so you will informed about the unique history about the cathedral ...

Stunning view of Paris. The famous 402 steps! You get rewarded with great view of Paris. There are three stops on the way up allowing the tourists to see the details of Gothic architecture and the famous gargoyles.
Always Nice to be there. Although there was a lot of policy iTS always Nice to sit down and watch what is happening n the hart of the city
Beautiful. Its worth a walk through to see this stunning cathedral. Do not miss this while in Paris! The lines are long, but move quickly.

A lovely cathedral. Make sure that you check your calendar and that you don't choose Sunday's, christian holy days.The top of the cathedral is a separate visit and you will have to wait a lot but has great views over Paris, but you already went to Eiffel Tower and the arch then there is not so much here.

Not overly attractive compared to other cathedrals. Notre Dame is tremendously popular for a reason I don't fully understand. It is not overly beautiful inside. Sainte-Chapelle, just up the street, is far more beautiful and less attended. ND has a nice rose window, but so do a number of other cathedrals. They lack the gorgeous side altars so many churches have. They do have public restrooms outside, which is a biggie. I've been twice to ND and have been underwhelmed both times.

Magical at night. We stopped by on our one night visit through Paris. We did not go inside but enjoyed the view from the outside. With the warm weather and Christmas spirit it was a lovely way to spend an hour or so.

Inside YES. My wife and I enjoyed very much this visit and it is one of those Cathedrals you shall not forget and well worth the visit. The structure is also impressive from the outside and it has impressive workmanship both inside as well as outside. Well worth the visit and highly recommended.

To see the roofs of Paris. Rates informations : Free entrance for the Cathedral but if you want to visit the towers, it's 8,50 euros per person to buy tickets on the spot.
(beware of agencies that sell tickets with guide up to 35 euros per person!)

My favorite Paris attraction. My husband and i visited so many attraction in Paris and this was by far one of our favorite attractions it is the most beautiful church that i have ever seen !!! We spent an hour there seeing everything you could it is free to get in but they do have a room you pay a small fee to get in and it is well worth it. It contained beautiful jewels on crowns and statues. they also have a small gift shop the we bought a few things from for our children. The only complaint i have is when you enter the church there is a sign asking you not to take pictures which i did not do but so many people were i just find that disrespectful the gift store sells books with all the pictures you need why not buy one to support the church ???

Must go inside!!. The Notre Dame Cathedral looks impressive from the outside but a look inside is a must! The sheer size, the stain glassed windows and more will blow you away. A look around the back is also a must with some lovely gardens hidden away behind the cathedral.
amazing.... It's a must see sight in Paris .. magnificent architecture... close to the center and worth a visit.. As it is one of the popular place, can get overly crowded at times..

Grand. There are places that are "must visit"; Notre-Dame is definitely on that list. If you are in Paris, just like the Eiffel Tower, please find the time to come and see this beauty, full of history. You will not regret.

Can not explain how grand this is inside!. Free entry to the major part of the attraction, you can pay more to see the special collection and climb up for a view (we didn't). If you like yo can hire an audio guide (again we didn't).The sheer size and scale (an knowing the history from our fab Wego Walking Tour the day before) help bring the Grand Dame to life - a must see when in France!!

Essential. A visit to Notre-Dame and its towers is an essential part of your trip to Paris. The top three or four items in Paris are Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, and then l'Arc de Triomphe, along with a walk down at least part of the Champs-Elysees. If you go to Paris and don't see these three sites, you are missing out. There are a million other things to do and places to eat, too, so plan on staying for two weeks or two months or two years!The bell tower is accessible by foot. It is important to review the tour guide for hours and arrive at least 1/2 hour to 1 hour earlier than when the line opens. The line moves very slowly. If you arrive during the day, you will wait 3-4 hours. If you get there early in the morning you'll be in the first group.If the weather is nice, take your breakfast at one of the cafes across the street and watch the line form and then get in line before there more than 10 or 20 people. The walking to the top is about 400 steps (I think?). The staircase is fairly narrow and is not suitable to persons who are not healthy.
Do the whole tour. If you go here I suggest taking the whole tour including the climb to the bell tower. Lots of history and culture involved with this building.
A classic. A must see the views are spectacular. The lineup is intimidating but worth the wait. I did it with my young children when the Disney movie came out they adored it.
Must see in Paris. Loved the tour of Notre-Dame Cathedral-Go early to avoid the line. Must have café latte at the Café next to the Cathedral.

Attending a church service is a must. No trip to Notre-Dame is complete without participating in a Mass. If you ignore all the tourists taking photos and videos whilst you attend the service, it is actually very pleasant.
A beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful place to visit. Such a grand place with amazing architecture and history. Close to the center of Paris and worth a visit.

Must Visit Cathedral in France. If you're visiting France, you must never miss a visit to its most famous Cathedral - Notre-Dame. Immortalized by the novel / play / Disney movie, this is a magnificent structure that will take your breath away. Located in an area along the river, it's a very popular place for tourist and can get really crowded. There are long lines of people wanting to go up the towers, but just seeing it up close is more than worth the visit!
Not to be missed. Do spend time wandering in and around the cathedral - it is beautiful and fascinating. Don't miss Joan of Arc's tomb.
Notre Dame. This is a wonderful piece of French history, well worth a visit to see this magnificent church. easy to spot off the metro
beautiful. when we visited we decided not to go inside but just to admire the amazing architecture from the outside
Beautiful Architectural History. Walk inside the cathedral to see historical pieces and archings including the Joan of Arc. You can buy religious souvenirs as well.

Amazing view of Paris. The line was long (at least one hour, It was Saturday), and due to security reasons there is no additional entrance for Paris Museum holders. But it was worth to wait! Highly recommended!

Try to get there for a mass . It's always impressive and the line to get in moves quickly even with the increased security This time we arrived in time for Sunday mass with the organ and chanting added to the experience Always nice to pop in and admire the amazing architecture and Windows

An ecclesiastical visit. We walked from the Quartier Latin ( Left Bank ) across the Ile back to Le Marais, and visited the Cathedral en route. How imposing and magnificent is that! Entry was free, although there were many opportunities inside to give money away. A sense of grandeur and wonder,,,,,
Beautiful. The zero kilometer is starting from here to all France. The one of the most cathedral in the world. At the night time you can take a parisian boat tour to see the river side of Cathedral.

Stunning Views of Paris!. The steps are no joke and you better be in descent shape in order to endure the hike to the top. I am in good shape and I was winded once I reached the last step. It is worth the burn in your legs once you reach the top of the church and take in some of the best views in all of Paris. I would highly recommend you climb to the top and take advantage of this once in a lifetime opportunity.

This place doesn't need my review.... It's Notre Dame people and not the college nor it's football team, we're talking flying butresses, amazing architecture, Jesus and history in general and maybe even a hunch back...

Going up to the towers is worth the wait. We waited in line for about a half hour to be able to see the towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. There are beautiful views from all directions. I wish there weren't as many fences/wires around the permitter of the building. When we went to Paris years ago these did not exist so it was easier to take pictures.

Best view in town. Had been inside Notre Dame on a previous trip but had never climbed to the towers. I wasn't sure if it was worth it but had heard that kids like the close up view of all the gargoyles carved around the rooftop. Since I was with my elementary school aged nephews, we decided to give it a shot. Not only was it really cool for them to see the gargoyles up close, but it offered a spectacular, 360 degree view of the city including the Seine, the Eiffel Tower and Montmarte. The pictures of the gargoyles in the foreground with those landmarks in the background came out beautifully. I highly recommend it.

Beautiful. Notra-Dame can be really busy and you often have to queue at the entrance. The Cathedral is beautiful and if you want to go to the top of the Cathedral you queue and pay to go up to the top. The stainglass windows and architecture are stunning as is the 400 year old tree to the side. Do take time to walk all around the Notre-Dame as there are small gardens at the rear.
Beautiful cathedral. Part of our bus tour. We were given sufficient time to walk through and the inside is as beautiful as the outside.
WOW!. We came to see it in the evening and it was stunning. The lights around it were fantastic and it was much larger than I expected. Got really lovely photos.
The beauty and spacious church. A very large church a beautiful church. Napolean was crowm Emporer in 1804 here, good history, beautiful church.
Classic. If you don't know the story by Victor Hugo, read it and then visit this place. You appreciate it more.

Wonderful Structure. A beautiful cathedral with really beautiful architecture. We couldn't managed to go to the roof top as time didn't permit. The place is accessible by metro rail from other parts of the city.

Visit to the Tower - Amazing view of Paris. I've visited Notre-Dame's Tower and recommend it - the view of Paris are amazing plus a different view of the gargoyles and the belfry. The only thing you must consider is the hard climbing - the stairs are tough !!

Beautiful inside and Phenomenal Views from the top. One of our favorite stops on our trip as the inside is spectacular but the views from the top are the best of anywhere we went. It was quite a climb but well worth the effort.

Higher Powers. The climb up the 400-some stairs is not for the faint of heart. The stairwell is very narrow and you need to be fit to climb all the way since there is no way to get down other than going all the way up and over and back down.

Best View in the City. Gazing at the Gargoyles Gaurding the City was worth the Climb. Absolutely one of the best views of the city. Love looking at the gargoyles with the Eiffel Tower in the distance. This is a spectacular vantage point overlooking the Seine and the City of Light. Definitely worth the 425 step climb to the top. There is a fencing to ensure safety but photo ops are still readily available. You can see a different level of detail in the cathedral looking down. What a view!!! Word of caution.. The climb is steep and the spiral staircase is dimly lit. Those with vertigo may be challenged by this climb. The Towers are covered in the Museum Pass but the pass doesn't get you to the front of the queue on this attraction.
Towers of Notre Dame. A beautiful structure, inspiring artists from Victor Hugo (Hunchback of Notre Dame) to Philippe Petite (Man on Wire).

Queues were long in October but now that Paris is quieter and calmer this would be a good time to visit. Queues were too long for us to entertain joining and we didn't want to waste our day standing in this one but from the outside we marvelled at what we saw. The surrounding little streets of the Ile were so fascinating that we spent all our time exploring these. A great area to get lost in and find yourself in one of the many little local eateries.
Beautiful but expect long lines!!. Beautiful space. Worth the visit. Close to the metro. Gift shop elsewhere however. Prices are high here.

Simply Out of this World!. We had spent the week touring cathedrals in England. Even though they were all amazing, entering this one was like walking into heaven itself. Color everywhere! Magnificent! Don't skip this if you go to Paris!
Delightful View. A real tourist attraction and a great piece of French historical monument to visit. The sculpting on the church arches is a must see.
Worth going!. It is definitely worth going to the towers of the Notre Dame Cathedral and taking in the views from the top. Be sure to take a camera so you can get the iconic views!

Fantastic Views. You need to be fit, there are a lot of steps, without resting areas. Once you have reached the roof area, you can enter the tower and view the 13 Ton "Emmanuelle" and the 7 Ton "Mary II" bells. There is an English speaking guide to answer any questions that you might have. You exit the roof by a second stairway in the other tower.

Must see!. We did very few touristy things during our two week stay in Paris but this was one of them. Sitting down and listening to the organ being tuned was so cool!! We were in awe as we walked around and then headed up the stairs to the first outdoor balcony. I was so caught up on the beauty of it all I forgot that I am scared of heights....:). We didn't go all the way up because of this but I am sure it would have been spectacular!
Notre Dame. Big queues to go into the cathedral. But atmosphere in the square good. Perhaps a visit mid-week would be better.

Great Views!. Went to see the Cathedral in the evening, didn't get to see the interior in daylight, what i did see was great. A short film played about the history of the Cathedral which was interesting.The next day i got there at 9:45 to join the queue to climb up the towers. As a 18-25yr EU resident i got free entry which was great. My first time in Paris - the views were spectacular, i'd recommend going up.Queue moves relatively quickly as people are allowed in as large groups. Note that there are a lot of steps to climb up and down.
Mesmorizing. We have been to paris many times and the Cathedral is always on our list to see. with free entry and spectacular architecture. it is always a new experience.
BEAUTIFUL CATHEDRAL. A must when traveling to Paris.. beautiful architecture and history... Arch de Triomphe+La Tour Eiffel+NotreDame must be visited while in Paris

Esmeralda and Quasimodo!. Point of major attraction not only for the unique architecture but also for Victor's Hugo romantic story of Esmeralda and Quasimodo. Monument of great interest and beauty. The interior of the Cathedral is superb. The queues are long but are worth waiting!!

One of the most famous churches in the world. This is a must see in Paris. Historic cathedral where Napoleon was crowned Emperor. Famous flying buttresses and sculptures on the exterior that tell the story of Christianity. Spend time with a good tour book that explains the various sections of the exterior. In the French Gothic style. Free admission.

Go for Study Mass!. This is a beautiful cathedral where we attended mass on Sunday. Be sure not to walk up front and go into the church if you are going to mass. Do not wait in the visitors line for those who just look and leave. Even if you do not speak French you will love the mass.
Must see!. Must see place for the architecture and history! Climb the stairs to the top if you have time but overall if you come to paris you must come here!

Takes you into a bygone era. Its a great old monument, a must see to feel the spirit of old Paris. The magnificent carvings shall be admired while you wait near the entrance to get into the cathedral. The sculptures take you into the olden days and give a glimpse of the bygone era. You can get the grandiose feeling of how grand life was in those days. The stain glasses are really huge and beautiful. For the Christians ....... it is also of religious significance. Read the story of this cathedral in wiki before going there.

Worth the effort. There are 422 steps up to the towers. The steps are small and you go round and round. There is a midpoint stop to view the bells of Notre Dame. Yes, they still use them! You climb up the north side cross over (see the walkway between the two towers) and climb back down the south tower. Your legs will be shaking when you hit terra firma. But it is worth it. For you photographers: you will get the grating in your photos as it is small mesh, not like a fence. Best photos are with smartphones.

Amazing!. My mom and I loved viewing the Notre Dame and actually seeing it in person. It is such a beautiful structure and something about being in it overwhelms you. We were lucky there was a mass about to take place so we waited and that was a great experience.Go visit.
Beautiful!. This centuries old cathedral is really worth a visit. Located on the Seines River it is filled religious figures and spectacluar stained glass!
Mezmerizing. It's beautiful and even though the ques look huge, they really move quickly. It's an amazing place. It's truly worth a visit.

Take your time. So many people rushing to have just "seen" Notre-Dame. Take your time here. It is a beautiful cathedral with a stunning windows from the inside. Take you time and enjoy the whole experience in this little island on the seine. the views of Paris are lovely but the windows are the real treasure.

Large Queues. We did not go inside due to the large queues. This was not a problem having been inside some years ago. Instead stood and marveled at the wonderful architecture externally, thinking of the workmen building such a wonderful building.

Very impressive!. The line was too long, so we decided to take photos and walk around...I had seen the interior in my youth, so it wasn't a priority... (Of course, we started to sing from the Disney movie!)The day wasn't terribly grey, so here are some photos around the beautiful cathedral.

Historic!. The cathedral is fantastic, an incredible architecture with sensational details, is one of the few places where the entrance is free, the queue is big plus moves fast, it is worth the visit.

Well worth the pain, more than just a tower climb.. More than just a tower climb, great views all round and fantastic architecture. Stairs are not for the faint hearted! It's free to visit inside first.

Worth it. Not going to deny it, I was totally out of breath by the time we got to the top. They allow a small group to climb, but I still felt pressured to keep up with the pack. The stairs steps are short but the winding stair case is narrow. The line was long outside, but it and the climb were well worth the views at the top. Do it if you can!

Climb to the top, if you dare.... The stairs climbing these towers are narrow, steep, and uneven. It is such an amazing taste of history to climb these towers. If your health permits it, I highly recommend it.
An Architectural marvel. Ok I just loved Notre Dame, but I must admit I am a lover of architecture and it has a lot of wow factor.
Awesome. The lines seem long, but they move fast. Once in take your time and look at everything. there is outstanding stained glass, incredible artwork and craftsmanship all around.

Magnificent view at night. The towers at night are beautiful. They lit up and a stroll outside is just fantastic. We saw different street artists outside the church. There were fire dancers, musicians and magicians and it was amazing.
No cost. We lined up to get into the cathedral, to our surprise, it was free. Very nice inside, not exceptional, but it is worth visiting. It has a nice atmosphere.

A spiritual place for worship. We always wanted to visit Notre Dame! a dream come through! A very popular place so there is always lots of people trying to get in. We attended mass, if you are interested in taking part of religious masses, these are offered daily. Amazing Gothic Architecture.No entrance fee but go early so you can avoid long waiting timesWatch for pickpockets!No bathrooms! is a place for worship and be always respectful and Visit the man of the house! Don't forget about him!...

Long queues but great view. Though long queues await it offers yet another magnificent view of the city. Reaching the top can be tedious and not advisable for the elderly. Else one must go for this view as part of the trip
Outside was very Photgenic.. During our visit it was very busy, with a queue of people many several meters long. Did not visit the inside on this occasion tooled like too long a wait.

Amazing view all over Paris city!. Amazing view for Paris city!
Closer view to the gargoyles and Cathedral architecture!
The waiting line is always extensive, so I advise to arrive before the opening hour. No priority line for Paris Museum Pass.

classic must see Paris sight. You can't go to Paris and fail to visit the Cathedral of Notre-Dame. It is an impressive sight both from outside (flying buttresses) and inside (beautiful stain glass windows).

Definitely worth the climb!. My sister and I did this on our last visit to Paris. We'd both done lots of the tourist attractions already in Paris having made multiple trips and not having done this before decided to give it a go. There's lots of stairs but the view is well worth the climb. Also the bells are really interesting and the gargoyles and other statues fascinating. We had a really fun afternoon.
Iconic and breath-taking. . The cathedral and towers are so ornate and beautiful it is hard to believe. We didn't want to leave. This is a must see for everyone who visits Paris.

Stunning Church - a must see. There is a replica church that was built in old Montreal , my home town. But nothing can compare to the beauty of the real thing... a must visit at least once... I was here in March this year and inspired to write a few more reviews due to the tragic events that unfolded yesterday... I hope the entire world stands together to support Paris and preserve the safety and security of the most beautiful city in the world... Je vous aime Paris

Fascinating to see the gargoyles up close; but not as good as it used to be.. In early November, we 'only' had to wait a half an hour to climb the 400 steps...but that number seems to include both ways; so it's not quite so bad..and there is a place or two to stop on the way. The view of Paris is spectacular; and we love the crazy gargoyles; but it is a poor experience compared to 20 years ago; before the netting was so insanely tight that you can hardly take photos of anything without pulling at it; and it is even hard to maneuver around the corners. As well, the staff now hustle you along, even if it is not particularly crowded. They want an entire group out before the next one is allowed in. No loitering! It makes for a less enjoyable visit, but I guess the numbers now just demand this level of control. I expect that soon, getting in here will be a whole different matter, with heightened security. Avoid the corner restaurant across the street, which looks nice, and charges a fortune for coffee and even has paid toilets!

Climb to the top for a great view. The interior is beautiful, especially the stained glass rose window. The climb to and from the top is a lot of stairs and often they're tiny, so not good for those having difficulty climbing or balancing. The view is amazing and I really enjoyed seeing the gargoyles up close.

The highlight of Ile de la Cite. Free visit of Notre Dame. Don't forget to spot "Kilometer Zero" in front of the church. Climbing the steps for a city view requires buying a ticket, but entrance to the church itself is not.
Awesome Historical Site. History, History, History! This is history at it;s best, the design and architect bars none. Being there is person doesnt even compare to any pictures we took.
Notre Dame. Breath taking from out side, even more spectacular from the inside, huge windows and art work no photos permitted inside.

Beautiful church with rich history of France here. Long long lines to get inside and I prefer Sacred Heart if I had to pick between the two. So many things have happened here--coronation of 3 French Kings, Marie Antoinette.

Big line, worthy experience!. This was one of the first things I did once I arrived at Paris. Climbing the towers is no easy task, so if you are not used to stairs, don't even enter the line: you will be climbing a lot of them. The line is super long, so be prepared to wait two hours more or less to enter the towers, especially under the sun. The good thing is that you will be close to a fence most of the time so you will have plases to rest, unlike the Louvre line.If you are under 26 entrance is free, but you will need to pay otherwise. As always, go for the museum pass to go on all majors attractions of Paris with the same ticket.

Notre-Dame Cathedral. Oh My I just loved this Cathedral. It is so regal internally. You are also able to light a candle inside (prayer) for a modest fee. Also keep an eye out for a prayer book. You can write your prayer in the book (which others can see) to make it a very special prayer.
A must see. The Notre-Dame cathedral is a must see and a must tour every time I am in Paris. I often coincide my visit with a religious holiday for an extra special experience.

must see. I have toured many beautiful churches in Europe, this one included. It is stunning but not my favorite. The crowds were manageable but the gypsies out front were so incredibly annoying. We toured the area on a open-top bus and this is where we were able to appreciate the exterior of Notre Dame.

Great architectural detail and beauty. We did not go inside as we were absolutely fascinated with this exterior of this magnificent. It offers so much for the careful eye. Truly superb. Will see the interior on the next trip.
Get there early to avoid queue. You can actually visit for free if you're under 25.It is worth for the views and for getting to see the gargoyles and bells up close.
Saw that from outside. We saw that from outside as a part of our city tour as we did not have enough time to go in. Good place!

love these two towers. The Two TowersMeasuring 200ft in height, these towers provide some of the best viewing points in Paris. The summit of 387 steps,no lift, it’s not only worth the climb for the panorama over Paris, but also to admire the stone gargoyles crouching on its ledge.don't be afraid of heights specially when going across between the two towers.the cost is Euro8.00 but beware of the very long queuesA paris pass is worth it.

I felt like i was in a romantic movie. This place is simply lovely! The architecture is amazing and the detail in every single piece of cement is just incredible. If you join the organized line that you will notice is formed down the center, you will be in side in no time because it goes very quickly. I went during a time that mess was going on and it is admirable how everyone is just completely silent although there are hundreds of people coming into and out of the cathedral. There are small booths set up towards the back where you can buy rosaries or bracelets and other jewelry. The outdoor area is immense so there's plenty of space for photos. There is a bus stop right in front of the cathedral so the location is also very convenient.

The Classic Cathedral. The Notre Dame Cathedral is steeped in history, and an important part of the Paris experience. We arrived at the beginning of sunset--catch the sunset view of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge leading to the island that Notre Dame is on--and it was beautiful to watch the sky colors change, then the lights of the cathedral come on as we waited to enter the church. We were fortunate to arrive in time to hear the bells of the church while outside, and the music during mass on the inside. You are not required to sit for the service, but may silently stroll along the edges of the church, soaking in history and possibly lighting a candle in prayer. Please consider making a donation to support the building, organ, or works of the cathedral in exchange for the meaningful experience.

Wonderful views but....long queues, narrow passages, and netting everywhere!. title basically says it all - the view from the top of the tower is spectacular, but if you've already seen the skyline from somewhere else, it's perhaps not worth it. The corners can be super narrow, even for skinny people - I'd say sadly, anyone above a size 16 might struggle to get around.

Must go for views of Paris skyline!. The line for the narrow staircase up to the Notre Dame towers start around an hour before it is officially open at 10a.m.- by 9:15a.m., there were about 20 people already in line and they only allow around 20 people up every 15 min. or so. It is well worth the efforts to climb up the 387 or so odd stairs up to the Tower. Before arriving to the West Tower, you will stop by a gift shop and this is where the admission fee of 8.50 euros is collected. You continue on the staircase until arriving at the top where the famous gargoyles and chimeras are found along with the wonderful views of the Paris skyline with the River Seine below. Views of St Chapelle and Montmartre are unbelievable from this point. It is quite narrow up here and you are encouraged to keep moving along to keep the flow of traffic going. There are no bathroom facilities until you go back down to ground level.Walking across from the North to South tower, look at both directions of the detailed architecture and for the famous Styrga -chimera-- a horn and wing beast with a human body holding his head in his hands and sticking his tongue out at Paris- used to scared off bad spirits. There are many different types of gargoyles as you look up from here also- they are used as rain gutters as the rain water drains out from their mouths.Make sure you walk in to see the famous 13 ton Emmanuel bell as well- made popular by Quasimodo in "Hunchback of Notre Dame." Continue across to the South Tower on your left and up another set of narrow steps to the "Sommet"-- the summit-- you are only allowed a 5 minute visit here as it is very narrow. The views of the River Seine are totally incredible from here is you see how Notre Dame Cathedrale is located right smack in the middle of Ile de la Cite island. Great photo vantage points through the barbed wire.From here you begin your descent down which should not take that much time ~ 15-20 min. at the most. If you need to look for restrooms, they are located in the back of Notre Dame- where the flying buttresses are located- next to the park.Anyone can make it for this climb as my 81 year old mom was able to make it without any problems! She states that she is glad she made this climb for the superb views!

Beautiful at night. Stunning building and amazing at night. The Notre-Dame was free entry and we visited late afternoon just before it was about to close. There was a service happening so you could stand and watch or look at the exhibits/information surrounding the main congregation. A lovely little experience.

A stunning view of Paris and get upclose with the gargoyles. The entrance to the cathedral is free but there is a fee imposed to go to the top. The queue can be massive but it was worth the wait once you are up there. The view is stunning from the top and I enjoyed admiring the gargoyles. Do come in the morning and expect to reach the top of the tower at around noon. I would recommend to visit the nearby attractions (Saint Chapelle, Concierge and Notredame Cathedral) before going to the tower. A must see if this is your first visit to Paris!

Nice views and lots of touristy things to do. We went into the main church area and the views inside are incredible. Note that the building is a live working church as well as a tourist attraction and you are asked not to take photos inside

Reasonable views but spoilt by netting. The towers, unlike the cathedral itself, are paid entry - 8.50€ per adult.We arrived at 9.45 for 10.00 opening and there was already a substantial queue building up. The problem is that with narrow one way staircases, they can only let a fixed number of visitors in at a time.Views from the top are reasonable after 387 steps. Height is 200 feet.The views for photographers, are rather spoilt by the netting that surrounds many but not all of the viewing areas.Pleased we did the towers, but not quite sure I would recommend it as a 'must do' whilst in Paris

Great Gothic Cathedral!. This is well worth the visit it is free entry and you can just walk around or you can pay 5 euro and use the pre-recorded head set tour, this is worth every euro to see this cathedral and understand all the components

the leadglass windows are stunning. join a tour and learn some of the history of this great building. Sorry, but loved the movie the Hunchback of Notre Dame and have always been mesmerized by this stunning building
A Must!. It's not a Paris trip without a stop here. Get ready to wait in a long que but it's well worth it. Be sure to do the guided tour. Beautiful!

Excellent Architecture. This is one of the most famous places in Paris, it's architecture is mind blowing when you give attention to details around the building walls. It's a bit difficult to get into the Church as both the times I found more than 300 people in the queue waiting. Hopefully next time ;-)
One of the Best Views in Paris. It is a climb to the top of the towers, but well worth it to see them up close, and also to see the great view of Paris from a different angle than the Eiffel Tower.

Beautiful!. We went in on a Sunday morning and mass was being held, which was extra special to see. The church is huge and amazing. We were able to go around the whole church on the inside and lite a candle for our loved ones. You can purchase items inside the church for keepsakes. Enjoyed it very much but did not like the beggars that are all around the outside of the church and we told to beware of pickpockets.
Very Beautiful. A very beautiful and historical building but a lot of people. Well worth the experience wither you're religious or not.
Excellent. Long jaunt up the steeps but well worth the effort when you see the views from the top, you do need to allow a couple of hours for this trip.
Stunning!. This cathedral is beautiful and free to tour reverently. Beautiful stained glass windows, sculptures, paintings and tapestries.

imposing!. every one should visit notre dame when visiting paris! the entrance in the cathedral is free. when entering the church you will be impressed my the windows and by its size ! It's worth buing a notre-dame coin from the machines inside the cathedral
Nice view. The bell tower is impressive. I was dismayed to see that there was a netting which made it tricky to take pictures of the great view.
Magnifique. Amazing church ! You can get in for free, but to go to the top you have to pay a little extra. Everything just gets more peaceful once you're there.

Great views of a Great City.. You need good legs to climb the Towers, but once up there the views are stunning, especially towards the Eiffel Tower, and Sacre Coeur.The main detraction is the netting which has been placed to stop things being dropped on the people underneath, and this interferes with the ability to take unimpeded photos. However the whole experience is worthwhile. It is hard not to look at the bells and not think od Quasimodo.

A must see attraction. We had to queue to get in but don't be put off by the length of the queue. As it is a security check for bags etc the queue goes down fairly quickly and worth the visit. Walk around it as well to appreciate the architecture.
trying to see the hunchback between the towers. the back of the cathedral is even better, more elegant. The gargoyles are quite a view on the sides. .
Perfect. The Cathedral is a wonderful place in the most perfect location in Paris. Take a walk around the lower levels by the Seine and look back at the Cathedral for some of the best views.

Average. I was slightly disappointed with our visit to not rename cathedral. Whilst the outside facade of the building is very impressive the inside was very poorly lit up making some of the artworks difficult to see . It is free entry which is good and we only had to queue for about 20 min to get in. Perhaps if there was a guide to explain it would have made the visit more worthwile

Not worth the wait for us. We spent over an hour in line, and although the views were good, they were ruined by black netting that had been put up to stop people throwing things off the edge. There were better and unobstructed views around Paris that you didn't have to wait for. The Chimera were interesting but have been photographed so much I didn't feel I was seeing anything new. All in all, if there is no line I would say this is a great attraction, just not worth the wait.
Very busy. Was lovely being back. However, this time was exceptionally busier that last. We arrived about lunch time and the lines were so long. loved hearing the bells ;)

Only if you don't mind waiting in many line ups. Note that visiting the Towers of Notre Dame is different than visiting inside the cathedral itself. Access to the tower is from the side of the cathedral and a fee is charged or you can get in with the Paris Museum Pass. There is NO priority line for those with a Museum Pass. We visited at the end of October and arrived at about 9:45 am - the tower opens at 10 am and there was a relatively large line up. As the access and exit points for the tower are limited, they allow in a bunch of people, and then there is a wait (10 minutes or so?) till the next group is let in. We made it in at around 10:30 am. You walk up a short flight of stairs to a small room where they sell the tickets. Everyone in the group has to wait here again till all have arrived. Then we climbed to the first level, which is cool as it gives a good view of the gargoyles and access to the belfry. The view over the city is also nice, but the mesh netting they've hung means that you won't be able to get good pictures if you have a DSLR. The small lenses on smartphones work fine. (Note - the netting obstructs the city view, not the gargoyle view.)The area here on this level is quite small so we made our way around it and ended up in line again. It turned out that we had to wait for the previous group to exit the top level before we could go up. The wait ended up being so long that we didn't even bother going up to the top level, and decided we'd rather just head straight back down rather than get caught in another line up somewhere along the way. We finally exited the tower at 11:30 - nearly two hours after getting in the original line up, and that was without going to the top deck. In our opinion, simply not worth it for the 10-15 minutes of total viewing time. There are lots of other places in the city that offer great views (Arc de Triomphe and Sacre Couer were two that we did) without the frustrating line ups.

Worth the wait. We went to the Notre Dame towers early one morning, getting there around 40 mins before it opened and the line was relatively short. We didn't make it in the first group but got in around 10 mins later and it was worth the hour wait.You walk in and first go up a steep winding staircase. This is relatively easy if you are fit but if not may be challenging. Some sections are also very narrow and may be claustrophobic to some people. When you reach the top the views are amazing and you can see the famous gargoyles.You can also enter the bell tower and see the two largest bells (and the place where Quasimodo lived in 'the hunchback of Notre Dame')After this you can go to the very top level and the views from there are even more spectacularDefinitely recommend this - worth the wait

A Must on a regular basis. I have stayed in Paris more than 30 times but feel the need to revisit Notre-Dame from time to time like I did on my last trip in October 2015. No it is not a complete new experience but it is a different experience nevertheless as for May years it front section or tower were covered to accommodate repair work over the years. Like most venerable sites it needs to be rejuvenated and maintained from time to time. I enjoyed my last visit almost as much as my first more than 30 years ago. This time we witnessed 7 ordinations, a first for me in Paris. Go on a day when there is a religious service to have a good feel for this place of worship.The quality of the repair work over the years are ensuring that many more generations will enjoy and appreciate one of the most important and visited historical site in the world. My repeated visits are always accompanied by a different sightseeing of the area. Loved my stay in the area, as usual.

beautiful. Beautiful cathedral. Stained glass windows gorgeous

Very poor management and rude too. Towers can be visited with museum pass. On the day we bought museum pass we went to towers however they closed it at 16:45 even on the pass it says 17:30 for closure. The guard was super rude, waved his hand at us and said come tomorrow!! The next day we went there at 16:25 and again they closed it!!!!!! There were many people like us which is not nice at all. When i tried to talk to the guard he didn t communicate at all!!!! Notre-Dame is a huge historical church – Interesting how long it took to build this, Somewhat dark inside. Much of it was roped off this time so you could only get close to the outer fringes. must see. u can pray, sight seeing, great architecture, culture, all in 1 placeview from the towers are awesome, the split of the rivers, and the DOME is perfect
Notre Dame. Norte Dame is a kool place to hang out with family and kids, have seen people ffccelebrating there bday around the Pizzas

Incredible. Having been inside the Cathedral on a previous trip but never going up the towers, I HAD to visit this time and gosh was it worth it. We had already purchased the Paris Museum Pass to enter the towers which made it a little easier once we were up there, however this doesn't give you priority in terms of queuing. When we visited, the towers opened at 10am and we arrived at 10:30am, by which time there was a fairly large queue, so perhaps get there earlier if you want to be ahead in the queue! We were fairly far back but we were in within an hour, which wasn't too bad. Once you are admitted in, be prepared to get those legs working because there are a LOT of stairs. But it is absolutely 100% worth it! The view is incredible up there, it's pretty magical. We took our time walking around and even went up the second set of stairs taking you to the very top, which was amazing. Definitely visit, the view is amazing and seeing the gargoyles and the bells right up close is fantastic.
Underwhelming. Good to walk through briefly and knock it off the bucketlist. The line wasn't bad and moves fast so don't be deterred by it. It's also free which is definitely a plus.

Famous for its antiques. This is a Church that is famous for most of its antiques that belongs to 1500 centuries. The place is always full of crowds and easily accessible by Trams, buses, Hop on Hop offs, Metros and Boats.
amazing architecture. a beautiful building in a wonderful location. the history of this amazing structure is worth reading. aws inspiring
Lovely to see. Was great to see this as this must be the attraction you hear most about as a kid as it's in lots of cartoons and books. I wouldn't go back to see it though.
Superbbb. Great place, great view.However consider going towards the end of the day when the queu is short and also because you will enjoy of both, the day and night lights! ;)
Beautiful sights. Notre dame is beautiful in sight. We went on a sunday and it was extremely busy. The queues were really long so we didnt purchase a ticket to go in, maybe buy before you go.
Good cathedral. This is one of the tourist attractions. You need to visit at least one cathedral when you are in Paris. There is no entry fee. There is a big line and fast moving.

We slowly walked round and took in the beautiful surroundings, despite the large number of tourists. We did not however climb to the top of the towers and cannot review this experience. One criticism, the number of donation boxes.

The lighting inside the church adds to the whole gothic feel of the experience. We visited around 9.30am and although there was a bit of a cue outside it wasn't long before we where walking through the front door.

Worth the wait for the views of Paris and the close-ups with the gargoyles and the giant bell!. Worth the wait for the views of Paris and the close-ups with the gargoyles and the giant bell! Many, many stairs to climb. It's a great workout with a terrific reward.

Long lines. The first time we went to Paris we enjoyed walking thru but the second time we went later in the day and it was so crowded....I think you need to decide if it is worth it to go in and spend the time. I actually enjoyed the gardens outside more than the inside.

Gothic loftiness at its best. Along the Seine and the Ile de la Cit this is a majestic cathedral and one of the most famous of any remaining churches, this one build 8 centuries ago.

A Must Visit. I've been to Paris more than 100 times during the past 35 years. You'd think I'd be taking Notre-Dame Cathedral for granted by now. That is not the case. I visited the interior of Notre-Dame again during our most recent visit in April of 2015, and during almost every trip I take time to admire the graceful structure from the left bank or strolling through the open plaza which lies at her feet.

History. Notre-Dame de Paris ( "Our Lady of Paris"), also known as Notre-Dame Cathedral or simply Notre-Dame, is a historic Catholic cathedral on the eastern half of the Île de la Cité in the fourth arrondissement of Paris.] The cathedral is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture, and it is among the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world. The naturalism of its sculptures and stained glass are in contrast with earlier Romanesque architecture.The cathedral has 10 bells. The largest, Emmanuel, original to 1681, is located in the south tower and weighs just over 13 tons and is tolled to mark the hours of the day and for various occasions and services. This bell is always rung first, at least 5 seconds before the rest.

Lots of small stairs. Waiting in line for about 90 minutes which wasn't too surprising. There are a LOT of very small stairs to go up the tower. They curve around so they are pretty thin which isn't a problem if you are average size, however at one point people were coming down at the same time we were going up, that was very tight. Eventually the small space made me a little claustrophobic (which does happen on occasion). Up top it has some nice views but is mainly covered in wires so pretty hard to get very good photos. Gargoyles up close were cool. My disappointment was when you exit the towers you have to go wait in another line to go inside the cathedral. Really thought you should have been able to skip that line as you already paid and waited for the towers.

not for the claustrophobic. we came up here as much to see the gargoyles as to see the view- both are pretty spectacular. the security netting all around the top is disappointing. The mesh is too small to get a camera lense through, so all our photos were spoiled by it. when we reachd the platform by the stairs down, they stopped us as the stairs were temporarily closed. we were given no information on why the stairs were closed, or for how long. more and more people kept coming up and crowding onto the small platform, and it got a bit scary. after 15 minutes, we were allowed down. the attraction itself is great, but they need to manage the crowds better.

Breathtaking. The Towers of Notre-Dame is one sight in Paris you don't to miss. My wife and I were lucky enough to attend mass at this beautiful cathedral and were amazed by the spiritual feeling we both received. Inside and out are both marvels of architecture.it is a must see.

Worth the wait. This is one of those attractions where you can't avoid a lengthy queue, even if you buy tickets beforehand. Access to the top towers is probably the best feature and the climb up those tight twisting stairs is a unique experience in it's own, unless you are claustrophobic.

Beautiful view of Paris. A must in Paris. Going into the church had a long queue but it would take only at most 30 minutes. Free entrance. Going into the tower would take longer time since Notre Dame staff limits the people going inside since the steps into the tower is very tight and it takes awhile to climb 327 steps. The view of Paris is breathtaking and then you can get a closer look of the church's bell tower and the gargoyles. If you'll be skipping Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame is a good alternative.

St Germain is very similar, without the crowds. The towers are imposing. The view is not worth the extra cost or the three hour wait, even with skip the line tickets

This time, La Pietra was in residence- an unexpected surprise. The gardens around the church are also worth some time to explore.

Beautiful Sounds Beautiful to See....... TOWERS of Notre-Dame. Beautiful to see in person and so wonderful to hear the bells of the towers ! Great place to meet people and walk around the grounds... Paris is so lovely......this is one more place that you want to see when you go to Paris !!
Most peaceful place!. The lines are better in the afternoon but you must talk to the Bird man outside! He is a WWII vet and amazing stories.

Been many times but never enough!. It had been at least 6 years since I had been up the towers, and although I've been doing it since 1984, my continuing pleasure comes from accompanying students who have never been. This time we got in line by 8:30, which meant that once they opened at 10, we only had a short wait to get in. In the high tourist season, if you wait until10 to get in line, you'll be waiting for hours in the heat. So get there early.The climb is challenging - about 400 steps, I think. You'll be stopping regularly in order to wait for the groups in front of you to advance, because it's a one-way passage. So relax and enjoy the view. Do check out the belfry with the old bells from days past, and do go all the way around to the back so you can see the main steeple. The whole passage will take you 45 minutes or an hour, and there's also a nice garden area when you exit, so stop and take a rest there. Don't buy the overpriced food in the sandwich places across from where you stand in line. have someone hold your place and go a block or two further north where food is more reasonable. And then do lunch in the Quartier Latin.

Ding Dong. Great!. Climbing on the towers of Notre-Dame is a must-to-do thing when visiting monuments in Paris. beautifully well preserved. No visit to Paris is complete without Notre Dame. it is easy to get lost in history and romance and it is close to great food and markets

It's amazing but for all the tourists. Amazingly beautiful but it's very hard to truly enjoy the church because there are soooo many people milling about, taking pictures and making idiots of themselves. The many large groups of people passing by like cattle really turn me off, it's sad

Must visit. One of the most visited places in Paris. Full of Catholic History and Paris backgrounds. Masses are running all day while visitors enjoy the Architeture, statues and paints.
Notre-Dame. They were doing work on this when we were there, but still amazed by this iconic building, look fantastic in the flesh.

Amazing architecture!. This is a must see site. Loved everything that was in the church
building, and all the details on the outside.
Gargoyles. Get there early and climb to the top. Its really cool. But lots of steep spiral steps to the top. If you are out of shape you might not want to tackle this.

See my review of Notre Dame where I tell about the towers tour.. I already wrote about this when I submitted the Notre Dame review. This does cost money and there is a long line. You have a limited time to climb the stairs and see the towers. It is well worth it.

Wonderful Atmospheric Experience. We walked up the 400 stairs to the Notre Dame towers in June, it was pouring out, and it made the experience wonderfully atmospheric...you could almost see Quasimodo peaking around the corners. The view of Paris from the Towers is terrific, a totally different perspective. The Gargoyles on the Tower walls are fantastic and worth the long climb up for pictures, as are the huge bells. There is no warning or information provided ahead of time that you have to climb 400 stairs up, so anyone with limited mobility should be forewarned. All in all, it's well worth effort to get up to the top, a terrific experience...

The Gargoyles. It's a long climb to the top, but the views are amazing. You will also see the famous stone gargoyles that keep watch over Paris from the towers. An absolute must-see, but line up early. The line was already down the block before the attraction even opened on the day we visited.
Notre Dame. Very busy plaza during the day, best - & I think prettiest at night when it's illuminated. Stunning architecture.
Magnificent architecture. Church is old and ancient. The architecture is amazing. There is a fairly long queue to enter but the line moves quickly.
