Powerful Cathedral. My favourite in whole Paris! So huge, glorious and gorgeous! Its French Gothic architecture will blow your mind and leave you speechless. I loved the details, stained glass and little sculptures! Its incredible, must see in Paris!

Stunning and incredible. Notre-Dame is absolutely stunning. The exterior architecture is amazing, with fabulous attention to minute details, and the interior is beautiful. It is respectful to wear something that covers your shoulders & is down to your knees (although you won't be denied admission if you're wearing a sleeveless top or shorter shorts/skirt) - it's a city-owned historical monument, but it is also still a functioning church. And like most popular tourist destinations in Paris, watch for panhandlers; I found that simply saying "non, merci" worked well to dissuade any who approached.
MUST SEE. This is a must see, We also toured the special room inside. Taking the city transportation around Paris was amazing and very inexpensive.

Passing glance. With our limited time and the long line, we were only able to view the structure from the exterior. Still these old cathedrals have such ornate details that are worth viewing. The heat cut the time short.

A view to die for. a must see and do while in Paris. The line was a little long but the view amazing. There are a lot of stairs and if you are afraid of heights it might be too much but overall a nice place to go to while visiting Notre Dame
Great view from outside . We did not get the chance to visit the inside but the outside was beautiful with a nice square from which you could see the many details of the facade

fantastic views- worth it. Go early at least half an hour before they open at 10 am and you won't wait as long. We waited only 40 minutes. The museum pass gets you in. The climb is definitely worth it and the views were spectacular. We saw people of all ages doing this. I got some great pictures.

Can't do Paris without a visit. It is crowded. They also turn away women that do not have their shoulders covered (so take a cover or wear sleeves). We did the visit on a Sunday morning with Mass underway and it made a better visit but it was hard just walking through the Cathedral.

Architectural Masterpiece. Loved this church. It is free unless you want to go up in the bell tower and I think it costs like 8 Euros/pp. The church is literally right outside a metro station (Sant Michel). There will be a line, but it moves really quickly. We were admitted in about 10 minutes. There is an audio guide which I thought was really helpful and allowed free access to some of the church's relics. For example, they say they have fibers from the cross Christ bore and also a nail. They also say they have the crown of thorns. There is a cool statue of Joan of Arc on the right and an interesting statue of a Saint holding Denis holding his severed head. If you want to go up to the bell tower, the line is around the corner on the left side of the church outside. They only let so many in so the wait time is longer. We waited about an hour, but there were little cafes and tourist shops across the street to pass the time. It was neat to see the bells. It is A LOT of walking up a narrow winding staircases, so if you are claustaphobic, this may not be for you. Overall, the church is a must do. I felt pretty safe though I am always aware of my belongings. It is also a stone's throw away from the Bridge of Locks (Pont des Arts). You can buy a lock (I am sure the vendor is making a killing!) or bring your own. Neat to see how many.

Top 10 Sites to see in Paris. The history and some of the largest stained glass windows anywhere. Beautiful church with lots of tourists. Rent the headsets for a more deep understanding of what you're seeing.

Unique Paris Walking Tour with Alexandre. Alexandre Besombes, the owner of Unique Paris gave us tremendous value from our 3 hour, private walking tour which actually ended up at 4 hours. He gave us a penetrating overview of Notre Dame, as well as the Grand Palais, Louvre, Jewish sympathizer Monument, the Marais, and several other key architectural sites. Wow!! 10/10

What a view. When you eventually arrive in the towers of the cathedral check your watch. If you're there at 11 am as we were take some ear plugs. The peel of the bells is wonderful but load enough to scare you. No down side to this tourist spot.
a must see. we were blessed by being able to attend mass here. it was such an emotional time for us all. such a moving ceremony and generally we were in awe of the place.
Beautiful. We went with a local tour guide. The cathedral is beautiful inside and out. The line was short for us in the afternoon. We loved it!

Hike up to the bell towers for the best views. We chose to hike the steps up to the bell towers and I am so glad we did. The views were amazing and I liked getting up close and personal with the gargoyles!! The inside of the cathedral is quite impressive too!
self tour. Great photo opportunity for some great pictures of this beautiful building. Statue of Charlemagne. Make sure you catch the front of Notre-Dame. So awesome

Do not Miss. Was a must see- despite the crowds! Line into cathedral moved quickly. Once inside, just amazing-words don't do it justice. Was difficult to see displays around perimeter because of crowds, but the experience of the cathedral was not diminished.

Awe inspiring...... This is a bucket list item that did not disappoint. The only down fall is I wish we would have had a private tour guide. You also need to spend a considerable amount of time, 2-3 hours.

Beautiful. a beautiful peace of architecture with great religious value.
You will enjoy the glass paintings on the walls and the depth into which it takes you.

Patience. Be prepared to stand in line, depending on when you go. I waited over an hour and half on a cool wet day. Completely worth it through. Lot of steps, wear comfortable shoes and cloths but the top is worth it. May do it again nest time in Paris.
Towers as in lots of stairs. Beautiful views once you reach the top, but be prepared to earn it with the climbing of narrow stairs.

remember the Hunchback of Norte-Dame?. A must see, Especially if you read : The Hunchback of Norte-Dame or if you saw the film or for religious purposes. It is beautiful to go up and also to see it while in a boat

Visit with a Persnonal Tour Guide. its amazing considering the technology of the time, I felt better about this as a church vs. the desectrated Westminster Cathedral. Place on your tour especially if your Catholic. I would take a personal tour next time, time kept us from doing that this time.

Architecturally impressive. As well as visiting Notre Dame, it is possible to climb the towers. If you are limited for time in Paris, then I would not regard the interior of the towers as a "must see". I would prioritise the Arc de Triomphe and the Place de la Concorde/Jardin Tuileries as more important than climbing these towers. If you have the chance, then seeing this cathedral from every angle is amazing. These towers are beautiful.

gorgeous historic site. saw this cathedral from a seine boat tour, then later up close. ornate and beautiful, everything I imagined it would be. unfortunately, unable to enter at that time. I'm sure it would have been impressive. you have to see this.

Gargoyles, chimeras, bells and vistas! All amazing!”. PROS: breath-taking views of the city, its landmarks (Eiffel, Louvre, Pantheon, Seine, etc…) can be clearly seen on 2 levels; historic gargoyles and chimeras inspired Victor Hugo to pen the Hunchback of…; CONS: can be a long wait in line- do watch out for insensitive and arrogant individuals who try to cut in line; while we were waiting 2 couples tried to cut in line beside/behind us- 1 Chinese couple and 1 European couple. I had to let them know and point out where “the end of the line was”. A very uneven and tiring 400 steps up a spiral staircase to the tower! For individuals who are not in shape, please think twice about it as it can be truly challenging – a virtual cardiac stress test!

Not to be missed. I love architecture and this place is not to be missed if you're in Paris. The line was relatively short and we were inside within 20 minutes. There was great information around detailing the history and construction of the cathedral. I was amazed by how long the construction had taken and its many phases of development. A little disappointed that we were not able to photograph the Madonna with Jesus sculpture that is located there. It was way behind the altar and probably about 30 yards from where you're permitted to stand so bring a telephoto lens and a tripod if you want to photograph.
Beautiful Architecture. Beautiful basilica! The church has gorgeous stained glass and architecture. Pretty garden area. You need to be careful of pickpockets.
Famous place for a stop in.. Everyone visits and so should you. I know there are tons of places to see in Paris, but if you are there a few days, add this in.

Truly stunning in all aspects.. Absolute stunning architecture. Amazing how everyone stands looking up with their jaws dropped staring at the carvings. The Eiffel Tower in the background and the Louvre just over the road. Must see.
Gargoyles are worth the hike. I already commented with the Cathedral that you should not miss the towers. Being up high with the gargoyles is a must.

Very impressive, and leaves an impression. Before you walk across the bridge to visit the cathedral, you see a great structure of a building, thats quite eye opening. Maybe because of its situation, with the river seine on both sides.As you walk across the bridge from the west side, you immediately face the 2 towers and an open square, then as you continue to walk down the south passage by the river, you come across some open gardens and peace. The cathedral inside is pretty impressive too, however I like the outside views more :-)Not to miss on the next visit to Paris.
Well worth the climb. Dizzy climb up and down but the views and the bells are worth it! If you are lucky enough you can hear the bells ringing.

Majestic and splendid. Really worth going inside and walking around. Great building. The walk up the bell tower is not for the faint hearted but it rewards you with a great view of the city and Seine.
Love it!. So beautiful, it's the first stop when I visit Paris! A bit crowded but not to be missed while visiting.

Everything you expected. Notre Dame Cathedral is massive, yes, but also a place to be intimate with the majesty of god. A majestic edifice which is given in offering to the heavens. Step out side and stand in the center of Paris, and imagine the power of the church in review of the centuries gone by. Awesome.

Beautiful views, lots of steps. My friend and I booked a tour of the Notre-Dame towers, so went up in the evening. There are 422 steps up and around the same amount down (you go down the other side). On the way up, we stopped fairly regularly at balconies or bell towers which either showed us gorgeous views of Paris or were steeped in history. The walking back down, however, was non-stop. Thankfully we're young so we could handle it, but we stayed at the back as there was an elderly lady who was struggling. They waited for us on the balcony bits, but I feel that perhaps the tour guide could've come back and checked on us as she was really shattered and could have probably used a sit or six on the way up.

Towers are a must see. We haven't gone in but we waited to go to the towers. We went late in the after noon around 4pm and the line up was only about an hour. A lot of these places are free if u have EU card/25 yrs old so take advantage of that. This was a great wrap around view of Pari. Gargoyle s are amazing
Amazing!. breathtaking views over Paris, well worth the long wait. While queuing one can make friends from far away places! Nice experience.

Gorgeous Gargoyles!. Perhaps one of the best views of Paris! It was a great opportunity to see the architecture of Notre Dame up close. Absolutely fell in love with the gargoyles! They are each unique and seem to have different personalities. Definitely worth the tour!

Spectacular architectural feat. When one thinks of the centuries it has been standing, and the centuries it took to building the towers, it's not difficult to be astounded. A remarkable piece of architectural engineering.

As beautiful as reputed. What a exquisite and soulful Cathedral! It's massive and somewhat crowded but the ornate alcoves may be viewed individually. The stained glass windows are awash with color and the ambiance is perfect for reflection and or prayer.
A must visit. The historic cathedral and charm in the middle of Paris is a great tourist attraction for its history and architecture. Beautiful is an understatement!!!!
Beautiful. Beautiful. Again, just beautiful. The carvings, stained glass, words can not describe the experience. I would love to go again.
A must-do. The interior is amazing. Not just for the stained glass but for the roof lines too. A mass was in progressive but they still let sightseers in as long as you were quiet.
So beautiful. Definitely worth the look at and I'm hoping we will actually get to go inside next time. The lines are a bit terrible during the spring and summer

Okayish. It was very busy and I was looking forward to seeing the Cathedral but only average inside... wasnt that impressed. Okay for a visit if you can tie in nearby Saint Chappelle at the same time.
Go and visit Notre Dame, when in Paris!. Another spectacular Parisien monument! This is well worth a visit, when you go to Paris. The architecture is magnificent! :)
Must see on and Paris trip. Amazing place and well worth a visit, I would recommend going both during the day and at night to get a completely different feel of the place after dark
Worth the time. A beautiful place to visit, quite a few beggars, but not too obtrusive. Pleasantly situated next to the river, seemed to be nice and cool on a hot day.

Amazing vue, worth the queue!. Get there early to beat the queues but even if you have to queue a little the view is worth it. You can see pretty much all of Paris up here & with the Eiffel tower too! The Gargoyles are fun & it's great to marvel at the gothic architecture & think about how old it is - over 800 years!!
Those Bells !!. Where was Quesimodo!!!! Incrediable building but was not of interest to me, lots of litter around. Not impressed
Beautiful. Very beautiful and stunning building which absolutely is a must when you are in Paris. Dont miss this wonderful church.

Lunchpacks not required. Yes its historic. Yes it is a magnificent piece of architecture that can be admired from any angle and distance in low-rise Paris. The queues are not for the fainthearted or infirm.

Austere and simple. Not as much bling as Venice or St Peters but more austere. Very pretty stained glass and sombre lighting. Cavernous spaces. Carving to the front facade is the highlight. Look for the statue of St Denis holding his own head on the front left. Worth the effort. No que.

Towers of Notre-Dame Catherdal. Do not miss seeing this. Fantastic and just brilliant with architecture and so much history. The glass stain windows and the unbelievable art is to be seen. The paintings are magic
Early visit. Try to plan your visit eary in the morning when is not so crowded and the waiting line so not so long!

Great views, great tour. Be prepared for a long queue. We arrived at about 8 AM and the queue was already immense. We waited for at least 2 hours which gave us loads of time to see the outside of the cathedral, to buy postcards and other souvenirs. Once you get to the top of the towers you get a great view over Paris. You are able to see the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Couer and many more. Great views of gargoyles and chimaeras, which I absolutely adored. Be careful at one point. During you're visit you'll come across a place where some stairs go down on your left and there's also a little door on your right which takes you even higher up. Some people went to the left and missed out on more views. Loved the descend on the stairs, it seemed like it would never come to an end.

Grand church. justified being in the tripadvisor list of 2015 of most visited destinations.Try and spend time reading up about the construction of the church through the centuries which will help you understand better the significance of the structure.
Notre Dame will last many more centuries. Exquisite detailing is what comes to my mind when I think of this masterpiece architecture. The line is long so an early visit is recommended.
Beautiful!. Notre-Dame was as beautiful as I expected. I really enjoyed our visit and I would like to return, again with a tour guide to get more information.

Forget those long lines!. If there is a HUGE line to get in to the church for viewing........walk straight past the line to the center doors and follow the sign that says "Mass". You will end up at the back of the aisle where Mass is continually said throughout the day. Have a seat for a few minutes to rest, then walk along the museum ropes and join in with the throngs of people running the inside circuit of the church.

Amazing views. Climbing up the towers of Notre Dame is not to be missed. The views from the top are absolutely stunning and worth those hundreds of steps up the spiral staircases. The space/walkways above are quite narrow and you'll need to squeeze through to get from one end to another so I would recommend separating from the group a bit so that you're not all pushing to get from point A to point B. Having the gargoyle and chimera statues all around makes for an even more unique experience. Probably one of my favorite activities during my stay in Paris!
climb for the view. Climb all of the stairs to the very top where you will find an incredible view of the entire city. EU students will be able to climb it for free with their student cards.

The Grand Dame of Paris. She has no rivals with her rich historical location and centuries of development becoming one of the most inspiring cathedrals in the world. Do not be afraid of the lines, they do move fairly quickly and you will not be disappointed.

A must. I reviewed these under Notre Dame Church. You should climb these first to take advantage of the light. The earlier on the day, the better (or really late in the afternnon). The entrance is to the left of the main entrance -as you stand facing the church- You do need to pay about 8 Euros, totally worth it. Not an easy climb so, take your time.

Notre-Dame is A Remarkable Structure. The cathedral is so many things all at once. It's familiar to Americans visually, but it's also a repository of so much history that a tour inside is really interesting. The architecture inside and out is beautiful and photo worthy from any angle. We spent a long time just staring at the stained glass inside and reading about what had happened in and around the church. Bonus tip: When facing the Cathedral, to the left across the street is a small crepe shop that is awesome and seemed immune from the crowds. Enjoy!

a must see in Paris. Dont like th queue to climb up the steps to the top.The view is fantastic and pictures taken with the gargoyles hovering over the panorama of Paris is unbeatable in its splendour.

Trip to Paris for my 30th. Excellent very interesting. Place very clean and people friendly. Would I go back? yes in fact we are off to Paris Disneyland for my 40th in September and if I get chance will be back in the city to see the sights.
great. Wonderful to see although queues. Not long to wait - 10-15 minutes. Moved slowly through and experienced the awe of the building and its history

The building and views are well worth the long wait to get there!. Be warned, only small groups are allowed in at approx. 10 minute intervals and once you are finally in, the staff are most unhelpful and miserable. There are some very tight squeezes even for someone who is only a size 10 UK dress size and the walk up the steps may be a struggle for anyone who is not fit. However, once you get to the viewing platforms, you can get some great photos of Paris.
A must to visit. Long queues since veryopular, check the times come early morning when it opens, amazing sight. So much history and the visit at the top is breath taking

Great Experience and Beautiful!. This was a workout for me. It's 400 steps, no lift (just in case some of you didn't know that) some areas were steep and tight, but once you get to the top, the view is incredible. Probably not something I'll do again, but glad that I did it. Although the line wasn't too long at 2 in the afternoon in June, we were able to get in without waiting when the person letting people through saw us with a baby and two little kids. So thankful for that.

Long Line, Beautiful Views. We waited over an hour and a half to get in, then walked up several stories of spiral stairs to get to the top. Be sure you're fit before you start the climb. Once up, it was totally worth it, spectacular views!
Stunning. If you are in Paris, you must stop by to see the Notre Dame Cathedral. Absolutely breath taking! So much history and beautiful shapes.

Get there early. We arrived at 8.45am and were in the first group to go up. The queue was enormous by 10am when the towers open. It is a steep climb up on uneven stairs so wear sensible shoes. The views are breathtaking and the gargoyles are cute and varied. There can be some waiting as people are grouped before going up to the second level. It was a bit chilly when waiting in line so dress accordingly.

The Gothic Beauty..... Paris was one of our honeymoon destination. Now I know whyis it called the city of love...I am in absolute love with Paris and everything in Paris. Notre-Dame Cathedral was obviously pleasure to your eyes and was a obvious choice if you visit Paris. It was definetily on our to do list and we are glad we checked it off...

Best views of Paris . Ladies and gents, you've found it! The best view of Paris is right here! Yes, you can climb Sacré-Cœur in a quarter of the time but consider this: Notre Dame is smack in the middle of Paris and you're up close and personal with the famed gargoyles. Also the two aren't mutually exclusive and given most tourists will visit both monuments, just climb both! Queues are lengthy as there is a strict limit on the number of visitors walking the tower at any given time. Try and arrive at 9:30 at least to be out by 11. The climb is steep but hardly difficult (people of many ages and physical abilities visited with me). Entry at €8.5 is easily justified. One not to be missed.
Majestic. Always a must when visiting Paris if you feel like being filled with awe. Central to find anyway, right on the island between the east and west bank, close to the Latin Quarter.
Long wait. Arrived at 10am and still waited 1.5 hours. Thought the Sacre Coeur was just as good, no waiting and nice views.

great views from the top!. It's a long walk to the top, but it is totally worth it! On my second visit here, there was a man handing out seeds to feed tiny sparrow-like birds that ate right out of our hands. When it's warm and sunny, it's lovely to hang out in the square outside, we did this, feeding the birds, just before a meal in the Latin Quarter, which is just a short walk away.

Ready for amazing views?. Totally worth the stairs! Dizzy husband didn't allow to keep going up after the first panoramic level but that alone was enough to see Paris amazingly from above. Spectacular architectural details... we also went to the church after the towers, I hope you get as lucky as we did and get to listen to their choir... goose bumps! That was around 5pm give it a try for the full package!

Exiting. Though there´s a line in order to climb the roof, it´s well worth it. Being a Victor Hugo fan, it´s magnificent to wander around amongst the gargoyles and picture the Hunchback hiding behind one of them. Go early to avoid the masses.

This was my son's favorite part of the trip. We are a family of 4 with two kids ages 7 and 10. We were worried about climbing the stairs and it was not very difficult. The kids flew up the stairs while my wife and I tried to pace ourselves. The stairs were a spiral staircase and we stopped about 1/2 way as there is a walkway across the front. The views of the city are incredible and the gargoyles are cool!

Notre-Dame from the Top. We waited on a long line to climb to the top of Notre-Dame. There is an admission charge, but it is well worth it.Be advised that there is no elevator and the over 400 stairs that are narrow and uneven and you must also climb down.The view is unbelievable of the Cathedral gargoyles and the city of Paris.
Amazing!. We were totally amazed by the architecturge of this amazing piece of stone work. It is so very detailed that it seems impossible to have been built so long ago.

Paris visiting. Just hopefully Cathedrale open late , during Spring
close at 6 . is too early ,
I came just after 6 cannot get in

Beautiful and mesmerizing. I was there with a friend and both of us are fond of historical places so we were mesmerized by this amazing cathedral. It was full of history. Lucky for us when we got there the service was in progress so we got to see the fathers and the singing lady, too. It was just great.

Worth the long climb to the top of the Towers!. We climbed the 400 steps to the top of the Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral in mid-May 2015. You actually stop on different levels, so you don't climb all 400 steps at the same time. It was worth the wait in line (which wasn't all that long - maybe 45 minutes) and worth the climb. You could see all of Paris from the various viewpoints, all the ornamentation on the Cathedral, and even could go in the bell tower. We used our Paris Museum Pass for the admission price. We enjoyed this and our visit to Ste. Chappelle more than Notre-Dame Cathedral itself.

Must See for Catholics. Honestly, I am a cathedral buff. Being in Europe the past couple of years, my family and I have a real appreciation for cathedrals, the architecture, the altar pieces, the art, just everything that drips with so much symbolism. I get annoyed by the fact the Chruch has opened the doors to every irreverent Tom, Dick and Harry. Notre Dame is one of those places that you need to set aside and see. Take an afternoon. It is immense, grand and well worth your time. Do us all a favor though and tell your teenager to remove that stupid looking falt-billed ball cap with the stickers still on it before he goes in... and keep it off. The work they are doing there is phenomenal! Pay attention and enjoy!

Beautiful but long queus. This is such a big and great looking cathedral and the area was really great. Unfortunately, we were not able to get insde due to the long queu. Really good cafes in the area

Just fine.... Fine architecture, just like anywhere in France. Nothing uber-special, but a must to fit it in your schedule while you stay in Paris.Very very busy during the summer and high tourist peaks. Go early in the morning, or you will be queing a looong time.

Visitors can climb the South tower which offer splendid panoramic views. The stairs leading to the towers (69m high having 397 steps) can be accessed from outside of the cathedral and are to the left of the main entrance.Climb the stairs paying attention to the famous gargoyles.Enjoy the sweeping panorama of the city from the top.Be prepared for queues because only 20-30 people can climb the tower at a time. Please note that there are very narrow and slick steps leading to the top. Thus the climb requires some level of fitness.
Good place. Didn't get enough to time to climb the ,.towers but always a good sight to see. Iconic to Paris. Will visit again.

Nice trip, but go early. We didn't listen to all the advice to go early and ended up spending two hours in line. It was an interesting climb, and nice to see the gargoyles closer, as well as the bell. However, in my opinion, the magestry of the Cathedral is unbelievable, and is a must, the towers are an interesting ad-on.

Beautiful!. The hour and a half wait were worth it, without an online pre-purchase option there is always a long line to access the towers, but the beautiful view and structure will make up for it. The climb is a real workout, but with the excitement I really did not feel it.When you reach the second floor take all the time you need to appreciate the beauty of the view, since you will only be allowed 5 minutes at the very top.

Heart moving visit. I was really moved by how beautiful this cathedral is... there was just so much to look at from the front of the building, and the visit inside just kept getting better, every step I took drew me in even more and I continued to gasp at the beauty. The way I would describe this place is that for anyone who has doubts about God, this is a place that somehow is able to take away all doubts... during my visit there was a priest who stood in a ray of light shining down on him, I really felt like God was there with us and I felt an overwhelming rush of emotions that moved me to tears. What is really interesting was also the tour of the treasures, I felt a mix of emotions during that little tour. I was amazed by the beautiful works done by people in the past, but at the same time I also saw how much potential all the valuable had on changing real lives of our time. There is not doubt that Notre Dame is a must-see in Paris, it will inspire a lot in your heart and mind.

Yes, we Climbed to the Very Top. our 9 and 13 yr old grandkids were keen to see the gargoyles and the city view. Spectacular and, although the climb is a workout, it is well worth it to see the city from this vantage point.

Incredible sight!. You will be awed by the beautiful stained glasses in the church. The interior structure and paintings in the ceiling are jaw-dropping and will leave you wondering how this building was constructed back in the olden days. The whole trip will take you 30 minutes for a brief walk inside and 1 hour 15 minutes for a detailed visit. The queuing time for me was 30 minutes on a Saturday afternoon.

20 flights of Stairs to the top - Exhausting and Amazing!. If you are up to climbing 20 - YES TWENTY - flights of circular rusted stairs - you will see the MOST amazing panoramic views of Paris that I have EVER seen! You can actually touch the famous gargoyles!!! Overwhelmingly beautiful - and a great leg workout!

Great time. We happened to walk right here from our hotel, very short lines and no waiting time. The outside is amazing, I love architectural details, the gargoyles, the bell towers. Inside has what's expected, after all it is a church. They were holding mass while we were walking past but visitors and congregation were all quiet and well behaved. Beautiful.I do believe I was there in December of 2013 nor 2014.
Amazing Notre Dame Cathedral. The cathedral is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture. Amazing beauty and lovely just to admire from near and far.

Notre Dame. Of course if you are in Paris you are probably going to visit Notre Dame. And it is worth the time. The exterior is impressive and you can spend a lot of time looking at the gargoyles and other features of this spectacular cathedral.The line to enter can be very long but if you time it right and avoid the tourist buses you can walk right in. There is no fee to go into; you can choose to drop a couple euro into the offering box and light a candle in one of the alcoves. Photography is permitted if you turn off the flash. If you wish to go up to the roof the entrance is outside and on the left side if you are facing the cathedral. We didn't go up to the roof because the line was always very long. If you do opt to go up to the roof go earlier in the day as they will cut off the line when it gets closer to closing regardless of how many people are behind the cut off point.
LOTS OF STEPS. Totally worth the climb, but be careful if it is raining as the little steps become very slippery... try to time your viewing so you will hear the bells chime!

Worth the Wait!. I had been inside Notre Dame as a teenager and spent time outside of it many times, but only just recently climbed the towers this past weekend. My son, cousin and I spent right on an hour waiting to climb up to buy tickets, which may seem long but paled in comparison to our 3 hour wait at the Catacombs the day before. We were the first to pay for our tickets, therefore the first to go up. We got all the photos we wanted, were able to spend time in the bell tower, had fantastic views. Since under 18's are free, the three of us cost 1 adult - such great value. Well worth the wait in line, well worth the years I waited to do it. Highlight of my trip to Paris this past weekend!

Great views .. lots of steps up to the top!. We waited around 45 minutes in the queue to enter the towers of Notre Dame but the wait was worth it. The adult entry price is reasonable and EU residents under 25 get in for free. When you reach the the first viewing platform, you get a great birdseye view of the square below, the Seine and a close up view of the gargoyles. You can also climb steps in the bell towers to se the bells inside. If you are feeling fit enough, you can climb a further staircase to the very top of the towers, where you get a beautiful panoramic view.

Smile the history inside.. Paris is one of 2 cities I usually visit, Amsterdam is the second one. several places I have to visit every time and Notre Dame is one of them. As a photographer, I always challenge myself to take photo for this outstanding colorful window (of course without using flash). Overtime, after my return home I need to go back because there are some of area I was need to take more photo. I think I always be there again and again.

Extraordinary view on top, with horrible wait on bottom. There has to be a more efficient way to see the gargoyles on top of Notre Dame. The wait on a Tuesday morning in May at 10am was 90 minutes; followed by a traffic jam on top that wouldn't let people down. The line doesn't move at the bottom; and the security at the front doesn't care or bother to explain the process either. In all the waiting time, we should be able to purchase a ticket in advance. Once you get into the special stairwell, you then wait on another line to purchase a ticket and then proceed to go up. Not very efficient again. The entire circumference of catwalks is not open either.

Amazing. I lived in Paris for 5 years and never went up there. It took me a trip with my 11 year old son to brave the long line. We waited for about 1 hour but it was all worth it. The view is breathtaking. I got some amazing shots of Paris. Highly recommend.....just be patient!
Long Line. We climbed the Notre Dame Cathedral towers in January 2007 - when there was no line. The view is worth it. But in the summer, expect to stand in line -- for a long time.

Not the towers make it excellent. The cathedral itself is something, what you can admire time to time when you come back to Paris. It is a magical place, part of the great history of the city. Not by chance there are films, music, theater which all dealing with this beutiful cathedral. To go up to the towers - always a huge line, and I don't think you have a better view, than from the Eiffel tower.

Special visit to Notre-dame Cathedral. I can't put into words the special feeling that I experienced walking through this wonderful cathedral. I now want to read more about the history of Notre-dame. Truly wonderful experience.
A must do.... We started to queue for the tower. This queue was slower, and because there was a charge for the tower, but very well worth it.
Tour. You have to take the tour to learn of the history of the church. U need a camera to take amazing pictures
Excellent. It was a great experience for us to visit such a good place.Mostly crowded but worth looking.Dont forget to change your euros to notre Dame coins.

The view is nice, but the bells are great, and the chimerae are amazing.. Lines are long, but well worth the wait. Some narrow parts on the middle level. Stairs are wide enough to allow for short breaks, or to let people pass by. You can go inside one of the towers and see the bells, and you can also take more stairs up to the top.What I liked even more than the view of the Seine and the rest of Paris were the amazing chimera sculptures that you see staring down along the way.

The Hunchback. If you have not read the book or even watched the Disney version, then you should to appreciate the cathedral. After visiting the cathedral you should walk around the banks of the river Seine in this area.

Even though it's not exiting, I'm so glad I went. It goes without saying that this Cathedral has played an important role in the history of Paris. That being said, and although it is beautiful monument, exquisitely crafted, it's just a cathedral (there are many all over Europe). But I would definitely be missing something if I hadn't taken to time to appreciate the amazing craftsmanship both inside and out with my own eyes... and it's free! (you can go up into the towers but there is a fee).
Gorgeous architecture. A must see on your visit to Paris. The gardens behind Notre Dame have free wifi and toilets so plan your day accordingly!

Lots of stairs, but what a view... plus the bells. Please, not just tour the cathedral inside, you have to go up the towers. There is no elevator, the steps are brutal, but it was so worth it. We had to wait for 45min to go in, but it was all forgotten once I got to the top. There are 2 stair cases, first you go up one tower (that takes you to the middle of the building), then you cross the pathway to the second tower to see the bells and then you go up again, to the very top. There was not a good communication and some people totally missed the top of the north tower.

Awesome building even at night. Well lit up into the early hours.. What a beautiful place, I had always wanted to go. I certainly wasn't disappointed. The iconic view from the roof is superb. I took some fantastic pictures. Definately worth stopping by.

A great history journey. It is a must see stop on your Paris visit even if you only have a day in Paris. The world famous cathedral is well worth your time to see. And it is Free! You will need about an hour to visit this great history experience

Be patient and in a good shape. There's no elevator, the queue is frustrating, but you must do it. It's much lower than the Eiffel, but located in Paris center, so the views are fabulous. At the very top, there is 360 degrees yard

Do Group Tour! Skip the LONG line!. Notre Dame is just another 'must see' in Paris. Use the Cité Metro stop or Saint-Michel/ND RER C "Yellow" stop for shortest walk (less than 5 min). The line starts on the north side of the cathedral and is usually really long.For the bell tower, spend a little extra and do a group tour in order to skip the line. The entry line was over 2 hours; with our group we walked right to the entrance and went up. There are 387 tight, one-way, spiral steps to the top of the bell tower, no elevator. You don't have to go all the way up though. At around 300 steps, you come out at the top of the cathedral facade and can go back down different stairs, OR continue up to the bell tower top. We got great photos from the cathedral top and didn't go all the way up.I did see a few people crying & sitting down while being calmed; upset from either heights or claustrophobia. So if you are easily affected by either, don't go up.

worth the climb. amazing views and i think thy are better views than the Eiffel tower as the tower is country in your view rather then standing on top of i. and from my experience id did not take long to wait to start going up the steps thought i would say to take your time on the steps as it is harder climb than u might think

Fantastic views. The line can be long and slow, so come early (9am) . The climb up the first tower is spiral and narrow. You come out above the main door and cross over to the other tower for an even narrowerer climb to the top of the tower. You come out to spectacular views of the Seine and close ups of the bells and gargoyles. Then that long climb down. Your time is limited on the tower. Worth it tho.
Awesome views. Don't miss this. You get some of the best views of Paris and the Eiffel Tower!! Well worth it (expect some lines up to an hour)
Well worth a visit.... We had only a weekend in Paris and Notre Dame was a must-see. A huge building and do admire the architecture. Delighted to have seen it. One more for the 'bucket list' - ENJOY!

Travel to the past. Very beautiful view from the tower, especially if you get the right angle where you can feel like you see Paris in the past. The queues is very long, if wake up early is not too hard for you, go there early to avoid to wait in the line, and there are a lot of time they will closed the line before the closing time to make sure they have enough to get every one out when they close.
Exactly what I expected. This was exactly what I expected from this place, I really enjoyed the energy felt inside, too crowded is true but it worth it.
magnificent. beautiful,inticate work on the towers,....had a great time .would have liked to spend more time had it not been chilly
good location. The cathedral is well build beside the river and the inside is remind of Resonance age which good architecture was born.

Far queue. . Long queues here. Lovely building, but the queue for the roof visit was beyond ridiculous.Inside, the gift store staff were rude and the old curly haired woman at main entrance had zero customer service skills. In fact a conversation with a complete stranger two weeks later made comment on the same woman.

Get up close with the Gargoyles. Great views of the city from the towers - 360 degrees - so bring your camera. You get to see the bells up close and climb to the very to top of the tower. Seeing the variety and detail of all the gargoyles is worth the climb.There are a lot of stairs and the tour itself keeps you walking on the perimeter of the tower, very close to the edge. These are not great conditions for anyone with height issues or vertigo.Groups of 20 are let into the tower about every 10 minutes, so the line moves pretty fast. Entry is covered under the Paris Museum Pass.

A climb, but worth it. The views from the towers were spectacular and you can get very close to the gargoyles where you can appreciate their artistry. Climbing the stairs was a bit of an adventure that my sister and I enjoyed, but it's not for everyone. Because it is an old spiral staircase, and you are climbing with a group, if you get claustrophobic, this is not for you. Plus, you need to have on good walking shoes and be in reasonable shape to climb the 387 steps.

Stunning. On our last visit to Paris we didn't get the opportunity to go inside but pleased to say we managed it this time. So worth the visit but we didn't go up to the dome (scared of heights 😊) so I can't comment on that bit.

One of the world's famous place. This place is one from must to see in Paris. If you are in good fit- try to reach top of these Towers. You can see beatiful view of Paris. I don't like only one thing there- always queue to enter :))

general stuff. you have to buy at least a candle pettie and some stamps, plus the picture you'll take they are going to be amazing, waite and take a time and you can find the towers tour, go with time and read a bit of history for your own a good

impressive view if able to wait. The queue is very long, considering the tower do not open until late morning, compare to the church which open really early. There is no separate line for museum pass, and there is only limited people allow up at one time, so there are not short cuts but to wait. once up in the tower, the view is magnificent.

You have seen this in the Movies. Notre-Dame, this is a must see in Paris , it structure and architecture is just as you have seen in those movies . you will never though forgive yourself if you don't visit here in person when in Paris

A historical view of Paris. You'll have to climb many stairs.
The place is incredible and the view is beautiful.
Don't hesitate to walk to Notre Dame

Excellent Paris view. The steps are worth climbing. Do not miss it. The line for the towers begins from the side of the cathedral. The line which is moving fast is only entry to the cathedral which is free. Excellent view of Paris and Seine and the Bell tower.
AMAZING!. WOW! What a great Cathedral, with beautiful architecture and that magestic feeling about it, it's defenintily worth the trip.

Great views and photos. This is the first time I have been up inside the towers of Notre-Dame and although it was a bit of a climb it was worth it the views and the photo opportunities were great, not for persons with a fear of heights.

Nice but as expected very crowded. Nice but as expected very crowded. Like Sacre cour much more, as even that is crowded, but still has a certain calm and warmth to it, which i found missing at Notre Dame.

Classic. I'm sure you could visit Paris without seeing the cathedral, but I'm not sure why you would want to. It's worth a walk around even if you don't take the climb up into the tower. It is, understandably, very busy, but to visit the inside I've never had to wait particularly long, if at all. The last time I climbed up to the tower probably took about a half an hour wait. The statuary and stained glass are both incredible, and the architecture is worth the visit alone.

Never cease to fascinates you. Visited the place several times and every time is all worth it. From inside one can enjoy and appreciate the many sculptures, glass mosaics, figurines, frescoes and architecture of Notre Dame. and the top offers a great panoramic view of the city. Just outside the main gate of the cathedral around 10 meters facing the main door is a small metallic disc where local folklore said represents the center of the world in those days and the belif was if one is to step on the metallic disc dial and utter " I will come back again in Paris within my lifetime", this will come true to you. I dis that first in 2001 and have come again another 4 times since. Be wary of the crowd as there are many pickpockets within this touristic place. There are souvenir shops )quite pricey though) on the left side of the Cathedral and across it is the public toilet on the sidewalk and walking further, you can come across Quasimodo restaurant. Yes, the same name of the Hunchback of Notre Dame. They serve good steaks and espresso.

A must see in Paris. Obviously one of the most beautiful and historic sites in Paris. We didn't climb the towers since the line was so long. Entrance to Notre Dame is free; there is a small museum inside which you have to pay to get in. There are only a few small rooms. The descriptions are in French, so if you don't speak French you won't get as much out of it and I wouldn't recommend spending your money on it.
Notre Dame!. A must see when you travel to Paris! Is is one of the most spectacular cathedrals in the world!! You may have to wait a bit to get inside but well worth the wait!

Stunning and peaceful. This is by far one of my favorite places to visit when I am in Paris. I love to walk around outside and discover new gargoyles that I some how missed on my last trip. The inside is peaceful for a moments respite from the rush of trying to see everything you can while on vacation. I recommend taking the time just wandering around the cathedral on your own to soak it all in.
Marvel. This place is just full of everything. The singing, Paintings, windows & stonework are just so unreal. Its a fabulous place to see & share a special thought in.

Loved this!!. I wrote a review of the Towers, but I think I mistakenly put it under Notre Dame. We loved it!! Lots of steps - if you are handicapped in any way - don't do it. We got there at 11 and had to wait in line an hour. Museum passes don't let you skip the line.
Gotta go up. Lots of little spiral stairs but the view from the towers and of the towers was beautiful. We got to see the beginning of the sun set which was amazing!

Interesting after restoration. No long queues usually. No entrance fee . Beware of pick pockets Stained glass windows and availability of private prayers help . Historical cathedral. Climbing the towers is a fun activity for good views
May 2015. worth the 45 minute wait to climb up to the towers! awe inspiring beautiful cathedral and stained glass

the whole church is interesting. This is a breathe taking place..you can actually feel the history running thru..and is't so beautiful..and huge..never seen anything like it before or after..just a wonderful place..
Nice view. Be prepared to stand in line but definitely arrive before it opens to minimize the wait. The walkways are narrow but the gargoyles are amusing with their own personalities.

Worth the line for the gargoyles. The towers are actually better than the interior of the church. The line will be long and it moves slow. Earlier in the day is better than later. The last admittance is 45min before the posted closing time. Lots of stairs. If the weather is poor have a jacket as there is very little shelter from the elements. The garden have a more impressive views of the church than the front.

Beautiful church!. This is a beautiful piece of art with an interesting historic story. I can't imagine visiting Paris without seeing Notre-Dame.The sculptures on the outside are telling stories from a Bible.The only minus are long ques to get inside... Be prepared for that!
worth the long line wait. the best 8 euro that I spent in Paris.Long line.Winding staircase. Amazing gargoyles. Take a good camera and head up. You won't regret it!

Worth the visit. Visiting Notre Dame on a sunny day in May was worth the visit, despite the huge crowds. The light pouring in through the stained glass windows was breathtakingly beautiful. Do not be intimidated by the lines which move quickly but be careful that you are in the right line---the line to climb the towers is on the side of the cathedral and the main entrances is for a general visit. We did miss not having a tour and/or an audio guide as the written descriptions were hard to read (small fonts and crowds) but, nonetheless, the cathedral was worth a visit!
Pretty nice. Unique sculpture, looks amazing from the outside. You must see it. Notre dame is one of the most beautiful places inside out.

Nice view from the top, long queue though.... Visit to the tower is free with the Paris Museum Pass however no priority, i.e. have to wait in the queue just like all others without ticket.The queue is long because they only allow a group of "xx" number of people up to the towers at any one time; this is due to the tight access, limited walk space at the tower top. And they work on a "one-way" system going up and down of the tower.Patience is key but it's worth the wait because the view from the tower is amazing and get to go into the bell tower to see the bells.Honestly, prefer this elevated view (compared to Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe), personal preference.Going up the tower - 3 "stops", first "stop" is the ticket counter and souvenir shop. At this level, we waited for a few minutes before being allowed to climb to the next "stop" as a group. Next "stop" gets us to the elevated view - nice view and nice close-up with the gargoyles. 3rd and last "stop" after more flights of stair took us to one of the bell towers - still get some really good elevated view, and get to some glimpse of the bells.The tower is accessible by steps/staircase only. For those who can't make it up, walk towards the back of the Notre-Dame Cathedral and the side (facing the river) - nice park with plenty of benches and a free public toilet too.

Must see!. It doesn't matter if you're religious or not Notre-dame is absolutely amazing. The detail inside and out is aw inspiring. The architecture is amazing especially when you think how old it is. We probably couldn't build something this incredible today.
Go on a weekday.. Busy so we waited to go on a weekday and got in quickly. It was amazing to see and really glad that we went back. Line goes faster than you think so worth the wait.

Just another beautiful view of Paris. I do not know if it is worth climbing 372 steps to have the vision of what is around the cathedral when the most beautiful is inside. At times the ascent is claustrophobic and you can stay a few minutes up there. Ok, if you want to feel like Quasimodo ...Still to consider: you do not pay anything to enter the Cathedral, but to climb the tower you have to pay and still queuing ...

Family day out. Excellent day out and would highly recommend it, didn't quite make it up the tower due to the length of the que but went inside, just watch out for the street sellers as these can be quite pushy
Notre Dame visit. Free entry for a look round Notre Dame. Queue was fast moving and no one rushed you out if you chose to linger.
Not re Dame. Tour of cathedral informative but was off putting due to the Sunday service being in progress. Did not go up the tower due to long queue.

How old is this place!. Big queue to get in but don't be put off as you move quickly through it. Another of Paris's free attractions with great story board inside charting the very long history of its construction.Lots of nice little restaurants & cafes all around it.

Iconic! My 13 yr old Smiled a Lot!. My 13yr old looked forward to visiting this place because of Disney's Hunchback of Notre Dame animated movie. She wanted to see the "towers where he lived." She was still excited about the place even after I told her the story really didn't go as it was depicted in the animated movie.

Very nice cathedral. Very nice views inside and wheelchair accessible apart from loads of cobbles outside. there was an electric step which impressed me.it looked like normal steps but one of the staff pressed a button and it flattened out into a lift for wheelchairs
Loved it!. Oh WOW! This Cathedral is amazing & just one of many iconic places to visit in the magical city of Paris. Well worth visiting.

Nice views!. The tower is the icing on the cake for a Notre-Dame Cathedral visit. The view from the top is worth more than a few photographs. You can see miles across paris in multiple directions and well worth the climb up the tower. Beware of the queues to enter though.
History. Definetly you should visit this place but be prepared to wait for an hour to enter and than ready to climb that stairs...

You must see this in Paris. I am sure I am not the first to say that you should not miss this attraction when in Paris. It seems like a mad house when you go there because there are so many tourists that include massive tour groups. This can seem daunting because the lines are long and I have been here a couple times now, and it's not as bad as it appears. This is a church so there is no entrance fee or tickets to purchase. That means the line will move pretty quickly. Just strike up a conversation with others in line and hear about some other people's adventures. Great way to pass the time and you learn great things from other travelers. Be friendly and bold and you will be rewarded.

OK, So Now I've Been There. Notre Dame is world famous and probably familiar to everyone. But to go there in person gives an impression far different than what you might expect. The church's exterior is really its highlight. The wonderful architecture and the marvelous statues that grace the walls are impressive. Inside, however, the church is massive and has many nice components, especially the stained glass wondows. But much of the church is badly showing both its age and its neglect. The climb to the top of the towers gives a nice view of Paris, but is hardly worth it, is very crowded, takes a long time, and does not provide an experience that justifies the effort.
Magnificent Cathedral. The Cathedral is magnificent. Its history is inspiring. One can not help think about the scenes in the novel that Victor Jugo wrote while going through the building.

top of the top. The spectacular views from the towers of Notre-Dame makes the hour's queue and hundreds of steps up the spiral staircases well worthwhile. While there make sure you don't miss climbing the few extra wooden steps to see the great bell (and imagine Quasimodo swinging around on it). Absolutely awesome experience - I just loved the opportunity to get up close and personal with the gargoyles. I would totally recommend the towers - provided you're fit enough to climb over 400 steps, not afraid of narrow spiral staircases and fairly slim as you need to fit through very narrow spaces on the top corners of the towers.

Amazing views. Go early to avoid queuing. . We made it across town early to be in the queue when the towers opened and we had just 6 people in front of us so we had no long queue to wait in (we'd seen such long queues during the day before!!!).Lots of steps to climb but sooooooooo worth it the views are stunning and the gargoyles are so interesting. Just like in the movies. My pictures are wonderful. We climbed in the bell tower and waited down on a lower level to hear a bell chime which was great fun too.

Over 400 slippery stone steps but SO WORTH THE VIEW!. There is a fee to climb up into the tower and a long line but the view of Paris is spectacular! Seeing the Gargoyles up close and the various other features around the roof is amazing. The bells did chime while we were in the tower which is startlingly funny at first. I'm claustrophobic and had no issues in the narrow, tall, stone, spiral stairs because there are windows that let fresh air and light in as you ascend/descend. I would not advise climbing if you are pressed for time because the cathedral has staff on 2 of the upper levels and they control the volume. Plus, after that climb you want to take your time up there to drink it all in!

The bells!. It was quite a hike up the steps but sooooo worth it! While we up there the bells peeled for at least 10 min it was sensational! I highly recommend it, even though it is a line and a wait, and a lot of steps.
very good. a symbol in Paris, I was not fall in love but of course it is nice and worths a visit . It is good to look it from several dimensions.

Worth the wait. It is worth the wait to hang out with the gargoyles of Notre Dame. And to experience the views that Quasimodo overlooked daily! There are A LOT of winding steps up, which gets more narrow the higher up you go. I'm talking over 400! It is well worth the climb up though, just take your time. Thankfully they limit the numbers of people up at a time, which explains the slow moving line. It costs 8,50 euro and is covered by the museum pass. You even get to go into one of the bell towers to see the bells! This to me was worth the climb! Make the climb, take a selfie with the most photographed gargoyle (who looks painfully bored with getting his picture taken), and then enjoy a cold beer across the street afterwards while you wait for your legs to stop shaking!!!

Very crowded but great people watching. We loved Notre Dame. We stayed near it so we saw it several times during the day. Our favorite was at dusk and in the night. At dusk the sun hits the front just perfect. At night the courtyard is a gathering place for 100's. They even had a 5K walk/race which started at midnight when we were there. Loved hanging out in that courtyard.
Must see. This is definitely a must see in Paris. Queues can be long to get inside, however it is worth it. There are also several cafés around the area too that are nice.
gothic stunner. what a lovely piece of Paris architecture such a brilliant landmark in a fantastic location not to be missed and admired

It is Iconic and should not be missed.. Don't just take pictures outside, you have to go inside and see this amazing cathedral with it's Stained Glass Rose Windows. Breathtaking. If you go on Sunday you can get in for free.
Wonderful. fantastic place to visit, well worth the entrance price. It's very big, extremely beautiful and very vibrant

One of the world's great cathedrals. From the expansive forecourt, to the soaring towers, and rich interior spending time at Notre dame is a must. How those ancient architects and builders managed to construct such an imposing building with the its stunning buttresses, stained glass and soaring ceilings needs to experienced first hand.

Very long waiting line for the view only. I don't think that I would wait about an hour and a half to get in if I knew what it was like inside. There is not much to see inside of the towers except an exhausting stairway and two big bells. However, when you finally reach the top, the view of the city is great.
Wonderful. Actually went Dec. 2013. Long lines to get in, but well worth it. If not able to go up, going inside cathedral is amazing
Tower tip. Be sure you do some reading on history of Norte-Dame before going. Look for "our lady " on the front. Also look for St Denis and his head.

Worth the long wait.. The towers opens at 10 o'clock. First in line for the queue get there at 9 o'clock.We got there twenty minutes in 10 and we got through the queue in 40 min.They let people in approx 30 people at the time each 10 min. So you can do the math when you see how many is in line before you. When you get in to the tower you go to next level where you will pay for your ticket. (If you don't already have done that elsewhere.)When you get to the view you almost forget the long wait and just enjoy the view over this beautiful city. It rained when we where there but it is still a fantastic view.When you move around in the tower you figure out where they let people in in groups of 30 people. Otherwise it would be chaos.So get in line and have your camera ready when you get up there. Remember that there are two levels in the towers. Grab a brochure at the start. Enjoy.
do not miss this. great view of Paris. Very atmospheric if the bells are ringing at the same time. However, there are 400 steps to navigate first so be aware of that fact.

Long climb to the top, but worth it. I had a paris museum pass which gave access to the towers (access to the cathedral is free). The climb, which is winding and narrow in most places, is not for the faint hearted. Still, worth a visit and wait if you have the time

Good for health. About 400 steps of climbing by spiral stairs of Tower of Notre-Dame is good choice for exercise. And the view at the top of the tower is fantastic.
Tips
We use Paris museum pass and wait about 1 hour in line, about 20 person is allowed to access the tower in 1 round.
Must see attraction. My tip, Get there early in the morning at you will beat the queues. It is amazing you can see a building that is over 1000 years old. MUST SEE
fantastic building. We went in during early evening service which meant certain areas were closed off, however the service was very moving and the singing was stunning! A must when in Paris.

Huff and Puff. The reward of going up over 300 circular staircase steps that are dimpled and often uneven and with only one short stop near the top is an incredible view of Paris and a close up of the strange and eerie gargoyles at the Notre Dame. Not recommended for those with mobility issues or who are claustrophobic.
Great Views. An interesting and different view of Paris up amongst the gargoyles. Definitely worth a visit, despite the climb to the top.

Beautiful on the outside. I didn't find this church very good-looking on the inside, but the outside is amazing and quite a photo opp. Get there early to avoid the crowds. It's free to go in, of course, but you don't have to stay there long to see what it's all about. Personally, I prefer Sacre Coeur. It's beautiful inside and out.

A must see in Paris!. I got there quite late so we only got to see it from outside. However, the cathedral still looked amazing and we quite enjoyed the street show outside. Highly recommend if you in Paris! Please see my photos and vote for me if you find this review helpful. Thank you very much.
Breathtaking view! . Spectacular views from the top of the Cathedral. The climb up is definitely worth it. Get your camera ready to take beautiful pictures of the city. Enjoyed the time there.

Quite a climb but worth it for the view. We used the Paris pass to visit the towers so we did not have to pay. That said, we still had to wait in line (1 and 1/2 hours) to get into the building (sometimes the Pass allows you to skip the lines but not here) and then begin the climb which was about 600 steps to the top). It is narrow and winding and can be overwhelming for some. The entire visit to the towers took over 3 hours so be prepared for the time commitment. The views from the top were fantastic and we have the fabulous pictures to prove it.
must visit place in paris. Dame Cathedral is a must visit place in paris. it is beautiful, spectacular & historical attractions
Beautiful. One of the best sites to see in Paris. If lucky you will get to be present during one of their services. Beautiful all around. Easy to get to from most locations in Paris.

Guided after hours tour was worth every penny. We had an English speaking guide who took us round the Towers after the crowds had gone. The climb ip the steep spiral staircase was difficult but worth the effort for the spectacular views from the top. Finding out the history and having things pointed out to us made all the difference to our experience. I would recommend this tour to anyone thinking of making the trip to Notre Dame Cathedral.
Towers of Notre Dame. Great view. Up close with the gargoyles. Long line to get in, and slow once at the top. You have to be ok with climbing lots of spiral stairways.

Its Notre Dame, need I say more?. What an amazing Cathedral. we went to mass here, and the organ player was amazing. The cathedral is beautiful and claiming those steps, well, although very tiring, quite worth the effort. A MUST GO to place while in Paris.

Never got in due to false advertising (see other reviews also!). The website stated that the towers closed at a particular time. We got there just over an hour before this, and they closed the line right in front of us. Absolutely nowhere on the website or brochures that we had checked stated that this would be the case and the staff member was, as others have said, entirely unapologetic about this despite the disappointment of everyone lining up. We were just told to come tomorrow morning instead.Pity that was our last day. And we missed our back-up option since that, too, closed in the time that we were waiting and then getting there from Notre Dame.I would advise the company running this to invest in their advertising and website to ensure the information given is accurate. This was truly poor work.

breath taking. Loved the stain glass windows and the beauty and history of the Cathedral it blew me away. I felt very at peace and myself and my family had a picnic outside on the grounds where it is possible to sit on low walls.

Great city view!. Once you've made it to the top you can really enjoy the panoramic view. Be in good shape and wear shoes with non-slip soles as the steps up can be slick especially when they are wet.

Spectacular view. The climb to the top was all worth it because of the view you get of the city! But to be honest, it was quite a lot of steps - and that's coming from someone in their mid-twenties. It's spiral stone staircases the whole way up - pretty narrow and there's people both right in front of you and right in back of you. You kept thinking you would get to a landing, and then have a lot more stairs to go.You stop at a couple different levels along the way, which was a nice break, but just be mindful of the number of steps!
Notre-Dame. one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture, and it is among the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world. A must see
Crowds. We tried on two different occasions and were too intimidated by the lines. This was in April. I cannot imagine what the mobs would be like in the heavy tourist season.

Well worth a visit. Really enjoyed the serenity of Notre dame. Even with the tourists. There were really long queues to get in and to cling the tower . Be prepared for a long wait but it was worth it.

Towers Of Notre-Dame. Visited this Cathedral whilst in Paris during our European tour. Great place and there was no charge for entry unlike other places in Europe. We're not even the slight bit religious but the architecture was just amazing. Highly recommend a visit if you are in the area. Lines were quite good and only waited about 5 minutes before we got in.

Worth the Wait!. We attended Sunday Mass and went after to the towers. It is on the left side of the Cathedral. When you see the line up you know you arrived. We waited about 45 mins and it was windy, so bring a jacket. My wife sat in a nearby cafe, while I waited in line. (Expect to pay $6 euros for a cup of coffee) WHen we finally got up the myriad of stairs, we saw Gargoyles, Extra large church bells and a great view of Paris. It was a bit crowded, however bearable.

Gothic Towers. A must see when in Paris. We enjoyed our visit. Will have more significance to those familiar with the history of the Cathedral and those who share in the Catholic faith. Do a little research before going to enhance your visit. Most people flock to the inside but walking around the outside to see the flying buttresses was memorable.
great view. do not miss it! you get a great city view! ok, you will have to get in line and pay extra but it is well worth it!

Climbing to the top of the tower. It was Easter Sunday and I decided to visit the Towers of the Notre-Dame Cathedral. It was already a long queue there when I reached there by 9.15am and i have to wait for more than1 hour to reach the entrance. Museum pass holders do not have any privilege of shorter queue here which I think was really making security sense (imagine the big crowd squeezing to climb the narrow stairs winding up with more than 400 steps). The long queuing time and exhausting climbing efforts was paid off with the stunning city view from the top of the tower. I could even see down there hundred or perhaps thousands of tourists queuing in the s-shape long queue eagerly awaiting to enter the cathedral in this sacred Easter Sunday.

Don't miss it!. Get there early and get in line on the side of the building to go up to the bell towers. The long gets very long and moves very slow. Also if you are afraid of heights or small spaces do not go upstairs. There is a lot of stair climbing and small spaces. But the tour of the inside of the Cathedral is free and is really one of those once in a lifetime places you don't want to miss. It is absolutely beautiful
Toilets closed. Pretty hard to stand in a really long line to get in, without the public bathrooms being opened. I understand they need maintenance, but perhaps you do that in winter?

Stunning Views. Really enjoyed the towers of Notre-Dame, its wonderful seeing the gargoyles up close! As we were both under 26 it was free - which was also fab! The walk to the top is tough, its up a very narrow winding staircase and you do it in a group so you dont really get a chance to catch your breath en route. After each level there is an option not to go up to the next level though so if you're finding it tough you're not stuck going up and up! I think its on the second or third level (not the very top) you see the Belfy which is really fun! Again, tiny narrow door, not disabled friendly or anything like that!! Overall I enjoyed it, but the views from the Eiffel Tower are better so if you've been up that already I wouldnt kill myself again doing the windy staircase. It is fun all the same!

Ridiculous queues so get there early!. The towers can only have limited people ascending and descending the spiral stairs at any one time, so the queue builds up quickly. The trick is to arrive before 9.30am to get up close and personal with the gargoyles and tower bells. Of course, the towers also offer great views over the rest of Paris.

Amazing stain-glassed Cathedral...Notre Dame is breath-taking.... It's really something when you walk through such a historic space and feel like the walls (and windows) are speaking! After a beautiful walkthrough of the cathedral, and actually observing a ceremony (in French)...it really was impressive. My two teens were in awe of it, and couldn't snap enough pictures of the glass and the entire space. You have to see this if you're in Paris, for the first time!

A good climb for early birds. The Towers open at 10 am and there is a line formed at least an hour prior to that. During the day the line only gets longer as visits are tightly choreographed for reasons which will become obvious once you enter the very narrow and winding staircase. The stairs lead up to the north tower. Then there is a passageway to the belfry where Quasimodo worked. After that, there is a passage over to the south tower, which has another stairway up to the top. After a trip around the top of the south tower, there is a long winding stairway to the bottom. All along there are magnificient views across the city as well as overviews of the architecture and up-close experiences with the timbers holding the bells in place. In my opinion, the views are the best in Paris because one is literally in the center of the city where a stone in the cathedral's parvis or courtyard marks the point from which all distances in France were measured. The views are also great because they combine overviews of distant and nearby buildings and neighborhoods with up close looks at the distinctive gothic architecture and its gargoyle embellishments.

Amazing views of city--worth it!!. Line can be long but they let 20 people in every 10 minutes so it moves nicely. It does cost money to go up. Be sure to be in shape as it is a lot of steps up and down. If you time it right, you can be up there at noon when the bells chime!
steps workout. have to buy tickets, and wait in line outside alley entrance of Cathedral. its about 420 steps, and 10 euros so you decide if your legs can do it !!!
Wonderful. Epic, iconic and the stuff of countless movies, this is the essential Cathedral to visit and explore.
nice view. I know it's very nice because I went there 20 years ago but now it was impossible since if we wanted to go up we had to wait for more than on hour.
SERENE. This is one place you can spend hours introspecting and then sit in the lawn and see Paris life go by.
Beautiful views. Amazing and serene cathedral well worth the visit, queues were not long at all,, and you could spend hours there

Notre-Dame Cathedral on Easter Sunday. What a beautiful place to be on this day! Mass was being held, but visitors could quietly walk around the interior. Gorgeous stained glass windows and old artifacts. Had the pleasure of hearing the organ!

have your climbing legs on. with approximately 380 stairs to the top, be prepared for a hefty workout. The staircase is spiral and the hall narrows as your get toward the top, but the view and the gargoyles are so worth the leg exhaustion

JUST A WONDEROUS VISIT. The line proceeded very quickly. It is just an unbelievable artistic masterpiece of ancient days..There is a huge 13th century organ and gothic architecture. The towers offer breathtaking views of Paris. There are large bells in this area to be appreciated.

Amazing and worth the lines and the climb. . Climbing the towers was a great experience. The views from the top are spectacular. The architecture is also amazing. I wanted to see the famous gargoyles and was not disappointed. Important to note, there is a lot of stair climbing involved and some parts are a tight squeeze. We arrived around midday and only waited around 25minutes to get in.
It's free but nothing much to do in there. We got in free of charge but while we're in we were discouraged from talking and people were more interested in taking pictures.

Arrive early. We arrived 20 minutes before the towers opened and the line was already forming, so we got hot chocolate and waited. The line moved quickly once the towers opened and the views are amazing, we really loved the gargoyles! When we finished the line was already 5 blocks long! So get there early and enjoy the view!

History and beauty..!. A Paris must see..! It was so busy with tourists crowding the area when I visited that i didn't get the chance to go in - but even from the outside I was blown away with the brilliance..!

Magnificent. Just seeing them 'en passent' is enough to make one have the memory for ever!
We visited it internally many moons ago, but I am sure that nothing has changed in such a wonderful

Get here early. We arrived in the queue at about 9.35 (it opens at 10am) and there were already a good 60-70 people in front of us. That figure normally wouldn't be an issue but because they let you in in groups of about 15 and it is a one in one out policy you can imagine how long you could be waiting. We got in about about 10.30am so not to bad. Once in you start the climb, which is broken up about half way through at the shop/ticket office. You stay here for a minute of two to get your tickets (if you've not be booked) then you carry up the tower. At the first observation level you can see for miles across Paris towards the Eiffel Tower and you can also see the Gargoyles and Chimera up close and personal. Further along is the Bell Tower, where you can see the bells, obviously. Then the last part is to the top of the tower for a 360 degree view of Paris. Time is limited to 5 minutes per group up here but that is ample to get your photos done. From here it is all downhill, a long way downhill though. All in all we were in and out within 40 minutes and probably would of been quicker had there not been a large school group in front of us. The building is just amazing and the views just as impressive. From my point of view i would much rather climb Notre-Dame than go to the top of the Eiffel Tower. If you do go here then you won't be disappointed.

Amazing... Notre- Dame is beautiful building. We truly enjoyed walking around and taking in all there is to see. We did not go inside, but well worth the trip just to explore around. The lock bridge is just behind the cathedral
going back in time. what more can one say than visiting Notre dame cathedral is a magical experience. One which you will never forget. Get there early to avoid the 500M lines
Nice Church!. Ok for an hours visit but not longer. Easy to get to and pretty building and a nice stained glass window. Didn't see the hunchback though!
Beathtaking. Notre-Dame in person was more magnificent than any photos I have ever seen. When we went there the choir was practicing they sound like angles, so beautiful.

WORTH THE WAIT. We waited two hours, and finally got in just before it closed for the day (around 4pm). It's 8.50 euro to get in, or free with the Museum Pass. Once climbing 400 steps in a spiral staircase, you're on one of the levels above the Cathedral. You're right next to all the famous gargoyles, and can see into the bell towers. As we continued on, we were allowed into one of the bell towers, which was awesome. So interesting to see the skeletal insides of the tower.
