Just after this, we were given the choice to descend to the ground, or continue upward to the top of one of the towers. Well worth the wait, for this wonderful experience.

I'm tired of churches! But I like taking photos. I've seen enough churches in my travel through Europe, so I did not go inside, but if you want a great pic of Notre Dame, stand on the Petit Pont and snap away...
They are what they are!. Nice towers. Worth a look. That's about all I have to say about that! Definitely something to see when in Paris.
Peaceful place.. Just visit this to see the excellent ancient architecture works and glass paintings. Very Peaceful place and also it was interesting to know how it is built.

Imagine the Hunchback.... Standing in the plaza in front of Notre Dame, it's easy to picture the Hunchback looking down from the towers. Allow time to climb the tower (at a cost of about €6 per adult). Bear in mind that the stairs are steep, spiral and very well worn. But the views from the top are remarkable. Allow an hour to go up and down, with time to take in the views. We went in October and waited maybe 30 minutes to start the climb.

Wonderful!. Lots of walking but definitely worth it! I am a huge fan of The Hunch Back of Notre Dame and so the visit meant a lot to me!!! Very nice and would recommend. Great views from the top and you can see the bells too

Again well worth the visit - ARRIVE AROUND 9AM!. We took our kids up to the towers this time. In prior visits, certain parts of the north tower were closed, but this time we were able to walk up to and touch the bell Emanuele. Very cool.MAKE SURE YOU ARRIVE AROUND 9AM FOR THE FIRST TOUR! This line, especially on weekends or holidays, can be several hours long. By arriving right around 9, you can often make it into the first tour group up and save some considerable time.

Great place if you like cathedrals. Loved that that the cathedral was open on Easter sunday. There was a long line up to get into the cathedral that day. Great cathedral to see if you like looking at cathedrals
30 years since my last visit, and nothing has changed,. Loved it. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. The stained glass windows are superb. The place was crowded, but very quiet.

Worth the wait!. Be prepared for long lines to climb to the base of the towers. I waited for over 2 hours to make the climb. The wait was worth it to take in the iconic views of Paris and gargoyles on the cathedral. Plan to arrive first thing in the morning to reduce wait time, then visit the interior of the cathedral. If you have a Paris Museum Pass, admission is free.
DON T MISS IT. Beautiful architecture. The different phases of construction during the centuries well explain your visitors
Get there 0930 or before!. Opens at 1000 worth the early start for a view rivalling the Eiffel Tower. Enjoy! Remember young eu citizens go free
a must see. great building just like it was in the films ,the queues were not to bad quite fast moving toilets very close to entrance be prepared to tip

No visit to Paris is complete without a tour of St. Michaels. This is a must see when in Paris. I recommend combining it with a trip through the Latin Quarter. You will get to see the St. Michael's fountain and have a chocolate Nutella and banana crepe too!!

Worth the time. Went here with patience, since we were in Paris for Holidays all places were packed, but it was worth the time invested on the line and then you have to be ready to climb +300 stairs, but is a beautiful view from Paris
Enchanting. Arrived on Easter sunday to a church service, the singing and bell ringing were enchanting and eerie considering its history

Amazing - but ridiculous queues. We arrived at 10.30 on a Thursday and queued for over 2 hours to get in. Only a handful of people allowed in at a time. Coach loads of students arrived and went straight in so when we were within view of the entrance the queue stopped moving for half an hour! Lots of space once you get in though! Absolutely spectacular architecture and views of Paris. Love the gargoyles up close.

A must see!. Do this for sure. The lines are long but worth it. They only let a few people in at a time which makes the experience more enjoyable and the views and close up views of the tower are unreal. My teen thought this was great after seeing the Hunchback movie and reading the book.
Excellent palce to visit. Visited it twice. Day one did the outside and the crypt. Second day (weekday) we did the inside as the queues were smaller. Inside is just awesome, a must see for sure.
Notre Dame Cathedral. its a place worth the watch in paris. after you visit the great eioffel tower. this cathedral is beautiful and its like soul met peacefully place.
Magnificent!. You have to spend time here! A MUST! You can also go underground to see remains of the old town! Beautiful beyond description! Must see!
Beautiful Piece of History. We opt not to tour the property, we instead sat appreciated the architecture. There's a shaded park with benches and public bathroom on the opposite end of the property.
Amazing archetecture. Beautiful stop on the island tour. Worth the decade it took to build. A must in Paris, accompanied by beautiful river surroundings and park like settings of grandure..

Not worth the climb. A lot of stairs and no windows, so no way of seeing where you where. The groups are huge and you need to go following everyone, so not a lot of space. And you are pressured to go since it is a carrousel visit (circular).

Wonderful!. Unfortunately the rooftop was undergoing repairs during our stay as I would have loved to go back up and see the city from this view. It is amazing to see the architecture of the building as well as the city.
Amazing building. Big queue which moved quickly, a really enjoyable building. Some amazing detail on windows and carving. The whole area was interesting.

Excellent and well worth a visit. A great step back in time to look around such a magnificent structure built over many Centuries. We took a look with our children aged 10 & 8 and entrance is free. We entered at a time of prayer and we couldn't help feeling we were imposing a little, but respected their privacy and walked around the entire Cathedral in wonder of how it was created. A great way to spend an hour or so.

Go to the top!!. The inside of Notre Dame is beautiful, but the thing that will take your breath away is to walk up the 400 winding steps to the top! It is the best view of Paris! I enjoyed this more than the Eiffle Tower view! The wait in line is definitely worth it. It was about 30 min to 1hour.

Long queue to get to the top!. Took about 2 hours to queue to get to do the climb to the top of the towers - queue is very slow moving as they let groups of 20 in about every 15 minutes. Once in though was a brilliant experience - great views, got to go in the bell tower. Definitely worth doing!

Fantastic. As you go up you con feel the medieval atmosphere and a sense of history, up there besides the view of the city there are the close up of the gargoyle statues and the inside of the bells towers with the woodwork, not something to miss.
The most impressive cathedral I've ever seen.. A true can't miss landmark of Paris. See it from all angles to really appreciate the architecture. Inside is astounding in size and beauty.
Impressive!. An awesome building, not to be missed on any Paris trip. More spectacular than the Eiffel tower and far more interesting.

In Awe!. We stopped by here and were just in awe of the architecture and history at Notre-Dame. There's usually a big line to get in but don't let that detour you. The line moves fairly quick and it's worth the wait. There is a crypt to see but there's an admission price for it as well as the treasure room. Great stop and a must see while in Paris!
Quazi's Crib. Stunning architecture and beautiful inside and out from all angles. Definitely one for the camera enthusiasts. Stunning with a blue sky backdrop.

Great views but be prepared. This is definitely a worthwhile landmark, but it's best to know what to expect before you go. I would recommend getting there early (like before the tower opens) as the lines become long quickly, and admission from the main line is interrupted for groups on a frequent basis. The stairs are very narrow and its a long way up to the top, but once you're up there the views make the climb worthwhile. Seeing the gargoyles up close and gazing out over the Paris skyline with the Seine right beneath you is an experience you won't forget.

Brilliant. Loved the gargoyles. Long queue, but well entertained by some chap in a flying jacket and his mimic the tourist routines. Easy climb up the steps. brilliant views of the city. Disappointed that the bell tower was closed.

Bit disapointed. We stumbled upon Notre-Dame while looking for a museum and didn't realize it was Notre-Dame because it just didn't seem that impressive. Went inside and the incense drove us right back out again. Must see just to say you saw it.
Great views of Paris. Such a beautiful building. Climbing the stairs to get to the top of the towers wasn't too difficult, and the views at the top are spectacular. Definitely a must-visit.
Queue wasn't moving, no explaination. We waited 20min and no one went in or out. Staff locked in their ticket office not giving information.

Forget the Cathedral and take the stairs for the towers. It was an amazing experience. When we arrived on the top the bells start to ring. What a noise and what a joy!
The Cathedral itself is like all big Cathedral. Not really interesting, except when they have concerts.
But the towers, that is something else.

The most beautiful of all........... Loved the entire Cathedral, especially going up to the Bell Tower, surrounded by Gargoyles. Beautiful inside with tiffany glass and a million candles. Definitely a place to see and take in the beauty of it!
Always busy but worth it.. Love the stained glass rose windows.. and the architecture.. La Chapelle is close by too and very worth the wait.

Lots of Steps. I think I stopped counting at around 450 steps going up.Going down was considerably easier.Our wait for the towers was around a hour, and we didn't arrive when it opened up (bad on us).The view was comparable (incomparable?) to the Arc de Triumph - you can see more of Paris than you might have thought existed.If you are physically fit (no elevators here folks, sorry!), take this on. It's well worth the effort, and the view is breathtaking in a good way.

NOT a cathedral. (see review). See my review under Notre-Dame. A cathedral is the seat of the Bishopric of a city. This famous edifice is a Basilica; the cathedral of Paris is the Madeleine, very near to the Place de la Concorde, the center of Paris, originally the Temple of Victory built under Napoleon, but made into a Catholic Church after the downfall of the upstart Emperor. Enjoy both!

Best Views of Paris. My boyfriend and I visited Paris on the off season (I suggest everyone who hates large crowds do this, or else be ready to wait in long lines. You've been warned so don't complain if you go to the most visited city in the world in high season and have to wait to see everything lol!). It was the first Sunday of the month, and therefore it was free to go to the very top. It's always free to go into the church, but there is a fee to walk up. There was a long wait, of course since it was free, but we got some hot tea and coffee to keep us warm as we waited. Notre-Dame was the thing I wanted to see most in Paris and so we waited.It was of course worth the wait to save a bit of money and go all the way up. You get to stop at 2 different levels and you can stay as long as you want. It wasn't crowded (off season benefit) so we were able to take all of the pictures we wanted without other people getting in the way. At the top level you get to see Paris from 360 degrees and these will be your best pictures of Paris from above. You will have to climb all the way up (around 400 steps I think) so be prepared and also mindful of who might be in front of you if it's taking a while. There was one thing I did not enjoy about Notre-Dame and that was going inside to the actual Cathedral. They (not sure who exactly) put a souvenir shop right inside the church which bothered me a since I found they were taking away some of the importance and significance of the church. Sad to see that they were trying to make money off of a wonderful historical church. I'm sure tourists would buy souvenirs if they put it outside as well, but that's just their poor choice. It was of course beautiful inside and there was a lot to look at.Other than that, it was wonderful. There was a huge Christmas tree right in front of the cathedral since it was December, which really added a nice touch outside.
Terrifyingly high but amazing! . I'm scared to death of heights and the stairs are crazy narrow, but the view makes up for it. Arrive early to avoid queues.

Better be able to handle stairs but worth it!. Make sure to arrive before the towers open or you will be in line for a long time. We still had to wait a bit but the views are worth it. Nice way to see the gargoyles atop Notre Dame.
dinner cruise the river for a treat. This was a fun way to have dinner and see the sites on the river lit up at night. Food is good but the view is magical.

Long wait for great view - you decide!. We had about a 45 minute wait in very cold weather, but the climb and the views were spectacular. Probably the most rewarding is the close-ups of all of the gargoyles and animals along the bell towers that cannot be seen well form the ground at all.
Not just a myth. Amazing building with a lovely story... not to be missed if in Paris... the Crypt was also a lovely surprise and very interesting
Experience not to be missed. A highlight of our trip to Paris a fantastic experience, busy but visitors moved through smoothly. Worth a visit if in Paris.
Historic. I loved everything about this, it was breathe taking. It was the first place I wanted to see after reading a Victor Hugo novel.

Amazing. The queue goes down quickly - amazing cathedral and truly touching to watch a service
We didn't venture up due to time but would definitely return to do so
classically breath taking. Loved the inside such amazing stained glass windows.However outside was dirty and very crowded.This added to the calm feeling inside the cathedral I guess.

The Perfect Cathedral. an amazing place in which breathes history of several centuries. Stone columns impressive grandeur. This is truly a holy place. I'm not Catholic, but even I prayed to the Lord in this cathedral. Be sure to visit the cathedral - it is unforgettable!

Worth the 400 or so steps!. Myself and 2 daughters (10 & 12) really enjoyed the towers of Notre Dame. We got there as they were letting the first group go up and we waited in line for half an hour. The view at the top was amazing. We had a clear morning and could see for miles. We loved being able to see the gargoyles so close up too.

Excelent view of Paris. After 3 times I finally made it last weekend.Expect several hrs to be waiting in a queue and a good cardio exercise (440 steps). Very nice view of Paris where you can also see Eiffel Tower and "Sacre Coeur". Nice view and you can take wonderful pictures of Paris!

What do you See?????. Hello Travellers, this is another place you cant miss either extreme details on everything, another work of art in architecture. If you go all the way up be prepared 400 degrees separtes bottom from Edge,....but it really pays off.You go there and then tell me somethingVisited December 2006
Wow !. Another must see...... Very very spectacular indeed. Easy to reach, lots to do & see. Ideal for those wanting to really soak in the Parisian culture

Beautiful. Notre-Dame is incredibly beautiful from both the outside and the inside well worth a visit, being one of Paris's free attractions, the only negative is that unless you go early in the morning you may have to que for a long time. However outside Notre-Dame on the banks of the river there are many interesting stall to look at, artists selling painting and books. Its a beautiful area just to wander around even if you don't want to go inside Notre-Dame itself.
Amazing venue!. Breath taking interior, so much history here, people still worship under this roof and if you are visiting Paris then you need to visit this site!!
MUST SEE. Get there early and if you are a study abroad student you can show your passport for free entrance. Expect to wait a while due to there being only one stair case.

Cathederal of Notre dame. You must go! The stained glass is magnificent and the immense size of it is mind blowing. The altar is beautiful and that Rose window--the light coming thru it maks it seem alive.

The View is Worth the Line. Its a long line (I think it took about an hour and a half) and its separate from the line to get into the main church, but the view of Paris is spectacular, and the architecture is beyond compare. Definitely worth it, just plan ahead for time!
Go there. Beautiful building if you appreciate medieval architecture, great views. I love the gargoyles. Only drawback is the crowd and queuing to get in and around.

Great Photo Spot and Free Entry. Notre-Dame was wonderful to visit. The towers are incredible. You can also go inside and look around for free. There was a short line to get in, but nothing too bad. We would have liked to go up in the towers, but did not find a way. The stained glass was beautiful on the inside. Do yourself a favor and take the time to enjoy this site in paris

Not for the faint hearted!. We had the Paris Museum Pass but be warned, this does NOT give you priority access.... You still have to queue, and we queued in the freezing cold for around an hour in the middle of February. LOTS of steps, spiral steps and quite narrow. Need a reasonable amount of fitness and you may struggle if you are claustrophobic or get vertigo. HOWEVER the view from the top is awesome, even though it was reasonably foggy that day. Epic photo opportunities!
Amazing. Wonderful inside and out. The architecture and stained glass windows are magnificent. Always worth a visit. Just keep an eye out for pickpockets and stay respectful to the worshippers inside
Spectacular. Magnificent Cathedral set on the banks of the Seine. Very peaceful and well worth a visit. The area surrounding the cathedral is worth exploring.

Great views but take it steady. Notre Dame is central to the whole being of Paris. A medieval gothic cathedral its interior is quite dark and foreboding. The towers however provide a totally different experience. Once climbed the towers provide a spectacular view over central Paris. Looking down you can seethe outline of the old basilica. The only problem we experienced was distinct leg tremble on the way down.

Amazing. This is the money shot. Everyone who visits Notre dame wants the photo of the towers.Be prepared for frustration as hundreds of people get in your way as you try to capture your moment.It's a beautiful place, albeit slightly haunting.
Notre-Dame at its best. Stunning building in a great location on one of Paris' islands....Extremely busy due to a beautiful afternoon in March, but great place to walk around the outside of.

Worth a visit. Although ther was a Mass going on when we visited as long as you are quiet they don't mind you walking round this beautiful cathedral . You may go all the way up to the top op if you wish . This too is worth a visit

The Bells!. Notre Dame Cathedral is one of those places you can't miss from your trip to Paris. Even if you are traveling with children they would connect this wonderful cathedral with the Disney film! Stand in the square outside and admire this wonderful sight.
Rainy day at Notre Dame. Even on a cold and rainy day the cathedral was beautiful...the shopping around Notre Dame is very good too!
Special Place. My daughters enjoyed this beautiful cathedral... off season so line was not horrible and we had lots of time inside with small crowds.

Must-do - but you already knew that!. Of course climbing up the towers of Notre Dame is a must-do in Paris, but everyone knows that! The point of a review is to read about the experience. The views are amazing, it's cool to see the church up close, all that. In my opinion, if you have to choose the Arc de Triomphe or Notre Dame, choose Notre Dame.Now, the actual experience - not the best. First off, the line can take kind of a while even if it's not very long because they limit how many people can go in at once, so it's best to get in line 15-30 mins before it opens in the morning. It seems like you're waiting in line to buy a ticket, but really you're waiting to have some guy do just about the most cursory and aloof check of your bag humanly possible. After that, you walk up a flight of stairs to what appears to be a gift shop...which it is, but it's also where you buy your tickets. No signs or anything telling you to do this. Once everyone in the group has bought tickets, you then can climb the tower. You get to stop at the first viewing platform, which seems like the end, but it's not. Again, zero signs or info. This is a one-way situation, where you then have to wait behind a Tensabarrier until you're allowed to climb all the way up. It's very unclear where the entrance on this platform is, but just keep walking until you can't anymore. From there, you climb to the top and you're only allowed 5 minutes - the snooty/kinda lazy employees will tell you this, but as I said, they're kinda lazy, so they don't really chase you down.So, climbing Notre Dame is a must-do experience in Paris, but you'll have to deal with a bit of rudeness. I guess they just get sick of dealing with tourists? But I dont' have much sympathy, since millions of people visit every year and they must be rolling in money. Honestly, most people we encountered in Paris were very nice and helpful, so these guys were not the norm. And not all of them were rude, but the ones who were soured our experience.*if you like my review, I hope you'll click the 'helpful' button; those of us who write reviews love to get them and it motivates us to do more :) *
Must in Paris. I had heard a lot about this Cathedral before I went to Paris. I was very very impressed by its lack of light inside which makes it kinda mysterious
fantatstic. well to see notre dam and its spires and windows is something to behold it is awesome trully awesome
Quasimodo. No we didn't see him, but trip to this is a must, really nice Cathedral. There was a service in progress which added to the visit.
Don't miss it.. A great tour. A wonderful place to attend mass. A great climb up the bell towers if you can get there.
What's not to like. Awesome place. This was my 5th visit and I will never tire of seeing the majesty of this building. Many people there but you don't have long to queue

Views to remember.... After visiting the magnificent sanctuary, I made my way to Notre Dames's historic tower. If you are limited on time while visiting Paris, and want to see most of Paris from one vantage point, this is the place that you must go. I experienced scenic views I will remember for the rest of my life...Read More: http://activities-eatsandtravels.blogspot.com/2015/03/notre-dame-tower-unbelievable-views.html

Beautiful building and then explore Latin Quarter. We are not religious at all but appreciated the history and architecture of this building. Its a great place to start your wander round the latin quarter.

Very atmospheric. Brilliant place to visit, the stained glass windows and the stone carvings are amazing. Try to visit on a Sunday when there is an international mass at 12.45. A must for any Catholics visiting Paris.

Wow the climb to the top !!!!!!!!. What a fantastic cathedral immersed in history. On arrival qued to go into the Cathedral itself. The first word you can think of is WOW! Mass was actually taking place as all us tourists walked around. It is free entry although you can pay 5 euros to go into a little museum to see the antiquities. As you leave the Cathedral walk to the right to gain entry and climb the spiral staircases to the top. This costs €7.50 well worth it. Amazing views of Paris and all the gargoyles and angels on the top of the Cathedral's roof tops. It's over 400+ steps to the top, knackered but worth it.

Nice views but steep climb up. This is not for those who suffer from vertigo. There are hundreds of steps in a narrow spiral staircase, but the staff manage the passage up and down very well. Lovely views from the top, especially looking out over the wonderful gargoyles. The queue for entry starts before it opens and the museum pass has no priority.

Impressive. Situated in the Ile de la Cite the towers of Notre Dame Cathedral cannot fail to impress you. It's different by day and by night. It's in a beautiful setting, but depending when you visit it can be very busy.   A visit in early morning when the sun is rising is a good time to be there.
Worth the climb. Loved getting up high with the chimera. Of course the views were good as well. Next time I might actually have time to go inside.
Worth the climb. Great views from here, you may have to queue in peak season , the entrance fee is worth the experience.

Best feelings/ Must go. Loved it from the outside and from the inside.
Loved prayer time in the evening there with organ music.

Worth visiting!. The building is a must see... Outside but inside too... The gigantic stained glass paintings are very impressive.
Of course, there will be queuing as it is one of the most visited attraction in Paris so be prepared (and patient!!).
Well done to Paris city for keeping this fantastic historic building so well maintained!

Lots of steps, but so worth it!. I'll begin by saying the Tower tour is not for someone who has problems with stairs. There are somewhere in the neighborhood of 375 steps to the top so if you have difficulty with stairs you may want to think twice. We had done a ton of walking the previous 2 days and I have a problematic knee at times so coming down was a little tricky. But oh was it worth it! The view is spectacular and to see up close all the different gargoyles and architectural detail is amazing.
A must if visiting. It's the only view that we sought this trip. Guardian gargoyle with the city in the background is a MUST.
breathtaking. the building is breathtaking beautiful place, we walked around the outside so never went inside would love to see it again,
Worth visiting. The stained glass paintings are very good. The catherdal is serene even though it is noisy and crowded outside. It is maintained well.
Notre Dame is a must!. Very impressed with this beauty and the fact that it was 800 years old. I think it is a must see.The artwork was splendid.

Must see. Beautiful church and so much history. We happened to go one day while it had been raining and were able to walk right up and go in. Went by a couple of days later when the weather was nice and there was a very long line. It does seem to move along but was still very long. So glad we went on the rainy day.

Has to be done ! Superb. The detail on the building is staggering and beautiful, wows me every time. A beautiful building, still in use. If you want to go up the towers this is outside, not very well sign posted, beware this finishes 16.45 but can close Up to half an hour earlier if busy. Well worth a visit.
Awesome.. It's a beautiful sight to behold, very lovely at night. It's really awesome, I really love it just that it's on a busy area.

Stunning. The Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral are another must see while in Paris. Just amazing, and the outside tells various biblical stories. Definitely must be on your list while visiting Paris. Incredible.
Very interesting. I enjoyed the church artifacts inside the towers of Notre Dame. You must pay extra to see the small museum of artifacts.

View from the top. I love this cathedral, there is always a line, but it goes very quickly. Once inside there is a peace and quietness that takes over, no matter how crowded. On the side you can wait on yet another long line and this ones takes a bit longer, but its to walk up the turrets to the top. The View from the top is simply amazing, and the gargoyles are great fun.
Towers were amazing. It was very cool too go up to the towers, if you get to Notre Dame, take the extra time to go in to the towers it is worth the line that will probably be there!
View. It's not too bad of a walk up. Nice wide stairs most of the way and the view is unparalleled. If you can make the trip up for a visit to the Gargoyles, DO IT!

Amazing Views. You must be in excellent physical condition to do this since it is a long way up and a long way down. Once at the top, however, the views are spectacular in every direction and you are right next to the Gargoyles protecting the city.
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning architecture. Well worth a visit. Be prepared for long lines, but that is to say with most everything in Paris. Must see though.

Very special inner feeling. If you are a spiritual person you will sense a special atmosphere of peace, tranquility, happiness...something beyond the material world. If you are not so spiritual, you will feel something different from the world outside. Be prepared to be transported to a different intangible experience.

Great Cathedral. We explored Notre-Dame Cathedral 15.02.15. We only queued for 10 minutes, admission is free to the cathedral and worth a visit to see the stained glass windows. It was very peaceful which was welcome after the hectic day we had had. I was amazed how small it looked from the outside but once inside it was like a tardice. I had wanted to see it because it was something I had read about since being a child and watched movies which featured it, I was not dissapointed. Lovely.
Beautiful. Unbelievable beauty, such a gorgeous place, in an outstanding city. Absolutely breathtaking. An absolute must see, particularly at night.

Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. One of the most famous landmarks. They also help you find the place. Well located close to the Seine River. Good to walk over the bridges. Also close to the Courts. We walked from Pont de Neuf
Excellent Place. Again if you are interested in old monuments & history , you will like this place.It is very dark there & during holiday season , it will be full of people

See it!. Head here and imagine what it must have been like to see during the crusades, at its height. If there's a line, going inside isn't entirely necessary unless you've never seen a Gothic cathedral before. Best time to meet Our Lady is at sunset, when the golden Parisian sun casts an orange glow upon her facade.
so peaceful there !!. fab peaceful place, a real feel good factor after visiting. Lit a candle and said a few prayers and felt great after visiting.
nice to see all Paris. We have to wait one hour outside but it is nice to see all over Paris from the top of tower. La saine river and tower eiffel and all center of Paris buildings.
Great attraction. The church has been cleaned and it is great to view from all angles. Best when the sun catches it. Still a line up to get in in February.

So glad I did this. This is the thing to do in Paris. Yes, we were there before it opened, and even in November had to wait about 30 minutes before we got to walk up all those tiny, winding stairs to get up the towers....but it is so worth it. Great photo ops and views that you will remember forever. This is on the Paris Museum Pass.

Scary. Stairs are very narrow and if you change your mind there is no turning back you have to go all the way up, cause there is no way two people will fit :) but its worth going up, view, gargoyles and the famous Bell are amazing :)

Incredible view!!. I highly recommend this attraction. It has an amazing view. You can access to two levels. Even though is really high and it requires patience to go up to the top, it totally worth it.I do not suggest to go with a large backpack or things in the hand, as stairs are really small and it might be more complicated to get through those small spaces. Also, it is better to go early in the morning!! During the day the queue is really long, and a lot of time is wasted....something you wouldn't like to do if you are only a couple of days in Paris. Make an effort, go early, and you will take a better advantage of the day!In the upper tower, there is a small balcony to appreciate the view. Up there it also gets a little bit crowded, specially because everybody tries to take panoramic pictures (which is totally understandable), and you get only 5 minutes in the upper external area (so everybody has the possibility of visiting). So...get early, be patient and enjoy the view.P.S. Go to the Square next to the Cathedral! It's super nice!

A long walk up. A spiral staircase to get up from the ground. Brilliant views on a clear day of most of Paris. You end up going to the middle first and then chose whether you go to the top or back down. Worth going to the top.

Worth a Visit to say you've been!. Notre Dame is very busy and if always packed with people but its definitely worth a visit to say you've been. Its very beautiful inside but not as beautiful as Cologne's Cathedral or St. Albans but it definitely has a gravitas that is very striking. Its well worth a visit and getting a tour if possible.

Get your FitBit ready!. I love Paris for the fact that you PAY the attractions so you can exercise by walking so many winding staircases! I was winded when I reached the top, but so glad that I did it! The view from the top is beautiful!

Disappointing. Having visited Paris several times this was my first visit to Notre-Dame. I was not very impressed at all. Comparing this to St Peter's in Rome is like comparing chalk and cheese.I have seen it now but would not be in a hurray to go back.
Inspiring. there is nothing to dislike about this incredible structure which was just so so awe-inspiring.Make you buy tickets and climb to the top

Go during sunset. Go anytime if you're into taking amazing Parisian cityscapes. Otherwise go during sunset for optimal photographs with the gargoyles. Otherwise, the dizzying 400+ steps may not be worth it. The balcony is extremely tight. If you have a protruding belly, you'll feel very uncomfortable there. I don't usually have one, but I did have a 12 kg baby strapped to mine that day, I earned each one of those 400+ steps.
The exercise on the way up is well worth the view.. Best views of Paris. We got to experience the bells ringing while taking in the views. Memories for a lifetime!
Beautiful. A beautiful building - always worth a visit when in Paris.Especially nice to see the huge Christmas tree outside still.
Can help you creat a Kodak moment. These are magnificent towers with history. When you finished looking around, these can also be used as background to create a Kodak Moment.

Breathtaking!. As a building, it is a stunning example of French Gothic architecture. The exterior is exquisite, with elegant flying buttresses, intricately detailed stone carvings, and awe inspiring towers that soar to the heavens. The interior is astounding, I cannot do it justice in words. The rose windows and the stained glass make for an ethereal and otherworldly experience (just what you would want in a Church).We arrived at the tale end of a Gregorian Mass and it was like traveling backward in time. We decided to hang back and observe, so as not to disturb those who had arrived on time. I am not Catholic, but even I was moved by the experience. On a more practical note: there was plenty of available seating if one wishes to attend Mass and it is worth a pilgrimage. As a point of interest we glimpsed artifacts from the past and viewed the archeological excavations in the lower part of the church.The cathedral is steeped in history, mystery, and glory. It is a must stop in a visit to Paris. It was a solemn and engaging experience.
Have to see it. Great old cathedral. Not over the top impressed though I think you must see it. Does not compare to st Patrick or the Vatican
Beautiful, stunning, and spiritual. I was floored by the beauty and historical significance of Notre Dame. The architectural detail is phenomenal.
Well worth the visit!. Make sure to see all that the Towers and Cathedral of Notre Dame. Wonderful to learn about the history and even more beautiful to see the architecture!

Tower Closed. I happened by the entrance to the Tower Tour entrance Friday night, January 23 and a sign was hung on the fence which read, "Due to technical reason the belfry is closed." I would imagine that this is an off season for tourists and that they are doing maintenance. No indication of when the tour will resume.
brilliant. one of the cathedral i saw it ...is huge nd very stylish ,it was sunday when we visit so was a huge cue but worth it all the way.PLEASE if u are in paris go there

Best Views on the Bell Tower. You will definitely want to climb the stairs up the Bell Tower for some of the most amazing views. You will get the most wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower as well as many gargoyles. A must if you are visiting Notre Dame.

lofty views of Paris and gargoyles. The queue was about 30 minutes (possibly due to recent events and drop in tourism?), the climb is steep and there is a bit of a squash at the top. However, they didn't rush us straight back down and we given ample time to take in the view and take pictures of the gargoyles. Lovely.

Winter crowd. I went in Summer last year and managed to go inside but this Winter the queue was so long that I was so glad i visited in Summer. I managed to tell my niece the story of The Hunchback of Notre Dame in front of the church.

Expect to climb.. Did not know there was a separate line for the towers and a fee (we expected the fee we just didn't know how much). The wait is long lucky there are street vendors to sell food and drinks while you wait. But expect to climb a ton of steps to the top, a narrow spiraling staircase with few spots to stop and catch your breath if you are not used to this type of physical activity.
Great views of the whole city of Paris. There is a waiting line of 30 to 45 minutes to purchase ticket and go up. There is a sign mentioning "No Fastpass". If you paid for fastpass, you are conned.
As always, beautiful. The best area to be, its pretty, there is great food, and its Paris! Its an easy ride in the subway, takes you right there!

Breathtaking!. Depending on the direction of your approach to Notre Dame the towers can be a wonderful surprise as you turn into the square to be confronted, for the first time, by the towers of the Basilica! We found the best views are from the Petite Pont and the south side of the river when, especially at night, the Cathedral takes on a surreal appearance! It is very photogenic but make sure you have a tripod with you to get those stunning pictures at night!
Incredible. The Cathedral is a truly inspirational building to visit. Any person visiting Paris needs to go and see this spot and behold the vastness and spiritual power of such an old landmark.

worth the climb. ok so you have to queue, and they only let you in 25 at a time but they cant help that .. that is the infrastructure built all those centuries ago .. you also get obliged to walk up quickly so you don't slow anyone down behind you .. it is tough , but doable even for oldies like me ... and .. the views are awesome - well worth doing
Good views. Luckily not much ques when we'd visited as usually the place is packed, the view from the top is amazing. Truly a great visit and very helpful staff and service.

Special. Magnificent. Even though it is packed one senses something very special. Sculptures and beautiful artworks too with lots of history. It is amazing how quiet everyone is and respects where they are
Nice. The Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral are a pretty tourist attraction in Paris. The views from the Towers are lovely, so it is worth the wait.
Where is Quasimodo?. Very friendly staff at the entrance to the towers. Enough time to explore the towers and the skyline of Paris. Very good view over the rooftops of the city
Terrible. They close the gate 25 minutes before closing time. They should mention this case in everywhere. We missed to go up just for 5 minutes

Time well worth spending. I had a few hours spare on a business travel, and spent them on Motre dame. Simply impressive and got some quiet time to reflect.
👍😄

Get there early!. We began standing in the line st 9 am and there was already a very long line to make the climb up to the top of the bell tower. They did not let people in until around 10 am, and by then the line was around the block. There is no elevator, so be prepared to climb a LOT of stairs. However, paying an admission fee, waiting in line, and climbing all the stairs the reward is definitely worth the trouble. The views of Paris are amazing from the top, and you also get to see the decorations on the cathedral up close. Gargoyles are very cool to see from the ground, but even better from the top of the tower! Also be prepared for lots of starts and stops on your climb and descent given the diverse ages of your fellow tourist, but be patient and enjoy the experience!

Huge Que but worth the Wait. Even in January the que was nearly two hours long, open air and freezing, once you have climbed the million stone spiral steps to get to the balcony though, it is worth the wait, the views are amazing, and the gargoyle,s up close, are fantastic.

Excellent views.... Get in line by 9:15 because the line starts to get very, very long. This is a great tour and you get wonderful views over the city. Be sure to take a photo of the Eiffel Tower with a gargoyle in the foreground. The tour only takes about 30 minutes, but you need to plan for time standing in line. As stated, get here early, unless you have nothing better to do that day! Look for Quasimodo, and ask him to ring the bells for you.

Must do at least once. Although the queues can be a bit long, the wait is worth it and the climb not that hard. The winding steps remind you of the history of this incredible Cathedral and at the top the views of the area are contextual but best of all is you get an almost eye to eye view of some of the gargoyles.

Amazing views of Paris.... Right in the heart of Paris, at the ile de la cite' there is the most lovely gothic cathedral of the world. Notre Dame de Paris. I think no visit to this cathedral is complete if you don't ''climb'' up to the cathedrals towers! Simply the most gorgeous panoramic views of Paris! Unfortunately you have to wait a long queue until you can go upstairs but the view is really breathtaking! You can breath the real Air de Paris from upstairs since you have most of the old city under your feet, from quartier latin to Monmartre hill, even if the latter is a liitle far away. You cannot stay long there because of the crowd waiting to come upstairs since there is not enough space for many visitors. But don't miss it, especially on a sunny day...

Beautiful. A beautiful cathedral well worth visiting. We didnt do the tour as it was very busy (to be expected) however, even just going to see it was lovely. Its near the Love Lock Bridge too which is nice to walk to.

A amazing experience if you don't have vertigo - like nothing else in Paris!. The line was incredibly long for a very chilly damp day (it started sleet/snow by the end of the viist). But worth the wait. You will get a perspective on Paris like no other. You must be prepared for two things:1) The stairs are VERY steep, tight and winding on your way up. It was tough for some people.2) You are VERY high up when you step out on the first tower, and it was very windy when we visited. My occasional freak out on heights kicked in big time. I was happy and content to keep my back to the tower and take in the sights but I could not walk around much less make the traverse across to the other tower over open space (!) or climb up higher on the other tower. My family did and LOVED both the unique adventure and views.Another lady and I broke the rules and went down the "up" stairs even though it says not to. Sorry, but it was the only way. IF you have to do this, watch for when a next group comes up (they time them in small clusters which is why the line is so long) and then you will have a mostly clear stairway down (see my point #1 on why this is important)You can then meet your party outside of the other tower - exit is clearly marked.

nice but que was to long. A really nice church but the queue was two hours long so we gic around it. Never saw what it looked like inside. We put ridge on a boat / restaurant on the Seine instead. Very nice view.

Gargoyles galore! Fantastic. My wife and I visted the towers in March 2012. Whilst the queue was long - not too long though the wait was around 30 minutes. We killed time by my wife went to buy ice creams at the cafe across the road whilst I stayed in the queue.The gargoyles ar everywhere and are fantastic. The towers are amazing and we were in awe at how they could build such a fantastic structure.The views are great from the top. My wife does not like stairs or heights but whilst there were many stairs and at some stages you feel enclosed you also get unobstructed views of the city. My wife loved it .It is well worth the visit.Highly recommend this tour and just eat your ice cream in the queue

Love, Love, Loved the Towers. My Husband and I visited to the towers with a tour through Easy Pass Tours in August 2014. Thankgod we booked a skip the line tour because the line for the towers was horrendous. We walked straight past the line and to the front where we were allowed straight in by the guard. we headed up to the first level which had a little gift shop in it and then started climbing. If you are not into climbing numerous steps in only one direction, that being windy and up then this is definitely not something you should do. We braved it and pushed through and made it to the top. I am soo happy that we did this because the view was absolutely amazing. You could see the entire city and you can walk the whole way around the tower to see the city from every angle. They only allow a certain amount of people up at a time so don't worry it is not overly crowded like the Eiffel Tower.The towers left a lasting memory and an exciting check for your itinerary.

Be prepared to queue. The entrance is at the side of the cathedral ( rue de cloistre ) and the queue started 1 hour before the door opens ( 10am ). The first level where the gargoyles are have the best view for photography. The climb to the highest point is dizzying and vista is like what you will see at any high rise place in Paris.

Extreme Beauty. I visited Paris in June of 2012 and it was one of my favorite trips hands down. This is a must see in Paris. The beauty is almost emotional. Be prepared to stand in line for an hour or more for the tour. It's worth the wait and the view from the top is amazing.

Lots of stairs!. I went up there since there wasn't a big queue and it was free for under 26 year olds. A lot of steps, nearly 400 and i dont recommend it if you are not fit :). View was ok but i would rather go up the eiffel tower than this if i had to choose!
Pure History. If possible, take half a day to visit Notre Dame, to climb the towers, whatch closely the details. It´s history at his best.
Must see. One of my most valuable moments while in Paris is to attend a mass at the Notre Dame.Always in my heart.
Visit. We dint go inside the cathedral as we werent interested in history but we viewed the outer area and it had a huge queue there.

Do it!. We arrived to Notre Dame around 11 am, so not very early in the morning. After walking around and seeing the inside, we found the line to go up to the top of the towers. People at the entrance said that they let in 30 people every ten minutes. The line didn't seem bad at all, but it seemed that it took us about 30 minutes to get in (although we had definitely fewer than 60 people in front of us). Walking up the stairs is fun--our kids loved it. Once you get to the top, it's not just the view-it's the atmosphere up there..especially if you happen to be by the bell tower when the bells are ringing. Definitely worth the 8.50 euros for this experience.

no words - only emotions. Being in Paris, it's impossible not to visit Notre-Dame. The cathedral itself is gorgeous. Much more better than in a book or a tourist-guide. You should also go inside and see the whole beauty yourself. I like Notre-Dame Cathedral even more than Eifel Tower. It is always the first place to visit when coming to Paris.

Wonderful gargoyles! . My third trip up these towers and while it was misty and we could see many of the Parisian landmarks it's always awesome to see the gargoyles so close up. The steps are challenging but just take your time they are not unmanageable and come in sections so time to rest in between. One thing I was shocked about was the lack of control of people going up and down the steps on the top and final tower. Usually they have staff to allow people up and down in turns to avoid two people meeting in the stairs which are very narrow and almost impossible to pass on. We were coming down when people were coming up and it was really dangerous as we had to pass on the inside (on the narrowest part of the staircase) meaning the steps were impossibly small and with wet and slippery marble also very dangerous. One slip would've meant a fall collecting all the people on the way down. Really poorly managed today - it was like a staff member had just disappeared off their duty??? Also the French security services have obviously increased security at the religious sites in Paris and there were heavily armed soldiers around the cathedral that I have not seen on previous (and recent) visits. This was also keeping the amount of beggars and annoyances down which was excellent. We saw none of the people asking for signatures on petitions that others were complaining about but if you do see them obviously walk on and don't engage at all - they are set ups for pick pockets and petty thefts.

Towers with a view. Stunning views of Paris from the towers... see the whole of the city with the gargoyles for company! Be warned though as it is a good climb up a spiral staircase. We love it & it's an especially romantic place to us, sure it could be to others.

Magnificent French Gothic Architecture. This was one of the many structures that I have always dreamed of seeing. I was always a fan of Victor Hugo's The Hunchback of Notre-Dame. After having seen it in person, I wanted to watch the whole movie again and compare the stained glass windows and the gargoyles perched on top of the towers from the actual. There was a long queue and I disliked the fact that you have to pay in order to go up the tower in order to see the breath-taking views of central Paris and the River Seine. We remained outside and watched as the huge Christmas tree was being set-up in front of the Cathedral in time for Christmas. So if you are keen to jump the line and fit enough to climb the steps (over 300 each) of the 2 towers, I suggest you join a tour. Notre-Dame is not just about the towers but also the stained glass windows, 10 ringing bells and the 13th century organ.

Beautiful architecture. The cathedral is well designed and built beautifully. Again it was now time and one can find its history inside the cathedral...I really love the architecture. Easily access to metro station and trains tickets are quite cheap.

Great Medieval Architecture. One of the must-see attractions in Paris. Right on the river and just a purely imposing structure. When it is sunny you can see the beautiful stained glass windows. However when you are outside watch out for the gypsies. They try to get you to sign some forms just walk by them and be sure you hold on tightly to your valuables.

Great view. After waiting quite a long time in a line you will climb up by the narrow windy staircase, just like in the movies. Then you will see the hudge bell Emmanuell about 15 tones and the amazing carpenter work of the roof top of the cathedral. Than onec on the top you can admire from very close the Gargoyles ( most of them are fake from the 19th cet restauration) but still very impressive. The view of the roof and the island around is srtunning. You will see the square in front of the cathedral like the caracters from numerous movies about it.
Beautiful. A must visit if you are in Paris! Stunning! I wish I was allowed to take pictures from the inside of the building. simply a beautiful building

A Must Do. Why would you not? This is another must do while visiting Paris. Besides the wonderful gargoyles, the views of Paris are amazing from here due to the cathedral's central location. Be aware that there is a very narrow spiral staircase of approx. 400 steps to reach the top that might not be suitable for everyone, but if you do it you will be happy you did. We visited the beginning of December and we only had a very short line to wait. They take small groups at a time for staircase management which lends for a longer wait time.

No tower tour but enjoyed the scene in the square. We missed the tower tour. The signage and directions were difficult. We walked around the block twice before finding the sign indicating the towers were closed for the day. But we happily stumbled upon a fun evening scene and ended up coming back a second night. In the evenings it seems there's a bit of a street performer scene... fire dancers, extreme rollerbladers, street artists, vendors, and the neat guys who pose as statues... A good family friendly feel (tho we did keep aware of possible pickpockets as we were advised). (mother visiting with boys 11 & 14)
Worth to visit!. It is such a cool place to visit. I have spent couple of hours there and bought some old postcards from stores which are located in the corner.
FEEL THE REAL THİNG. Again once more Paris Attraction dont miss it and go there and climb up those STEPS. Really nice , somekind of different feeling . You have to see it to believe . Dont misss.

This might not be a good idea.... Let me rephrase that - this is not easy, and it is not a good idea for everyone to try to climb the Towers of Notre Dame. Instead, you should listen to my advice, get out of line, and go do something much more enjoyable with your time in Paris. You can always buy postcards with terrific pictures of those gargoyles and the view. This is one Paris experience that is not all it's cracked up to be, unless you are in very good shape and possibly related to Quasimodo...Several times a week, I walk by the line of people waiting to ascend the narrow, winding medieval stone staircase. Many of them have no idea what waits ahead - parents with very small children that will have to be carried up those 387 steps, people who have mobility issues, people with other health issues - and all of these patient people will have a great deal of difficulty managing the climb. Some people - the young, the mountain-climbers, the fortunate few - will be fine, though I never see many of them in line. They're probably off in the Himalayas, or someplace...The line is very long, and so is the wait - because only a certain number of people are allowed inside at any given time. Many stay a long time - taking selfies with the gargoyles and each other, some people need a lot of time to catch their breath, some actually enjoy the view - but all of them must descend before anyone waiting in line can go up. Some people even climb up into the bell tower - not advisable unless you really relish the idea of walking across a thin plank with only piles of pigeon guano to cushion a possible fall. Anyway, you have to wait till all these people decide to come down to Earth, too.What goes up must come down, and a similar set of 387 winding, medieval stone steps is waiting for you on the other side. It's not any easier, going down - especially if you have joint problems which have been aggravated on the upward climb, or have to carry a child who has simply had too much fun for one day...or not.I first climbed the Towers of Notre Dame when I was 40 years old and there was nobody in line. Even though I'm in much better shape, some 20-odd years later, and went up with a friend in September this year, I wouldn't attempt it again. Life is too short, Paris has much more to offer, and all of that can best be experienced without gasping for breath and limping for a week, afterwards.As I mentioned, you can buy photos, postcards, placemats, even statues of the gargoyles - all of which will look better than the photos most people take. There is a display of 3 beautiful bells in the rear garden, so you don't have to risk your life playing Quasimodo. Save your money, save a whole lot of time - go wandering the medieval streets around Notre Dame, instead of going horizontal. You'll have more fun, and when you're lots older, your knees will thank you.
interesting. There is always a very long line to go inside. It is worth waiting if you are patient. The location is also very good and convenient.
50th Birthday. I enjoyed everything there was not anything I disliked such a beautiful place sat out side the cafe's in the glorious sunshine

Not worth the wait. Long lengthy wait to get up. You get to right up the top of the right hand tower, though you won't see the bell or internal part of the tower as it is shut. The view is obviously very good, however, if you have already been up the Arc de Triumphe and/or Eiffel, don't bother. This view is then nothing new, and wasn't worth the line up to see it. But if you've had no other birds-eye view of Paris yet, then you'll enjoy it.

Beautiful and Historic Site. Despite the absence of a hunchback, it was still a wonderful historic site to visit and behold. The audio guide helps add depth to the experience but you don't need it. Feel free to simply walk and admire the architecture, artifacts and atmosphere. Oh and don't forget to go up to appreciate the view.

Tough climb but the view is worth it. I have a bit of trouble with vertigo so climbing the stairs was tough, going round and round and round but the view was totally worth feeling a bit dizzy. I love the gargoyle's.
church. I do like the structure of church, the surrounding, the ambiance inside. what I did not like was the long queue.
Great views but overcrowded. It's understandable but the sheer number of people allowed into the limited space can't help spoil the experience.
Not worth it!. Long queues to go up. Felt herded at the top and stuck in a queue to come back down. Views not worth the bother. Church itself was very nice.

Great place but... . It is a must see destination for anyone visiting Paris but unfortunately the staff let it down.Outside it is amazing to see the architecture of the building and inside it is just something you must see with the stain glass windows and the sheer size of it! At the end you get a chance to pay ?2 for a gold coin (various designs) but any tourist who has exchanged money knows you only have notes! I asked politely in the little French I knew for some change after waiting in a queue for 10mins and all the lady did was shake her head and look away! Very rude especially as she must come in contact with a lot of tourists every day! Really let's the place down. Needless to say we left without a gold coin and spent nothing in the shop put of principle much like other tourists!

Worth the Climb. Although I didn't think I would make it up the endless winding stairs, it was worth the climb! The views are breathtaking. You can see the whole city! I felt like I was in the clouds. You can get great pictures of the gargoyles and panoramic pictures of the city. Worth standing in line
No wait in November. We only had a 15 minute wait and loved the view. I'd say if you don't like long lines, don't visit in summer or peak season.
not worth the climb. This was not worth the wait and the super hard climb up. The view is good, but it ia quite caged in.
Do not miss this cathedral!. Beautiful inside & out. The rose windows are gorgeous. Love the architecture. In warm weather the grounds are lovely & even now in November still lovely.

well worth the trip. The views are incredible There are so many different ways to see Paris. Like the Eiffle Tower Looking out at Paris at night is a wonderful experience. and you need to do it from both locations

Fantastic. This place is a must, the views at the top are wonderful. The art work on the outside is as good as the art on the inside, the Gargoyles up close are fantastic. its a tight fit and very narrow if you have not got a great head for heights then keep away. The steps are steep and we were told there is about 400 and a spiral staircase. so be prepared for a climb, and sometimes slow. it is a must.
Best view of paris. A visit to the gargoyles of Notre dame is a must do! The view you get is way better than the one from tour Eiffel and sacre coer :) Worth a visit!!

Must do in Paris. If you are in Paris, you have to see the world famous Notre-DameThe entry is free. Light a small candle is 2 EURO, light a bigger candle is 5 EURO. Go up to the Towers also has extra costs, they changing by season, last we paid 15 EURO per person. You can take pictures inside but you cannot use the flash light. All in all honesty, there is enough light inside so with a good set up on your camera, you are fine without the flashlightNo hats, food, pets, drinks etc. They also don't really like if you duck to take pictures. This building is absolutely gorgeous

See the gargoyles up close. The entrance to this is on the left side of the cathedral and I think was about 8 euros each and they asked for exact change. It was great to see the gargoyles up close and views of the city. It is about 400 steps, spiral stair case and no lift. We had to wait about an hour to get in and they only allow about 20 people at a time up the towers about every 10, 20 minutes. Worth doing if you have the time.

Oh wow.. It's something, climbing those stairs & walking the towers in who-knows-what kind of weather. It's something, waiting in line, meeting travelers from all over the world. It's something, hearing the high-thrown notes of choirs echo the walls were saints are laid to rest.I look at pictures, taken over time, of Paris...always with the cathedral somewhere in the frame. Bring it home and go yourself.

Wonderful Place. The history and architecture are astounding. Every visitor to Paris should tour this Cathedral. We went on a bright, sunny day in November, and the crowd was not too large. Just a perfect afternoon.

Good views of the City. You get a 360 degree view of the City and close up views of the gargoyles, roof and flying buttresses. Need to be in fairly good shape because the only way up is by climbing the 300+ stairs up and down.

Bring a Lock .... It was fantastic cathedral and I was so amased with all beauties and arts inside.
One thing that I have to recommend all couples ... don't forget to bring a lock ... otherwise you feel something is missing on the bridge nearby Cathedreal.

Great architecture and history. When visiting Notre Dame Cathedral, beside the impressive architecture with the sculptures, paintings, artistic windows, etc., the towers are a great feature on their own as well. As there was no lift and the stairs were too much for our child especially after climbing the spiral staircase of the Arc de Triomphe the day before, we did not climb or enjoy the view from above this time. In the past I climbed it by myself and found the view fabulous. When our child grows up, hope we will be able to climb it again. It is one of the top sightseeings in Paris.
Que for a while but worth it. The que can be quite long and the climb difficult for some but you get to seethe great architecture and those gargoyles up close.

marvellous view from the top... When you visit Notre Dame you must visit the Towers too.You should be there at least 45 min. before the entrance closes,at around 4 o'clock.You have to pay a ticket (about 10 euros) and climb up 387 steps as there is no lift. But when you finally reach the top you will see the wonderful view and feel part of the story ''The hunchback of Notre Dame''!!Don't try to find Quasimodo or Esmeralda..they are well hidden..

Worth every moment of waiting in the Q !! Magnificent !!. Please don't get scared of the long Queue...Its absolutely worth it...the spiral staircase is never ending and not for people who may feel claustrophobic...but once u reach the top..the view of the city is breathtaking..i fell in love with the Architecture of the building...the Gargoyles...the statues...the pillars..everything is amazing...Definitely worth the effort of waiting in the long queue and the steep n narrow spiral stairs !!

Dont miss this. You really should see this place. Even though there is a long queue and a long waiting time but its worth waiting.YOu certainly will enjoy the view and the atomsphere. Its on a small island kind of in the river sin and really really beautiful. Your Paris visit is not complete without it.

Clearly, a Worthwhile Attraction. Be warned that there are long lines and many stairs to the top, but the views are certainly worthwhile. We are in Paris during what is considered to be the off-season, and the lines of tourists are still considerable.The attendants do their best to move people along--there can be something of a bottleneck of people all trying to take pictures of the same things and of one another--so be patient (and, if you're one of those people, try to be thoughtful of the others behind you). The view of the entire city is quite wonderful. Among many other things, you will see Sacre Coeur in the distance, ensuring that you will want to take the trek to Montmartre!
Well worth the climb!. Lots of stairs but you get up close and personal with the gargoyles at the top with great views of Paris

Oh but the view at the top!. Get there early because there is a long line to get in.There are no lifts for tourists. The stairs are winding which makes for a difficult climb (which come in two stages)and descent. Oh but the view at the top!

Crowded, but well worth the crowds.. The cathedral itself was free to enter and you walk around the inside perimeter and can see the stain glass, the interior architecture, and the statues and crypts. Very old and beautiful. You can then sit in the worship area and rest or meditate before heading back outside. To get to the tower/roof, you have to go outside and around the corner and there is a line to go up, but never made it on this crowded and raining October day.

Gargoyles!. If you're in Paris, climb the towers of Notre-Dame! The views of the city are gorgeous and it's such a cool experience to see the famous gargoyles. Make sure you have a large memory card because you'll be snapping away! While I recommend this to everyone, those that are claustrophobic might feel a bit uneasy as the stairs and some walkways are pretty tight (and everyone walks up single-file, so there isn't really room to "pullover" if you need a rest). Tips: arrive early because the queues are HUGE! If you need to use the restroom, those located outside ND (down the stairs) are free. There are con artists that will tell you that you need to pay (and they even have a crummy handwritten sign they use to block the turnstile) ~ just walk past and go in. The turnstiles have no coin slots and there is clearly marked signage that these WC's are free.

Excellent view from the top!. Toured the Cathedral at opening and then went straight to the line for the Towers. It was a very rainy day but many people were in line to get in. We did not wait long. There are many stairs which are very narrow but the view from the top makes it well worth it! Even on a cold and foggy day, it was amazing. Would highly recommend to others.

Stunning!. If you're in Paris, you should take your time and visit the Notre Dame de Paris. From the outside as well as inside a masterpiece, very nice. You can also go up to the top. I love the gargoyles.

Incredible piece of architecture. We visited as part of a long weekend in Paris.The building itself is stunning, inside and out, and you don't have to be a believer to appreciate this incredible structure. Try not to rush round snapping random photos of nothing in particular. Pay attention to the small details - of which there are many - as you're strolling round.We were lucky enough to visit on a beautiful sunny day which really made the colours of the magnificent stained glass pop.Get there early, especially if you wish to go up top. Unfortunately for us we didn't and it was packed! Needless to say, we gave it a miss

Must to see!. When u're in Cathedral inside u just have to go up to the towers. Beautiful view and all sculptures. Dont give up if u see a huge line. Wait cuz its worth it or come back during the week when is less people than at weekend.
Gorgeous. Really nice visit, although the queues were long that cannot be helped when waiting to see a famous sight, although it was great to be able o climb right to the top.
a good visit. excellent display of gothic architecture. i visited in the late evening and it felt quiet and eerie. nevertheless, the place is a significant visit in paris.

Well worth the wait!. We would definitely give this experience 5 stars, even though the wait in the queue was lengthy. (...and we were some of the first to arrive in the morning - expect an 'ish' kind of opening time! The information said a 10am opening, in reality this was more like 10.30am). However - it was worth the wait! The views across Paris were breathtaking. And the gargoyles - wow! There are time restrictions that are loosely in place - you will be moved on from various areas mainly because the next group have been let in and will be climbing the steps of the Towers. However, we seemed to stay for longer than most and no-one bothered us. We are keen photographers, so the gargoyles coupled with the views meant we took our time.Thoroughly enjoyable. Not an experience to miss. We climbed the Eiffel Tower steps the day before…but would still recommend the Notre Dame Towers in addition to this - if you love views, photography, art and Paris….do both! (Note - Queue for the Towers of Notre-Dame are around the side, opposite the cafe, not the main queue in the square. Old, uneven spiral steps to climb. Not difficult, but good to be aware of this if you have mobility difficulties. Also - your first stop is the ticket desk and shop area - if you want to purchase something, do it straight away as you don't return to the shop area before you leave.)
a disappointment. the story is in the history and in the architecture. there is no reason to waste time going inside. try to avoid the many gypsies outside.

History, art and a great view all in one place. Europe is full of history and this is a great place to start. The awe and wonder of this is incredible. The fact it was built a few hundred years ago, the art that is in it and the spirituality of it is second to none. Then to walk up the steps to the top and see the view of the city, the grounds and the area is an added bonus. Cross another off my bucket list!
Beautiful cathedral. It's historical value and the details in the build are awesome. Good place to go with boy/girlfriend, family and friends.
massive queue to get into the towers. go in the afternoon - it closes at 4, I think last lift is around 3,30. good views from the top, but Eiffel tower is best, if you have to choose

Always impactful. One of those places where you can't help but feel your connection to generations of human history. Humbling to imagine the labor that created it. I found the audio tour very informative.

The best way to see Paris. I loved this! Going inside the tower and out onto the roof felt like an adventure back in time. The detailing on the building is beautiful as is the 360 degree view. Really cold up there this time of year but worth it - take a scarf & gloves, but look out for the rust on the handrails in the staircases. I was only in Paris for 4 days & I'm so glad this is one of the things I chose to do.

Go to the top!. It is surreal to get to the balcony and come face to face with the gargoyles that you have seen in movies and in books before. They are well preserved and the views are great as well. We went up to the 2nd balcony which was fun as well but not necessary as the view is the same and just makes more stairs to come down! Definitely worth the wait in line.
Spectacular views. If you go to the top the views are amazing. You can see all the way to the Sacre Coeur. Arrive early
Closed. We were disappointed that the towers were closed due to refurbishing. I had read how amazing the views were from the tower so we were really disappointed that it was not open.
Like a story book. Nice place to get some beautiful pictures out the beautiful cathedral...also take a walk on the river bank...
Must see. A must see stop with so much history and beauty inside. Simply stunning. The architecture is amazing.

Nice to see. Big, authentic and nice!
Fun for kids that know the cartoon.
Supposed to be very nice inside. But i didn't go inside.

worth the climb. Notre Dame. Just saying it conjours up romance, mystery, and excitement. The cathedral itself is quite beautiful. The stone outsides and the beautiful stained glass inside. It is a sacred place. Go outside and wait in the line to climb the towers. We waited about an hour, and got to the line about 1 1/2 hours after it opened up. The climb is not difficult, but it is a lot of small, narrow stairs. You go up one set, and down another set, so thankfully there aren't people trying to go both ways on the same staircase. Once you get to the top, the view is beautiful! We had a very clear day, and the view was amazing. And the gargoyles! To be eye-to-eye with the gargoyles is an experience I will never forget. The bells started to ring for Mass while we were up there....it is very jarring! Very noisy, and if you hold onto the stone, you actually feel the vibration. The bells are on the same level as you are, so be prepared! There is a walkway all around the front of Notre Dame. At the bridge between the two towers you can turn around and see the back of the cathedral, equally impressive, and a view of statues, etc, that can't be seen from down on the ground. There is no timing, other than waiting on the line. Once you're up top, you can stay as long as you'd like, but it does get crowded up there. That is why the line is so long a wait; they only let 20 people up at one time, so the line lurches. But it was worth it~!

Good views - long wait!. Loved the views and the spiral staircase up to the top. There are no lifts or toilet facilities so once you start theres no going back. It was lovely and sunny the day we visited so the views were fantastic. Large crowds meant a 2 hour wait to get up. It was pretty crowded up there as they can only allow so many people at a time as it is narrow in parts.
Liked it. I have been to Paris about 5 times now and I always like the look of this building. Its different and have got a great history.

AWESOME view of Paris. Be sure to get a guided tour. Go very early in am. Avoid crowds. See if you can find tour guide that does small groups and has access to letting you get in prior to those in line

Gothic beauty. The line was not so long, and certainly worth the wait. The exterior is so detailed that there is much to see as you move forward toward the doors. Inside, even on a cloudy October day, the beauty of the windows is magnificent. On the Sunday morning of our visit there was a service in progress; a reminder that this isn't a museum but a true place of worship. In addition to the art of the interior, and the incredible architecture, a pictorial exhibit shows stages of construction from the mid-1100's until completion in the mid-1800's. Yes, centuries and generations of craftsmen were the cost of this unique cathedral. Please, stop and look, light a candle, say a prayer if that is your way, and recognize and appreciate that this is something more special than any one person can imagine!
Climb to the top. Well worth climbing to the top but watch the handrail. it is dirty! Aside from this a great experience
Good. After visiting the Cathedral take the climb through these structures and see this great city from the center and bask in their great vistas.

Pretty cool, found it by accident. I was wondering around my first night, jet-lag and all, and ended up at the cathedral. It is quite a sight to see. Also there are at least 2 bridges with the locks on them, and I crossed one to get to the cathedral.
Nice cathedral. It's a great place to hang out by the river and people watch. Shopping is pricey in the area, but there is a creme brulee cafe right off the subway exit that's worth it.

A Must Do. It's been my dream to climb the steps of the tower for several years and I finally had enough time to do it this year. It was absolutely wonderful being "up close and personal" to the gargoyles. It was clear enough to see Sacré Cœur which is gorgeous. The view is worth every step!!

climb to heaven. it's like 400 steps but once you get there you won't regret it.The view it's simply spectacular
from an area different than the Eiffel Tower and The Arc of Triumph or sacred cur .
wonderful views and the gargoyles the river will definitely make an impression on you.
Great!. Great history and architecture, lovely old building. The towers are a bit extra $$ to climb to the top and usually aline-up but overall it is a must do!

Must see in Paris. Such a wonderful architecture with a very calm and majestic feel.
Good to bring your family to visit this cathedral. Was there on Christmas eve and it was a truly a place to be for that occasion.
We finally did it. We dedicated 2-3 hours to wait in line but the experience was worth it. Not a bad climb up, views are spectacular and it was a treat to see the gargoyles close up.
Beautiful masterpiece. The vista from the top is well worth the 400+ steps to get there. The gargoyles are exquisite. It is amazing to think that this exceptional cathedral is 850 years old.

Gargoyles Galore and Iconic Views of Paris. You've seen the pictures before: a stone gargoyle sitting with his hands under his chin, pensively looking out over the city of Paris. If you take the Tower tour, you can enjoy his view and that of his numerous stone brethren who adorn and guard the two bell towers of Notre Dame Cathedral.The line will be long at this popular attraction, so I recommend going first thing in the morning on one of your sightseeing days (though I hear the evening sunset is particularly stunning from this vantage if you can work out the timing just right). Check the website for hours as they differ on some days. Despite the seemingly interminable line, my husband and I counted this attraction as one of our favorites in Paris. There are no elevators (of course), so be prepared to climb up (and eventually down) steep, winding stone stairs. Once at the top, you and the rest of the tourists who are let up in groups of a certain number will be free to walk and take pictures of the gargoyles and views. It is crowded up there, but people seem to behave congenially and take pictures for one another. You don't feel too rushed, but the ushers will keep you moving along at a steady pace, so that other visitors can take your place once you leave.
