If "seeing more" interests you; it's worth climbing many stories of steep old steps to see the bell towers -and- look out to see Paris from the bell towers. Personally, I thought it was very cool and for me it was worth it, after seeing Notre Dame from the ground many times. You get to see the gargoyles up close; and you get to climb up to pretty much the very top of the cathedral! However, at certain times of year, the line for this tower tour may be very long; be sure you have a good estimate of how long the wait will be, before you start. If you get to ND early in the morning and the line is short: highly recommended.
So cool. We went for Christmas Mass. It was beautiful and so worth it. The line was fast and an experience well worth the effort.

Not for the weak.. I wasn't sure I would make it up those stairs, but was it worth the trip. The views and photo ops can't be beat. My advice don't try to do his and the Arc de Triumphe in the same day!

Cathedral experience like no other.. Free entrance! However if you want to check out the cathedral's special collection of jewels, you pay EUR3 per adult (I think it is worth it and since you're here, what's another EUR3?, more info below:The cathedral’s Treasury is located in the sacristy and presents liturgical objects, mainly made of gold. The Treasury of Notre-Dame de Paris exhibits objects from the 17th and 18th centuries and testifies to 19th century workmanship as seen in the painstakingly created gold liturgical objects, architecture, furniture and neo-gothic decoration. For more information, visit this page. Open Monday to Friday from 9:30 am to 6:00 pm; Saturday from 9:30 am to 6:30 pm; Sunday from 1:30 pm to 6:30 pm Full price : €3. Reduced rate (under 26 years old, the unemployed, etc.) : €2. Children aged 6 to 12: €1.http://www.notredamedeparis.fr/spip.php?article478I find the souvenirs sold in the cathedral are of superior quality and does not feel like some cheap knockoffs you so frequently encounter everywhere. Like their EUR2 "850 years" gold coin and their magnet (EUR7) and other ornaments (between EUR12-EUR20).
We were able to enter and walk the side halls of the cathedral. We lit candles for our deceased relatives while a mass was getting started. Very touching experience for us.

The Norte-Dame...wow. Breathtaking, until you see it for yourself....no picture will be able to do justice to it. The details in the structure is unbelievable. You will easily take over 100 pictures before you it. Great for the entire family.

View is worth effort. How do you beat the views of Paris from the Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral? It is hard to but remember they offer a limited view because of the safety caging to keep you from falling or jumping I guess. The be able to get up close to the gargoyles and get some unbelievable photographs makes the climb up the tiny winding stairs worth the trip. So if you are of faint heart because of heights or in bad physical shape this might not be the site for you. However, if you can keep on climbing the stairs and have no worries about people complaining if you take awhile go on go it is worth the stops to catch your breath and let people pass you. Enjoy the view and take the great photos that only come with a little effort not everyone takes.
Traditional Cathedral. There, one can feel how was to be in Europe centuries ago.Must-go attraction once in Paris.Highly recommended.

Great views and gargoyles. Located on the left side as you face the cathedral, this has to be one of the mist popular places in Paris. But be aware in tourist season, there will be long lines to get in. They want exact change and the climb up the small circular steps is not for anyone truly out if shape. But the gargoyles alone are worth it!

gargoyles. It's worth the wait in line just to be beside the gargoyles and look at the view of Paris. For the 800th anniversary of Notre Dame, they are forging new bells. The old bells are out of tune, and of course two of them are missing---stolen during the French Revolution.
Best view of Paris. Try to be up at sunset. You'll get the best view of the beautiful left bank. And when the city starts to be lightened, it gets wonderful...
Ornate. Really brilliant in design and they were being cleaned and repaired when I was visiting but still enjoyed them. Such an old church and towers like nothing you will ever see.

Lots of fun!. These are beautiful towers. The tour is well run and although I considered it a little on the expensive side, I was glad that i did it. Also the walk up the stairs is a little long/steep so not easy for someone with walking problems. View from the top was amazing!

Notre Dame. It is a beautiful church, wonderful art work and scuptures, both inside and out. There was Confirmation of young people, on the day that we were there, so we even got to see the Bishop of Paris, and the church lit up. There is a lot to see at the back of the altar area, including a miniature model of the church.

Best Views in Paris. You really can't beat the views, and pictures, capturing gargoyles contemplating the beauty of Paris. Get there a half hour before opening time in the morning and you may be the first in line. It is a fair amount of stairs, and yes, they are narrow and winding, but not as bad as some reviewers are making them, and Grand Canyon wide compared to spots in Siena and Rome, if not elsewhere in Italy. The views from the Towers were one of the highlights, if not the highlight, of our trip to Paris. Highly recommend.

Great viewing spot over Paris!!. Climbing over 400 stairs above street level provides an awesome view over the city of Paris and is worth the extra effort to get there. Not to be missed are the multiple gargoyles that stand guard on the towers. Lots of great photo opportunities!
Splendind. There are seats opposite the tower. You could sit on them and enjoy the beauty in the towers. Sad I could not read Victor Hugo before my visit.
Marvellous. Its one of the beautiful landmarks of the city...And at night the Look is different and even more beautiful...Had a memorable day in PAris :-)

Go up. A small waiting of some 10min and after paying the entry fee of 5.50 Euros on the northern part of the Cathedral you are allowed to go up the hundreds of stairs to the top of the Cathedral with it's wonderful views up to La Defence, Eiffer Tower and Sacre Coeur

A long way up but worth it. Not the fittest of people but having climbed up all the narrow stairs the view at the top was breathtaking. The building's architecture is so beautiful and having been a town planner in the south of England I wish that my location had been in Paris. Imagine getting paid to look at a building like NOtre Dame.

amazing architecture. beautiful beautiful beautiful... we walk from round to round and corner to corner, the detail just amazing... best time to visit in morning or late afternoon when not so much crowd and you will get beutiful photo of this amazing architecture

Nice place to be. Nice place to visit. very easy to reach there. It is in middle of the city. I'd like to be there with the Sun set. you can take nice photograph out side the cathedral with flash lights but you cant use flashers inside the cathedral. because of the heavy crowd during the week ends, you may find some difficulties to enter to the building. You can reach there on foot and by various public transport. plenty of restaurant also available near by including Chinese cuisine.
Amazing. What can i say more then people have not said about it. I had visited it earlier but with the right company it feels different. It appeared somehow more cleaner then last time.

Absolutely Fabulous!!!i. This was the number one attraction for me in Paris. You get to wait on line for hours (unless you get there at 9am like we did), and then climb 400 steps in a very narrow medieval spiral staircase. My girlfriend was very tolerant! When you get to the top, you get (1).A fabulous view of Paris, and (2) a chance to study the wonderful gargoyles at very close range. In fact, the first one you see is the most famous, the Stryge (Vampire). These gargoyles are trememdously interesting. They were created by the restorer, architect Violet le Duc, from about 1840-1860. They were inspired by the impact of Hugo's Hunchback of Notre Dame (1831) -- except that in 1831, they were no gargoyles. They had all fallen off or been taken off to prevent them from falling. There is an absolutely fascinating book by Michael Camille called The Gargoyles of Notre Dame: The Monsters of Modernity. I realize not everyone has the time to read a book about just one sight in Paris. But if you did read the book,you would never regret it. And you would appreciate visiting the towers been more. An absolutely wonderful experience. We'll worth the wait and the climb. And there is a good patisserie right across from the line, so you won't suffer from malnutrition.
great climb great view!. Be prepared for a lot of steps but the view is fantastic and the gargoyles are enchanting! Kids loved it.
A moment of prayer in an amazing building. What a building! Beautiful painted breathtaking windows. A place of history. Stayed for ages, took photographs to treasure.

franksgogetter. This is an excellent place to see in person its nothing like seeing in a book or on TV if you go to Paris go see the Notre-Dame you will love it. take your time look it all over one thing you must do is get in line for tower early or you well be line for long time about one hour wait. the view is great all of Paris. if you like you my light a candle for love ones, went to mass it was just beautiful.

Beautiful view from the Towers!. Notre Dame de Paris in French stands for "Our Lady of Paris". It is a historic Catholic cathedral on the eastern half of the Île de la Cité in the 4th arrondissement of Paris. Construction of cathedral began in the 12th century. It’s one of the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world; one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture. It’s a designated world heritage site by UNESCO.Lines to Notre Dame are huge, but they also move pretty quickly. Entrance to the Cathedral itself is free. We paid 3 or 3.50 Euro each to see the Treasury of Notre Dame, which is inside of the Cathedral.Cathedral is beautiful inside and out. I prefer view of the cathedral from the banks of river Seine, not the Tower view that usually put on post cards. Beautiful gardens surround the cathedral. Don’t miss climb to the Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. If you are facing cathedral with Towers in front of you, the line to the Towers will be to your left. This line is huge and much slower moving. They allow only 20 people to enter every 10 minutes. There is entrance fee: 8.50 Euro. It took us about 1.5 hours to get to ticket office (2nd floor). Stairs to the top are very narrow, 350 steps, spiral staircase (no lift), but view is definitely worth it. At first you will go to the outer gallery between Towers. Gargoyles and chimeras will surround you. Take another spiral staircase to the upper gallery. The gallery will provide magnificent views of Paris, the Seine, the bridges across the river, Eiffel Tower, etc. Beautiful! Highly recommend.

Notre-Dame Cathedral lovely, outside not.. Did not like the huge construction in front of Notre Dame, much preferred the way it was, plenty of room to move around and take photos, not the way it is now, like a huge viewing platform.

When those bells toll, you will understand the power of the church.... Unforgettable experience. Well worth the climb. Very narrow staircase though, if you are overweight please don't risk it - you might become wedged (no kidding!).

Stunning!. Everything about this is beautiful. We lit a candle for our lost loved ones and toured the church. There was no line the day we went and a very small crowd. There are lots of paintings and sculptures. The stained glass windows were exceptionally beautiful.

Breathtaking views. One hour wait in line was completely worth it with breathtaking views of Paris! My advice is to come before 10 AM (opening time) since they allow only 20 people to enter every 10 minutes. Also, Paris Museum Pass does not guarantee special access to tower. Standing in line is still required.

What can you possibly say.... Just don't choose to pass up a visit to Notre Dame. There was staging set up outside in the spring. I believe that they were making a new exhibit. Once inside, it's nearly impossible to leave. There is so much to look at, and there are such interesting people. Do your research and know ahead of time what you will be seeing when you enter, because you really need to understand everything there. I can't even begin to list everything, but I hadn't been there for 40 years, and I had forgotten so much that I was sorry that I hadn't done my research.It was very difficult to leave. Allow plenty of time to wander. You will not be sorry.

Very good. I have been to the church of Notre dame I got shock the way they maintain the chuch. I have a much time I will love to spend it there, I wish we do have such a beautifully pllaces in our country

Very beautiful and moving. Joined in mass celebration and received communion. Very beautiful but not as beautiful as some other cathedrals in France and Germany. But well worth a visit. Hold on to your wallet and purse near Cathedral.

The bells of Notre-Dame are spectcular!. Having read about them and seen them in movies, you cannot really appreciate the sound of the bells of Notre-Dame until you sit down in front of the cathedral and wait for them to chime. It really is a must on any trip to Paris.

All the way to the top!. If you are visiting the Notre Dame, it is definitely worth all the stairs to see the view from the top. Myself and my partner actually got to enjoy this experience free of charge due to being under 25, which is a common benefit in Paris. The first level was far more impressive than the very top we felt, but if you're going to do it you have to go all the way to the top.The stairs close at 5pm, so you cannot see the view of the night. So we found it best to get there at 10am when it was opening and beat the crowd, and get to listen to the bells being played whilst up there.

Long queue. It pays off to wait even an hour to take a ride up the towers. You will be able up-close the gargoyles and see the entire architecture of the cathedral. You will find here one of the best places to take photographs of the landscape from Paris' center.Be aware of pickpockets as this place and almost all the best things to visit in Paris are full of people wanting to rip you off
Amazing view. Free as an EU traveller, and an incredible view. Walking up those winding staircases adds to the gothic feel of the place.
breathtaking views. Expect to wait in line and a spiral, narrow staircase walk up to the most amazing views of Paris from the top of the towers. It's absolutely worth it. Just go on a clear day
Magnificent work of Art... Very memorable and sacred place to go to and not to miss when visiting Paris. 850 years anniversary this year!! Amazing!

Magnificent Architecture.. We were very humbled by our visit to Notre-Dame. So much history in this beautiful Cathedral. Found the audioguides very helpful. Perfect location to continue on to Left Bank and neighboring areas.

Its is on the island. I didn't know much about where exactly is Notre Dame until now.It's easier if I describe like this ,Paris city is divided in two by the River Seine,this river itself got split in 2 rivers by islands in the middle, on one of this island locates the most beautiful Towers of Notre-Dame,you can not miss it because all are in the middle of Paris.

Amazing. The climb to the top of the towers is worth the wait in line. My wife and I got there somewhat early and waited about an hour to go up. There are some cafe's across the street to grab a bottle of water or a snack while waiting. The views from the top are worth every step up and down. You can see the entire city from a unique perspective. It is hard to believe that the building is over 800 years old.

inspiring. Plenty to do and to see in Paris and I would suggest you try pensil this one in if at all possible. You can almost picture yourself in the 18th century visiting this place for worship and marvelling at all its intrigate artwork and sculpters.Outstanding

Great views inside and on top of the Cathedral but beware!. Be aware that the tour up the Cathedral is staggered with 20 people allowed in every 10 mins so when you join the queue have a look where you are especially if you have children. Worth the wait as the views are amazing but I agree with previous reviews that the visit inside the Cathedral which is free and usually involves no queuing is the highlight of the visit. Enjoy the 400 step climb!

Notre-Dame Cathedral. I visited Paris in April of 2013. The Towers of Norte-Dame are beautiful, and the area around Notre-Dame was very crowded. We stood in line for almost an hour just to get inside the building, but it was well worth the wait. The beautiful paintings and statues were beautiful.

what is the use of climbing this anyway as the most interesting is inside?. Tourists are addicted on climbing things to see them from upstairs. Of course this is interesting to give people a different angle but even so, what is the use of spending hours on a line, sometimes under the rain to climb this a take pictures? Go inside the church, it is FOR FREE and you can learn about almost 1000 years of christian culture.
Beautiful Cathedral. If possible, try to attend the noon mass any day. Services will be in French and Latin. The accoutics is marvelous.
OK, was tired of cathedrals. Was tired of cathedrals at this point so I give it an average score, am also not really religious but can see how it is attractive to those who are.

Worth The Trip. Beautiful and well worth the trip. Give yourself plenty of time to enjoy the beauty. Lines are usually long. We hired a guide which allows immediate access and informative information of the "must see" places in the Cathedral. The Cathedral is often busy with several altars being used and offers a shop for religious items.
Magnificent - can't miss!. A must see for your heart and soul! Fortunate to be there during a Mass, very moving. Amazing architecture! No charge to enter.
must-see. anyone who goes to Paris must see the Notre-Dame Cathedral .. its Gothic architecture and being in the tower exhilarating experience and the view from there is like being quasimodo

Nice Spot for Pictures. This is a very old cathedral with a lot of architectural charm. It is really nice to take pictures from a distance outside but not necessarily up close or inside. The inside is very dark and flash is not allowed. Also, there has been special services lately and they do not allow access to all of the areas of the cathedral.

As magnificent as you expected it to be!. My mind cannot comprehend such a beautiful structure being constructed 850 years ago! The architecture is amazing and the stained glass even beyond that! Truly this must have given the people of Paris a vision of Heaven in their own lifetime.

Gargoyles and views reward a nice hike. The almost 400 steps up the North Towers of Notre-Dame are a great hike to a face-to-face encounter with gargoyles, cathedral exterior architecture, and wonderful views over Paris. Included on the Paris Museum Pass, which is well worth the investment, but no separate queue for pass holders. No lift, so must be able to climb stairs up a winding staircase.
Amazing place. The arts of the cathedral is very good. My daughter said that it remind her of huncback of Notredame. It was amazing experience to see such beautiful building.

great view. Go early to try to beat the queues. I went around lunch time and waited for and hour and a half. The entrance is to the left side if you are looking at the cathedral from the front. Lots of stairs .. apparently 325. hard to enjoy if there is alot of tourists as alot of areas are tight.
Magnificent. A must see..this is truly a wonderful Cathedral..The stained glass is indescribable..Beautiful..The history is worth the trip.

barely able to conceive the work involved to create this cathedral. I don't think my jaw ever closed during my recent visit. What an extraordinary cathedral created to last an eternity. Magnificent tour with audio features, we also were fortunate to experience a live church service with beautiful vocals. An aboslute must see no matter what devine faith you support in life.
Awesome. This is a magical place. There is so much to see here that you simply can't rush it. The attention to detail is unreal. LOVE IT !!!!

Closed due to strike!. Turned up at the gates and were told they will not be open today despite a sign saying they were open today.....thought it must be because they are renovating the place however ...then we asked information desk if they would be open tomorrow before we fly home and told us the builders were on strike and they didn't know when they would reopen. Very dissapointing and very frustrating. There is also a large platform structure in the square in front of the Cathedral for a concert that's planned so it ruined the view as well.Tres grumpy tourist tonight.....but don't mind me! Its still beautiful inside and worth a visit.
What a great view. The view is fantastic. Be ready to climb lots of narrow stairs. The bells were out of the tower for the renovation, but still worth it.
Impressive. Amazing architecture, intricate artwork simple a materpiece of 850. Of course this isa must see in Paris.
The view ,yes, but the lines..... The lines are long, the climb is strenuous,the view is beautiful and the gargoyles up close are a sight to behold,so it's not on the top of my list of must-dos

Icon. If you are in Paris and don't go here, you're so wrong. This is an icon of icons and a must. The place is amazing, and there is tons of history inside. The room that houses the jewels and gold crowns is worth the cost of admission while inside. It's also an added treat if you can go when there is a mass. The music can be amazing and well worth a sit to just meditate and worship.
Beautiful. Loved the visit to Notre Dame and then to climb the steps to the top and view the city was incredible. So worth the wait in the cold to see everything to the max
If you like architecture is a must. Excellent view or the roof of Notre-Dame cathedral and besides a good view of the Seine and the surroundings

It's worth waiting in line.... We arrived at 10A.M. and had a 45 minute wait to walk up the many 100s of steps of the tower. The wait and the climb were more than worth it: the iconic views of Paris are truly spectacular!Get there earlier or in the late afternoon and the line may be shorter, but do it, no matter what time you arrive.

a must do when you're in paris. wow... the view is absolutely stunning, there're a lot of stairs to climb on but it's worth it!!! definitely visit it, you get an awesome view and it's not as crowded as Eiffel tower <3best regards and enjoy your stay :)
The wait is too long. It just took forever too get in..The line is always really long..Nice public space outside though. Nice view of the structure from the river

Towers of Notre Dame. The Paris Pass will not get you to the front of the line. We waited a bit over an hour in July, and once through the line, did not have to pay, as we had the passes. Great view of Paris rooftops from the roof of Notre Dame, and of the gargoyles, statues and angels. Lots of narrow staircases, so if you're not a climber, might want to skip; otherwise, a must-see.

Really neat. While the sanctuary of Notre Dame requires no admission fee, the towers do. You have to stand in line at the north side of the building, where you buy your ticket (or show your museum pass), then are admitted to walk up a LOT of steps, only to find you have simply reached the gift shop. You are held at that level until the group ahead of you has cleared the top of the tower, then allowed to proceed up the stairs with your own group (about 25 people at a time). Once again, LOTS of stairs so not for the (literally) faint of heart. You can pause, but since there are not really any designated places for stopping, you are holding up the people behind you when you stop, so you can't linger too long. Then, just when you think your heart will explode from the strain, you emerge from the stairwell onto the gargoyle level, which is really neat. You get to stay there a while, then they herd you toward another stairway where you either descend, or proceed further up to the very top of the tower. But seeing the famed gargoyles up close and personal, combined with the magnificent view of all of Paris, makes it worth it (as well as just being able to say you did it!).
Great Architecture. Should be seen at sunset! Beautiful, with the last sun rays on the sandstone! When combined with a perfect blue sky, a breathtaking scene!

must see attraction in Paris. Also take the tour to the tower - unforgettable view of Paris from the top of the cathedral. Also brings up nice memories of Quasimodo and old stories from the French classics

Absolutely stunning. Yet again, another fantastic example of beautiful parisien architecture. While we didn't go inside the cathedral as we were running short of time, it is beautiful from outside, and just looking at that was enough for us.

"Our Lady" A Star of Paris. You will have to visit and discover this incredible masterpiece yourselves.Its hard to put into words what you feel when you enter it.Ques for the belltower are really long but to just visit the cathedral,you can go straight in .Don't miss the treasury!!

Skip this one.. Part of our Paris Pass. There is no skip the line for Paris Pass holders which meant we have to wait in line. Waited about 40 minutes to get in and stayed about 20 minutes on the tower. The tower is really narrow and scary. The view is great but the climb and wait was just too much so didnt really enjoy it that much

Lots of stairs but a must see.. If you are reasonably fit, take the time to climb the stairs to the top of Notre Dame. Fantastic views of the river and the surrounding area and a close-up look at the magnificent gargoyles.
A very long wait. Waited 2 1/2 hours o climb lots of steps. Good view but here are several places you can get that. Not worth the wait in my opinion

OK, but not essential. As others have said, there is always quite a long queue. Once in, you climb stairs to a small gift shop and we were left there for a further 15 minutes, with no communication about what was happening. It felt like a ruse to get us to buy things. The climb is steep and unrelenting, but is taken in three separate stages. For those who are wary of heights - I don't like being in places where I fear falling, but I felt quite safe as there are fences and parapets between you and the edge. It is fun to see the gargoyles up close, and the view of Paris, but frankly, if you are climbing the Arc de Triomphe and/or the Tour Eiffel, don't worry if you can't fit this one in.

Lovely building. Nice building. However, as there was a stand built in front of the building, it spoiled the view, and any chance of a direct photo opportunity. Still managed to obtain photos, but not a good full front elevation one. Didn't go inside, so can't say what it was like.

Amazing. A beautiful church worth waiting in line to see. The architecture is like no other church I have ever seen. You can sit outside on bleachers and take it all in for as long as you want. Make sure it is on you list.

Its a bit of a hike up there, but worth it!. We decided on the tower queue rather than the church because we wanted to go to the top. The Tower queue is to the side, and is long! They let in 20 people every 10 minutes and it looks like its not moving, but it took about an hour the day we were there. It was ok, there is a wall to sit on and its nice watching life go by as its crammed with tourists and you get to do great people watching. The steps to the tower are spiral and steep. We stopped at the first level and walked round the really narrow parapet where the gargoyles are, and took in the fantastic views of the city. Then up more spiral steps, even narrower and steeper to the very top, which was stunning! The architecture is incredible and the views are breathtaking even if it did make me feel a bit wobbly! Tips, if you are very large or unfit, don't try it!

thin air at that altitude. Impressive view. Long climb up narrow steps. Not for the faint of heart as you are on an 18" ledge very high up at times. You must be in shape to take this climb. The line was very long and it took 2 hours to get in to see the towers.

Worth the Wait!. This is not for the faint of heart. If you are afraid of heights or not in at least fair shape do not take this walk to the top. If you do not meet either of these negatives take a walk to the top of this grand cathedral. We walked to the top of Notre-Dame and Arc De Triomphe. Both have great views which are very different. This is among my favorite views of the city including the one on top of the Eiffel Tower. We arrived one day in the late afternoon and they closed the line right in front of us, be sure to get there first thing of late in the day but not too late to miss entry. Entry in included in the Paris Pass. Try to time your walk up that you are there when the bells are ringing! It is a sound that you won't forget. Limiting the numbers that go up at a time give you an un-crowded time to appreciate this gem and the city

A must see.. Thanks to screwy internal clocks we were up at dawn. Early in the morning you get to see a different side to Paris. Despite not being a morning person I loved being up early and seeing the city before all the tourists are around. On this day we arrived at the Towers at 9am and there was no line yet so we wandered right around Notre Dame taking gorgeous photos with no other people in them ( a rarity!). It was just lovely, quite a different atmosphere to the cathedral at that time. By the time we had strolled right around and taken lots of photos and gone to the toilet, there was a short line. We waited for about 30min and were in the 2nd group to go up (would have been in the first but they let a school group go in the first group).First you go up to a ticketing area which also has a gift shop. You dont get to revisit on the way down so if you want a quasimodo doll then buy it before they let you go up. The spiral staircase is tight and steep but not as bad as I was anticipating. The views are amazing. Right across Paris - it was fun to pick out landmarks and thanks to construction cranes at Les Halles we could pinpoint where we were staying as well. Gargoyles up close , touching the 850 year old stonework - this was definitely a highlight of our trip. Unfortunately the bellfry was closed so no seeing the bell but there is plenty else to look at - in every nook and cranny on the rooftops there is a gargoyle or a statue or a clock or a piece of scrollwork. It was amazing to see the Paris from above but there was also so much beauty on the towers themselves. Husband didn't enjoy the heights and he went down but I continued up to the next part where there is a time limit of 5 min and it is in a 'cage' - you can see a bit further and walk around to see out the other side but it's not got quite the same feeling as the lower down level. This was an absolute highlight of our trip - just amazing. Totally recommend. When we got to go up the line had stretched right down the street so when they say go early, they mean it. By the time we got back down to the bottom the area out the front of the cathedral was full of tourists and there was a queue to get into the cathedral, so again, if there is one thing you get up early for in Paris I would say it is this one.

Stunning sight. Even after seeing this nanny many times, it is always awe inspiring. They have just built a viewing platform opposite the towers so we had a romantic time listening to street music and performers whilst the towers were flood lit, fantastic free entertainment.

Medieval grandeur. Most well-traveled people have visited many venerable churches. Most will agree that after a while they all begin to blend together. Note Dame is different - very different.It is built on an island in the center of the Seine which was once the entire city of Paris, thus the name Ile de Cite. The cathedral itself rises grandly to huge heights fronted by two enormous towers. Less than dependable building techniques of the 13th century necessitated the famous "flying buttresses" along the side walls to support the massive structure. They worked - it's still here. Inside the massive cathedral there are all the trappings of an ancient and orderly progression of religious ritual which is still carried on today. A visit here is a "don't miss". The people handling has improved so the lines tend to be shorter and move faster than in previous years. Admission remains free but most people leave a small donation.

Fascinating. Easily one of my favorite places to go in Paris. The views are amazing (if you ignore all the wire fencing to prevent people from throwing junk off the roof) and the gargoyles are creepily fascinating.

Classic sight-seeing in Paris --- you have to go at least once!. We waited in line about 15 mins before gaining entry, so not too bad as the line moved fairly quickly. We did the audio tour which was fair. It was sometimes hard to realize what items/spots the audio tour was referring to around the cathedral. Lots of people, so expect crowds. Hard to pass up though, it's very beautiful and expected when in Paris.

Go early or very late. The lines for admission, which form into the hundreds within a half hour of the 10 AM opening are horrible and move incredibly slowly. This is because only about 25 people are allowed into the steps of the towers at a time, and groups are given generous amounts of time up top for photo taking. So the line moves at snail's pace. We arrived at 9:15 AM for the 10 AM opening and were within the first 10 admitted on opening. That was great, significantly limiting our wait. I've heard that going near the end of the towers' opening period works well, too, but I am a bit skeptical re that claim. I recommend going before opening as we did. The climb itself isn't bad, as you can take your time and let others pass as necessary. And the payoff at two levels on the top, including the very top is huge, a vast vista over the western part of Paris. Well worth the time and effort!
Great views. Wonderful views - loads of steps to get there so not for those in poor health (my husband was recovering from a chest infection and he struggled)
Worth the wait. Yet another wonderful view of Paris. Sometimes difficult to stay in line, but glad I have had the experience.

Fence.... Climbed up to the top, that made me disappointed with the fence all around the terrace.
The space was so narrow and all visitors are forced to walk through within a limited time.
The cathedral is fancy and good value to watch. But the tower is not so much.

850 years and counting. it was absolutely amazing, totally refurbished for 850 year aniv. we would have been very sorry to miss this.
we went across the street to the latin quarter to outside cafe for lunch that to was great.

Worth the climb. We did this the last day in Paris, which meant that we knew the city enough to appreciate the view and what we were looking at. The line to get in was slow, because they only let so many people in at a time. Not a good idea if you need to rush to something else. We passed by several times and there was always a line. They cut off the line 30 minutes before closing.It is a climb up spiraling stairs, and many had to pull aside to catch their breath. The climb down, again spiraling stairs, also don't agree with some people. An intermediate level puts you on the level of the gargoyles, which were great to see close up. I took some pictures of the I will always treasure. Also some great views of Paris. If you are out of shape, this will be difficult for you. I think this would also be better later in the trip. BRING YOUR CAMERA.

Must see. The first time I saw and climbed the Cathedral, was in November of 2011 we walked right in and walked right up to the top. I didn't realize that September was still tourist season in Paris so the line to get to the top and even to get into the Cathedral is huge. I would suggest timing your visit to walk through the Cathedral about an hour before the towers open and then standing in line about a half hour before the gates open. The Cathedral opens its doors at 8 am and the towers open at 10. If you think you'll need more time inside the Cathedral obviously plan accordingly but I would highly recommend being one of the first groups in line for climbing to the tower. They only allow about 20 people in at a time to climb to the top and there are two platforms. If you are claustrophobic, or have health issues that would cause you to be easily winded or pass out, you may have a hard time with the stairs. They are tight and they are circular. The Bell tower section of the Cathedral is closed for the next year or so due to repairs.  The views from the top are some of the best in the city with the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coure, the Seine, the louvre, and all of the left bank houses visible. When you stand back and look at the construction of this building it is awe inspiring and magnificent!
Worth the trek. Worth the walk up just to see the view and lookout for any hunched over men! Expect to wait a while in a queue if your going at touristy times.

breathaking view!!!. A breathaking view!!! I made it. I am not in good shape, and I was able to climb those stairs. I went around 2pm. I had to wait like 30 minutes to go up. At first, you start to climb some steps that lead you to the "billeterie", where you buy your ticket for 8 euros. You have to wait there like 10 minutes, then they let you go up. Don't worry people are kind and tell each other how many steps are left. However, there are tiny "corners" where you can rest and catch your breath . I didn't feel any claustrophobic or anxiaty while I was climbing. There are windows that light the way up. Once you finish the first tower you arrive to the first viewpoint, where are several gargolyles. you can stay there some time, then you go to the next tower, and finish your way up. You can see almost all Paris, the sacre coeur, the Eiffel Tower, several churches. it is absolutely worth the effort. I would love to go back. Make sure you go on a sunny day.
Go with Tour. Must seen, the queing so long, the best is to go with tour so no waiting line need it, amazing place

Majestic. We really couldn't go up close to the cathedral, so just contended ourselves by watching it from the river-cruise.The place looked majestic and I seriously believe, not-to-be-missed, if u are a monument lover.Hope to visit the place again.
Sit and admire.. Read about Note-Dame as you sit and admire the towers. I did not climb them, I just looked and admired them. The interior is monumental!

Great views!. If you are able to climb the stairs, the views of Paris and up close looks at the gargoyles are worth the effort. There are 2 levels--The stairs to the first level are wide enough that you can move over and rest. However, the stairs to the 2nd level are very narrow and you will not be able to do that.

Great views. Otherwise disappointing interior. Guess I have been spoiled by visiting to Basilica in Old Montreal and expected somthing similar. To see the main Cathedral it was a shuffle along in the crowds and keep shuffling as there was no chance to stop and try to catch the feeling of sanctity of church.

Some of the best views of Paris available. The line, the wait, the climb all worth it from the view of the top. I much more appreciate climbing through an ancient structure like the cathedral for a view like this than taking an elevator through a high-rise or modern structure to obtain a view of a city. When you consider the tremendous work and labor not to mention the ingenuity to create something like the bell-tower centuries ago, it truly enriches the experience. Especially since this view would be restricted to so few until recent history. We got in line early before it opened and waited...sadly the Paris Pass didn't let us skip the line, but at least the attraction was already paid for. Once the tower opened the line moved quickly so waiting for it to open was the right move - because it was REALLY long when we finished. The views of the Seine and the older parts of Paris are unparalleled. Also it rained the day we planned to go to the Eiffel Tower, so the climb to the top of the bell tower more than made up for not going to the top of the Eiffel.

Make the climb!. It's along way up and it is a long climb. I had to take it in stages but eventually made it. The view was great but I thought the gargoyles were the best things to see. They are charming!

Great View. Offered amazing views, only problem was that there were far too many steps to walk up and pretty much ruled out doing anything else for the rest of the day.Also queued up for about 1hr 20mins to get in.

Good Gargoyle pics.... The line was long to get into the towers... and they want exact change for the entrance fee. Once in the tower stairs you follow everyone up the narrow stairs in groups of 20-30. The outside landings are narrow, and hard to pass anyone - so you pretty much play follow the leader. The landings are enclosed in a wire cage (probably to prevent people and things from falling) and so photos have to be taken next to the wires. You are limited to 5 minutes on the upper landing, before following everyone down a second staircase. Not good for rainy days, no room for an umbrella to open, and would most likely be closed due risk of slipping on wet marble stairs. Best views of the city on sunny days!
Very Ornate. The towers are very ornate with lots of detail in the design. If you like the architecture of old buildings, this is a must see.

Travel through Time. The entry to Notre Dame Cathedral itself is free, however there is a fee to climb and visit the Towers (7 Euros, I recall, but I could be wrong). The entrance is located off the cathedral square, on 'Avenue du cloitre'. There are no elevators, and people with mobility, cardiac or breathing problems should reconsider. There are over 400 steps to the very top, all of them in a narrow, stone, corkscrew staircase. The staircase is so narrow in places, that one can't overtake the person in front, or that guards have to coordinate the crowds, so that a bunch climb up, while those at the top wait for the 'clear' signal to climb down. There is a break half-way, in a gallery where visitors can view Paris and see the gargoyles and chimeras. This to me, is the best part, the view is impressive (***) and will remind you of Victor Hugo's "The Hunchback of Notre Dame". Go, if only for this, and if you find yourself too winded, you can climb back down from there. If you want to climb fearlessly on, to the very top of the South Tower, there is an even narrower corkscrew staircase up, with the remaining 200 or so steps. The top affords an amazing view (***) of Paris, rivaled perhaps only by the Eiffel Tower. It consists of a gallery about 4 feet or a little over 1 meter wide that goes around the entire circumference of the bell tower. At the end, you line up, and wait for the guard's signal to go down. You eventually take a different staircase down the south Cathedral and exit at the south west corner. I have been there twice, and both times, I've profited from my jet-lag to get there early. The gates to the Towers open at 9 AM, and people were lining up along Avenue du Cloitre as early as 8:15. I can imagine the crush and confusion when hordes of tourists arrive and jostle with each other. I strongly recommend an early visit, which will allow you to relax and gaze on the city below, just like the gargoyles...

Impressive Cathedral. Well, not easily overlooked as the building is towering up over your head. Must be seen. The nearby Quartier Latin, once nice and hip, seems to have become a tourist trap. Don't waste your time. If you want the taste of boheme/hip/folklore, turn to Montmarte, 18.th arrondisement.

Saved by a monk!. Another historic site that was saved after a lot of fight through history. If you are a fan of the movies/cartoons, it's a must to see. Although has the same architecture from the other Churches it's special in its way.

Beautiful. Beautiful church, even it was raining people well all there to admire this beautiful construction. people were sitting on the steps outside the church just chatting and taking picture. I will recommend a visit to this church if you ever visit Paris.

New views of Paris. Not exactly new views, but a view that most travelers do not see. Well worth the 400+ step ascent to see the gargoyles and just gaze out over Paris.If you are not in somewhat reasonable physical shape I would not recomment that you try it. There is not a lot of space in the stairwell and the steps are rather steep.Well worth the effort it takes to make the climb once you are to the top!

Long wait ,But worth it.. It is a long,long,long wait but really worth the effort.422 steps from the best view of Paris you could imagine.Great photos of Paris taken up the Tower.It is a must for getting a real perspective on Paris .Looking down the Seine from such a vantage point was truly spectacular.Don't miss this.

Worth it for the gargoyles. We queued for about 30 minutes for the Towers, as they let people in in batches of about 20, due to the narrow staircases and general lack of space.After you get through the first barrier at pavement level, you then climb up to a room where you are permitted to buy tickets for the ascent. You then queue in that room for another 10 minutes. Not that anyone tells you that this is the procedure: you have to sort of pick it up as you go along and hope that the people in front know what they are doing. Since we were the first in our batch, we had to get it right for the rest.The views from the top are great, but what really makes the climb (373 steps) worthwhile are the close-up views of the gargoyles

Great views, long line. I think this was the longest line we waited in on our European vacation. There are sandwich shops across the stress from the line, so grab some food and eat while you wait in line. The views are definitely worth the wait. Prepare for lots of stairs!
Brilliant views !. Super awesome construction ! beautiful ! but as usual really really crowded.Cheap street food stalls around and nice walk around the cathedral.Lot of souvenir shops around !

Don't be discouraged by the line up!. A must see in Paris for sure. Easy to access by the Metro. There were long line ups both times we went to visit (because one visit wasn't enough) but they move fast. And it's a free visit! We did pay the extra to go see the relics which was amazing to see.

A don't miss Paris sight. This is such a historic site, from the outside Gargoyles and Architecture, marvelous.My husband and I went at opening time, this is a free entrance to see the chapel. We got there just in time to hear the bells ring and to see a mass being held. Neither one of us are Catholic but it was a very moving ceremony in French. We were allowed to take photos without flash and walk around in silence while the mass was being said. Loved this historic site

Amazing Building. Spent too short a time here. Needs at least 4 hours to take in the history and beauty of this place.The stained glass windows all tell their own story. No flash cameras are allowed. Please respect this when you visit.
Incredible. It was worth the wait in line to see the Notre-Dame. Such an amazing and historic attraction in a city filled with beautiful places. It was an amazing thing to see!

Wonderful View of the City. Wonderful view of the city and I loved that you got the Eiffel Tower in your view (as opposed to being in the Eiffel Tower and seeing the rest of the city). There is no lift to get to the top, so you have to walk up the 400 steps but if you are able, it is well worth the view.

Breathtaking. WOW. A must see! A lot of stairs but it's worth it. NB: Starts at 10am, not 9am.Although the Notre Dame is surrounded by fantastic bakeries (e.g. Hure) so there is plenty to do in the morning.
WONDERFUL!. A marvel!; lines move fast/none of the tedious backpack etc. checksalso open during servicesFREE! in Paris!
Amazing. Notre-Dame Cathedral is just amazing, the architecture and gargoyles just beautiful. A must stop for visitors to Paris.

Best views of the city. The lines are long and there are no reservations, but the climb up the Notre Dame bell towers are well worth the time and effort. You will have a more intimate view of the city than from theEiffel Tower and you'll have the added advantage of looking down on this incredible cathedral and touching the gargoyles. Highly recommended.

Amazing. It was amazing to see this Cathedral in person. The outside is beautiful and historic, while the inside is grand and unbelievable. I honestly could not believe that they were able to make this cathedral 850 years ago.

Stunning. We loved it, you get up close to the fabulous creatures carved everywhere. The view is fabulous I preferred it to the Eiffel Tower. It was very crowded and we queued for about an hour but it was worth the wait. I love the whole cathedral.

Amazing views and stunning gargoyles. First the gargoyles - actually more properly called chimeras and grotesques - the tower tour gets you up close to them for those classic photos. They are really nicely detailed and with paris at their (and your) feet, you won't find a better or more unusual view of Paris. There are no guides, but really it's all abut the view. The bad - the queue - but then it's worth the wait, and if you find an overcast day the queues won't be too bad. Indeed an overcast day is probably best for photos as you won't get overly bright highlights - although perhaps sunset photos might give a nicer light. And then there's the view - the second stage of the climb takes you to the top of the towers and you get wonderful views of Paris laid out before you. It's worth taking a long lens as well as a standard 24-70mm so you can pick out highlights. If there is a downside it is the cage-work - presumably to prevent suicides or vandalism - necessitating some reaching out with the camera for some shots. But with Paris staying largely clear of high-rise buildings, Notre Dame towers gets you a birds eye view.
Wait. Don't be discouraged by the long line to get in. It moves quick. They have audio guides in many different languages.

850 years and counting. This year is the 850th anniversary of the Notre Dame. Which means the front area has been dedicated to some additional grandstands,etc. that prohibit a really good view of the front of the church. Due to the celebration, there is now limited access with a somewhat long line. Still a must see, just get there early.
Beautiful!. It's hard to miss Notre-Dame being right in the city centre. Inside it's beautiful too! It's definitely one of the icon's that you must see whilst in Paris!

a must do!. yes pay the extra and go into the towers, be warned thogh there are LOTS of stairs and the staircase is very narrow. If you are claustrophobic I wouldn't recommend it. But the view, the gargoles and everything is stunning. I would do it again.
Pure Grandeur. What can be said...the beauty, the history, the size...oh, la, la. Lines moved quickly, don't let that discourage you.
Beautiful. Always enjoy spending time in Notre-Dame more so in the winter when there are fewer visitors. In late July early August its a bit crowded.
Stunning. Stunning building inside and out. Que looked long but moved very quickly. A must see if you are in Paris.
Notre Dame. Take my advice - stand in line, view the interior! Then suck it up and climb the stairs to both levels!! The view, the experience, WOW!!

Some of the best views of Paris!. We were able to get some of our best vacation photos from these towers! Amazing Panoramic views of Paris with the gargoyles watching over this amazing city!
Go early! Lines are long but move fairly decently. Must climb stairs....

Climb to the top!. It's well worth the money. The view is very different than from Arc de Triomphe or the Eiffel Tower. You get a view of the Seine, you'll see gargoyles and the architecture of the Notre Dame. I could almost see Quasimoto peeking around the corner at me.

Feel like Esmeralda (or Quasimodo). If you dont affraid the difficult strairs (narrow and high steps) try it. You will see another view of the city, the Gargoils and the roofs of Notre Dame. To go upstairs is a bit difficult because you have to wait in a long row and then to climb the stairs but I think that it is a "must to do". I dont like the iron fence they put recently (some years ago) but even with the fence the view is nice.

Long way up!. After visiting the cathedral itself my husband and I decided to go up the towers. Unfortunately, Emmanuel was under maintenance and we therefore did not see the magnificent bell but the views from the top are amazing.
Worth it!. It was quite a hike up for someone who is not in great shape, but SO worth it! Seeing the gargoyles up close was a real joy and the views were fabulous too!

Awesome!. The only things not to like are the lines and the hundreds of stairs.
The church is an awesome sight, and the towers are totally worth the sore legs. Not to be missed. Covered by the Paris Museum Pass

Historic, unique, and one of the best views over Paris. After years of visiting Paris, I finally decided to wait in the 30 minute line (November 2011) and pay the 8.50 euros and see what it is I have been missing. In a word: Breathtaking. Some of the very best views of the east of Paris. Gargoyles, Statues, the bells of the cathedral and all right there at your fingertips. In my opinion, this is a must-do activity. Don't let the line put you off, just do it and you'll be glad.
Impressive Building. Such a beautiful building inside, I would have liked to attend a mass however I didnt have time! Great views from the top (it is 400 stairs but totally worth it)

Awesome on Assumption Day. We visited Notre Dame on Ascension Day and while we did not wait in line to go in, we witnessed a large procession in honor of the holiday which was sunny and hot, and lots of families and tourists sharing the experience which enhanced the view of the architecture.
Amazing. The built a large viewing stand in front of the Cathedral. The garden in the back and on the river side very lovely. The church is a wonderful site to see. We did not climb the stairs.

good view of gargoyles watching over Paris!. The interior of the church is amazing and the climb is thrilling! It’s a great way to see Paris in a glimpse and a fun way to get some physical activity during your holiday! Although I still could not reconcile gargoyles with angelic faces of the church, they amazingly surround the tower and watch over the city.This is a strenuous climb for those legs not used to some form of exercise and could be scary as the winding stairs are narrow and steep. Ooops, the queue tends to go some distance!

Old Charm. This place is all about old times. the Cathedral, from outside look very old yet graceful. From inside, there are many paintings and facts on walls, which makes you feel a part of those times.
Great views from the top. Amazing cathedral inside and out. Highlight was going up to the towers. Spectacular views of Paris. Especially love the close up view of the gargoyles!

Beautiful. The history and architecture is amazing and beautiful !
There are lines outside but the lines do move quickly.

historical. I had been here in the winter, now enjoyed it in the summer with flowers in the garden around. Being here brings to mind so much history and books I've read. (beware of pickpockets here, how sad)
upper tour. It's over 250 steps total. 85 to the place you buy the tickets and souvenirs. Steps are plenty wide and it was cool in June so easy enough to manage even if a person is out of shape!

Christmas beauty. Outside Notre dame cathedral was a HUGE. Christmas tree .. The streets filled with vendors and the cathedral soooo sooo beautiful. I don't normally enjoy seeing cathedrals or abbeys but this is a must see

Hard to find the entrance. You can actually enter and go up into the towers of the cathedral. If you are standing and facing the entrance go tot he left and at the side corner you will see the entrance to the towers. You can go up and get to the walkway where you will be face to face with the gargoyals

skip this if you are claustrophobic.. Go early or late but be prepared to wait with a ton of people on a very high ledge with nowhere to go. Views are good and seeing the gargoyles up close is fun, but the trip down the spiral staircase can leave you a bit nauseous at the bottom.

View is fantastic winter is the best avoid long lines.. Worth it if you do not have to wait. Much more enjoyable at a leisurely pace. Montparnasse is a nice alternative view. If notredame is overcrowded. Either is stunning city view.

Beautiful. We took the stairs to the top. Unfortunately, This is not an attraction for those with back, heart or mobility limitations. Te assent is only by stairs. There are a lot. The view is breathtaking over the city. This was my first glimpse of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The gargoyles up close are awesome. The bells were ringing when we were up there. Go early. The crowds were plentiful when we returned to the bottom. We then went through the inside. We had to get In Line for that. It would be awesome to let you in, as you have already waited. The details are so amazing inside. Tourists were permitted to take non-flash photos. It was a little odd, since a service was also in progress. It would appear that people can't read the pictures posted with the flash crossed out or they don't care. I didn't see anyone asking or reminding them to turn off the flash. Beware of the peddlers and beggars outside. I had no real issue with them. Someone sells water for 1€. Just make sure it has a seal on it when you twist it off.
Amazing views. The views from the top are amazing, there are a lot of stairs though but its worth it when you get to the top. Be prepared to queue though so get there as early as you can!

See all over Paris. The climb up the 400 odd steps is well worth the effort, the view is spectacular. The queue can be pretty long as only 10 or 20 people are alowed up at any time and you only have 20 minutes. There are several levels to stop at on the way to the top and moving on is controlled by the number of people and how quickly they get to each level. Isnt to bad this way as you csn get a god view at each level. The guide leaflet supplied makes locsting land marks easy and points of interest are shown. Well worth the wait.

Definitely worth the wait and the climb. This was one of the highlights of our trip.
Not only a great view of Paris from the top but being part of the history of Paris is very special.
Only for the reasonably fit! Can't remember how many stairs but it seemed like 300 in a very confined space. You are glad to get to the top.

Worth the view on the top. Very organized in terms of letting visitors ascend tower in small groups. Did not like the first stop is the gift shop. Panoramic views of Paris from the viewing balcony definitely worth taking the time to climb the towers.

Well worth the wait. We were in line for what seemed like 2 hrs or more ( mostly because of poor management by the folks manning the gate). But once we were in, it was Very interesting.
A long climb up ever narrowing stair wells, right up to those famous gargoyles. Great views from up there. The building is marvelous and fascinating.
Sight is wonderful!. If you're lazy don't even try to reach the top..there's no lift, just an infinite winding staircase!

Crowded but worth it. There are tons of things to climb in Paris, but this and the Eiffel Tower were the two I think were most worth it. Give yourself a lot of time - the line is really long and people are very slow moving at the top. Great views, awesome look at this fantastic church.

Go early if you can. We arrived at the Cathedral at 8:30 and spend about 30 minutes inside. The got in line for the Towers around 9:15. The line starts to the left side of the church as you are facing it. We were the first group to walk up and had the top almost to ourselves. We have fabulous, close-up shots of the gargoyles and enjoyed seeing the city from this venue. When we exited, the wait to go up was over an hour.

A New Perspective. I hesitated climbing the towers, but I'm very glad I had the experience in the end! The viewing platforms you stop at along the way give you a totally different perspective on one of the most famous cathedrals in the world: you can see the roof, cross shape, flying butresses, and gargoyles up close. Plus, you get a fabulous view over the rooftops of Paris. Just be prepared to climb hundreds of steep steps in the process - it may be difficult for older travelers, children, or those with physical challenges.
Worth the que...... Get there early to avoid the wait and you will not be disappointed - a great vantage point for the whole of Paris. A unique experience that you will always remember.

Best Views in the City. When going to Paris, Notre Dame was on our "must see" list. The church is one of the few things in Paris open before 9 - we arrived at 8am, and walked right on in, no waiting (didn't realize until later in the day that there would be a cue at all!) We exited just before 9, and there were only a few people waiting in the line to climb the towers, so we thought we would go for walk while waiting. When we came back at 9:45, the line was down to the end of the street and around the block, so we decided to return a couple days later. This time we arrived at 9:15 and waited the 45 minutes until it opened. We were still almost 40 people down in the line. However, we got in really quickly. The first set of steps take you up to the gift shop. Then every 10 minutes they let a group from the gift shop start the climb to the first level. The climb was easier than expected. The view on the main level was extraordinary. I'd say the best in Paris. My husband did the second set of stairs to the very top. This set of stairs is the only to the top, so it alternates between people going up and people going down, so time is limited. You can view the bells from the main level most of the time, though they were being repaired during our visit. This is also the best place to check out the gargoyles, who are each very unique upon inspection. This is a MUST SEE for any trip to Paris.
Unforgettable!. What can I say when the name already bring so much passion and a physical urge to come see it! The architecture was so beautiful.

Another DON'T Miss it!. Although the lines are long to get in (prepare yourself as it could be an hour or more), it is well worth it. I think I was actually astounded to see archetecture students studying and drawing, and it hit me how impressive this was even more. I loved it.
strongly recommend. As I suggested in the Notre-Dame Cathedral, the tower is strongly recommended to go up and have a whole view of Cite.

Best stop. Notre Dame is awesome! Outside and in, it is magnificent. Busy, but free. Plenty of police around for support-folks like to demonstrate out front sometimes. Army was there, too
Charge up your camera before this visit.
Crowded in August. A beautiful Church but I was surprised that visitors kept moving around even during a service and although cameras were not allowed few seemed to take any notice.
Beautiful and iconic. Charles Laughton would be proud to have lived in this beautiful church (he was the Hunchback in an early movie version)

Missed out due to tour finishing earlier than I expected. Wrote about this in the Notre Dame review.... but thought I would add it here for ppl wanting to go on the tour.I thought I read on their website that on Sat and Sun the tours finish at 7:15pm, and last tour starrts 45 minutes before.We got there at 6pm on a Sunday and the tours apparently closed at 5pm when we asked ppl inside the cathedral, so we missed out and wasted some of our museum pass.We saw many others with museum passes trying to do the tour as they obviously read similar information.Even on the sign out the front to the tour entrance it had that it closes later on a Sat and Sun....so not sure how ppl are meant to know that the tour was closing early.

Love the gargoyles!. We qued for an hour to get into this which was the longest I've ever waited to get into an attraction but luckily it is entirely in the shade. It is worth it to climb to the top and the view is spectacular. You can see all over Paris.
Gargoyles!. The Cathedral is amazing! Such awesome gothic architecture and it's free to go in and walk along the rows of chapels and be awestruck by the flying buttresses and gorgeous windows.
A must do. Going up the steps and into the real Notre Dame gives a great panoramic. You can almost identify with the hunchback. The queue was very long but worth it

Exquisite.. This is a must while in Paris. The architecture is absolutely unbelievable and every detail is just exquisite. We have visited many cathedrals in our European travels and this is our second visit to Notre-Dame, but each time is more breathtaking than the last. Take the time to see this stunning work of art and bask in the glory of this holy place that is far too incredible to miss visiting.

Wonderful experience and worth doing!. We had the Paris pass and got to the towers early. The line was already long so we toured inside the church and walked around for a while. We went back to check the line and it took us about 45 min-1hr to get in. Lots of stairs but so great! The view is spectacular and it is so wonderful seeing the gargoyles and statues up close. We had a water bottle with us and I'm so glad we did! Like I said, lots of stairs! It can get crowded but I think it is worth waiting in the line to do.
Norte-Dame. Just rolled up, 2 minute wait to get in. And best of all... FREE!!!Loved it. An amazing place, rich in history. Well worth a visit.
Amazing Just Amazing.. What a wonderful sight to see and tour around inside. remarkable to see what man has built and so many years ago.
What a piece of History. You come across with 900 year old building in such a beautiful condition with whole history of France. Must visit place in Paris.

Easy access and Free of Charge. It took less than 20 minutes to get in, since most people are not stationed at one place for too long.The art and glasses are well maintained and breath taking. Excellent for pictures .
Well worth the wait. The queue to climb the tower was very long. We had to stand for about 1 and 1/2 hours before we got to go up the tower but was well worth the wait.

An awe inspiring Cathederal. Notre-Dame is a must see staple in any visit to Paris. A truly remarkable cathedral! The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. The self guided tours are highly recommended. You simply feel humble once inside and lighting a prayer candle was one of my highlights!

The Towers. The Towers of Notre Dame have a great architecture and are woth a visit. . .central location and easy to access. You are able, if willing, to climb steps to the top, where you can see most of Paris. While there please allow time to see the cathedral - large and beautiful.
Go early. It's really stunning from the outside. We never went inside as the queue was REALLY long. It stretched round the cathedral. Next time will go in the early morning.

Notre dame. The lines were more than 500 meters long so we did not get to go inside. Be careful of traveling in August as there are crowds of people everywhere. If you do not book in advance be prepared to queue for hours. The cathedral is stunning sorry we did not get to go inside

Beautiful church. We didn't go up to the top, just looked around inside.
It is very beautiful. The line was long but moved quite fast.
You can't talk inside or take pictures with a flash.
Why should I pay 11 euros per person?. It is ridiculous to 'sell' so expensive an famous interior view, and we had to climb 425 steps (no elevator in case children could not make it).

You'll See Paris, not Notre Dame. You climb this tower as a challenge, not as a way to see the cathedral. It's a great way to wear out the kids but since there is a charge, there are better views to be had. Walk through the cathedral instead.
No Entry Dear. No comment as we couldn't get near due to the ques that stretched round the cathedral. They only let a few in at a time and there was plenty more to see..

Get there early. Worth the climb to see the gargoyles. Want to do this early - as soon as they open and then go and see the inside of the cathedral. While you are on the island, don't forget to go to the Justice building and see the chapel there. That is a must see - probably the most beautiful stainglassed cathedral. Incredibly charming and easy to miss. It's a real gem.

Climb for the best views over Paris. We had visited Notre-Dame Cathedral on our last trip to Paris and were very keen to climb to the top this time. We climbed the tower late in the evening so that we are able to see Paris just before the sunsets and then see the Eiffel Tower light up with its glittering lights at the stroke of the hour after sun down.To get to the top one has to climb 387 narrow winding steps. It challenges your fitness levels but the views from the top are breathtaking and totally worth it. The Chimeras and Gargoyles are outstanding and some quite scary from up close. Definitely a must visit.
Really neat perspective on Paris. We climbed the towers as the sun set. We loved seeing Paris at Dusk. Definitely worth a visit. Bring your camera.
Excellent view. for 8 euros to enter to the towes, you can access using the stairs to the top of the towers. amazing view.Try to be at the bells time so you can enjoy the sound from the tower.

Woth the time and stair climbing to see the gargoyles up close and great views of the city. See all the gargoyles close-up. It takes a decent amount of walking up stairs and navigating some narrow terraces. But, it's great once you get up there. Go early in the morning to avoid a long line/wait.

Worth the lineup. Try to beat the lineup by getting there early in am. Caution: not for those who don't like climbing stairs - also the upper levels are quite narrow in parts so not a trip for the wide in girth. The view from the north and south towers of Paris and of the gargoyles are incredible - worth the climb and the wait.
A MUST SEE!. You just have to go in and see for yourself...stay for mass if you can, but this is a beauty. Plan on spending time here. Need I say more?

View from the towers is worth the wait.. Skip the Arc de Triomphe terrace and see Paris from this viewpoint. The incredible stonework detail on the cathedral at this level and of course the gargoyles is amazing.
Lines can be long!. Arrive early or you will wait in line for one to two hours. The view of Paris and City Island should not be missed though.

Breathtaking views!. We waited in a queue for 2 hours which was very tiring, especially for moaning teenagers! We paid €8.50 for adults and children 18 & under are free. Steps were a little narrow but safe. Once up and out the views were fantastic and breathtaking. Well worth it! Take you time going up as there are lots!

A memorable Afternoon. Sit on the steps and dream, walk inside and feel history. A must for anyone who has a few hours in the afternoon. Walk along the Seine, and be captured by a time that is still here and now. Continue a your stroll across the bridge to Ile St. Loius and have an excellent ice cream, at Berthillon! A true Paris afternoon as you continue through the parks and statues of St. Louis and the West Bank.

A beautiful place to visit. An imposing edifice beside the Seine, Notre-Dame is a must see that you will never forget. A place so full of history that the hair on the back of your neck will stand up. The only dislike was the huge number of heavily armed police in and around the cathedral, very un-nerving.

Beautiful Church! Free Admission!. I really liked the concept of donate with what you believe is worth. The church is beautiful - it has a combination of nicely designed glass, some sculptures, nice paintings .it's a must see if you're in Paris. If you're lucky, you may get to attend a mass.. Don't forget to donate to the Church .. this is how they keep it free!

Beautiful views, a trip highlight. The views from the top are stunning. We went just before sunset which was lovely. The only down side is the long wait to get into the tower. We had tried a couple other times and found the lines too long. This time we got lucky and arrived after a sudden downpour which may have scattered the crowds. The lines are slow for a good reason - they limit the number of people in the tower at one time which means that you have more space to move around when you are on the tower, and it is possible to get some great photographs. They also stay open later on some summer nights which is great.

Peaceful and Gorgeous. How can you not stop here? It is such an iconic symbol of Paris.There were long lines just to get inside if you said you were a visiter, but if you when in the mass attendance door there was no line at all. Both doors take you to the same exact place.I did actually attend mass, but I really think anyone could go in the mass door and avoid lines.If you are interested in a mass where there is some English, 11:30am on Sunday is the International Mass. Most of the mass is in French, but there is some in English. I found it very interesting.

Paris Pass Saves Notre-Dame Tour. The line to see Notre Dame Cathedral circled around Paris...or it seemed. Our Paris Pass let us right in without waiting. Had it not been for the Pass, we might have passed on this incredible landmark. We spent five hours viewing ever nook and cranny. Believe me, even if you don't have a Paris Pass, the wait is worth it!

Spectacular Building. I liked the fact that when we visited Notre dame thee was a Tiered viewing stand. I was great for just sitting there & admiring all the fine details of the face of the Cathedral. FREE ADMISSION. You only have to pay if you want to go up into the Towers. We decided not to this day as the queues that day were too long.

great climb. The visit to the towers is a must but you need to stand in a long queue again outside the cathedral to get in there. Great view of Paris from the top and admire the classic french Gothic architecture. takes around 15mins to climb - decent fitness level.
Must see while in Paris. Just a wonderful church and structure. Will just floor you at how it was accomplished as old as it is.
Climb Upstairs for a nice view of Paris!. This is another nice place to visit. We climbed the stairs to go to the top of the Cathedral and enjoy the beautiful views of the City.

Grand facade!!. The cathedral is beautiful but overrun with tourists during high season.We chose to eat lunch across the street and enjoy the amazing view! Be prepared to wait in line at least 1.5 hours.

Cathedral with Character. I have visited, more grander and impressive ones than the Notre Dame in Paris, but this one, still has the best charm and character, Love the Notre Dame in Paris, Lots of history in this building. Take an hr or 2 and pay it a visit, climb the stairs, visit the outside & top, not just the inside, sit on the roofs, not a lot of cathedrals allow you to visit the places that this one does.

The line was enormous but worth it. You can't go to Paris and not go to Nortre Dame. The line moved at a decent pace and once I got in, I just found a pew in which to sit and enjoyed the people and what I could see from where I was sitting. My husband did walk all around the behind the altar, but said it was so crowded that he could only see what was above people's heads. We did not go up the towers because we had already been to the Eiffel Tower. There are people outside feeding birds that will land on your arms and hover over your head to be fed. There is a playground behind and to the right towards the Seine if you kids need to run around for a bit. It really is a must see.
Lovely. I didn't climb the towers as the queues to get in were too long but will be doing next time it's beautiful!

Queues!. This is a fabulous Cathedral on the banks of the Seine. We have been before, in October, and had no difficulty accessing the interior. In August, however, the queues were probably a quarter of a mile long - too much for us. Well worth a visit though.
notre-dame. It's a church it's interesting but I've seen betterLooks very impressive from the outside This was the smallest queue of our trip to Paris

Worth waiting for. Climbing the towers was a highlight of my visit. While there are better views of Paris, the detail in the carvings, and the expressions on the gargoyles was fantastic. Yes you have to pay, and yes you have to line up, but I would climb the towers before visiting the inside of the cathederal again!
Spectacular. Could have spent a full day at the cathedral. The architecture alone was mind boggling. Definitely a must see in Paris

The glorius Notre Dame de Paris. Notre Dame, the heart of old Paris. The beautiful and glorious cathedral is the gem of Paris. If you visit it, warning, there are lots of stairs until you reach the roof!

Worth the wait. It was almost an hour wait on a cloudy weekday morning. The staff will only allow small groups of people to go inside at a time because the stairs are narrow. It wasn't too difficult to climb up for young people I believe. The view was gorgeous with the gargoyles just in front of you.

Pretty. Large and pretty cathedral. The architecture was especially detailed. Very beautiful indeed. There's also a secluded little park at the back of the cathedral not many know about, very peaceful to just chill back.

Long lines and lots of stairs, but view is worth it!. Would definitely recommend this for those who brought the museum pass, however get there early since the pass doesn't allow you to skip the line. We got there around lunch time in May and it took us a hour and a half to get to the front of the line. There was a lot of stairs that you had to walk both up and down, but the view was worth it! The gargoyles looked just like the ones from the Hunchback of Notre Dame movie and at the top of the tower you could see a 360 degree view of Paris! Well worth the wait and the stairs!

850 years of greatness. Celebrating 850 years of existence, this cathedral is in the center of the city - literally. Outside the entrance of Notre Dame is a landmark circle that is the basis of all streets in the City of Lights.For the cathedral itself, the architecture and history is well worth the visit.

Fun with a lovely view. It does not get better than this--up close with the gargoyles, images of Notre-Dame de Paris by Hugo, and great views of the cathedral and city. Get there early--the lines can be long.

Great views of Paris. Ok, you do need to be patient as the lines are very long to go up to the Towers of the Notre Dame but then you won't regret it.
