If you can manage it, you will see quite a few gargoyles and can get some great shots of them and nearby architecture. This is a big improvement over the view from the Eiffel Tower, for example, where you see mostly traffic and smog. Coming down is equally torturous, but you can reward yourself nearby with some Berthillon ice cream.

Excellent views, better be fit. This is a really hard activity and many people probably should not do it as there are almost 400 steps and the height to negotiate is about 70 metres. However the views are fantastic especially the close up views of the gargoyles. Those who are not so fit and especially obese people will find it hard as the spiral stair case gets narrower and narrower as you get towards the top.

Notre Dame de Paris: so impressive. This is a must in Paris like eiffel tower to visit Notre Dame de Paris. Do not hesitate to spend more than one hour there, you will not regret it. Take time to have a picture of the towers ans the archs outside before to go inside where you will descover the most beautiful ''vitraux'' that I ever seen. NDP is wheelchair frendly.
Worth the walk. Take the time to walk up the steps to top. Wonderful views of Paris.

A wonder of the world that you must see!. This is one of those places that seems very touristy but should be seen by anyone who has an interest in French history and architecture . Worth the lines and the price
Very Very Sacred. I felt like praying when I walked in the building.

Worth a visit !. I hated the stairs but the views are worth the effort ! If you appreciate gothic architecture and want a view of Paris accompanied by a number of gargoyles, visiting the towers are a must !

I hate to say it was worth the wait, but it was.. Bad line. Slow moving. I wouldn't have done it, except my son's favorite movie of late is Disney's Hunchback of Notra Dame and I think he was convinced that Quasimodo would be there. The line took considerably linger than it takes to watch the movie, but, admittedly, it was very cool. The gargoyles up close are really quite gruesome and suggest a lot about the beliefs in the middle ages. And I kept thinking about how we were standing atop what is a tall building today and must have been an enormous building -- indeed probably the tallest building in the world-- a thousand years ago. My son didn't see Quasimodo (he was apparently on holidays in Ibiza) but we had a great time anyway. Just try and figure out how to avoid that line. Go early, or in the rain, or pay someone to stand there for you...
Impressive. Knowing the history helps, but to see them in "real-life" is impressive.
Can't miss cathedral in Paris. A nice and stunning cathedral on the island in the middle of Paris.Try climb up to the top of the tower of cathedral to get even more stunning view of Paris.

Wonderful Experience. If you can handle climbing the 400 steps I would recommend this view. Expect it to be windy in the spring & very chilly. Being able to see the great bell was a once in a lifetime experience!
A Must!. An absolute must! It's worth every stair you must climb to see Paris from this vantage point, right beside the gargoyles.

Very interesting - great photo opportunities. We arrived at Notre Dame just before 10am when the tower opens. A queue had built up but it wasn't that long, we waited 20 minutes before we entered the towers. The admission to the towers is very well managed, they let in small batches of c 20 people at a time. They have staff posted at various points along the tour to make sure there are not too many people in any one section. You are not rushed though, after we got in we spent about 40 to 50 minutes on the tour,The views are super and there is the opportunity to view the largest of the bells. A great trip for photographers. We enjoyed the towers more than the interior of the cathedral itself.

The infamous bell and gargoyles. If you are planning to go to Notre-Dame Cathedral, you must go to this tower. The queue is pretty long as they only allowed about 20 person to enter each time to avoid congestion at the top, but do not let the queue deters you from going up. When you are on top, you can see Paris from a different angle, the very unique (and Gothic) architecture of the Cathedral, and viewing the infamous gargoyles up close, as well as the bell of Notre-Dame.
Amazing!. Well worth seeing. I found it amazing! No words can describe the beauty of the church and the view from the Towers

Climb 387 steps to wonderful views. We climbed the tower's steps this morning and the views of Paris are outstanding. From the platform between the two towers, you are extremely close to the gargoyles adorning the building which provides for fantastic photo opportunities. Back to the 387 steps... There are no lifts up or down so you have to be reasonably fit. Once you start, you can't really stop of turn back because it's mostly single file so others are probably following you. There were plenty of moans and groans from our group this morning. The majority of the climb is enclosed inside the tower with minimal windows, so you can feel a little closed in before you reach the top. This experience isn't for everyone, however if you choose to do it, you're rewarded with magical views. Tip: Pre-purchase your ticket so you don't have to line up. The queue for tickets this morning was 20 mins and it wasn't really that busy.
Beautifully done. Took the time on this visit to include the crypt. Well how well done is this. Awe inspiring sypathetically restored area of Paris of old. Well worth a visit.

Discover Walks tour of Notre Dame. We did the walking tour of Notre Dame with our very knowledgeable guide Vincent with Discover Walks.I would highly recommend this company as we took three tours with different guides and they all had a great background on the history of Paris. Some of the tours were free of charge and you tipped them individually for the tour.We wished we had more time to do more of the tours they offered.Sept48

romantic place to visit. i have been there in a cloudy day and re constructing period of the cathedral , sadly, i could be able to see the whole front . inside was absolutely stunning and very great beautiful place. a must see in Paris.

Splendor construction. - close visit will make you enjoy to check Splendor construction for Notre dame .- You can walk and enjoy the park attached with building.- You can also view and photography with a dove of Paris .

Definitely worth it! . This is my second time in Paris. The first time we skipped it because of the queue but this time we went and it was amazing. I would recommend going in the afternoon, around 4 p.m. Because we were there around 11, and by 11:30 the line was huge. We waited an hour, but the people a while behind us maybe double that. Once you get in, you can see why the wait is so long. There are about 400 stairs, and in some places are very narrow, which means it's one way traffic only (hence the very long queue). I would definitely recommend this. Like many things in France, it's free for EU citizens. I think it's around 10 euro for others. If you're mobility challenged, very unfit or claustrophobic, this might be a very difficult activity as there are no breaks for the 400 stairs, you just need to keep going up and often it's too narrow for others to overtake you. Amazing veiws from the top.

Panoramic views from the towers. A climb of nearly 400 steps takes you to a narrow platform from which the 360 degree views over Paris are superb. Major buildings and landmarks are easily seen. Some people in the group of 20 or so who entered with me found the climb to the viewing areas a bit strenuous.
Notre-Dame. Superb structure and wonderful area. You will have to queue for a while but it is worth it. As with many of Paris's wonderful attractions river Seine is never far away......

queue s too much. free to get inside d church but d queue s far longer. there were modus around who asked f u cud soeak english and wud ask u to sign the paper lol. humors said, when u sign it thats when her/his partner will check ur bag as well (its a distraction for u). anyway, take pics from d side near d river, the cathedral architecture s far better than the front.

Amazing. Grand. Better than you can imagine. . As someone who's seen the hunchback of notre dame. I already had an idea the place would be impressive. As, who didn't love that movie and think that's one hell of a building. But in person, it's so much bigger and more beautiful than you can think of. And it's not just the facade but also the sides. It's truly a wonder and the greatest cathedral in France for sure.
Notre-Dame says it all!. This is another one of those must stops when touring religious and tourist sites in Paris and its free!

International Mass at Notre-Dame. My husband and I attended the 11:30 AM International Mass on Sept. 11, 2016. I loved it, but my husband had issues with it. Firstly, be advised that the website states that part of the readings are in English---what this really means is the readings are available in written form in English, which is okay. This particular mass (when we were there) was packed with tourists, like ourselves, attending the mass while others were walking around looking at the cathedral. The priest used a GREAT DEAL of incense---so, if incense bothers you, don't go. We were sitting in the back and the incense still bothered my husband. Due to the number of people during mass, the church was warm, which made it uncomfortable. I would go to mass at Notre a Dame again---my husband would not. I took the tour of the Cathedral and enjoyed it very much. It is a beautiful structure and the side and rear alters are just magnificent. It is an amazing place.

Impressive. As an Atheist I can say that it's the most remarkable church that I ever seen. I loved the details on the front facade. A thousand faces looking at you. The inside is also amazing detailed, with the high ceilings and the catholic stained glass. I wouldn't miss the opportunity to go inside if you're in Paris.

Mavelous visit to a wonderful site. Totally enjoyed visiting Notre Dame. Didn't get there early enough to get to the tower but the cathedral is beautiful and well designed tourist path makes a visit easy, even during mass.

Amazing!!. The queue to get in looked massive, but it only took about 5 minutes to get in. It was free to go in and inside is breathtaking! We were going to do the archeological Notre Dame but it was fairly expensive for what it looked, but the actual Cathedrale is amazing!! a must see if you are doing paris!!!
An interesting place. A must see place in Paris with lots of history and fantastic for a photo opportunity however, be careful of beggars.

WOW - a must see!. Hard to believe this church is 853 years old!!! A medieval catholic cathedral, if you can make it up all those stairs to the towers to see the gargoyles in person, do it! Go on a sunny day, when the sunshine lights up the stained glass windows. It's fairly gloomy inside anyway. I was impressed with the amount of painted columns on the interior still survive today.

Notre-Dame de Paris, also known as Notre-Dame Cathedral or simply Notre-Dame, is a medieval Catholic cathedral on the Îl. Notre-Dame de Paris is a church, a place of Roman Catholic worship, where Christians come together to pray. It opens its doors to you to participate in services or to freely visit the cathedral all year long.

Worth a visit. This is a Cathedral that you must see if only for the fact it is famous. It is like many breath taking cathedrals: it is built in a way we can only dream off. Thinking back all those hundreds of years to when it was built and the meagre tools they would have had. Breath taking inside and out.

Amazing - Pictures will never do it justice. We enjoyed visiting the revered sanctuary. We did not attend mass here, but can see how breathtaking the service would be. All the intricate details can never be fully appreciated unless seen in person. One of the true masterpieces of Europe.

Notre Dame a quiet place for the busy traveler. Notre Dame is on the A list to visit. The grounds behind and to the sides of the cathedral are very interesting as well. While strolling by, one gets to view the support system used by the stonemasons to build this huge church. It is so big, one doesn't mind the crowds.
Worth waiting in line. We did not go to the very top but going inside the catherdal is well worth the line to get in. Now aheads everybody is getting a bad ck, so lines are long everywhere in Paris!
beautiful. The Cathedral Notre Dame is a spectacular architectural feature. Not being a church going person i am still amazed by the grandeur of the building. Well worth a visit.
treasure tour. There is a 5 euro cost to enter a large room that houses the treasures A small piece of the cross and many other items
Wonderful. Lovely Cathedral. There was a mass in progress when we visited was lovely to witness. Also very beautiful at night.
I loved it. Notre-Dame is beautiful. I love the gothic style architecture. It was a very busy day, and the queue was very long, but it was worth the wait.

Quick self-guided tour. Walked in quick via the Paris Museum pass. Didn't bother with the audio as we were pressed for time. I would recommend since using the audio guide at other locations revealed some fun and interesting facts. Architecture and history of the building are really something to behold. Wanted to climb the 300+ steps to the towers, but line was too long.. Girls in the park next to the river wanted signatures and money for some scam. Wave them away and enjoy a quick break from the crowds in front of the cathedral.. Captured a great view of the building from the back side via river boat tour. Cross the bridge for souvenir shops and food.

Oh jeez! Here come the haters!. It's a church...a big church with big lines. The windows are awesome, the rest is okay. Better kept than a lot in France due to the tourists but get there early - like an hour early to get to the top in September - off season.
Majestic. A majestic building.Get there early as the queues are long later in the day We got there 10;30ish and had to que a short while when we came out they stretched across the square

A must see. If you've never been here, this is a must visit location in Paris. From the flying buttresses to climbing the towers, the history and architecture are all must sees to understand more about the history of this famous city.

Very crowded outside and inside. Unable to enjoy the beautiful Notre-Dame because of too crowded outside and inside. Beware of pickpockets and they all looks like tourist people too. Don't place a coin on the walking floor outside where the sign 0Km start is. It is nothing to believe it. It is just a money place for homeless people to get free money (my local tour guide is not recommended). Anyway, inside is huge and beautiful glass windows with different meaning on the east and west side. Lots of sculpture and statues, walk around the cathedral and you'll see how great the cathedral is.

Love this place. This is a wonderful Cathedral not to be missed. The glass work is magnificent. Only problem is the number of tourists. Nice little cafes and lots of souvenir shops around if you like that sort of thing.
Must see place. Despite visiting the Cathedrale during the late evening, the rush was amazing. There was a crowd of people always around the place .

Amazing building. We have traveled quite a bit and I prefer the architecture of this church to just about any other building I have seen. It is smaller than the Vatican in Rome but I find Notre-Dame more impressive and we were lucky to catch a mass there and when they fired up that organ, wow!. Easy to get here on the hoho bus or boat.

My Favorite View of Paris. Walking to the top of the Notre Dame bell tower is a must do at least once. This attraction opens at 10am, but you will need to get in line no later than 9am to avoid a huge line. Line forms on the north side of the cathedral. Enjoy a coffee and some conversation with fellow tourists while you wait, you will be glad you got there early as you look behind you and see the line! Access to this feature is 10 euros.This is a fairly strenuous climb. Only attempt if you can climb about 15 flights of stairs continuously. It is a winding and narrow staircase. First climb takes you to a balcony of sorts between the towers. At this point, you have the option of continuing to climb to the top of the south tower for the ultimate views. Catch your breath here, marvel at the architecture, and then continue to the top. It's worth it.

Most visited Church in the World. I think this is the most visited and famous church in the world not only because of its wonderful architecture but also for the fame that Victor Hugo gave to this church. Esmeralda and CasimodoI should add one important thing : There are two queues for the church : one for climbing to the top of the church with the narrow staircase ( approximately 385 steps) by which you can watch Paris under your foot . The entrance fee is about 10 Euros but it is worth trying it.2) Another line/queue to the main entrance ( inside the church ) is free but long. You can see the Gothic architecture with the statues of the bishops and ....Also, you can find a beautiful scene covered with many pigeons around you in front of the big statue of Charlemagne . Your little children would enjoy feeding the pigeons.Do not hesitate about my advice and come to visit this beautiful church and Seine River beside it.

Beautiful . Today we went to Notre Dame. It was a Sunday and mass was being held so the line was long to enter but well worth it. My recommendation is to visit during a week day if possible. The stained glass windows are gorgeous. I love the gargoyles are my favorite part of the church. So much to see and learn. If possible, hire a local guide to explain the intricacies of the building.
The legend of the Hunchback comes alive. The architecture makes for great viewing and photo-ops even from the outside. However, it is good to enter to truly experience peace.

Definelty do the tour. The tour is where you get to go up to the very top of the cathedral. Its not free and the museum pass does not get you priority entrance so there will probably we a wait. Its worth it though.

Beautiful. Building inside and out are as beautiful as you can get. The stain glass windows are great. There is so much detail to the building it really can not be explained. You must go there to take it all in

Arrive 40 min before the towers ("tours") open. The line to climb the towers is along the left side of the cathedral if you're facing the front. Grab a crepe from the stand across from the queue and wait your turn to climb the towers. I would suggest going to see the cathedral (free) and get in line to see the towers ~ 40 minutes before the towers open (not free, but it is part of the museum pass). I was able to be in the first group this way. They only let a certain amount of people (~20 ish) up at a time, so if you're not part of the first couple of groups, it may take a while. I loved seeing the gargoyles and the views are great. There's a resting point in the giftshop - buy whatever you want at this point because you don't come down the same way. If you have concerns about being slow up the stairs, just make sure you're at the end of the group after the giftshop stop...there's less pressure to move quickly up the stairs this way.

A must see!. We took a boat trip down the Seine and one stop was the ND. It is of course a must see for any traveler to Paris. I found it to be very dark and pictures were hard to take. I was very surprised to find such a small gift shop. Don't let the line intimidate you - it moves quickly and you're inside before you know it. It is cool inside so sit down and take some time to reflect and rest.
Interesting!!. What a beautiful Cathedral - both inside and out. Amazing stained glass windows, carvings, towers and entrances. Put this great place on your list of things to do in Paris.
Nothing special. It was okay, but I wouldn't pay to go inside! Its an old building but there are great restaurants around if you bored looking at it!

Tours de la Norte Dame. We toured Norte Dame Cathedral in Paris from the L'Open hop on, hop off bus. It's a landmark in Paris you must visit. There are long lines but they go fast. Statues that surround the Cathedral are remarkable. Such a beautiful site that's a must "To Do & See"!Jump back on the hop on, hop off double decker bus to the next attraction!

Amazing Place. It is so beautiful inside, and also so peaceful! You can have the opportunity to attend to a mass while you are in there. The gift shop is also great!É tão bonito lá dentro, e tão tranquilo! Voce pode ter a oportunidade de assistir a uma missa enquanto estiver lá. A loja de presentes também é incrivel!
Famous Notre-Dame. Quite nice cathedral. Can't say it's the best architecture I saw but I'm happy I've seen it anyway. Some piece of different gothic in the center of Paris.

Worth the wait. We waited a long time to climb the towers but it was worth it. The ticket is included in the Paris Museum Pass, or you can buy a ticket there. The views from the top are wonderful and it is fun to see the gargoyles up close.

Must-visit and experience this wonderful cathedral. Yes it is crowded here - it is a must-visit like the Louvre or the Eiffel tower. In the early mornings it is likely to have shorter queues; avoid large tourist groups if you can. Inside start exploring on your own and marvel at the colourful windows, the big rosette, the sculptures and everything else. If able-bodied and not afraid of heights and spiral stairs, pay the fee to enter the towers - the view is even better than from Eiffel tower (as you actually see it from here). If a Disney fan, look out for the gargoyles - and who knows, maybe Quasimodo will make an appearance, too ;-)

You have to see it to believe it!. Get a guided tour, there is so much to learn about this great place. Our guide was from USA so we didn't have a problem understanding him. We went into the bell tour and the view up there is beautiful. More history than you can absorb.

Notre Dame De Paris. Very beautiful Cathedrale. Nice Place. Afternoon and at night some show for people.
Around the Cathedrale many souvenir shops , in front the is 'quartier Latin' where you can find the big sandwiches of Shawarma.

Didn't see Quasimodo but that's okay. . Standing as a monument to the beauty and history of Paris this cathedral is in use daily. That means please keep the noise down and absolutely no flash photography or tripods. The pic I posted is with a 20 second exposure so practice your camera skills for low light photography. Amazing paintings and pay extra to see the relics stashed away in the back. With all there is to see on the inside don't forget what's on the outside. Beautiful stonework can be seen anywhere you look. Cafes and shopping are just across the river so take your time and be sure to drop a donation on your way out.

a beautiful very old church. We stood in line and got in quickly- as the line moved fast- this is a free admission- the church is very old and there is a display showing how the church was built and changed over the years. Mass was going on , and people were still allowed in the church and you need to be quiet . There is a lot of thick dust on some of the statues -the Rose windows are amazingly beautiful! Such history and beauty

Attending Mass. If you are intent on participating in a Mass, the readings, at least, are printed in several languages. You will have to ignore the usher, an older gentleman, who seemed determined to weed out the tourists from the worshipers and direct us back to the crowds circling around the nave during the service
Very impressive and free. Everyone is drawn here and the line gets quite long but it does move quickly and once you are inside there is plenty of room.

was just ok. Went here as id always wanted to see the building. I was disappointed. queued in a massssive queue (although it went down quick) to get inside and have a walk about. it was a little boring and I abs love stuff like this normally. a lot of beggers approaching the queue was you wait. once you done the down stairs, you then have to go outside and queue again to get upstairs. we didn't bother as we were so bored at this point
Not worth the wait. I waited for about an hour to get in. The view is nice from the top but if u have visited or will visit the tower it is a waste of time.The church is worth the time

terror attack. the building is great and the pictures i got where spectacular but when i was there the police discovered a car full of gas and it was a test run for a later supposed attack which is terrifying to think the amount of people that where there the day i was could have been injured or worse is just petrifying.

Notre-Dame. Went on a skip the line tour through Viator. I was very enjoyable and our tour guide sorry forgotten his name he is an American but live in Paris 10 years plus.This was a great tour wasn't sure how I would enjoy it have done a lot of churches before can get a bit much but this is well worth a look. We had tickets to climb to the top which was an amazing view all over Paris. The guide took us up to the first level and we could make the choice to continue or not. Some went back down with the guide, I was tempted to go back down but decided to continue and so happy I did the view is specular and you can take your time getting up but it wasn't to bad after all. Although after coming down my legs felt a bit like jelly for awhile.

Underwhelming. Got here expecting que to be huge but it moved very quick so didn't take long. Was expecting it to be amazing but if you have been to a cathedral before then this is nothing really different. Considering it's free it's worth the visit
Must see!. Out of every site, this has the best of all worlds - architecture, art... Beauty! Easy access, near the Seine

Highlight of our trip. The tour to the top of the towers was breathtaking (literally) but well worth it for the opportunity to get really close to the chimera and see the gargoyles from above. The view of Paris is astounding and one which we shall be going for again
THE VIEW. I love the view from that monument!!I was excited. You should visit Notre Dame. The negative is so many people around

an historical celebrity.. It' difficult to imagine how such a grand structure could have been built by people so long ago, and the architectural processes they executed to achieve the dynamic results.

Massive Medieval Artifact of Scale and Inspiration. You may not understand the affect to this day of enormity and profound inspiration, unless you stood before something even bigger. I've been to some natural wonders that would dwarf this place, but the beauty and splendor of nature has its own quality. The Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris is shere perspective that penetrates into the mind, even unto the soul and spirit. This is a carry-over from the enlightenment that I hope will continue to provide this experience. If you don't believe me, stand before the altar in the center of the cathedral and look up. Take in visually what you see above you and get a feeling for the shere scale and inspiration of yourself and the entire building. Astounding. I hope you can see it too!
Too many tourists.... Hard to walk around as people go about taking pictures without looking where they are going. Still, a historical site that should be seen, maybe better on a rainy day.

Gothic. The best thing I noticed of this place is the strange architecture(Gothic). I personally loved it but some people I was with did not. They found the cathedral scary/haunted kind.I was looted by the cafe outside the Cathedral so do not recommended eating nearby.

Brilliant! . Took a day out from Disney and took my 8 year old daughter to Paris for the day. Had to go to Notre Dame as that's where the hunchback of Notre Dame was based around . The cathedral was magnificent and the stained glass windows beautiful. The towers are accessed to the side and children are free! It was a must do visit and we both loved itRob

Be ready to take the stairs. We took the self guided tour to climb up. It's all stairs up and down but it is all worth it. It is an exhilirating view of the city of love. Everything written to describe it is true. We took up the belfry area and imagined Victor Hugo's novel. Admire the architecture, stained glass windows and the full history. I will do it all over again

Great history and no Cathedrale entrance fee. There is no ticket or fee needed in order to walk around the Cathedrale. The line goes by rather quickly and it circles around the inside with the ability to sit in the center for prayer. The stained glass that line the Cathedrale is so beautiful and full of history. There is a diagram of the many stages of how it was built and when parts were added on to what it is today which was fascinating and very informative.You also have the ability to climb the towers as well, however there is a fee for this and about a 1-2 hour wait to climb. This is separate and around the corner from the Cathedrale entrance.

Photo-op Heaven. Its a stunning building inside and out! We did have to queue to get in (10 minutes) and then queue again around the left side of the image to climb up the stairs to the bell tower. !!!NOTE!!! if you are under 26 and a european national, and you have proof with you (passport) its free entry to the bell tower!! the ground floor is free regardless.

Faith meets Tourism. The magnificent columns of Cathedral Notre Dame de Paris have always fascinated me. Not a Catholic, but this Cathedrale represents faith in God for many people and Christians as well as others who love great architecture. I've never stopped going back to visit this Cathedrale Notre Dame since my first encounter in 1985. A must see!

Review of the TOWERS, not the cathedrale. This is suppose to be about the tours not the inside. The inside of the cathedral is free, the towers are not. The towers are climbing a bunch of stairs in a spiral staircase with 20ish people at a time all in a line up to the very top of Notre Dame. It's very beautiful but very grueling as you feel like you must keep up with the group and there isn't much space for people to pass. The line was very long, we went around 10am and had to wait about an hour. You first walk up a bunch of stairs where you can than purchase your ticket, than you walk up more stairs and are on the flat part in the middle. It has great views of the Eiffel Tower and that view of Paris. You can also see gargoyles up close which is really cool. You can also go up in a bell tower and see one of the bells and take your picture with it. Than you move up to the very top of the towers where you get a 360 degree view of the city. Please note, you're doing all this as a group, you can't wander on your own very much and it's limited time. Very cool and I loved it I would suggest you see it. The tower line is on the left of the cathedral if you're looking at the front.
Excellent. Beautiful place to visit . Most amazing history and architecture.The stained glass is incredible. Highly recommend.
Beautiful cathedral. Beautiful, historic cathedral. Lovely location on Siene river bank. A must visit during your Paris trip.

Great views but poorly run visit. This is the tower view from Notre Dame and is managed seperately from the main cathedral visit. The key things with this are: they only let 20 people in at a time at about 15min intervals. The initial climb is hard work and this is to the ticket office. Once you have paid we found that we were not given any instructions on where to go next and found that we were waiting in the shop area for a good 10mins before we found out where we had to go next. Recommended for the view and the experience of being on the Notre Dame but be warned that if you have issues with lungs/heart etc that this is not recommended.

Forget climbing up!. The cathedral itself is really nice and a must-see.This time we stood in line for climbing the tower. Great disappointment! The panorama are only to be "enjoyed" through nets. With the 10€/pers they get, they could invest in a new structure; The Tour Montparnasse has done the best of jobs for the photographers and tourists!!!
get there early. Since it is free the lines fill up fast. get there early. did it on a Friday and it worked out fine. No one there just walked in

Great Cathedral. This is a must see if you are in Paris. There is so much history surrounding this cathedral. The inside is beautiful. Take the time to walk around. We were there at the start of a service which was fascinating to be a part of. The only downside us the amount of people who are allowed inside at any one time.
Notre Dame. Our teenage kids rated this their favourite Cathedral. Beautiful to visit at Christmas time. Waited to get in, but not a problem was worth it. Lovely atmosphere around.

The most beautiful Church of all.. Visiting the Notre Dame was an exciting experience, the walk there with all the canvassers then the magical walk up all those stairs to the tower...they told a story in themselves. The view from the tower was the best in all of Paris. The Church itself is stunning. Simply beautiful.
Must see in Paris!. This is another one of those must-sees in Paris. If you are into that stuff it is worth going inside, otherwise, just skip it.

Notre-Dame Cathedrale. Long Ques- we opted not to enter as time restraint-Que early for this attraction. Majestic building, beautiful architecture and seating outside where you can sit and admire the Cathedral-We met some interesting tourists, chatty and friendly a musician was singing in the courtyard and the atmosphere was almost heavenly-I will definitely enter the cathedral on my next visit.

A must!!. Everyone visits Notre Dame so I really don't have to push it. For those who are Catholic or those who want to experience a Latin Mass in a Medieval Cathedral.....go to the 10 am Mass, but with respect for the service. The acoustics of the Gregorian chants are superb and of course the same for the magnificent Organ. I always visit Notre Dame twice....once for a walk-around and once for the Mass. BTW....when going to Mass there is a separate line which helps to avoid the big tourist line,
Take the TOUR!. Take the tour! It is absolutely worth it! You can walk around for free but the tour just gives so much more information! Go to the top for the look-out as well! Beautiful!!!
Worth the wait in line. Beautiful place to visit and experience all the creations of worship inside. Most amazing history and architecture. The stained glass is incredible. Highly recommend.
Well worth seeing. Take your own faith out of the equation, the building is stunning, The history is oozing out of every pore

You are there, enjoy the ascent. If you can handle the slight climb then I highly recommend waking to the top. We arrived at 11 after going inside the cathedral and it was about a 45 minute wait for the tower but will worth it. You are able to see the inner workings and be closer up with the bells. Gargoyles and decor well be right by you which was great to have a close up view of them. It's a narrow stair case but it's not terribly difficult, enjoy the view from the top a you circle the tower and see all of Paris.
Imposing. Great architecture and very lively square to have some coffee and remember the Disney movie the hatchback of Notre Dame

Everyone should see it . To go in the cathedral you must do a big line, but mostly is really quick to make. Once inside you can choose to take an audio guide or to take a real guide that will show you the cathedral.The place is just amazing it can't be described.
Beautiful. What a gorgeous cathedral. We really enjoyed our visit to this historic place. I highly recommend a visit here when in Paris.

Wow. This cathedral looks as magnificent in person as it does in pictures! Go as early as possible and you will not need to wait in an entrance line. Take your time inside bc their are tons you details in every nook and cranny that you don't want to miss.
Crowded to hell. It is one of the most global iconic churchs, there are lot of visitors trying to get in. However, the stained glass work is absolutely worthy.

A bit of exercise, but the view is worth it. Since this attraction is entitled the "Tours" of Notre Dame, I'm assuming it's supposed to cover the Tower climb activity, which is seperate from the entry to the cathedral itself (and the tower climb is not free, though it is covered by the Paris Museum Pass).Queue up for the tower at the northwest corner -- or rather, at the line that starts at that point. The queue usually seemed to stretch for much of the length of the cathedral itself along its north side. But no problem: it tended to move quickly, as visitors were admitted periodically in groups of 25.The tower climb is in three stages along spiral staircases: first to a giftshop, then after a short wait, up to the gallery at the level of the bells. The bell room can be accessed via very small entryways from the gallery; note there the huge, ancient wooden beams.It's here on the gallery where one gets the closest look at the iconic Notre Dame gargoyles. it's a bit of trick trying to shoot through the fine netting that's been erected -- I wonder if it was added because folks had been losing their phones while holding them out over the edge while taking photos...?In places, the gallery is a bit of a tight squeeze, but in every direction it provides wonderful views over the city: from the front (toward the west) is the best. There one can see the Eiffel Tower and to the right of it, the L'Defense complex, and below, the long line of folks waiting to enter the cathedral proper.Then it's up another tighter staircase to the very top of the south tower. Here I found the best view of Mont Martre, which lies to the north by west.In summary, the tour climb might not be for the weak or those with no head for heights, but for anyone else, with much exertion comes much reward.

Truly a spiritual moment to enter these doors. Having seen pictures and scenes in movies it was quite moving to actually see this imposing and impressive building up close. It is absolutely gorgeous outside as well as inside. One of the most amazing things is to go up to the bell towers and hang out on the decks for awhile. Great views and a fantastic experience.

Beautiful Cathedral.. We had the pleasure of seeing this beautiful cathedral from the River on our boat trip and the tour bus. Absolutely breathtaking and you could just imagine the hunchback swinging around the building.

It's beautiful. Northern France has plenty of medieval cathedrals and the Notre-Dame is one of them. It's quite a piece of work and requires at least a few hours visit. Excellent to do on a rainy day. The cathedral is full of atmosphere and worth every minute you will spend here
Impressive!. Great architecture and very lively square to have some coffee, read a book and just enjoy Parisians lifestyle!
Nice and Tranquil. A really nice and tranquil cathedral with many nice parts to see and able to sit down in peace from the outside world
Long queues. We walked past the church, a very beautiful building. The queue however stretched across the plaza in front so we did not enter it.

Amazing detailed architecture . I suggest you ho on Monday when most other museums are closed. The architecture was so detailed outside and inside. There is a lot of artwork hung up. Keep the noise down because it's still a church. It's crowded.
Church of Our Lady. Nice church to visit. See the bell of church on the top of the pillar. Heavy bronze made bells symbolize the history of the dwarf lived in the church.
A must see. This is a lace that every one to visit Paris must see, It is not the most beautifull church I have seen, but it deserve the visit

Fantastic, Serene and historic place!. A fantastic place that must be visited if you go to Paris, short waiting line for entrance and for free! Being into the temple is just wonderful, just get a seat and admire the mosaic windows is just amaizing. Great place to with the kids and explain the evolution of construction and history of the church. Just fantastic!
Stunning Cathedral. The line is long but moves fairly quickly. I find these old Cathedrals and Churches to be stunning and this one is World Famous so we had to go! It wasn't a disappointment.
amazing. This I must say is a must when visiting Paris. The architecture is bueatiful. Don't forget to sign the book and write a little something.
Beautiful artistic rendering of the Bibles New Testament. It was emotionally and spiritually moving.The architecture and intricate design details are breathtaking.

Amazing. This was everything I had dreamed of. Beautiful church, we even got lucky and mass was starting so we just sat there and listened to it. Everyone visiting Paris should stop by, it's worth it.
You will feel in a Movie!. Is just as the movie, but even better, my kids love it... you need to climb it but is totally worth it.

Beautiful outside, amazing inside. It's famous for many reasons, the outside is very beautiful. But, when you get inside, at least for me, is the most incredible building in Paris, no matter how many people on the line, you must get inside of the church, I'm not catholic, but I loved the inside, it's amazing.

Beautiful cathedral near the river. This cathedral was within walking distance of our hotel so we saw it many times. Georgous stained glass and interesting chapels and areas for prayer.Very serene inside, however I was disturbed by the beggars outside. Many of them were elderly, some prone on the ground, and clasping hand begging. It was so sad, and I had to give, to sooth my conscience. Here I was spending thousands of dollars to be there and they were begging for coins!

Stunning building. I remember seeing these with my very own eyes and thought that a stunning piece of history . Stunning to look at and see every detail.Pleasant walk around inside seeing the famous cathedral

A place that sets your hair on end. Notre Dame is famed for that movie Hunchback. There's more history to this place than that movie elaborates I took the L'Open Tour bus and this fine church was one of the stops. Take time to pray. You can almost hear God whisper... And laugh

Long Line-Even When Trying to get Down. Not worth the effort. Waited in line to go up and get down. Maybe it's a must for some who want to see the gargoyles up close (even with the chain link fence covering them). The view is good but even better elsewhere.
Fantastic, unique and amazing. It is really unique and fantastic. So many details and sculptures. Really recommend to go there and see it!
Big CHURCH.. Line form around the church so be sure to come early. Once inside they want you to buy a candle to make a prayer but it's not required. You will need to pay to climb the towers.

Beautiful Views of Paris. Want a way to see architecture and gargoyles up close and incredible views of Paris? Climb the towers of Notre Dame! In the summer there is a line but if you go later in the evening, around 9:00pm the lines move rather fast. They let 25 people in every 10 minutes. The towers are open late on Fridays and Saturdays.The climb can be difficult but it is worth it! You are up close and personal with gargoyles and the incredible exterior of the church. The bells are impressive in size and structure. And the top tower is worth the extra climb. We went at dusk and saw the city lit up! There is a fee to climb the towers but if you buy a Paris Museum pass it is included.

For those who hate long lines.... I waffle between a 2-3 star because I've been here twice and both times the line to go in was enormously long. I mean, bring your lunch and don't drink any liquids long (unless Justin Timberlake is inside, I'm not doing it). It's worth visiting to look at the outside though. Besides, we went to Segovia, Spain and saw the Segovia Cathedral which kicks Notre Dame in the pills. (No line, you have the cathedral to yourself, and it's enormous and beautiful). So, if you hate long lines, don't feel bad about skipping this. And no it's not a good rainy day activity because you'll be standing in line for five hours in the rain!!

A must do. At the top lies a stunning view of Paris, but also a close up look at some amazing architecture and some of the most unique gargoyles around! Absolutely loved it.Note: the attraction says its open until 6.30p, but that means"last tour out at 6.30pm. The queue will be cut off at around 4.30m so don't leave it too late in the day to go!

Amazing.. I made the mistake of thinking that my newly 12-year-old would not be interesting in Notre Dame, so I just planned on going there to see the building, take a few photos, and then for us to grab lunch nearby at one of the many cafe's located right there.I was shocked that she wanted to go in, but the lines were absolutely insane. From my understanding there were two lines, one for those who had booked tours, that wrapped around the building and were at least 150 people deep, and then there was a second line to purchase tickets, that went out into the square, and wrapped around itself a few times, making it impossible to count how many people were in line. So instead we settled for walking around the Cathedral, and just standing in awe of the amazing architecture. I regret not deciding to do a tour of the Notre Dame Cathedral and booking in advance, but at the very least it is a very worthwhile walk to and around.

Superb Notre-Dame. We have visited the Notre-Dame Cathedral every time we have been to Paris and it is never enough. Each time we have been lucky enough, however, to be able to hear the angelic voice or voices of the singing choir in the cathedral. It is absolute magic. The Notre-Dame has to be one of the most well known land marks of Paris. It is one of the most important symbols of Paris and France too. There are other Notre Dames in other French cities, but this one has to be the only one that is so uniquely beautiful, both inside and out. Stunning architecture and wonderful stained glass all over.
Grand!. A place on everyone's list to visit and it doesn't leave u disappointed. it is quite grand and the interior has amazing details & is quite rich.

Long lines, worht it. Beautiful cathedral, line can be very long, but worth every minute of the wait. You must come and enter the cathedral. My children loved the architecture and the area is very safe.
Don't Leave Paris without seeing. Whether from a distance or up close, the towers are a stunning landmark. The grounds are quite lovely.

A sight to be seen. If you are in Paris, then this is truly a place to see. The history, architecture and sheer grandeur makes this a definite bucket list sight. We were fortunate to visit during a late afternoon mass service and the young woman singing (hymns I suppose) was a real treat.

Stunning cathedral!. Disney's Hunchback in the Notre dame has brought me to this! It was so pretty but if you wanted to queue up to the tower, you have to wait approximately 30mins because it's a really touristy place, but I absolutely loved it!

Spectacular. Possibly the best cathedral in the world with its magnificent open setting on the Ile de la Cite in central Paris. The towers loom overhead as you walk by and act as a constant pinpoint to orient yourself as you walk around that area of Paris. We visited them several times during out 5 day trip.

Quick visit. Having been to disney for 4 days our children want to see Notré Dame. The cathedral where the Hunchback lived. Although we didn't go inside the outside is stunning. Extremely busy with loads of activity. The queues to go inside were massive but appeared to moving quickly.

Famous landmark is a must to visit. It's one of the Paris landmarks that should be visited. Rather austere in design, it is still magnificent but feels as if it's walked straight out of the story books. A must for church buffs and those you like history.
beautiful. The French are known for their engineering Marvels, one has to appreciate the craftsmanship of this Cathedral.

Never Say Never!. Before leaving for our trip to Paris, we spent many computer hours looking for a way to guarantee our teen and young adult would have the opportunity to climb the Notre Dame Bell Tower. No success. All such experiences for the days we would be in Paris were sold out. So, while we oldsters sipped coffee at a cafe outside Notre Dame and enjoyed the shady benches in the park behind the cathedral, the kids went exploring. Next thing we know, they are in a line to climb the Bell Tower. They said the view was fantastic!

Beautiful church with fascinating history, beautiful architecture and artwork.. Don't let the long line of Notre Dame scare you away. It goes quickly and the visit to the church is well worth the relatively short wait. It is an amazing place with a fascinating history.

Enchanting catheddral. We went relatively early on Sunday morning. When we entered, it was not too crowded, but very crowded as the morning progressed.There was a mass going on, but tourists were allowed in the area surrounding the main sanctuary (church). The mass was beautiful as was th music, but not for anyone easily distracted by crowds. There was security outside the church grounds given the new heightened awareness in Paris. The beauty of the church is breathtaking and the windows live up to expectation. Outside, the view with the towers is very impressive. There is a new shrine outside to Pope John Paul II on the grounds. If one just wants to observe the architecture, the large plaza (shown in this picture) makes that possible. There are tourist shops about 200 feet to the left of this plaza so you can plan to buy reasonably priced souvenirs during the trip. I believe that there is a small shop inside the church as well for religious articles.

What a View!. The view from the towers is worth amazing!!! Note the museum pass does not allow you to skip the line, so you have to wait, and I waited over an hour. There are also almost 400 spiral stairs to the towers and then more to the very top, so this is something to keep in mind. From the top, you have a panoramic view of Paris. The gargoyles and chimeras are fascinating. You also have to wait to leave once you're up there.
No Quasimodo . I love this cathedral the architecture and the mosaic windows were beautiful. The Madonnas statue with the cross was moving. This now my favorite Cathedral
Climb to the top!. The cathedral is amazing, but the walk to the top was simply more amazing. Their is a long line to get in and no skip the line tours, but worth the wait.

If staying longer than a day well worth a climb. Not done on this visit but if you get the opportunity, well worth climbing the towers and indeed having a proper tour of the whole cathedral. There beauty will keep you busy taking pictures outside on the square for quite a while as well.

Do it so you can say you did.. While I like the cathedral and the architecture, it's the people taking selfies and other photos inside a functioning church that leaves a bad taste in my mouth. To the point of distraction. So, it's not for me unless it's off peak.A better choice is the Crypt of Notre Dame. In my opinion, a very fascinating display of the history of the development of Paris over time.

Impressive sight. An impressive sight located just off the River Seine. Worth visiting even if you don't go inside as the Cathedral is stunning to look at, even if it's just the exterior.This is a busy area so may be popular for pickpockets - would take caution.
towers worth a climb. The towers are a master piece of Architecture though needs some effort to climb the 420 steps but once on top the view is out of the world.

Reverant in theory. The architecture is a must see! There is a relic s room if you are interested. In the alcoves on either side there are statues and amazing paintings. On the exterior walls of the chancel area are large carved stories depicting Christ's life. We toured on a Sunday morning. Line moved quickly. Mass was in progress and the singing was beautiful! The annoying visitors on their cells was not.Be sure to walk around the outside of the building noting architecture and flower/garden beds. Tours of theBelfry and Bell tower are available. There are pay restrooms in the public area in front of the building accessible only by stairs.

Notre Dame. Notre Dame Towers were amazing and one of our favorite attractions we did. I would highly recommend taking tour to the top and seeing the gargoyles and architecture and spectacular views. There are a lot of stairs!
A lot to climb. You will have to wait in line, even if you go early in the morning. However it is worth it. The cathedral is magical up there.

Amazing. While I was just a young person, traveling on a tour, this location will make your jaw drop in awe. It also makes you automatically whisper when you enter. It isn't a rule, it just happens from the beauty and magnitude of the site.

Fantastic. The church is enchanting. Try to avoid going during a service, as you aren't allowed pictures during service, rightly so. If you get lucky, you can attend mass, I did, there was a visiting choir that sounded angelic. Loved it, will return if I go back to Paris.

Be patient!. Be patient, it's well worth it. The tours start at 10, we were there by 9:15 and got inside at 11! Once inside it's nice and quick although some people find it physically challenging. The views are impressive, the ambience is Medieval, the picture opportunities are extraordinary.

Day in Paris with Joanna. Joanna, my tour guide and I visited the towers of Nortre Dame Cathedral. The architecture was amazing and provided a lovely background for photos. I highly recommend visiting this site.

beautiful!. It is beautiful both from the inside and out. There was a huge line up to go inside. We also go the museum pass that allowed us to tour the upstairs of Notre Dame, but had to line up as well.

It's worth the climb to the top!. Of all the climbs in Paris (and there are plenty that afford great views of the city) this one is really worth it! The combination of the views of Paris and the gargoyles makes this climb extra special.You need to be in line early. Get there at least a half hour before they open up the steps (which is later than when the church interior opens. This is the only line we spent a good deal of time in - an hour. Here is my advice. Buy the museum pass! Go early and enjoy the interior of Notre Dame before they open the climb. Download Rick Steves app and walking tour (you can listen to it through earbuds offline.) If you are not traveling alone, go immediately to the line to make the climb and then you can take turns taking a bathroom break (look behind the sculpture of Charlemagne - it will cost 80 cents.)

A great view and experience. Get there super early (an hour before opening times) otherwise the line is super long. The experience is wonderful. Climbing to the top to enjoy the view next to the gargoyles is priceless. My 6 and 9 year old loved it as well.
another great church to visit. Every church we stopped at was pretty cool. This was also one of them. The sculptures are unreal and worth taking a look at them.
Breathtaking. I was enthralled with Paris's architecture, and the Notre-Dame Cathedral did not disappoint! Definitely a MUST SEE.

Awesome! . Take photos, walk through, chat to nuns (as well as you can if you haven't got much French on the go) gift shop is great and the ladies there are lovely! Buy the guide book it'll help as not much info is in English in the actual cathedral

You can go to the top of the towers for a wonderful view.. The day we tried there was a long line and we couldn't stay.We talked to several persons that had been up there and they said it was amazing to look down and see all the architectural designs and the crowds below. They were thrilled to have done the climb or elevator trip up there. I wish I had gotten the opportunity to do that also.

Just as you might have imagined. We went there a number times as it was on our way to other attractions and also attended morning mass which was quite an experience. And beyond all of this, we had a great view of Notre Dame from our hotel room. Could not get enough of Notre Dame.

Breathtaking!. My husband and I with other seniors were on tour in Paris and this was one of our stops. The towers are breathtaking as is the cathedral. One needs time to explore it all. We took amazing pictures but you have to be here in person to get the whole incredible experience. No charge and lines were not bad. Worth the trip.

Great views . The views from the towers were fantastic- however this is a popular attraction and the walkways get crowded. If you are going to any other towers with amazing views I would maybe skip this one and save some euros.

Very good. We got in line at 9:45 after a quick 30 to 45 min in the chapel. after an hour and 15 min wait we were in the towers. I think if you got in line at 9am you may miss the chapel or have to come back because the line was insane after the tower. The tower line was long you just need to be patient.
What a great old dame. Towers of Notre-Dame allow visitors to observe a wonderful great old lady with all her beautiful, take a moment and look up this building.
Tourist site. A great place to understand the religious history of Paris. A very interesting experience. A day is not enough to visit these historical sites

Perfect on a Christmas eve. We stayed near the Luxemborg gardens after we arrived paris on Christmas eve. We took a stroll outside and we reached Notre Dame. It was packed with people outside. We got in and found that there was a mass being performed. We took seats and prayed. It was purely in french and so captivating. Such a memorable Christmas eve it was.
Must visit Cathedral. This is one amazing place to visit while you are in Paris, the architecture and the interiors is absolutely amazing
Slowest queues in Paris??. We had to give up as the queue was taking an hour and half at least in the baking heat. Such a shame. Would be great if something could be done about the queuing system.
Not worth the wait. Ok view, view from Eiffel tower is 10 times better. It was an hour's wait to go up the towers, for 10 minutes up there.
Get there early. Get there early as the lines can be very long as it is free to get in. A must see when you visit Paris.

A must see. If you are visiting Paris, regardless of being religious or not you should pay a visit to this place to appreciate the architect and history. Stunning place to visit, I was lucky to be there on a Christmas Day with my daughter which made it more special.

Beautiful. It was worth the wait to enjoy that beautiful view, and given the fact that is free for under 18 and under 26 EU habitants.100% recommended, be aware of the weather cause it may not be that lovely.
Awesome!. Awesome, inspiring place to visit! A "must-do" on your next Paris trip! Highly recommend! Take the time to go to the top for incredible city views.

worth the price to climb the towers - come face-to-face with funny gargoyles!. Climbing to the top of the towers of Notre Dame is a great way to see the city and to experience the cathedral. There are lots of steps - all part of the spiral staircases that lead up to the top. Claustrophics, beware. But the climb and the price of admission are rewarded with up-close views of the many different gargoyles who guard the towers at their base, and then again at the very top. Just know that you're going to wait a while in the summer - get in line at least 45 minutes before the tower climb opens up - the line forms alongside the cathedral on the left. You'll have the best pictures of your whole trip!
Views from up top. If you're looking to take pics from up high and catch expansive views of the city...this is your place! Then you have the gargoyles and a history of the church, this is Paris.

Revive Your Soul!. The signature towers grab your attention and draw you inside, free of charge. Upon entering you are cloaked by rays of light and dark streaming in through kaleidoscopes of stained glass. Time your visit during mass and incense’s holy smoke and the whispers of prayer fill the massive stone hollows, you are in a spiritual world. As you steal through the hallways, you feel calm and refreshed. May peace be with you!
Day Trip. Visiting Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral, which l find very interesting and also there are quite a lots to see, and l am sure the children would enjoy it too.
Too many people!. This is a place where you need to visit early.....hundreds around!Seriously, a must see. Impressive.

Go early to avoid huge lines. We started lining up at around 9:30am and there were still about 20 to 30 people ahead of us. By the time the towers opened at 10:00am, the line behind us was huge! Would definitely recommend lining up early to avoid having to wait for ages in the heat. We went inside Notre-Dame Cathedral at 8:00am that same morning (also beat the crowds, when we came out the line was starting to get long, lots of tour buses had begun to arrive), went and got some takeaway breakfast nearby, and then ate it while we waited in line for the towers. We were finished both Cathedral and Towers by 11:00am and were able to go onto our next thing, so would definitely recommend doing it early, especially given the inside of the Cathedral is one of the earliest attractions open in Paris!

Well worth the wait in line to see this remarkable cathedral. I was lucky to have a short wait in a not so long line. One thing I wish I could have added to my visit was a walk up above, I saw people on the balcony when I was departing. However the line to do this was extremely long and I didn't have enough time.

Steeped in history. Another must see when in Paris. Definitely better to do on a sunny day, the day we went was raining and it was very muddy. The trip to the top would have been worth paying for on a clear day.

Neat experience and great view. Climbing up the stairs takes a lot of effort, but it was fun and worth the climb. There's a little gift shop partway up. Definitely book with a tour in advance that let's you skip the line. We used City Wonders, which gives you a tour around the area first, through the church, and then up the tower. We had to wait about fifteen minutes before going up the tower, which was much better than waiting in the line. You don't need that much time once you're up at the top. We checked out the big bell, and then walked around the outside for the view. Pretty cool experience.

Ancient Cathedral. We wanted to see this cathedral since we planned the trip. What a cathedral it was. Enjoyed every moment of it. We were lucky to go when there was a service. The lady leading the choir was majestic in her voice. I will never forget that voice that day.The Church itself is a must for every history freak (which I am).

The magnitude of this structure will overwhelm you.. The stained glass windows are very beautiful. There is a line outside to enter the cathedral but it moves very fast.. To access the tower is a vey long line and only 20 people may go up the tower at a time. I don't think seeing where the Hunch Back of Notre Dame was filmed is worth the wait.

Must See. We arrived in Paris a few days before boarding a river cruise ship for Normandy. So we had some time to visit some of the wonders of Paris before embarking. There was a bit of a line outside so it gave us time to marvel at all of the intricate sculptures that adorn the exterior of the Cathedral. I was certainly not disappointed with the Cathedral at any point once inside you could wander about at your leisure. A must see.
walk 400 staird to the top to see the gargoyles. So glad I did this, but it was a little windy that day and when we got to the top, I was pretty cold.

Beautiful. A very beautiful cathedral but I could just take a look from the outside. There was a huge queue to get inside and I was short of time so missed the visit inside. But worth paying a visit to the beautiful old structure and architecture. All hop on hop off buses drop you off here and you can take some good pictures around.
Stunning architecture. This is a must see when in Paris. The detail is astonishing and the work that has gone into this building over the many years has certainly paid off

Out of this world. If visiting the towers be early (9 am) paris time and the same applies for the cathedral entrance. We did both over two days which was well worth it. Once inside the cathedral ( free entry ) it takes your breath away. The paintings, the sculpture work is amazing. Try to visit on a Sunday when they have a choir singing. Walk around the garden to see a statue of Pope John Paul. Would definitely recommend
long line at the entrance but breath-taking views of Paris. After climbing 422 steps on the spiral staircase, when you reach the tower level, the view is simply unbeatable!

Must visit for Travellers. This is very old monument. During peak season, it may take 2-3 hrs in waiting que. You may take pictures outside as well as inside. You may also buy souvenir coins / batches / books once you reach inside.

Breathtaking but Unnerving. We visited Notre-Dame on a beautiful day and the church is simply breathtaking. Do be aware, like most spots where crowds now gather, you will see a heavy presence of armed patrol officers. In one way, having a first responder steps away if needed is comforting. Certainly on the other hand, it is unnerving. We do live in a very different world, and this beautiful city remains on highest alert.

Humbling Experience. Another "Must Do" for travelers to Paris. Get a "front of the line pass." The Cathedral is stunning inside. When we went there was "Mass" being attended. No flash photography however bring a camcorder. Also, if you can handle the long line and can climb a long flight of stairs, then you must go up to the top of the tower. You can go right up to the bells when they peal off. It is quite amazing. We saw the hunchback. A four foot door opened up near the bell tower and a 7 foot black man climbed out scrunched over. We called him the hunchback then he stood up and just smiled at us.
wonderful architecture. you can spend an our just outside looking at the sculpturing and arches. the sense of age can be almost overwhelming. and don't forget the gargoyles!

Long Queue, Worth It.. The queue took almost 2 hours to get through but it was worth it as the views and the gargoyles were second to none. Of all the photos I took in Paris (almost 400!) the absolute best came from the top of the Notre Dame Tower. As for the queue, they only let 20 - 30 people in at a time every 10 minutes. And if a tour group comes along then they take up one of those ten minute slots. So there is a lot of standing still. I got so bored I counted the line about an hour in and there were still 126 people ahead of me and my wife. But there is a great little vendor across to street to get water, ice cream, and/or snacks at.

Stairs to Tower! Awesome views and gargoyles up close!. Got to there early and waited two hours to get in but we all agreed it was worth it! Interesting stairs, bells and views; our fave part was seeing the Chimeras (gargoyles) up close! Bring an umbrella if sunny day for line wait. (note some people have reviewed this as easy to get into and i think they are referring to the Cathedral entrance, not the tower).

No words to define the architecture.. Completely amazing. We went to the top of the towers which is completely amazing. Need to wait in line, as its not accepting priority queue for Paris pass, so, 2 hrs of wait is worth.

Fabulous and very sacred . The only reason I don't give this breathtaking cathedral a 5 rating is the annoying people inside who did not respect the requests for them to be silent so we could pray undisturbed - maybe there should be a few more employees keeping the quiet observed however for everything else it was majestic. What a beautiful spiritual place and those plate glass windows are breathtaking, a sight worth seeing. Oh yes, the queue to get in was very quick - another winner

A must, how could you not come here!. Inside or just outside this is a mUst over and over. I never can get enough because there is SO MUCH to SEE. if you don't want to stand in line to go inside, just walk all four sides of it, there is so so much to see its amazing and be sure to come at sunset when the stone turns a totally different color. Fabulous

Go early. The Cathedral opens at 0800 be there then or you will spend most of your time waiting in line. The structure is immense with wonderful architecture. Be sure to see the back as well as the front from the outside.

We love notre dame more than anywere. walking in front of notre dame at midnight listening to a rnadom guy singing and playing the guitar ALELUYAH it was heaven on earth. The lighting of the towers at night are breathtaking and really a must see

don't let the queues put you off!. on arriving the queue looked rather offputting but after a surprisingly short wait we were inside. It's such an amazing building which needs to be on the list of anyone visiting Paris
Festive atmosphere , iconic structure. Its so crowded with weddings and tourists .. Make sure you visit inside and spend some quiet time . This was the first stop before I walked to the louvre
Beautiful. Nice photo op prior to entering. Part of the entire package of Notre-Dame Cathedral, but you miss a lot by not taking the time to venture inside.
Beautiful cathredal. The church has a beautiful facade and remains busy with tourists all day long. Entry is free though a small donation is expected.

Beautiful!. Jaw-droppingly beautiful.... admiring from afar helps you appreciate all the hard work that must have been put into making a place look so intricate and detailed both inside and out. A must-see on any trip to Paris.
455 steps. 455 steps to the top but the view is amazing! Get ready for a 1-2 hour line because only 20 people go up each time and normally they can stay for 25 minutes in the top!

A Must and Great Location. On a recent trip, we walked the small islands of Ille de Le Cite and Ille St. Louis on a pleasant summer day. Notre Dame was as majestic as usual attracting tourists from around the world.
A recent feature was all those involved in Pokemon Go looking for points and playing in groups of two to four.

Beware of the Tower Climb!. The times indicated for the tower climb are not set in stone. We showed up in time but were turned away bc they decided to cut the line short. We saved it for our last day in Paris and missed a chance to climb the tower. Very disappointing!!!

Amazing! Worth the wait!. My teenage son and I did this together and we loved it! Well worth the wait! The line is around to the right side of the cathedral. Adults are 10€ and kids are free. Be prepared for 400+ steps and Do wear proper shoes! If it's a clear day you can see forever and seeing the gargoyles up close is really special! They let 20 people up at a time. You stop along the way to see the belfry and different views.
Gothic wonder of Paris. A Gothic cathedral in heart of Paris. There is a display that illustrates the construction over several hundreds of years. A wonder of its time and still stunning.

Do it once if you have the museum pass.. You stand in line on the outside along the street. Yeah, I know.. So much fun. They allow a certain amount in as a group. Then the next, and so on, and so on. So, you move then you stand there forever then move closer only to wait again and again. Once in.. They wait till you are all there, then you go up the stairs to the viewing platform. The views are ok. Nothing special. You get a gargoyles perspective of the area. Would I do it again? Nope, been there done that. Would I go into Notre Dame each time in Paris? Sure. Depending upon when you go throughout the year Notre Dame is the same yet different.

Photos don't do it justice. I've wanted to see Notre Dame since I took high school French. It was wonderful. We didn't spend enough time there. Maybe an hour or two. We were all incredibly jet lagged and running on empty. But it made the impression that we all want to go back again and see more, read more. We want to climb the steps. The park behind the cathedral was lovely.

Spectacular consctruction....stunning.. Second time in Paris and still put off by the miles of people queuing. Having read reviews still not disappointed not been to top. Been twice and equally enjoyed this time wandering round outside and up Seine taking shots of cathedral. Impressive on many fronts amazed how they built this so long ago. Get up close and see the detail in the building sculptures itself. Love it.Visited June 2016 YB Paris.

Always enjoy visiting Notre Dame Cathedral. Notre Dame Cathedral is a stunning landmark of Paris. I always enjoy visiting while in Paris. The queues are long, but move very quickly. Free to go in. If you want to go up to the Towers there is a fee.

Site seeing . Was brilliant to see the grand building which is famous by the story of the hunchback of notre dam. The building was a real site to behold with such amazing detail in the sculpting of the figures all around. Well worth a visit.

"The bells!". When the bells call people to Mass on a Sunday, you've heard anything like it in your life. Granted, they do have a little chime every 15 minutes but you need to experience the full acoustics. I can't imagine what it would sound like inside. We were over the Latin Quater when we heard them, so quickly hurried over to hear them better- it sends chills up your spine. When we come again I'm going to be sat right outside around 18:00 on a Sunday to experience this in full swing!

Very professional Architecture. We have visited this Cathedral at night, we could not visit inside because it was closed but very very nice view at night with special lights and it can be one of the magic in architecture.

Beautful view!. We arrived about half an hour before opening. We were up in no time. The view was wonderful. A nice route to go up to the bell tower and to see the gargoyles. The stairs up weren't too bad, but might be difficult with younger children or the elderly.

Absolutely Stunning Architecture 💜. You walk around this Cathedral and you feel peace running through your spirit. You walk around in total awe of its beauty, and try and soak up the spectacular architecture...The huge lead lighting Windows, to old lighting, the art work of Jesus life. Cost of entry is free.Try and get there early, so avoid the afternoon queues.

Long lines, in two places . Of course this place has long lines and that's understandable because it Paris, but what I didn't appreciate at the time was that there are Two lines, one to go inside the cathedral part and one to climb up to the top. By the time we realized this, the line was down the block and around the corner. Therefore, I can only comment on the cathedral. The audio guide is extra, so we didn't get it. It probably made it hard to appreciate what was inside but we followed a tour outlined in a book we had. It was interesting and beautiful, but I bet the upstairs would have been more interesting.

Breathtaking view!. In my opinion, the views from the top of the towers are the best in Paris!! Even better than the views from the Eiffel Tower. I could have stayed up there all day and stared out over the city. In addition, you get an up-close look at all the gargoyles around the towers. A lot of steps to go up but, trust me, the climb will be worth it!!

Amazing!. The Notre dame by itself is a french jewel. When you visit it, you can do some exercise going to the towers after 400 steps. You can be close to the bells and touch the unique gargoyles!!! The view is amazing too!
Beautiful architecture. We did not go inside due to rain and we were on the hop on hop off bus doing tour of city and got a late start.

Slow lines because they only let 25 or so at a time.. Been to Paris and Notre-Dame several times but going up in the towers for the first time was well worth the wait. It's a serious bunch of steps, so beware of that. We were up top when the bells rang which was very exciting and the views were just beautiful. If you have the time to go, go early and be amazed at one of the coolest things to do in Paris.

beautiful. the entrance to the cathedral is free! you can buy things inside but are really expensive! the cathedral inside is amazing ! i would say it is just absolutely stunning!
if you go to paris you should visit it

Excellent View. I visited the tower of Notre-Dame Catheral and i was really impacted because of the view was excellent i stay ther for around 40 min and i can't believe the view, I can recomment to visit it when there is the sunset the view is amazing
WOW. This was a spectacular day with wonderful experiences of the Notre Dame Cathedral. I kept hearing (inside my head) the music from the Hunchback of Notre Dame - Disney!! WONDERFUL memories!
A must see. Amazing and awe inspiring, this cathedral is a do not miss on any sightseeing itinerary.(Especially since there is no entrance fee.) The displays and architecture are truly breathtaking.

The best view of Paris. It is amazing how from the Towers of Notre Dame, you are in the center of the city, and you are able to see all of it in an amazing view.The steps are a little narrow and you get tired of climbing up, but it is totally worth it as soon as you get to the top and you face a gargola from 10cm close. You are able to see the biggest bell: Emanuelle.When I went, it was not available to go all the way up of the left tower, but I have seen pictures and it is even a better experience.

Massive. We got there early in the afternoon to find them closed for a special performance. They were reopening at 4:30 so we walked to other places to see then came back. The line went all the way across the square and back and in circles, there had to be easy 300 people in line. We were expecting to wait a long time, but within 20 minutes we were inside! The line moved very quickly - once inside we could see why. The place is absolutely massive. There was a mass going on and the singing was so beautiful as it echoed through the walls. We were able to walk around the whole Cathedral & never felt crowded - we took a few pictures & they have a very small gift shop, it was just amazing to see all of this. Very inspiring and well worth the wait to see it.

Long line. We had to wait in line for about an hour, even though we had the museum pass which gets us in for free. I don't think the views or the experience are worth the wait, but if you get there at a time with not as long a wait, go for it! Views are better at Arc de Triumph.
Astounding. A cathedral that's worth a visit. From inside you visit all the histories of the past. The area around is wonderful with people always wanting to guide you and assist you.

Must see. Amazing. Must see. Lines can be long so be prepared. Our line went very quickly and we were inside in just 15 minutes. Breathtaking. You must be silent inside so be aware if you have small children. I've heard the lines on Sunday's can be crazy so possible save for a weekday as we had no issues.
