The pendulum and the crypts with out people pushing their way around are a must.

Plenty of steps, so beware!. The queue to go up is rather long - we went just after Easter. But it is worth the wait. To be able to see those eponymous views of the city by the side of a gargoyle is great. Just be ready for when the bell so toll
Beautiful Cathedral!. Make sure you walk around the entire Cathedral to get a full appreciation of the size and architecture.

Can I just say WOW?!!!?. This Cathedral is so amazing and stunning, I would definitely recommend going inside because it is just so lovely. Do be prepared to wait in a line to get in, but trust me, if you are a lover of architecture and beautiful churches, DON'T MISS OUT!

nice one!. i liked the church!!is really big and the connection with the fairytale of my childhood was really intense butttt.it wasnt as i thought it would be!i was waiting for something more spectacular!but ok!its a church!Also i know that you can go on the top (free if you are under 26)!you cannot miss that spot when you are in Paris!you own it to your childhood anyway :)
Stunning. Absolutely Breathtaking. The history was so interesting. The inside was gorgeous. I recommend if you are visiting make sure this.is one of your stops. You won't be disappointed.

Definately a highlight of Paris. Plan your arrival carefully as there can be very long lines and the Paris Museum Pass does not give you jump the queue to climb the Towers. Having said that it is absolutely worth it as there are sweeping views of the city with the Eiffel tower in the distance. We specifically visited the towers on a different day to visiting the Cathedral itself so as to split up the visit. I particularly likes the various gargoyle on the edges of the roof.

The center of the city!!!. Interesting!!! Piece of Art!!! History!!! Mistyrious!!! Another place that makes you come back to the city of lights!!! I didn't make it to get to the top and i really regret it!!!I hope next time I can dedicate the respect and admiration it deserves !!!
The Cathedral is special place. but you may have to wait on very long queue, so I recommend wearing a hat or head cover to avoid the sunstroke

Great View and Climb. Definitely enjoyed visiting the cathedral and the towers. The architecture is beyond beautiful and the historical overview was also very nice. We also decided to climb the towers and we were glad to have done so as the views were great. Though, it is unfortunate due to past litter-ers, they have installed mesh netting so people don't throw stuff over. Would recommend though.

THIS BUILDING IS JAW DROPPING. Oh my this building is stunning. We went late afternoon early evening as the lights were dipping so the internal lights were on . As you enter there is a feeling of historic presence of being. The architects again have kept this style of Gothic artistry ( which I do love ). The height of this building shocked me somewhat as i expected it to be smaller ( viewing the top from the other side of the Seine ) The doorway is covered in sculptures too many to list. Inside is what you would expect in décor of such a truly magnificent piece of art. Another very moving visit for me emotionally. We came here for our honeymoon a few years ago and wasn't disappointed.

Beautiful.. We chose to purchase a skip the line ticket to see Notre Dame and climb to the bell tower. It was well worth it. As they say the lines are quite long. The church itself is full of beautiful stained glass windows and sculptures. We just loved the Gothic architecture ! Amazing. If u can climb the 422 stairs to get to the top of the bell tower do it ! We loved it.

The heart of the French world.. Here is where the French say all begins. Look for the brass disk in the middle of the square in front of of the church.Looking at Charlemagne statue enter on the right, easier. Be quiet and respectful in the church. If possible go to mass if catholic For Saturday evening mass and hear the magnificent organ. To get to mass seating, the rope is at the entrance of the church in the center. See the beautiful windows and statuary.
Must see. Stunning building, and worth a visit. Very crowded area though. We didn't go inside as wanted to explore the area, plus queue was too long!
Be Patient. If you don't mind standing in the queue your patience will be rewarded. It is so massive yet peaceful inside that you would wish you could just stay there and pray.

Stunning Cathedral Inside and Out. We had a great time just walking around the outside of the Cathedral, so it was all icing on the cake when we went inside. There was a line to get inside, but it went very quickly. The inside is quite dark (it was a rainy day) but very ornate and beautiful. We wanted to climb to the top of the towers, but the line didn't move for the 30 minutes we waited so we went on to other attractions.

A must see, but crowded. I love churches and this one is magnificent really. It took a little while to go in, but as soon as I did (for my very first time) I cried, and cried. The organ was being played and it was beautiful. Though crowded, it's worth it.
Stand back and take it all in!. Make a point to view at night, as the towers and the rest of the cathedral are lit spectacularly. Take your time to take it all in.

Stunning building. Almost of famous as the Eiffel Tower is Notre Dame cathedral and its towers. Its a stunning building and well worth visit. It can, however, get extremely busy so plan well in advance.
Spell-binding!. We caught this place at 9 o'clock on Monday (18th.)morning as they started choir practice,stayed inside for half an hour ,then spent an hour outside enjoying the views.

Awesome. Got there about 45 min before it opened was 1st in line by time it opened line was quite long so go early. Narrow stairs going up but was easy and I'm 55. Awesome views at top, cool gargoyles, don't miss the 2 bells can be missed very narrow passage to entrance. Wife got a bit dizzy going down but over all a must do.

Beautiful building. Beautiful building, waaaaay too many people! The queue was MASSIVE so we skipped going inside and outside had a lot of people hanging about so we didn't stay long. If you are going, be prepared for a long wait (outside, so plenty of time for pics!).
crowd is huge. I visited this place just after mass. So the crown was huge. And weather was so nice so I sat in front of this and ice place in Paris.
Awesome trip back in time. The architecture inside is simply breathtaking, until you see this for yourself, words cannot even begin to describe the beauty of this stunning cathedral.
one of the paris symbol. the line to get into was too long and I couldn't do it, but the view from outside enough to deserve a visit.

Long but fast moving queues. Absolutely worth a visit. Plan to spend some time inside. Go upstairs - steep climb bu an absolute must. Avoid restaurants nearby. Use the toilets outside before entering as restrooms are difficult to find. The art and the architecture are just too good - and so the importance it has got in literature throughout the history is justified.
Worth the wait. Queued for an hour but it was so worth it once climbing. Views across Paris from the rooftops and opportunity to go into the belfry. Included in Museum Pass

Gothic. A beautiful building in the Gothic style. A lot of sculptures in the exterior of the cathedral give this building an appropriate entourage. The interior is similar to the cathedrals of those times, a lot of stained glass and stone.

Notre Dame. Absolutely amazing. Must see when in Paris! Tons of love locks on the gates there. Romantic spot! There is a corner restaurant that has the Best crepes that I ever had! Grand marnier crepes! AMAZING!

Views. This place is a must see. Beautiful views of the city and gargoyles up close. The wait can be long, but grab a crepe and read your travel book while waiting. I didn't go inside the church and decided to go to the top instead. When faced with that choice-I would chose to go to the top again. There are many churches in europe to see and not many church towers to climb. Must see!! Beautiful views!!

Get there early to avoid queues. Queued for approximately two hours to go up the towers. One way spiral staircase to get to the top and separate one way spiral staircase for the way down. Great views of Paris but netting obscuring them for safety a bit. Not for the unfit or sufferers of vertigo or claustrophobia.

Beautiful Cathedral. This was a beautiful cathedral, very spectacular. You can look round the cathedral for free which is greta but you can always give donations and you can sit down and have a prayer.You always have the opportunity to go up the towers at a cost.I would certainly recommend to visit.

One of the most impressive frontages in Paris. Impressive in any weather conditions, the intricate details of the decorative stone are absorbing on a sunny day stood or sat on a bench at the front entrance. Well worth a casual stroll around the perimeter as the details continue all around

Great Views. Get there early to get in line. No bypass line for museum pass, but entrance is included. Lots of steps to get up there, so be prepared to climb, but so worth it. The views of all of Paris from up there are incredible and seeing the gargoyles and the bells up close are historic and beautiful.

Go up the towers.. it s worth the long wait. I went previously into the cathedral, which is for free.. it s nice and you see good art inside.. but when i went the second time i wanted to go up the towers, we waited almost one hour and the sky was sprinkling... but believe me it was worth it.. up there is where you can feel the soul of the story of notre dame de paris. Mind you, there are lots of stairs. The square in front is full of life and performers at night..

Awesome View. This is worth the 10€! The views from the top of Notre Dame are magnificent. If you go on a sunny day you can see the whole city. The view is even more spectacular due to the brilliant architecture of the cathedral.

Interesting site to walk around, but huge line-ups to get in. My wife and I walked around the Cathedral Notre Dame, but did not go inside as roughly 300 people were in line waiting to get in. We felt it wasn't worth it to see inside, so instead we walked around the park and neighboring streets.
Notre Dame. Enjoyed the cathedral particularly the history of the church and the surrounding island. Definitely a must to visit when in Paris.
Just impressive. The Towers of Notrre-Dame Cathedral is just impressive. It's crowded, but it's worth to take a look. The interior is so beautiful, an atmosphere very special...

Blown away by the stained glass. Absolutely loved Notre Dame. Yes it is busy, and there are a ton of tourists but it is iconic. It was much bigger than I expected and I was blown away by the stained glass, both the designs and the sheer amount. Absolutely beautiful.

want a great view of Notre Dame?. I stayed at the Hotel Notre Dame Saint Michel.Rooms 42 and 52 are high up on the corner and have KILLER views of Notre Dame.I could lie in my bed in Room 42 and look at Notre Dame.It never got old the entire week I was there.
Good but tiring. There were 350 steps till to the towers. The tower road are so narrow and the view is good but not suitable for photographing due to emergency covers.

Kind of famous.... We saw this famous cathedral from the outside via our Fat City Bike Tour. You need to see this place and also watch the people. It is fun to absorb the surroundings of the square which is also right beside the River Seine.

Ultraclean and stunning day or night. Disappointed to say that we did not have time to climb the towers. However, we did view them from the plaza below. They are beautifully lighted in the evening and are stunning in the early dawn light as well.

Make sure you visit Notre-Dame cathedral in Paris. The cathedral is located within the city and can be easily reached my metro. You can also take the hop-on, hop-off bus. There seems to be lien always but it goes pretty fast. We didn't go up.
Fabulous views. Over 400 steps to the top but they split it into 3 stages all up a narrow circular stone staircase. Wonderful

Must see site. It worth climbing 367 steps to the top. The stairs were broken down in two level, after climbing a few steps, you will enter ticket office/book store then climb a few more stair ( a lot) you get to the level where you see the gargoyles up close. You can see the two bells. Then you climb more steps to the top.The views were breathtaking. I liked it better than the view from Arc de Triomphe.If you need to buy souvenirs, buy it when you get to the bookstore, because you won't be able to go back there on the way out. When we climb down, the door to the bookstore was closed. Lucklily, we already bought some souvenirs on the way.Try arrive 45 minutes before it opens. We arrived 10 minutes before and waited an hour and half. What made it hard was lots of people smoke, so we were inhaling second hand smoke for one and half hours.
Stunning Architecture. Such a cool property. Easy to spend a ton of time just walking around the building checking out all the intricacies in the architecture.

Paris Marathon 2016 & Sightseeing Trip. . Another Beautiful Chapel and Sacred Visit. Stunning Architecture and a worthwhile trip. Just a pity we didn't manage the open top bus. Will save this for another visit.
Beautiful Cathedral,. The tower is not for the faint of heart.The climb up the spiral staircase is narrow and somewhat difficult if you're not in the best of health.
My favorite view of Paris. Such a long line to enter!! Waited over an hour. Still, the views of the cathedral's gargoyles and the city are well worth it. Be sure to peak in to see the bell.

A Long Climb. While we enjoyed the view from the top of the cathedral and seeing the bells and gargoyles, I am not sure it was the long wait in line and the 400+ steps to the top (though I may be tainted since we also visited the top of the Eiffel Tower the same day).

Mesmerising structures. First thing you will notice upon reaching here is the magnificent white structure. This place is at a good location and can be reached by river cruise or the local metro trains. If you want to go inside you may have to wait in a long line. There is a good market nearby where you can buy souvenirs related to the place and Paris.this is a must visit if you are in Paris.
Come Visit. Beautiful, Great iconic building. Must see we are glad we got to come here and visit. we did not go in but you can get plenty of photos just from the outside.
WE came we saw.... The lines to get in are outrageous! We came by, walked all around it and that fulfilled our Notre-Dame experience. Cool to see at night too...but the line is crazy
Another impressive building. We only viewed it from the outside as the queues were huge and it was hot. The building is impressive but again street sellers and scam artists are everywhere.

Worth every step!. We visited Notre-Dame towers on a Saturday afternoon so had to queue for quite a while, but was absolutely worth the wait. The 387 steps are divided by the ticket office and souvenir shop c. half way up and the views at both the lower and upper levels are stunning, right down the Seine and across Paris. You can see all the major landmarks clearly, as well as having the chance to appreicate the gargoyles close up.

900 years old; it doesn't look a day over 750. It is a beautiful, iconic, majestic location. Once inside it is inspiring. I am not a religious person however you cannot help but become awed at the majesty of the Cathedral. I also enjoyed that there were very diverse groups of people inside representing many religions.The Gargoyles outside are very cool; my favourite. Unfortunately I did not do my due diligence and did not realize that there is an exhibit inside which houses some significant religious artifacts.
Beautiful view. The views are well worth the stairs up! Be careful because the stairway up is very narrow and the hours of the tour is limited.

GO! dont hold back. Don't hold back on travelling and exploring the world, especially when there's something as beautiful as the Notre-Dame. I was lucky enough to be there on a romantic date with my partner (whom I met on triptogether) - what a beautiful monument and even more beautiful French woman to travel with!! Love all around!
Incredible views. If you have the strength to climb the steps - do it! The views are incredible and you get to see the Bells! Fantastic experience!
You have to see it at night. Beautiful at night and well worth a visit. We also went in the day and were able to get into the cathedral and see the inside - very pretty.

Epic journey back in time. My wife and I took our 8 & 9 year old boys to Paris for spring break. At the top of our list was visiting the cathedral. It did not disappoint. Walking inside the cathedral takes you back in time. The long history of the church is outlined in intricate marble sculptures that force you to think, how did they do that? The grandiose stain glass windows illuminate the church spectacularly. That being said, the real treat is going up into the cathedral bell towers. Although the nearly 250 steps is going to be a bit much for some, the payoff is well worth it if you can do it. Personally, I don't think you can claim you where in Paris unless you do this. We loved going to the top of the Eiffel but it didn't compare to the cathedral towers IMHO. It's at the top that you get to witness Paris through the eyes of the gargoyles. It's a spectacular view. Tip: get there early and if you can swing it, pay for one of the "skip the line" tours available as the lines are long. If you can't, I would strongly encourage you to wait in line(separate from the line to get inside the church itself). The towers compare closely with walking up in to the dome at St Peters Basilica in Rome. It too is a tremendous and exhausting hike up many many stairs but one of the things we've done that we still talk about many years later. We will be discussing our morning at the Cathedral Towers for many years to come too.
be early . You have to be early to be able to see the church without too many noisy tourist. It's a great attraction and you should definitely spent the 5€ for the audio guide.

Amazing. The history of this cathedral is mind blowing...beautiful doesn't do it justice. I can say I did it but I will never walk up all those stairs to the top again hehehe. I did get my pictures of the gargoyles I wanted
Beautiful Notre-Dame!. A must see! It is simply stunning! I spent a wet late morning walking around and it was a great place to be out of the rain!

Absolutely breath taking inside. I did a self tour - mass was going on; the choir was singing, the smell of incense and the architecture were awe inspiring. There is no entry fee and worth the wait in line - it goes quite fast.
Enjoyable place to walk around. An interesting part of town to wonder around and enjoy. You can go at anytime of day to enjoy, it is atmospheric and has an interesting vibe.
Popular tourist site. You have to go there early. The line to tour is out the courtyard almost to the street. Beautiful Church.
Amazing.. Stopped and had lunch around the Notre dame to take it all in and it was amazing. The bells ringing out added a lovely touch.

Stunning. The Architecture is phenomenal..... It is a masterpiece - that many many people like to visit!! iconic and a must on everyones list. Choose a fine day so you may be able to catch a river ferry and walk around a bit to get some great photos!! enjoy!!
Nicer then eiffel. The view from the tower is a better view from the Eifel. It is cheaper and the street there is amazing.

The stain glass windows are beautiful. It is very dark and quiet inside. Very historical and a must see when in Paris. There is a view from the top outside and a park in the back. Great Crepes near by the church.
intresting and mesmerizing. beautiful part of history, charming and magnificent, love to be there. be careful for metro- lot of pick pockets around this place. enjoy with safety.

Great Views of The Towere from the 5th Arondessment. In the 5th Arondessment or Latin Quarter there is a great chance to take photographs of the beautiful towers. I am always reminded of Quasimodo whenever I look!

Wow, amazing with long queues to match. What a beautiful Cathedral.
I walked there from La Gare Du Nord and hoped to get in early i.e. 9am on a Saturday, but the queues were about 500 metres long!
Next time
amazing!. One of the most amazing places - they had a hymn session, and although we are not christian, we found it amazing. Truly a must visit place.
Our lady. Visited when touring Paris - notre dame is serene, awe inspiring, and worthy of quiet time to devote to God- get there early before the crowds

Stunning stained glass, just be ready for the crowds. The number of visitors on the day we were there was unbelievable,k which made it more difficult to appreciate. Queued for 25 minutes to get in, then had to follow the line slowly round. Pleased to find no entry charge or "recommended donation" as in some cathedrals. Stained glass still stunning and worth the wait. Second (long) queue for the towers was however one queue too many.
A must see. Awesome. Simply awesome. The stained glass windows are beautiful and the gargoyles outside on the building are super cool!

Great for city view but quite tried. After climbing small stairs for half an hour you will reach the rooftop. Not a stunning view but still very good experience. Seeing gargoyles are also on the rooftop that made me think about the hunchback of Notre-Dame.

you can not miss it. all the tours include the Cathedral, very popular for students, locals and tourist, a beautiful architecture, many restaurent around it, and small boutiques, try to enter, but line can be really long
Fun for the whole family. So worth the climb. Note that entry is free and the queues move quickly. Definitely recommend a visit.

See the Gargoyles!. Great way to see some great views of Paris and see those gargoyles and the bells up close. The worst part is the line--definitely have one person wait in line starting at 9:15--it opens at 10 am. Lots of cafes nearby and a few shops that other parts of your crew could go inside and wait in comfort--especially if it is cold and windy. Line moves extremely slow and easily gets up to waiting for more than 2 hours--but is the only way to get up close and personal with those gargoyles. If this is on your must-do list--definitely slot it for the start of your day --Paris pass does not give skip the to head of the line power ----or buckle up and pay for a tour that includes it.

The Carvings are Beautiful. We saw this church during a private tour of cathedrals in Paris. An art historian took us from place to place and told us about each location. I loved the art work and attention to detail. The fact that the wood panels are still inside is mind blowing. This was one of my favorite churches we visited. It's a testament to time and culture. And seeing the rose windows was amazing. I can't believe they were taken out piece by piece during the world wars and put back after. To hear it is one thing. To see the window has THAT many pieces and to think someone took it apart and got it put back together again is amazing. I love art!

Very Pretty and Overrated. This church is very clean and well structured. I liked the architecture of it and it could be a nice place for your post card collection but its nothing that much special about it after that.

Amazing!!. Unfortunately, it is not possible to book tickets online and the queue tends to build up very quickly. My advise is to go there at 9.30 a.m. and wait until the opening. They let 20 people in every 10 minutes, so you might be able to get up in 30 minutes top. The view from above is breathtaking and, in a clear day, you will be able to see the Arc de Triomphe and the Arc de la Défense in perspective. The gargoyles are so beautiful! Climbing on top is a must in Paris! Have fun!!

What a lovely way to spend Easter Sunday. My daughter and I had the privilege to go to Mass on Easter Sunday at this world class cathedral. The Mass was divine and the whole experience really spiritual. We did have to queue for an hour and ended up going to a Mass more than an hour after the One we landed but it was worth it.

Definitely a landmark. Please don't get me wrong, if you're in Paris I recommend you go see Notre Dame. It is a landmark and when standing in front of it you know you are in Paris. The line is exceptionally long and while it is free to enter, the time spent in it takes its toll on you. When you enter, you are aware of how grandiose this space is, but it is quite dark. It's a little difficult to see some of the great aspects of this cathedral. I would also recommend going up the towers if you're up for climbing many stairs. Seeing those famous gargoyles up close is a fun experience. So, go see Notre Dame. see it from all the sides, hang out in the park behind it (there's free wifi too!), just be aware that you will be in that line for ages and that you mostly just make a loop around the inside and then leave.

Long lines, but worth the wait. So beautiful and spiritual. You will have long lines, but it is worth the wait. We were there for Christmas Mass. There were tourists while mass was going on, but it was tasteful and not a tourist trap. Great for history buffs. It is awe inspiring for those who lost architecture.

Beautiful On The Outside, But Even Better Inside. The famous Notre-Dame Cathedral, which appeared in Disney's The Hunchback of Notre Dame is a beautiful church, but be prepared to wait for hours to get inside because of the long lines that form of people waiting to get in. Inside the climb up the top requires lots of stairs, so if you are in a hurry view the cathedral from the outside, and come back another visit to tour the inside when you have lots of time to wait.

Walk to the top!. At the bottom, it's much like any other cathedral. In fact, I would argue that I've seen and experienced better, but once you go up to the top, it's a very much different experience and well worth the wait and climb to see the panoramic views of the city.

Be prepared for a lot of walking and steep spirals stairs.. The view from here is spectacular. However, to get here, you must walk up quiet a few steps. they are narrow at times. Be prepared for this. It is absolutely worth it.
Better inside, but iconic building. A visit to Paris would be missing something if you neglected to pop along. Complemented by some excellent local bars and restaurants.
Detailed architectural design, beautiful art!. We went there without a guide. Make sure you have one for the history lesson and also to get you inside faster.

steps, steps, very narrow walkways and more steps!. the queue went down very quickly, ticket prices are reasonable but there are a LOT of steps and no space to stop for a rest with people behind you! worth t for the views though

They`re in a hurry. Be prepared they are in a hurry to make sure you don`t take to long gawking at the gargoyles. Let`s face it though you`re not going to miss this if you can possibly help it. Inside is great but this is the part I came for, and so do a lot of other people.
a must for every Tourist. it was my first place to visit in Paris... i liked the medieval scent there.... so close to the river

No words could describe our experience.. Arrived on Palm Sunday prior to Easter. Arrived by surprise to morning mass, the pipe organ playing and choir singing. Spine tingling. Beyond that they early gothic architecture is beautiful.

Great. A great place for photos in front of the Cathedral.
Full of tourists with cameras a plenty and now the selfiesticks.
Pinch yourself your here. Great Historic attraction Very difficult but worthwhile climb incredible satisfaction when you get to the top. A must when in Paris

You gotta go.. 422 steps to the top of the south tower. Get in line before 0930, they open at 1000, otherwise the line is too long. They take people up in groups of 20 to buy tickets at the gift shop, then after all 20 buy their tickets, then they let you proceed up the steps to the next part, the Gallery of the Chimeras. Just a note, the workers come to work at 1000 and then set up the stanchions to control the line, so we actually got let in to go up the stairs to buy tickets at 1035 (viva la France)

Feel the History. If you are in Paris, even for one day, a not to miss experience is Notre-Dame Cathedral. Though eerie to walk on top of ancient burial sites, the structure is an incredible edifice that is everything you ever imagined. Take your time, pay for the headphone tour, and make sure to light a candle, no matter what you believe.

Notre-Dame Cathedral. Where do I begin. Having just returned from London/Paris February 2016, one of the most beautiful Cathedrals I have ever visited. An amazing place that fills your heart as you walk around in awe and definitely on your bucket list when visiting Paris. The day I was there it began to snow outside, something that will never leave my mind. I visited the Cathedral via the Batobus, which is a service that is run on the Seine but being winter it runs every 40 mins so I wasn't able to visit all 8 points of interest. At a cost of about 16 Euro it is certainly worth it and a great way of seeing Paris. This can be caught across the road from the Eiffel Tower.

Amazing!. My husband and I really enjoyed getting to know the history and construction behind Notre-Dame. It was amazing to us to learn what kind of work went into making this cathedral what it is today.

Worth seeing. Definitely a must see!
There was quite a long wait, but the line flowed smoothly.
The cathedral also offers tours in the upper levels.

Beautiful and a must see.. March was a wonderful time to visit the line was minimal. Our tour guide said he had never seen the line so short. The more the tour season nears the line gets longer and longer. Arrive early and enjoy the wonders of the Cathedral.

Keeps you fit and was worth the wait in the queue. I have tried to visit the Towers of Notre Dame many times and have always been put off by the long wait, this time I decided to wait and finally see the famous bell, 'Emmanuel'.The queue was long and boring, thank goodness for the little stores that line the road that you are queuing on - it took us 2 1/2 hours to finally get in! Make sure you are aware of this and wear comfortable shoes, and maybe bring a book.Once past the queue you must pass through a security check, you need to open your bag to allow the guard to check inside.You then begin to climb the stairs..... this is not for the faint heart and there is no other option but the stairs. You have been warned.Taken to a shop and ticket office, if you want anything, buy now as you won't get the chance to go back. Take this opportunity to get ready for more and more stairs.Once at the top you can see stunning views of Paris and the details of the sculptures on the walls and roof. Despite the wait and the stairs, this was worth it and I am so so pleased that I took my time and really enjoyed everything I was able to see.
Great Dame!. Don't miss the inside...and visit the roof, amazing view on "la Seine" and the heart of historical Paris !
Amazing Place. It's in a small island linked by bridge. People climb it up to have a great view of the city. Its one of the good place to visit.
Good Architecture. Visited with Wife she is an Architect and it was really amazing to see all the details. It was really beautiful but some people were throwing things around which was very annoying.

Amazing!. Wow! What a great surprise to see so many gargoyles and chimera up close. This is a fun experience, and the 387 stairs weren't that hard to climb. It's narrow, but worth the effort. Go as soon as the line opens or check back an hour before it closes. Included with the Paris Museum Pass.
Awesome!. Incredible building and nice relaxed atmosphere walking up to and around the building. Its a wonderful piece of architecture and very awe inspiring.

Saw at Night Twice. Weirdly, I didn't see this church during the day, only at night—And at that, twice. But I would dare to say the night spotlights gave the architecture a unique sort of impressiveness. Look for the "accident" on the left side of the facade. They did such a good job compensating for it, you probably won't notice it unless you're looking for it.

Symbol of French Culture. Nothing in Paris is a better reminder of the breadth and depth of French culture than Notre-Dame Cathedral. A symbol of religious values, but more. A lasting tribute to those who labored to build it. A constant source of pride to believers and non-believers alike. Happy trails....
Its freakin Notre Dame!. Its a must see upon any visit to Paris, didn't get a glimpse of Quasimodo but that's ok because both the interior and the exterior are stunning.

Sunday morning visit. We stopped by at around 11:30 am on Sunday, and were in time to join mass. It was a very nice experience, and the mass service itself has portions in English, French and Spanish. The cathedral is just so magnificently gothic, and seeing it being used as a place of worship was a very nice experience. We opted to view the treasury exhibit for €5 each, and this was insightful, seeing some of the historic and grand pieces of wealth in the Church's possession. Unfortunately nearly all of the descriptions were in French only so some Google translation was required.The queue was relatively small when we arrived in the morning, although it had increased quite a lot by 12:30 pm. There was no charge to enter the cathedral however we did make a donation.
Peace. It shows history, it shows the stunning architecture. During touristic times, a long queue can be found to enter however its worth waiting.
Lovely . It's is one of the major attractions in Paris. Cannot miss it. You have have a high street next to it with loads of bars and a market where you can pick up mementos.
icon. Based on other reviews didn't even attempt to go inside. The outside is dirtier than it looks in pictures. The area a round it is very nice though.
For the view and the gargouilles. I had to wait quite a lot due to the long queue, but I was pretty satisfied of visiting this place. Great viet and lot of history.
Impressive.. Such an impressive and ore inspiring place to visit. Simply stunning. Made even more special with the romance about the place, including all the couples.
Wonderous religious building. Very impressive close up. The sculptures are amazing. Usually, long queues to enter. This is a great meeting point too.
Worth the visit. Take a trip to see the fantastic architecture in this impressively maintained historic building and enjoy the laid back atmosphere of the area.

when the Paris from long ago is still alive. a great view from the top but a stony stairs rising to the top that bring you to the middle age for a few euros; really fun and nice feeling, worth doing to feel like Casimodo!

beautiful. I sad in another comment,this is place,this is beautiful aristic building,what you must see and you must feel this beautiful atmosphere.We entered the cathedral, but we did not climb to the top, because we did not come at the right time.Unrelated whether you are religious minded, the feeling is wonderful.View from the Seine, the Notre Dame is a fascinating and enticing to admire the Cathedral.My boyfriend and I have enjoyed and we have great pictures from here.

Man made wonder. Even if you are not of a religious nature, no visit to Paris would be complete without visiting this truly stunning building. I have been twice in 30 years and have been moved to tears on both occasions. I won't say any more. just go.

a long queue, but the views from the top are worth it. I had been here before in 2002, but did not go up to the top until now. Seriously long wait - over 1.5 hours on an early SAT afternoon. Up close views of the gargoyles and rooftop architecture were worth the wait. Plus the views of the city. Also could go in the belfry to see some of the large bells (they were in operation - the attendant in the area had a few pairs of large ear muffs to use when the bells would ring. Charge was 10 Euro.
Climb to the top. It was a long climb - If you aren't up for it, then stay on the ground. But the view was very rewarding! Even on a cold, gloomy day, it was still gorgeous.

Notre Dame Cathedral. Magnificent building just past Sant Michel right on the river. Probably best to visit early in the morning as gets very crowed later. Lots of cafes nearby along river where you can get a coffee and enjoy the view.
duck days. i was by the notre dame when there was a duck and wine festival there....omg...it was the best combination i have eaten in my life. gastronomy in paris is outstanding..

Great Spot for View of Paris!. You can visit the towers of Notre'Dame separately from visiting the cathedral itself, which is what we did. When facing the church, the line forms to the left side of the building. They let groups of folks up at a time, and since there is only 1 staircase (and a narrow one at that), you have to wait for visitors to exit before more people are admitted. If the line is long, there is a bistro directly across the street from the line, which I took advantage of since it was raining, I was cold, and hubby let me run over there for a coffee. The view of Paris from the towers is lovely. Being so close to the famous gargoyles is a giggle! Lots of great photo opportunities, this was a nice stop on our itinerary.

Don't miss the top of The cathedral . It's probably the most beautiful gothic cathedral in the world and to climb the towers will give you amazing views on the towers, the roof and of course all ParisTo go to the top you need to queue at the north side of the cathedralThe queue was going till the north gate and lasted 1 hour and 20 minutes

Extraordinary views!. The views from atop Notre Dame are absolutely stunning in every direction. Please keep in mind that you'll need to walk up the stairs. Plenty of opportunities to see the famous gargoyles. There's also an opportunity to go in to one of the bell towers.

Chimeras, bells, steps and wonderful views. February 2016: The feeling of walking those 385 steps, in a cathedral built 853 years ago, and then taking in the same views that the famous chimeras watching over Paris have gazed at for ages… it´s something every visitor to Paris should do. And many people want to, so make sure you arrive early, probably when it opens! Good to know:- Free for EU-citizens aged 18-25 (tror dette inkluderer EØS, ettersom jeg og kjæresten kom inn gratis), otherwise it´s about 10 €. Free for everyone first Sunday of the month- They let in about 20 people every 10 minutes, so to a certain degree you can calculate the wait by counting - At 11:45 the line was quite long, about an hour. - Due to the wind the panoramic view from the western tower was closed when we visited, but the views from the chimera gallery was more than good enough for us

i enjoyed the exterior even more than the interior. we had a guide that explained the meanings of many of the intricate carvings on the exterior as well as the architectural features of the towers and cathedral. this made the monument really come alive for us
Numerous Steps!. Stood in line about a half hour, in the rain, to tour the towers. While the views of Paris are spectacular, the staircases can be challenging.

Literally made me cry. I'm not sure if it was all the wine I had with dinner, or the fact that I've been born and raised a Christian- but I had no idea how beautiful this catherdral would be in person. When I walked up to it (in the evening, the lighting is beautiful) I literally started crying...it was so beautiful, powerful and grand. I didn't know what to expect, I figured it was just another cathedral but it truly moved me. The entire story of Christ is carved into the stone above all three entry points. It was an incredible sight and I highly recommend it, even to those who are not religious. You can respect the fact that it's one of the few Cathedrals that wasn't destroyed by the war regardless of your religious affiliation.

Narrow climb, amazing view. I waited in line for about an hour on a Saturday afternoon to climb the towers and that plus the climb was still worth it. The climb is broken up into a few levels and you are sent up in groups, so it is definitely manageable. The panoramic view from the top is great and seeing one of the bells up close is super cool. I would definitely not recommend this for young kids or those advanced in age as the climb is steep and slightly difficult.
A must. Going in March allows greater access to sites due to less seasonal footfall. Good restaurants across the bridge allow one to recharge the batteries

Saturday night mass-Great way to start the evening in Paris.. I can only add that for an extra special experience attending Saturday night Mass in French at Notre- Dame Cathedral was inspiring. You can exit afterwards and enjoy the nighttime view and also feel refreshed for the rest of the evening. Check the website for schedule.

Nicest example of French gothic architechture. This is one of the oldest & catholic cathedral. also identified as " Our lady of paris" It is big in size with length of 128 metres & width of 48 metres. tower height is of 69 metres. asi wnet early in morning & hence did not come across crowd. once can climb the stairs & go to the top which gives a marvellous view of the city. A famous place for sight seeing.

One of the most beautiful churches in the world. In both of the times I visited Paris, I had to go and check out this architectural landmark. It is certainly a very good spot to take selfies and group pictures. Make sure you enter to be able to see the beautiful sculptures and stained glass windows. It is worth check it out again in the evening as it is lit up.

Paris' best view!. Be patient and take the lines to visit its interior, and don't forget to climb all steps to the top of the tower! This is Paris' best view! You can see the Eifel Tower and the Sacre Coeur from this island. The "not so good part"? You are allowed to stay 10 minutes at the top, as they need to get people moving in and out... Coming down the stairs is lots of fun! and then, before leaving, don't forget to go to point zero, where distances are measured in France.
Short and sweet visit. Nice area, amazing site too see and very busy . Sketch artists are quite persistent but charming. Plenty of shops and cafes around overall a pleasant experience.
Grande Cathedral! . Notre Dame have a unique and nice looks. Definitely have to take a lot of picture in front of this church. Too bad I have no time to go inside. But from outside, it was beautiful.

Notre Dame de Paris. Memory from September 2014. You're thinking of Esmeralda when you walk the doors of the church. I didn't get to go to the top of the building as the line was outside on the side street. Next time I go back, I intend to.
Notes Dame Towers. I was lucky enough to go up the towers at night. From the top, I think you can find one of the best views in Paris!

Breathtaking. Breathtaking. Notre Dame has so much history and character. We did the audio tour and was very pleased with it. There's so much more to the cathedral than I was expecting. Also, since both my boyfriend and I are in wheelchairs we were a bit nervous about accessibility, but we got to cut the line to get in and enter through the exit, also there is a hidden lift on the left side of the alter that will take you up to go explore behind. Otherwise you will have to go up three steps.
Beautiful. It's very beautiful! If you have te time to to the top of the tower you won't regret it :) The surrounding area it's interesting too.
Great Historical Architecture. I went by the Notre Dame and was able to see the view of Paris and the close up details of the Cathedral's architecture.

Best view in Paris!. Worth the effort of the climb - absolutely breathtaking view even on a grey day. Don't miss out on the chance to see a bell too - it's through a small wooden door!Also don't be put off by the queue - it went very quickly even though we were initially a bit concerned.
Just wow!.... I always loved this building, and I finally got to see it on my own eyes and I got to go inside. It is definitely worth a visit! Photos don't do this cathedral justice...
Beautiful historic site. A must visit for everyone visiting Paris. As a non-religious person, I had doubt about visiting this site, but It was amazing experience, you wouldn't regret it.
Beautiful . We visited in February and it was not packed, we were able to attend evensong/choir and it was breathtaking. Highly recommend.

Must visit. The famous Notre Dame is something just must visit. The church is beautifull lit on the insight and it still holds a very churchy feeling. We went late in the afternoon and it was very peacefull and quiet

Gobsmacked. I did not realize when I booked my flat in Paris,how much luck I really had. I was in the middle of everything! Across from The Louvre,up the street from Musee d'Orsay and a gorgeous summer stroll with the breeze in my hair and face,to The Eiffel Tower. What almost reduced me to tears was the sight of the Towers of Notre Dame Cathedral! I have read The Hunchback Of Notre Dame so many times that I could NOT believe I was standing in front of the very place that inspired this historic book. I'm a proud man but crying here is a must. This place defines Paris for me. It always will. Going back in July when I plan to spend a whole day inside and out so if you see a grown man crying that is me!
Try to climb all the war to the top. Buy a ticket, queue on the left hand side of the Cathedral and climb to the top through narrow staircase...Magnificent view....

Must See!. Unlike most reviews where I try and tell the reader what my experience was/is, this one will be shorter. You MUST SEE this amazing cathedral while in Paris. Also, for the best experience, find a tour guide to go with since there is so much history inside the cathedral. Finally, unlike many cathedrals where you can do an 'audio' tour, this is one that is best done with a real guide.Enjoy!

Beautiful. After 800 years it still looks amazing. We've seen a lot of churches all over the world and this is one of the best ones, with a rich history. The area outside the church is great for pictures and people watching.

very lose view of the gargoyles and the bells! great city view!. place where you get an awesome view of the city, but also where you get to see the gargoyles very closely ad the ancient and new bells of this epic church! it is worth it!
Saw them light up at dusk. It was stunning and inspiring. Also went past on a river cruise. How beautiful the pictures are, still can't compare to seeing it in person.

Amazing!. One those place you can't miss in paris, in the ilê de la cité, just watch those gargoyles!We also went when the mass was about to start, 15 minutes before, and we also had goosebumps with the amazing organs of the cathedral.

Incredibly beautiful. Notre-Dame is an amazing structure. It is awe-inspiring when you think about the limited technology that was possessed during the time it was built and that hundreds of years later it is still stand and just as magnificent as it was the day it was finished. It's worth the wait to climb up to the bell towers and see the view and the gargoyles.

Great view and workout 426 steps to the top. A great quick tour if you are lucky enough to beat the lines and once you finish you can walk directly into the cathedral if you like. A great view if the city once you reach the top and then you can also visit the bell tower there. A great online or once you arrive tour so check it out, you won't be disappointed.

Beautiful view!. We waited in line for just over an hour (wear your blanket scarves if you visit in February, as the line is in the shadow of the cathedral), but it was worth it when we found out study abroad students can get in for free! There are around 400 steps to the top, with no elevator, so don't forget to wear some comfortable shoes. The view from the top is beautiful, and you can see quite a few gargoyles from the walking path. We even went into the belfry and saw some of the bells before we climbed to the complete top of the tower for a panoramic view of Paris. At the top, you can really see that you're in the center of the city!

Absolutely worthwhile. First off, you'll likely wait in a slow moving, potentially long line. My girlfriend and I went on a rainy and windy day, which made the line that much more difficult to withstand but it was absolutely worth it! If you feel physically ok to walk up the towers, this is a must do. When in line, it could become frustrating that the line moves so slowly. When you do get up the tower though, you'll be glad that that they don't just shovel people through.

imposing. They are architecturally intricate and indeed very ornate in detail. When you gaze at them the famous story of ' hunchback of Notre-dame' come alive if you have seen the film or the TV show. Very rich piece of cultural and religious by-gone era. France could be very proud of this.

Greeted by divine choir singing. The cathedral is every bit what the legend tells us. A must on the grand tour of Paris. The treasures are countless, the atmosphere impregnated with fervour and spirituality.

Get Ready To Climb. I suggest you go as early as you can as there is strict crowd control (that's a good thing.) The stair case is winding and narrow and you can only go as fast as the person ahead of you. My favorite views of Paris is from here. The iconic Eiffel Tower and its surroundings is a perfect postcard.

387 Steps. Not for the faint of heart--or feet, but doable. The good news is that there are stops along the way. The first is the gift shop. (By the way, if you see something you like on the way up, get it. You won't see it again on the way down.) The second is the rampart over the entrance about half-way up. Then you either do or don't take the last 100+ steps to the top of the bell tower.There are other places in Paris with better views--the large brownish iron tower by the river comes to mind, but the fun of climbing the stairs at Notre Dame lies in knowing that people--including hunchbacks--have been doing it for five hundred years.

Just Amazing. Such an amazing beautiful piece of architecture.It's definitely worth doing when you visit Paris. Please get your Paris Museum pass to skip the queues as the lines here are very long and slow.

Christmas morning in front of Notre-Dame de Paris. It was really special and magical on Christmas morning in front of the Cathedral when the Towers bells started the song.. It was so powerful and we really felt Christmas happening.
Just Amazing!. We loved our visit. Such an amazing beautiful piece of architecture. If you can find a spot to sit and take in the wonders of it. This is a must place to visit if you are in paris.

Best View In Paris!!. My daughter and I waited in line in the cold for the oppertunity to climb the 400 steps to the top of Notre-Dame. We were in the last group that went up for the day. It was worth the 35 minutes we had to stand in the freezing cold!! There are multiple viewing stops at the top. You can see everywhere over the city. Better views than the Eiffel Tower or Arc de Triomphe. You are eye level with the gargoyles, and even go into the bell tower. I know the lines in the summer will be much longer, but it is well worth the wait!!!
Iconic landmark. Notre Dame cathedral is an iconic landmark in Paris and is worth a visit especially now that the outside has been cleaned and you can more easily see the carvings on the facade.

Let s go !. It s Better to do it when the weather is beautifulYou should be patient.... Or wake up early to be at 09 amBut it s really worth it !What a view, what a style , I love the bells areaIt was a good surprise
Day trip. Imposing and impressive. A must if you visit Paris! Beautiful stain glass windows. Beautifully decorated. Inspirational experience!
Love is in the air. Beautiful Cathedral on the banks of the River Seine, perfect for a stroll around the canal and admiring the ancient architecture.

Worth the climb. Like most people I stood in line forever and then climbed the many stairs up to the gargoyles the first time I visited Paris. It's definitely worth doing and I'd recommend adding it to your itinerary - just allow a lot of time to get to the front of the line.

My dreamed trip to Paris.. You will love the art, and architecture if you are religious in any way, or not, MUST SEE This cathedral is amazingly beautiful Gothic gem . So don't leave this off your list. It was a highlight of our Paris trip--as important as going to the Eiffel Tower and also the Museum of levorne.

Climb to the top and get there early!. It's Notre Dame and you're in Paris. Don't skip climbing to the top. Not only do you get a lovely view of the Seine and the rest of Paris, you get to see the building's gargoyles up close and personal. Beware if you have knee issues though - the climb is for the active!

A must to see in Paris. It is one of the most beautifull places in Paris, I think it is a must to see, but some people just see inside, I recommend to see the upside of the cathedral. there is a 3-5 minutes walk in the stairs to go up and most of the times you have to wait in a queue for long time. It has two floor in the top and you will have a great view to all sides of Paris. You will enjoy it and a it is also a good place to photography.
Must see. This is a must see, it is free and the location is beautiful. There is a long line to get in, but it moves quickly.

Fabulous!. If you love art, architecture or are religious in any way, this is a MUST SEE. It is amazingly beautiful. So don't leave this off your list. It was a highlight of our Paris trip--as important as going to the Eiffel Tower.

A must when visiting Notre-Dame. If you want to get close to the gargoyles and see a beautiful view of Paris, you must visit the Towers. Don't get intimated by the +300 steps you have to take, it is worth it once you get to the top.
Avoid being hit with a selfie stick. This must be the busiest selfies spot in all Paris with so many people busy taking their own photo that they don't care about anyone else
Great place to hand and people watch.. Great site and area even just to "hang out" and people watch. Short walk over to some very nice restaurants that have a mix of tourists and locals.

a fun climb and an incredible treat at the top. u better be in good shape! its a long narrow climb
once at the top u can climb even further into the bell tower
an incredible piece of architecture and view at the top
at the night is better. Was there during the November by night and i must say that Notre-dame looks even more Gothic and dark by the shadow of the night.

Notre Dame: Center Location for your Parisian Adventures. Notre Dame is one of the classic stops on any good tour of Paris. If you're going during the busy tourist times of the year, expect it to be busy and for there to be a line. I would recommend getting there early or trying to aim for January-March when Paris might not be the most beautiful but the lines are nonexistent.
Must visit in paris. Its a wonderful church and a must visit if you are in Paris. Nicely decorated inside and wonderful architecture
No trip to Paris is complete without a visit to the Cathedral.. Always a pleasure to visit. The interior always is a magnificent sight no matter how many times you visit.

Not for the 'Faint of Heart' but Oh, so worth it!. With lots of (but impressive!) spiral stairs (quite uneven!) and a small landing leading to the top of the towers this attraction is not for the 'faint of heart'. But those who are willing to take on and able to complete the challenge are rewarded with spectacular views of not only the surrounding city but also of timeless architecture and craftsmanship. I admire the work of the many hands and years that were spent constructing this building and its towers. The sounding bell of the clockwork is majestic as it swoops through the surrounding area. Oh, I held my breath so many times...

Nice exterior but nothing special inside. It has a wonderful exterior. However the interior has nothing special to offer. The interior is only ordinary standard as compared to other churches in paris and Europe. There is a john paul ll statue at the side of the cathedral.

Think of Victor Hugo and climb the towers. Think of Victor Hugo and climb the towers
Top of almost 800 years of history, contemplate Paris ... and do not miss the gargoyles ... the sculptors had fun ... we also

Tourists that break rules!!!!. We visited Notre Dame as all visitors to Paris should. It ticked all the boxes that one expects of a place so well known. Stone work, stained glass, statues, staged nativity scenes, etc. We have gotten used to much more than usual armed security outside and gypsy women beggars. BUT - why do people STILL use flash photography in NO FLASH zones, stop dead in your pathway or in front of a religiously important painting or position to take a SELFIE. Be prepared for the "modern tourist" who spends more time taking photos of spots and scripts than actually enjoying the processes of walking, reading, breathing and feeling a destination - every year and every place we go it seems to get worse, especially when we do return trips and compare!

This grand ol'dame has still got the goods.. If there is one sight in paree that isn't likely to leave you indifferent, it's this one... dramatically towering alongside the banks of the Seine. To call it breathtaking is simplistic... it's overwhelming when you consider it took labourers over a hundred years to complete. Who doesn't remember the haunting image of Quasimodo, Hugo's anti-hero swingin'dem bells from its famous bell tower or the scary gargoyles that literally make you stop in your tracks... grotesque, yet captivatingly beautiful.. Inside, the stunning rose window has been courting and seducing millions of travellers and is without a doubt one of Paris's wonders.But many come here for the spiritual comfort or creepy interest to gawk at the archeological crypt. Over all, for sheer aesthetic grandeur it takes a lot to beat, being the apex in the Gothic pantheon with a harmony that focuses all your senses, especially its facade which is recognisable all over the world. One has to stand still at the end of its plaza and allow the grand vista to sweep over you. I love its portals and the series of 28 statues representing the Kings of Israel. Not even its Grand Gallery can avert your eyes from its imposing ornate towers which, when you have climbed the requiem of stairs, offer a view from its eerie that looks down a plunge of 68 mt over the IIe de la Cite, the Seine and the whole city.... just a few steps to climb... all 400 of them, shuffling behind the constant flow of minions or devotees training for marathons. I love the rear facade... its perspective is as beautiful as its front with those stunning Gothic spires. You would find it hard to find in Paris better example of Medieval history, and Paris certainly abounds with enough treasures, yet nowhere is it as hauntingly gorgeous as this grand dame's long halls, vaulted ceilings with soft light filtering through the intricate stained glass that elevates medieval history regarding divinity and humanity. Just like royalty, a queen to be specific, the cathedral welcomes the visitor to its grandeur... but wait till you see her twin sister, just north of the city in St-Denis, whose basilica and royal necropolis will knock your socks off.

The center of Paris!. Love stopping by the cathedral! It's at the center of Paris! Very busy and the line to tour the facility can be very long. Lots of shops and restaurants around this area to pick up tourist items. Be prepared, number of women hang out and ask for money in this area. It's a must see in Paris! When you look at the front of the church, see if you can see the statue of one of the saints holding his decapitated head! It caught my eye right away!
A must visit!. We were like kids in a sweet shop. At every turn you have these incredible structures. It really is a superb City.

Great view lots of stairs. The view from the tower is great and is well worth seeing. However there are a lot of spiral stairs to the top. Definitely do not visit this attraction of you can't walk up lots of spiral stairs with uneven surfaces and a small landing. Defiantly wear comfortable walking shoes. I completely enjoyed my experience and would do it again!

Out of this world.. Notre-Dame Cathedral is easy to reach by metro, as many other of Paris places. it is a very popular place, so mind you at the time of visit. I don't know exactly the timings but of course morning is the best time. There is a long line to enter even when is not high season, but goes inside rather quickly. Pictures are allowed and during that time some areas where in renovation. Be careful with people asking for donations while you are doing line, some of them are so insistent and at a times demanding, and that becomes irritating, and you don't want to be rude with anybody in front of a church. It is surrounded by cafes and is also close to Saint Michelle fountain which is a beautiful spot. Take as many pictures as possible.
เรดา. It's really very beautiful I want everyone to see it !!! It started off very มัน สวยงามจริงๆ เหลือเชื่อมากกก เลย ต้องร้อง

Beautiful Towers....So Much To Take In. The Notre Dame towers are quite simply breathe taking and only gets better each time you see them. We visited on a Saturday and it was busy but still possible to get a good photo as long as you get the right position. We also visited them at night to get the illuminated shot which was spectacular. Wrap up if going at night as the square gets breezy.We stopped by a little bakery nearby and got a walnut brownie to eat at the site and sat for around 10-15 minutes just taking in the view.Be cautious however as there are street sellers hanging around as the area is typically quite touristy.Do remember to take a camera however as you won't want to miss the opportunity!
Gorgeous . There are at least 180 stairs to go up and down. When you are up there, there are a lot of gargoyles and of course bells. Also, there is a beautiful view of Paris.

Very good. We visited it with the hop on hop off bus. very beautiful architecture and also very busy, it is free to enter but I believe there is a fee to pay if you want to go up. nice little restaurants close by for lunch.

GREAT. GREAT
amazing building high rise tower and nice decorated church
good locations beautiful Cathedral
do go by your self take tour better

Awesome!. I only went here because my girlfriend insisted, but I'm so glad she did! There's plenty of history behind the landmark and the architecture is stunning. Great views as well - better than the Eiffel Tower, in my opinion - so well worth climbing the steps for. As there is restricted space in the towers, they only allow a certain number of people in at a time though so be prepared to wait a bit to get in, but it's a must do if it's your first trip to Paris.

Chimeras and Gargoyles of Notre-Dame. The Towers of Notre-Dame should not be missed while visiting the cathedral itself. The visit to the towers is equally impressive. After climbing the stairs to the balcony, you’ll be able to meet all the famed chimeras and gargoyles of Notre-Dame up close and personal. Besides, you will enjoy one of the most spectacular views of Paris. All the fascinating chimeras, together with the outstanding view of the city, offer great photo opportunities. Do not miss!The entrance to the towers is situated on the left side of the cathedral. The queues are usually very long and move very slowly, as access is limited to 20 people every 10 minutes or so. In the peak season, you could wait up to 2 hours to get inside the towers. However, all the inconvenience is totally worth it. The architecture is fantastic and the views are simply charming.

Definitely worth climbing up the 387 steps. It took us a while to get there, we have waited for hours in the morning, the steps were very steep, but the view was breathtaking. I was very excited about this since I am a photographer and I can say that the scenes I caught from up there are the best I ever made. You can see literaly everything and Paris is magnificent from up there.
landmark. its a landmark monument in paris. easy to find out. and the cathedral along with it is worth to visit.
Interesting Architecture. A good tourist spot. A must for 1st visit to Paris. As with many Cathedrals, interesting details and history.
Such a beautiful Structure. It feels like you are in an old Disney movie - or about to witness a royal wedding. See if you can either on foot or one of the many sightseeing trips

A beautiful Cathedral. This was my favorite Cathedral that we were able to visit in Europe it does hold a candle to The Vatican (less crowded too). Sits on a quaint Island is surrounded by history and the beautiful city of Paris. If you miss it while in Paris you must go back to visit it. Just beautiful.

Worth visiting. After a great disappointment I visited Notre Dame Cahterdral and It was a pleasant experience. Its beautiful from outside and very beautiful from inside. Its replica of Duomo (Milan) and fabulous. Square is very good and you can click picture. The view is very good from across the road you see the Catherdral with river. Picture at bridge is good. There are two train station nearby RER B is just 10 steps away.

Worth the climb. Wasn't sure if my knees would be up to this. The short climb to the reception/cashier was a good test, which was good. Really enjoyed it, including the belfry. Just glad we weren't in the belfry on the quarter hour, when the bell rings!

Inner peace. We visited the cathedral at the end of our trip. We were literally exhausted; hoping for nothing, we went there just for its name as an important cathedral in Europe. But the experience was fabulous. When we were in, the choir was on. There was this solo vocalist, singing in French. But, music requires no language isn't; and so there we were, completely lost in the shear beauty of the voice. We spent close to one hour, never realising that it was an hour that was passed. Like I mentioned above, we felt inner peace!

LOve it. I think that this cathedral is Notre-Dame de Paris, also known as Notre-Dame Cathedral or simply Notre-Dame, is a historic Catholic cathedral on the eastern half of the Île de la Cité in the fourth arrondissement of Paris. I loved it !

A must to your visit to Paris. I have tried to visit The towers of Notre Dame numerous times on various visits to Paris but have been defeated by the queues. This time I was determined to visit the towers so despite the cold weather we queued 30 minutes before the opening time and as a result we were able to be in the first group of people that were allowed up the tower. I can understand why there are long queues as there is only room for a single file and the guards need to wait for a number of people to leave the tower roof before they can allow more people up. If the first group is spell bound by the view and are taking a long time to take photos or just take in the view it would add to the waiting time of those below.
Beautiful Church!. This church is so beautiful and right on an island on the Seine - this is a must see when visiting Paris.

Worth the visit. I was unable to get inside due to the extremely long line, which is also why this just for four stars. However sitting and looking at it from the outside it was still amazing. However very crowed.

A church is a church, bust Notre Dame is a landmark filled with history!. This cathedral is absolutely amazing! Yes it costs a few Euros to enter, but the history of the world for many centuries is right here! If you're adventurous, climb the stairs and check out the view, and the gargoyles! It's now clear why the clergy (and the hunchback) were a little "off"-all the water storage containers are lined with lead! OMG. Just a bit of trivia for you!

Tours de Notre Dame / Paris. I visited Notre-Dame Cathédral, Gothic art, who took about 200 years to be built; I was inside with friends of Paris and they explique us the portails topped by the famous KingsGallerie composed of statues representing the Kings of Judas and Israel.The unique Rose-Window has 10 m in diameter, and is very beautiful.I had a fantastic view of the Capital.
Well when in Paris. If your in Paris and you do not visit here it would be like not going to the Eiffel Tower take a coffee and just sit and watch the world go by.

Quasimodo lived here. Really, does anyone NOT go to Notre Dame? Be sure to head up and down both side aisles and view the area behind the alter. You'll get a sense of history more than anywhere else in Paris.

A must to every Paris visitor. Even in cold and rainy January days this tourist magnet is attracting many visitors.The much better sight on the outer architecture is from the Seine riverside or from the wonderful park at the rear side of the cathedral. Most impressive are the devil faced gargoyles . Another attractive view is the Seine bridge at the rear side (sorry under reconstruction partly 01.2016) its railing is covered with thousands of love padlocks .
Lovely at night!. Beautiful lit up on a winter's night!, when the crowds have gone, but it is also one of the great churches of the world. Try to visit when a recital is taking place.
Just stunning. Every time I go here I see something else to wow me ..... The stained glass windows are breath taking .

Glad I saw it. My trip to Notre Dame was extremely brief. It was so brief that I didn’t have time to actually go inside the cathedral because there was a line approximately one city block long to get in. That being said, the façade is incredible and I’m glad I got to see it. There is a pretty cool statue of Charlemagne in a park in front of the cathedral as well.

Old world charm. This place exudes history. I felt like I was taken back to another time in history. The detail is incredible. The only thing I didn't like is that it was very busy and lots of kids pushing their way through. I went in February and I'm not sure if there is a quieter time.

Everyone knows Quasimodo!. Beautiful architecture and centre of one of my personal favourite story with Quasimodo! We went in July and didn't get to go in as que was very long and it was very hout outside to stand in sun for what looked like couple of hours. Next time I hope!
GREAT LANDMARK. Well worth a visit. The stained glass windows are superb and the whole place exudes peace and quiet. A must!
Typical French beautiful. By visit Paris I came along the Notre Dame, really worse to visit, so wonderful, even if you don't have religion, this is so excellent, you must go.

Beautiful. We were there in June 2015 and there were lots of people. We were in line at least 45 min, but it could have been the time that were there (2PM). The stain glass and rooms off the main area were interesting. You can go to the top for a great view and to see the gargoyles. There was a small gift area on the right as you leave, bought a cross and keychain and the prices seemed to be fair.
Take binoculars!. This will enable you to see high-up details of "grotesques", carvings, etc. Also beware of pickpockets in crowded touristy places!

Great workout - but long lines depending on what time of year you go. The walk up the stairs to the towers is a real fat burner. It was beautiful and has a lot of historic value.
You should get there early if you don't want to stand in line for hours though.

Simply spectacular view. The view is what it's all about. The actually inside of the Notre Dame is nice, but in my opinion the top is even better. So the lines start packing up quite early in the day, so you'll want to get there at around 8am if you want to get up there early. The climb itself is predictably pretty harsh and strenuous, so it's not advisable to any little children or elderly people. However for everyone else it's definitely well worth the walk up to the top. The officials usually send 20 people up at a time and wait for the groups of people to go down before sending more up.The views are well worth the price to go up. Because of the location and the lower height, the views even shame the Eiffel Tower. The front facing view is the main feature, but the left and even back facing views are almost as good. If you are bringing large photographic equipment though do be warned that it is very narrow up the top, so no large bags or tripods.

Stunning experience. Long queue at the entrance due to security issues but still worth waiting in any case. Climb and you won't regret by watching so amazing view of Paris including Eiffel Tower and Montmartre. After exploring the bell and balcony you can rise up to the top of the tower. Several times we visited the cathedral itself but never the towers. Finally we did it!
Very special Cathedral. This is one of the most famous attraction in Paris and a lot of movies talked about it. also, the shapes of this place is unique

Not sure what all the fuss is. I'm not sure what all the fuss is when it comes to Notre Dame. Yes it's famous, but it's so similar to so many churches in central Europe. I can't tell them all apart and this one did not stand out. Ok maybe because it's big? But size is not all that matters...

Must climb and must see!. Notre Dam is very beautiful inside, but from the towers it is AMAZING!A fascinating Paris and stunning Gothic architecture is so close that you can touch it with your hand! And of course if you like Victor Hugo stories, you should never miss it!
Nice view with amazing picture possibilities. Its very nice up there and you get the possibility to see Eiffel tower and a lot else of paris. The gargoyles are amazing
world landmark to see. if you think how old this is , you really thnk how could they have constructed this master piece or architechture and art, see it , you will not regret it.
Amazing. Truly a beautiful RC Church, This magnificent piece of both Catholicism and architecture is stunning. The tour is worth the wait in line

Beautiful. I would definitely recommend this to make your list of must sees in Paris. Most importantly don't just stand outside and take pictures but go in and explore this amazing church. Best of all it's free to get in, just get there early because the line tends to be long-well worth it :)

A Different Aura. This cathedral is one of Europe's most renown and its organ is the world's most famous. Admission is free, but to climb the tower for panoramic views of the city costs 8.50 euros. Notre Dame is worth a quick visit to see what the fuss is about, but there's nothing spectacular to warrant going out of your way, especially if you've seen other cathedrals across Europe. However, it's located on the island in the middle of the city, so you'll undoubtedly have to walk pass it at some point. To get here, the nearest metro station is Cite on Line 4. If you plan on using the metro frequently--which isn't a necessity because Paris is a fairly walkable town--buy a carnet of 10 metro tickets for 14.10 euros, rather than paying 1.80 euros for each ticket individually. The 1-Day Mobilis tickets (for unlimited 24-hr use of public transit) are only economical if you plan on using public transportation more than 4 trips per day since it costs 7 euros.

A Must See in Paris!. Notre Dame is amazing with amazing history and architecture. It took over 200 years to build. The stained glass windows are truly impressive. If you happen to be in Paris on a Sunday they still hold Mass in the Cathedral! Must see.

Worth the wait for the view. I truly believe this is a little bit of a somewhat hidden gem of Paris (in comparison to other highlights)When facing the front of Notre-Dame if you go down the left side of the building. There you will find a line. This is a line to go up into the towers.The towers are in the Paris Museum Pass which I highly recommend for anyone going to 2 or more of any of the museums, attractions and city highlights.I would suggest going on a clear day as when you get up there the beautiful view of Paris is even better without the smog/haze. Also go in the early morning or late afternoon when there is not to much sun on the line area. As you may sit there for at least an hour +. Go with a friend if possible and take turns in the line. As with all major Paris attractions there are plenty of places to get food, drinks and souvenirs. Also with all popular Paris attractions watch out for the pick pockets and con artists. If you can hold out on eating high priced fast snack food in the area i would suggest strolling across Pont de l'Archevêché bridge and sitting in one of the lovely bistros along the river.This is not an attraction for people with disabilities, heart conditions or who have very poor health. There are allot of stairs and the passage is very very narrow in some places. So if you are claustrophobic or very afraid of heights skip this.It can take at least 15min to climb to the top and that is at a good pace. They give you a time limit when at the top to see the view and take pictures. The catwalk up there is very narrow and very high. But if you can get over all that the view is so worth it.

Early morning inspiration! . We went at 8am on New Year's Eve and were able to quietly explore this beautiful church. I would recommend going early as its quiet but we couldn't go up to the bell towers until 10. There was a mass going on and it was very spiritual. We stayed a few meters away and the bells at midnight in New Year's Eve were incredible. It went on for 10 minutes! A great way to see in the new year!

It's a Church-ssshhhhhh. This was another place we visited that was sooooooo worth the visit. The beauty of this place is absolutely breath-taking. I loved it. But one thing to remember is that this is a living, breathing, functioning house of worship and should be treated as such. Residents of France come here to worship (although I really don't see how with all the tourists). I am so grateful that they allow people like me in to see this place of beauty and experience it firsthand. So remember although it is beautiful and you want to talk about it with your friends - be QUIET and respect what this place is meant to be. Perhaps look into attending a service which is allowed and would submerse you even more into the Notre Dame Cathedral experience.

Your legs.. A gorgeous piece of history. This fantastic building, providing you with some fantastic architecture. The views of Paris are brilliant. Sadly, your legs will suffer! Especially when you think you can make it to the very top bits just to get another view, your legs will hate you a little bit more. But, totally worth it! 100% worth it. Go early, avoid queues and don't rush yourself.

The Dame of Paris. One of the most beautiful and majestic religious structures ever built. Nice to tour but for the real experience do attend an evening Mass. The Mass delivered in French and Latin includes Gregorian Chants and Angelic Choirs. You can also go up into the towers for an exceptional view from the IIe de la Cite, (the island)
