The lighting inside the church adds to the whole gothic feel of the experience. We visited around 9.30am and although there was a bit of a cue outside it wasn't long before we where walking through the front door.

Worth the wait for the views of Paris and the close-ups with the gargoyles and the giant bell!. Worth the wait for the views of Paris and the close-ups with the gargoyles and the giant bell! Many, many stairs to climb. It's a great workout with a terrific reward.

Long lines. The first time we went to Paris we enjoyed walking thru but the second time we went later in the day and it was so crowded....I think you need to decide if it is worth it to go in and spend the time. I actually enjoyed the gardens outside more than the inside.

Notre-Dame Cathedral. Bought a museum pass ahead of time which we did not need here as they were letting everyone in for free on this day. It is gorgeous inside. Gothic loftiness at its best. Along the Seine and the Ile de la Cit this is a majestic cathedral and one of the most famous of any remaining churches, this one build 8 centuries ago.

A Must Visit. I've been to Paris more than 100 times during the past 35 years. You'd think I'd be taking Notre-Dame Cathedral for granted by now. That is not the case. I visited the interior of Notre-Dame again during our most recent visit in April of 2015, and during almost every trip I take time to admire the graceful structure from the left bank or strolling through the open plaza which lies at her feet.

History. Notre-Dame de Paris ( "Our Lady of Paris"), also known as Notre-Dame Cathedral or simply Notre-Dame, is a historic Catholic cathedral on the eastern half of the Île de la Cité in the fourth arrondissement of Paris.] The cathedral is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture, and it is among the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world. The naturalism of its sculptures and stained glass are in contrast with earlier Romanesque architecture.The cathedral has 10 bells. The largest, Emmanuel, original to 1681, is located in the south tower and weighs just over 13 tons and is tolled to mark the hours of the day and for various occasions and services. This bell is always rung first, at least 5 seconds before the rest.

Lots of small stairs. Waiting in line for about 90 minutes which wasn't too surprising. There are a LOT of very small stairs to go up the tower. They curve around so they are pretty thin which isn't a problem if you are average size, however at one point people were coming down at the same time we were going up, that was very tight. Eventually the small space made me a little claustrophobic (which does happen on occasion). Up top it has some nice views but is mainly covered in wires so pretty hard to get very good photos. Gargoyles up close were cool. My disappointment was when you exit the towers you have to go wait in another line to go inside the cathedral. Really thought you should have been able to skip that line as you already paid and waited for the towers.

not for the claustrophobic. we came up here as much to see the gargoyles as to see the view- both are pretty spectacular. the security netting all around the top is disappointing. The mesh is too small to get a camera lense through, so all our photos were spoiled by it. when we reachd the platform by the stairs down, they stopped us as the stairs were temporarily closed. we were given no information on why the stairs were closed, or for how long. more and more people kept coming up and crowding onto the small platform, and it got a bit scary. after 15 minutes, we were allowed down. the attraction itself is great, but they need to manage the crowds better.

Breathtaking. The Towers of Notre-Dame is one sight in Paris you don't to miss. My wife and I were lucky enough to attend mass at this beautiful cathedral and were amazed by the spiritual feeling we both received. Inside and out are both marvels of architecture.it is a must see.

Worth the wait. This is one of those attractions where you can't avoid a lengthy queue, even if you buy tickets beforehand. Access to the top towers is probably the best feature and the climb up those tight twisting stairs is a unique experience in it's own, unless you are claustrophobic.
Worth the climb. After viewing the cathedral this is worth the climb up the spiral stairs of this tower. 387+/- stairs. Magnificent architecture.

Beautiful view of Paris. A must in Paris. Going into the church had a long queue but it would take only at most 30 minutes. Free entrance. Going into the tower would take longer time since Notre Dame staff limits the people going inside since the steps into the tower is very tight and it takes awhile to climb 327 steps. The view of Paris is breathtaking and then you can get a closer look of the church's bell tower and the gargoyles. If you'll be skipping Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame is a good alternative.

Stay outside. Notre Dame is a magnificent Gothic cathedral. There are many in Europe. I personally think Sacre Couer in Montmarte or Westminster is better. Beautiful stained glass. St Germain is very similar, without the crowds. The towers are imposing. The view is not worth the extra cost or the three hour wait, even with skip the line tickets

Beautiful Sounds Beautiful to See....... TOWERS of Notre-Dame. Beautiful to see in person and so wonderful to hear the bells of the towers ! Great place to meet people and walk around the grounds... Paris is so lovely......this is one more place that you want to see when you go to Paris !!

Been many times but never enough!. It had been at least 6 years since I had been up the towers, and although I've been doing it since 1984, my continuing pleasure comes from accompanying students who have never been. This time we got in line by 8:30, which meant that once they opened at 10, we only had a short wait to get in. In the high tourist season, if you wait until10 to get in line, you'll be waiting for hours in the heat. So get there early.The climb is challenging - about 400 steps, I think. You'll be stopping regularly in order to wait for the groups in front of you to advance, because it's a one-way passage. So relax and enjoy the view. Do check out the belfry with the old bells from days past, and do go all the way around to the back so you can see the main steeple. The whole passage will take you 45 minutes or an hour, and there's also a nice garden area when you exit, so stop and take a rest there. Don't buy the overpriced food in the sandwich places across from where you stand in line. have someone hold your place and go a block or two further north where food is more reasonable. And then do lunch in the Quartier Latin.

Ding Dong. The cathedral itself is a little dim but the sunlight which pours through the rose windows allows the visitor to appreciate the craftsmanship of the glaziers.

Great!. Climbing on the towers of Notre-Dame is a must-to-do thing when visiting monuments in Paris. beautifully well preserved. No visit to Paris is complete without Notre Dame. it is easy to get lost in history and romance and it is close to great food and markets

Must visit. One of the most visited places in Paris. Full of Catholic History and Paris backgrounds. Masses are running all day while visitors enjoy the Architeture, statues and paints.
Notre-Dame. They were doing work on this when we were there, but still amazed by this iconic building, look fantastic in the flesh.
Amazing architecture!. This is a must see site. Loved everything that was in the churchbuilding, and all the details on the outside.
Gargoyles. Get there early and climb to the top. Its really cool. But lots of steep spiral steps to the top. If you are out of shape you might not want to tackle this.

See my review of Notre Dame where I tell about the towers tour.. I already wrote about this when I submitted the Notre Dame review. This does cost money and there is a long line. You have a limited time to climb the stairs and see the towers. It is well worth it.

Wonderful Atmospheric Experience. We walked up the 400 stairs to the Notre Dame towers in June, it was pouring out, and it made the experience wonderfully atmospheric...you could almost see Quasimodo peaking around the corners. The view of Paris from the Towers is terrific, a totally different perspective. The Gargoyles on the Tower walls are fantastic and worth the long climb up for pictures, as are the huge bells. There is no warning or information provided ahead of time that you have to climb 400 stairs up, so anyone with limited mobility should be forewarned. All in all, it's well worth effort to get up to the top, a terrific experience...

The Gargoyles. It's a long climb to the top, but the views are amazing. You will also see the famous stone gargoyles that keep watch over Paris from the towers. An absolute must-see, but line up early. The line was already down the block before the attraction even opened on the day we visited.
Notre Dame. Very busy plaza during the day, best - & I think prettiest at night when it's illuminated. Stunning architecture.
Magnificent architecture. Church is old and ancient. The architecture is amazing. There is a fairly long queue to enter but the line moves quickly.

Notre Dame Cathedral itself is incredible, but the climb to the top is poorly managed. To be clear. Notre Dame Cathedral is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. It is stunning, beautiful, moving and absolutely massive. You MUST go see it. Notre Dame is free to enter and if there is a line to get in, it moves quickly. However, Notre Dame towers are a different story. There is a charge (I believe it's 8.5 Euro) to climb to the top. I've done this twice in my life and it's one of the most stunning views of Paris. You can see Sacre Coeur, Eiffel Tower and so much more. It's totally worth the climb (do suggest you're in good shape though- and that you're not claustrophobic). But this time, when we reached the top there was a bottleneck. At first we were able to move about, take great photos, enjoy the view, bond with the gargoyles...but then towards the opposite end of the towers, we got stuck and didn't move for about an hour. It seems that what happened was that they allow people up to the south tower, but because there's only one way up & down, they let people up, wait, and then let people down. In theory this may work, but on days with big crowds, it simply caused a huge bottleneck effect, confusion, and a group of annoyed tourists stuck on top of a tall building. It was incredibly frustrating and I felt like I wasted unecessary time. We had already waited over an hour to go up, and then to wait another 45 minutes to go down- it just didn't make sense. Poolry organized and not managed well to handle the crowds. It's a shame, because it's an amazing attraction.
Notre Dame. Everything you would expect from Notre Dame. Beautiful cathedral. Gets very busy and crowded but queue goes down quickly.
Not my cup of tea. The line is too long, slow, 422 steps; nice view from the top. I do not know if I would recommend this one The line, as i said, its much long.

Near sundown visit then walk down to pony neuf with a bottle of wine.. The line up was too massive to wait out the climb up the towers when I was there but Notre Dame can be thoroughly enjoyed without the hike. Much narrow than you will imagine it to be, subduedly lit, inviting and seeping its 800 year old history, it's quite the experience walking the outer aisles and transepts and around the apse. Large circular trays of tiered lit candles to the sides of the entrance hold the prayers and memories of visitors. There is a special gargoyle that you are challenged to locate, hidden among the many in this magnificent gothic cathedral. Hint: go for chocolate crepes in the outdoor cafe and look up.
Huge and beautiful!. These towers are huge and beautiful! Its gives a typical feeling of old Parisian kind of life. The River is just nearby.
Always worth the trip. Notre Dame is the quintessential labor of love and devotion. The Rosetta windows are extraordinary every time I see them
Great City Views. Be aware that there are about 400 steps to get to the top of the tower. It is well worth it to experience the views.

Make this a early tour. Very busy. I like to be there early. Go to the top if you can. Beautiful views and a once in a life time type visit. Have a tour booked in advance if you can. After stop for a cafe and snack there is lots to choose in the area.

A Cathedral Like No Other. This is by far one of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe (and that is saying a lot since there are so many in Europe). The stained glass windows are incredible and their beauty indescribable (because they are like nothing you have seen anywhere before). Go early and avoid the crowds because it will surely be crowed during the middle of the day. The view in the above pic is nice, but personally I prefer the view of Notre Dame from the back which, in my opinion, sets it apart from the other cathedrals I have visited in Europe. Anyway, Notre-Dame Cathedral is not to be missed.

Ok if you like churches.. Good for free. It's really busy inside and out. It's right in the heart of the city so there's lots to do around there. Might as well see it as you'll likely be in the area anyhow.
A magnificent cathedral. Its a huge cathedral. When we entered, the father was giving sermon. There was a peaceful silence inside. The interiors are grand.

Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris. The long line to go into the cathedral was long but it moves quite fast. Lots to see inside but even more from the top! Line up on the north side of the cathedral to climb the tower! Worth the price!

Climb to see the best view . . .. Stunning ... I pre bought a ticket to climb the 484 stairs . . to the top AND I am terrified of heights, but this had me feeling safe.. AND it was stunning amazing views from up there.. would do it again next trip .. totally worth the wait in the que to climb the stairs. . THIS is something you HAVE to do ! ! !

A MUST, BUT ONLY FOR THE ABLE BODIED. This is a must for all able bodied visitors. The views from the top are incredible as are the gargoyles up close. The spiral staircase is very narrow and includes over 300 steps.
Breathtaking view. One of the most amazing view that I ever seen. Be prepared for very long queueing. Just tip to save some time book you tickets online.i
amazing towers. great towers Beautiful on the inside and outside. Lots of pictures were taken. Loved seeing the bell tower.
Notre Dame. Great architecture didn't climb the 387 steps long queues to get in good souvenir shopping nearby...

Long Lines, lots of pushing and shoving.. Beautiful medieval cathedral with a HUGE line. I fail to understand why there is a line for this attraction. St. Peters in Rome where you have to clear security it is understandable. There was just a limit of people allowed in the cathedral.

Not to miss !!. We've been here a few times in the past . This time we decided to take an easy afternoon stroll in l'Ile de la Cite , enjoying the eternal mass of visitors infront of THE Cathedral , look at the impressive Towers , watch the young "going to be married soon"young couples taking photos (and envy them just a little ) .Don't miss it .
Do not miss. Do not miss, buy a museum pass and always aline, go at sunset and take binocs with you, lots of sets, but take your time

Enjoy the gargoyles at the top of the Towers of Notre Dame. Climbing the spiral stairs to the top of the Towers of Notre Dame was very strenuous but worth it for the fantastic views at the top. I liked the views from atop the Arc de Triomphe but I liked the views from the Towers even more. One of the things I liked most about the Towers was the gargoyles. I don't know how many different ones are up there, but each one is intriguing. My favorite photo from my trip to Paris is the one with a gargoyle in the foreground with the Eiffel Tower in the distance. Be sure to go up the Towers when you visit Notre Dame Cathedral.
Photo's could never do this justice. Paris - so many wonderful buildings, so much to see and do, and beautiful buildings like this one free to the public.

Unique Experience. The line for the towers was quite long with almost an hour wait, but once we made our way up the very narrow staircase (not for the faint of heart), the view of Paris from the balcony was amazing. Visitors can go inside and see the bells and look out over the city through the gargoyles. Definitely worth a visit if you have time and energy.

Great view and close up with gargoyles!. My husband and I went up the towers of notre dame. The view was amazing and definitely worth the climb! You get very close to the gargoyles and the bells. We even went up while it was raining...still worth it! You can see the Eiffel Tower and the beautiful city of Paris below. If you're facing the front of Notre Dame the line starts on the left side of the building for the towers.
Notre Dame Cathedral. The glass painting in this huge cathedral is an art by itself. This huge structure depicts the rich culture french in the past
A must for a walking tour. So much history that a guided walking tour is highly recommended, not sure if long wait in line is worth it to visit or clime to the top

What a great view of Paris!. What a great way to see Paris and gain some history I took the trek up the stairs and was glad I did. Lots of great opportunities for photos. Go in the morning for the best photo opportunities, when the sun will be behind you. As you face the church, the line is on the left. Keep in mind they stop the line prior to closing time, so you have the opportunity to go up. I went late and saw a lot of people turned away.

For the Young, Curious & Foolish .... Yes, the ND towers are neat & Yes, I did them in my twenties. But, remember: stairs are narrow, one way - no turning back, low head room, crowded, & the view is "nice" but you'll have a much, much better view from Arc de Triomph, Sacre Coeur or Tour Eiffel. Think about what you're doing & weigh it out. Nice ....but ...
Very beautiful and great photos taken. Gorgeous, Went late morning and captured some amazing pictures of the sun peeking between the 2 towers.
Awe inspiring. The rose window is absolutely incredible. We were there during Sunday mass and couldn't get close to the alter, but the peace and beauty were timeless.

Spectactular. Such a beautiful, large church, it really is something special. Recommendation is to get there early or later on in the day as it gets really overcrowded with tourists. A mass is the church would be worth experiencing

Must do in Pais. We visited the towers on a Sunday morning. We arrived about 45 minutes before opening and was about 15th in the queue. The towers can get very long queues, the queue was an hour and a half on Saturday afternoon.There is lots of steps to get up to the top but it is well worth the effort. You get up close and personal with the Gargoyles and there is a fantastic view over the city. You can see lots of the main attractions like the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and Arc De Triomphe.Once we entered the towers the visit lasted for around an hour. You also see the large bell that they only ring a few times a year.I hope to visit when we return to Paris!

Wanted to photo the famous picture with the deamon and the city, all i got was a black security mesh!. It took over 1h in que to get in. Then 20 more min to pay and get up. Fineally at the top looking forward to get my picture of the statue deamon looking over the city and the eifeil, but what the %¤#. A new black mesh security is installed all over making pictures impossible from the tovers. Pictures of the city is possible from the top of the tower though.

Incredible french gothic architect and beautiful stain glass windows. The q moves very fast so don't let that put you off, its free in. I have been several times and I still enjoy each visit. I think it has signs saying no shorts. You should also walk around the structure as the back is also very interesting.
OK….but much better sights to see in Paris. We went to this cathedral after seeing several sights in Paris and found it a little dreary, crowded and not really worth the time.

Commands Respect. Beautiful must see 670 year old Catholic Cathedral. Still today remains as one of the worlds largest and most beautiful Cathedral ever built. You c an feel the powerful devotion to the Lord within its walls.
Nice quick pitstop. This was a nice historic building. An attraction which doesn't take much time unless you want to go inside.

Paris Best for Us. Our favorite attraction in Paris. We took the tour three time throughout our vacation. We had a bottle of wine, bread and cheese on the grounds and just enjoyed the gardens ... Beautiful and amazing.

Climb On Up! It's Worth It!. The towers of Notre-Dame offer both a vista view of the Seine and both banks of Paris and also close-up views of the sculptured gargoyles who look out over the same scene. If you are anywhere near the cathedral, explore it fully--including the towers. Don't miss them!

Very interesting and beautiful!. Amazing architecture and very interesting statues!
Did the whole walk and ended at notre dame cathedral!
Magical!

This is a must. Not our first kick at the cat but this place still takes your breath away, A fast moving line through a bit of security and you are in a place you will not see anywhere else. To be in this house and so see what they built so many centuries ago, your fenestrate for the whole visit. The structure so simple but amazing. Just pondering how this was constructed over 180 years. How does the vision remain and be consistent?take your time and just let the aura of the building and surroundings infuse into your body. Make sure you sit for a while. Be peaceful and recognize the significance of the Cathedral.It is always a must stop while in Paris. Stained glass windows so large you whole house will fit through them, Centuries old.Pause and appreciate.

Spiritual Experience. It is always fascinating to visit Notre-Dame. This time around my family was able to participate in mass celebration. The ambiance is an interesting combination of those who respect and enjoy a moment of spirituality and those others just curious about the building architecture and history.

Grand Tower- go in the morning. Notre Dame Cathedral is one of the major attractions in Paris. I came here many times and last time I visited in May 2015. We were in a hotel in Bibliotheque Fr Mitterrand and took Line 14 Metro, got down at Chatelet, then took Line 4 and got down at St Michel Notre-Dame. There was another option by RER C for direct train to Notre-Dame, however it was very infrequent at the time we went to Paris.Although the church is open to public, there is a fee to go up the towers about 400 steps. The view from the top was excellent.
A must see. Lovely building and great for photos. A must if you are a tourist in Paris. Very busy with tourists and locals.

Notre Dame-Do Not be Intimidated by the Line!. OK--do not be intimated by the line -it moves very quickly and is free. You will be disappointed in that the famous "Rose Window" is best viewed from the outside. There is a large pipe organ that blocks the view from the inside. The inside is not as impressive as you would think. Notre Dame is to be admired for its architecture and the park on the outside is the best place to view it. There is a metro stop very close by. Walk around the whole building -you cannot help but to be impressed by the magnificent structure

Stunning. Gargoyles! . Wonderful! Church bells! Bell tower! History! Architecture! Amazing! Kept touching the walls thinking how old they were! Loved it, more than the Vatican. So... my phone isn't cooperating to post pictures. Ugh.

Spectacular views, long line. Only one staircase, so they must carefully control visitors. That said, once you ascend the 240 steps, the views are beautiful, and you don't feel too crowded or rushed. We had a 2+ hour wait however, but grabbed a snack from a café to make it work

Not worth paying for. You would need brave an hour long queue, walk up a steep cylindrical staircase to see a panaromic (not so great) view of the city after paying a fee. It doesn't seem worth it. Rather, visit the church which is more spectacular.
Stunning. There are lways hoards of people for good reason : its stunningAllow plenty of time for the visit & book a guided tour - you will find far more than you will find alone
Notre -Dame. Very intriguing place to be as you go round the Cathedral and attentively listen to the story of the hunch back of Notre-Dame

The views we will never forget...and the gargoyles.... Climbing the towers of Notre Dame Cathedral was definitely one of the best things we have done in Paris. Try to arrive early enough to avoid long lines and start the ascent (be careful of your personal belongings while waiting in line - plenty of pickpocketing threats there). Of course it's not easy to climb 387 steps, but you will be rewarded with the most impressive 360 degrees vistas of Paris.Also, you will get so close to all elaborate details of the finest Gothic architecture - gargoyles, statues, ornaments...I would do this climb just for that... not even talking about the views... Obviously, you will benefit from a sunny day for terrific photo opportunities. Caution: do not attempt the climb, if you have knee problems: it is a rigorous exercise, to say the least. Descending will be even harder on your knees than going up.

Intersting. A par excellence gothic church ...around easter week visitors are not allowed in the nave n crossing areas ..only in the side aisles....go there on a sunny day to appreciate the stained glass otherwise quite gloomy n dull within ...without adequate light its difficult to look at the ribbed vaulting too...the artificial lights cast deep shadows all around

To The Ones that really appreciate Art, Stylish, History, Antique, Work and many other things.... It is just a dream to visit this well known place. I did visit Notre-Dame Cathedral in August with my two teenagers. My son was amazed with this stately building; full of extraordinary details at every single point you place your sight. It took us hours to go around the Cathedral and admire the richness of detail and creativity. It is a place that you can not miss in Paris. It is a Cultural and Historic legacy to us from those who lived to create this monument that can even bring tears in the eyes with an indescribable emotion of love, life and beauty. Good Luck! Visiting Notre-Dame Cathedral, feel the time and the emotion and share to others. Just being there says a lot of you.
Worth Visiting. The lines to get inside the sanctuary area are fast moving and free. If you have the time, it is worth getting in line.

There today long queues to climb up to those towers, but from there you have the best view over Paris and the river Sei. To endure the queue you need patience and energy to climb up to the Towers, but then you have (Accord to me) the best view along the river Seine in Paris - much better than from the Eiffel Tower!
A must see.. This beautiful Cathedral will forever leave a lasting affect on me. It's free to go in, which was a wonderful surprise. In awe of the talented craftsmen who built it.
Amazing. Beautiful Cathedral, the stained glass and artwork are unbelievable. All of the walls and glass tell the stories of the bible.

Amazingly Beautiful. The Cathedral is so beautiful with stained glass windows and sun shining through. Very old and yet majestic. We were able to tour even during morning mass which made it even more reverent.
Part of our walking tour. Great church to take pictures of the stained glass, beautiful setting,walking along the Seine surrounded by restaurants and bakeries
Hanging out with the. Very long lines. The entrance to the Tower tour is not the main cathedral; it is on the right side. Lots of winding, narrow stairs. Beatiful views.
must see. Everyone should go and see it! there is very special inside, very beautiful! I wish to comeback one day!

A must see when in Pairs!. A must see when in Pairs! A beautiful iconic site, just be careful at each of the tourist sites in Paris as there are children who will try and sell you things but whilst they are distracting you they are trying to pick pocket you. We were not affected by this as I had already been warned about it. If you ignore them you will be fine but I saw it happening at quite a few of the sites in Paris so be aware.
Incredible. Check the service times before you go. They limit the sights during services. The line will appear very long but moves super fast.

Family fun at Notre Dame bell towers. For those with younger children I recommend watching Disney's The Hunchback of Notre Dame before visiting. The kids loved finding all the similarities between what they saw in the movie and what they saw in person. This kept them really engaged and excited about our trip to Notre Dame and the bell towers. The stairs up the bell towers are plenty but we made a game out of it by calling my youngest "the stair master". She was so proud to be the stair master that she took on the lead role up and down the stairs and never complained once! We praised her for how strong her legs were and she just beamed with pride. My kids loved the gargoyles and took a ton of pictures of them. It was a fantastic day!
The Cathedral. A building like no other.. Be sure to go inside and tour the building. Bring your camera!! The lines may look long outside but move quickly..
Highly recommend going in!. Super beautiful from the outside and inside. It's very crowded almost all the time so buffer in some waiting time in the queues but totally worth your time.
The famous Cathedral. Amazing cathedral to visit. Rich in history and religion. Be sure to climb up to the top of the towers (400 steps) to see an amazing view of the city

stunning cathedral. The Notre Dame Cathedral is another must see on any visit to Paris. If your lucky and get their either first thing in the morning or late evening you might avoid the crowds. The cathedral is beautiful.
Awesome Place. Good view from here and one of the nicest places to be.This place has seen quite a bit of history. It gets crowded at time though.
Great French Cathedral . This French Catholic cathedral is not that old. Some 250 years old? Anyhow it is a great architectural building and a great symbolistic building for the Catholic

One of the most spectacular buildings in a city filled with Spectacular. One of the most spectacular structures in a city filled with spectacular, but long lines and a long wait for the towers makes it not as accessible as others. I would strongly recommend visiting the small Holocaust Memorial at the back of the structure, it is something you will not forget.Upside: Beautiful beyond measure, this is also a "working church", so there are usually services happening, which is lovely in itself. In a hurry? You can enter and take a 15 minute tour walking around the periphery. Have more time? There are endless nooks and crannies filled with art and religious statuary.Downside: (At least when we went and I have heard this is not uncommon) Tons of rude tourists, with their phones and cameras taking pictures with their flashes on, while the church attendants and priests attempt to stop them. It's dim and. . .cloistered. . .in the church, but many people apparently are not fans of available light photography. If you want to ascend to the tower, it can take an hour or more of waiting - try to find the best posssible time to go, which may be during the morning on a weekday. In the Fall or Spring (Paris in the Spring!). In the Summer, getting in to the Cathedral itself and, worse, the towers, can take quite a long time.

one of the nicest places in Paris both as a neihgbor and an image of a monument.. you should see that incredible building from all the angles! in front , from the back and of course across the river where in my opinion is the best view to reach it's full beauty ! besides in front of notre dame there is always too much crowd...

A must!. Although this is a church it is in fact so much more and needs to be appreciated as a centuries old Paris landmark. You will need to line up to enter. There's 2 lines - one in front to the church itself - free admission. The other line is along the left side of the building - to the towers; admission fee required or included with the paris museum pass. The line is very slow moving but worth it! The views are spectacular - not only of the square in front and the city but also of the church spires, and all the amazing and weird statues. A view appreciated by many for many centuries til today. It's like going back in time!
Lovely "church". A must see a beautiful building and as always I am amazed by the details. Debate better than Sacre coeur?

Best View of Paris. The Ques are hell to wait through, but since it was included in the Paris Museum pass I decided to go and see what it was like. It was a long climb up, with spiral stair cases that seemed to go on forever. You are initially taken to a gift shop and are forced to wait there for five to ten minutes no doubt to splurge your tourist money on the thingamajigs they're hocking but once you finally get up to the Cathedral top its very lovely and although there aren't as many bells as there should be, they're still there, and the gargoyles also are quite lovely. Since the flow of people is controlled, it doesn't get overcrowded and you can find your own space to appreciate the place and take it all in. You are then taken to a higher roof top where the final treat is a spectacular view of Paris. It was jaw dropping gorgeous.highly recommended.

Great place to be!. The Cathedral is a great sight, we never went inside but just walking around outside was good enough. The area around the Cathedral is excellent; lots of restaurants and bars. It's the best part of Paris for me and the family!
MESMERIZING!. I went here 2 times on my trip, day one to see the interior and grounds at the back. Day 2 was the climb in the towers. There are almost 400 steps with no where to rest along the way
Another Historic Site in Paris. This is another historic site in the heart of Paris city. Its architectural work is magnificent and gorgeous.

Summon your strength -- it's worth the climb and the crowds. Worth the climb. How else to enjoy some of the best views of Paris, plus get up close to gargoyles? Great views of the Gothic architecture of this incredible building.

You should see the exterior.. I am not much for visiting churches and cathedrals, but if you've never done it before, this is a must see. Go very early unless you enjoy standing in long lines. The exterior is amazing. Take a camera with a telephoto lense or a pair of binoculars to see all the incredible details.

One of the reasons that you are in Paris. We have been to Notre-Dame many times. Every tourist wants to see it. There have been times when the crowds were so bad that it was impossible to get in, but at other times we've walked right in. Later in the evening is better, but then the windows aren't as brilliant. While you're there, try a visit to the archaeological site at the other end of the square in front of the cathedral. Quite interesting.

Very glad we waited in line.. Gaining access to the Towers is not free. The line begins off to the left side of the Cathedral if you are facing it.We waited in line about a hour, but the time walking the historic steps and the views the top provides were well worth it. Be sure to continue walking the 'cat walk' to see different components of the Cathedral and Paris!

Gods Place...... beautiful. This beautiful Cathedral is must see in Paris for any visitor and can be easily reached using hop on hop off buses. One may have to wait in the queue but once inside, its worth it.
crowded place. Free entry to Cathedral on Sunday afternoon mass. The entry line was long but moved fast. Beware of people try to cut lines and there is NO immediate public restroom nearby.

A MUST See!. Notre Dame is absolutely beautiful to see during the day and at night. The cathedral is free to enter and beautiful on the inside with some of the biggest stained glass pieces of work anywhere in the world. To climb the stairs of the tower may cost a small fee, I'm not sure, but there is a separate line on the side of the cathedral. If you do not want to wait hours, you need to get there early! As many disney enthusiasts know, it is the cathedral in the Hunchback of Notre Dame and the bells and gargoyles can be identified as well! Right by it is the Love Lock Bridge so don't miss it!

Iconic. great to visit. Great place to meet up. Lots of tours commence here. Went on walking tours from here which were great and you paid at the end. Most people paid 10 euros. Great value for money and they took you to very interesting places that were different to the norm
Stunning. Absolutely stunning inside and outside. Make sure to climb the stairs in the towers for a fantastic view.

I'm on top of the world!. Climbing the towers provides a stellar 360 view of Paris. Be advised there are no elevators, but the extra bit of exercise is worth it! The gargoyles are unique and provide an interesting foreground for city scape pictures. The line starts forming before 10am - get there early!
Notre Dame in the evening. We did the guided night tour of Notre Dame. It was spectacular. do the 6:30pm tour which will get you up near the bells when they ring at 7pm. Most spectacular.

Amazing Views. WOWWWW!! Thats the word you can say after you climb all the stair!! You are rewarded with an amazing view after climbing the stairs! So be prepare if you want to visit the towers of two things, First the waiting time to enter is of 1 hour or more! Second you have the climb stair to arrive on the top, but they are not as bad as we could think,

Be careful. A similar problem to lots of parts of Paris is the amount of pickpockets around here - they seem to be kids asking you to sign or donate and then whilst distracted another grabs at you - To smart for the French Police they seem to get away with it time and time again - but the Towers are really nice and go up them if you get the chance.
What a view!. Got to go up to the towers! only 384 spiral stair case steps!!! The view is breathtaking. You can also enter the bell tower through a small door - quite interesting to see!

So beautiful and interesting.. So many tourists, myself included, wanted to be able to find out more information but not enough personnel to give information. It was probably due to being so crowded. Too many people in our tour to hear leader. I don't know what solution is unless they limited how many people are in the cathedral at a time. The wall that depicts all the changes over the centuries was so interesting! The stain glassed-windows so beautiful! The signs read not to take pictures but everyone was, so I did too but I did take off my hat according to sign. I really wanted to climb the 350+ stairs to bell but I couldn't find out about where to go and asked several people. Next time?

Great views!. Lots and lots of steps, but worth it for the fabulous views of the area and the Gargoyles on the Cathedral. We had to climb quite a few steps just to purchase the tickets after waiting in line 40 minutes. There is no elevator. Don't wait for tickets if you are not up to climbing.

Lovely even from the ground. Noter-Dame was near where we where staying. We had walked past a few times. Got in line to go inside. It's just a stunning church. Lovely gothic cathedral. Plenty to inspire a good man to live a good life. They are cleaning up the dark ceilings making it even more beautiful. The cathedral allows a time of reflection and it's a grand place for reflection.
Standing tall & beautiful. The towers are the most beautiful part of the Notre dame & one can even see the whole cathedral until you see it from the side. So thoroughly designed & crafted.

Just Stunning!. This is just mind blowing and beautifully located. Beautiful by day and stunning at night. Gets very busy but so worth while. Amazing building and the stained glass windows are spectacular!

Quasimodo no longer lives in the bell tower, but that's okay.. Get here very early in the morning or the line is long. If you only want to see the church itself, go when it's time for Mass. If you want to take the 400+ steps to the top to see the marvelous gargoyles and the incredible vistas, be prepared. It's quite a hike. I'm planning to do it once more before my knees tell me I can't. Notre Dame has an amazing history and it's evident why. Look at the chapels and Rose Window and notice how the statue of Jeanne d'arc resembles Ingrid Bergman. A must see!!!

Beautiful to see if only from the ground. I am sure the view from the towers is breathtaking, but more than two hour lines discouraged us. We preferred just to enjoy the Cathedral itself and the gardens and to save the steps and wait for the Eiffel Tour and the Arch d' Triumph.

4 nights in Paris. We arrived here on a wet Tuesday from the Metro "Chatelet". Bit of a hike, but arrived just before 9.45am and walked straight in. Had an awe inspiring walk inside, and got back outside to find massive queues filling the front of the Cathedral space.
Well worth seeing. Well worth a visit, lovely building. The whole area is nice with lots of cafes shops and restaurants

Well worth the wait in line!. Don't miss climbing the tower of Notre Dame and seeing the bells and gargoyles as it is well worth waiting in line. The line moves pretty quickly until they let a tour in first. Anyway we did the line and even I (at 66years and out of shape) could do the stairs. I don't like the wire fencing at the first stop but I can see why it is there. The view from the top is better but they only give you 5 minutes there because of the lines.
It is amazing at night with the lights on it. We were just blown away by this wonderful cathedral. To think it took 100's of years to build. The stained glass inside is beautiful.

Super long line. The line moves very slowly and there is no priority entrance for Paris Museum Pass holders. The view from the top is decent, but you get a better view from top of Arc de Triomph and Eiffel tower, which had shorter lines.
favourite spot. notre dame in general was my favourite part of paris, the streets just seemed so nice and the relaxed atosphere was a pleasure to be in. lovely place

Awesome!. If your not interested in visiting the inside of Notre Dame or into cathedral/churches/religion or even history you will still be hard pressed not to appreciate the towers of this incredably inspiring Gothic Cathedral which empowered Victor Hugo to centre his famous french novel on. Climbing the tower is good is not for the weary but the treasure that awaits is immense .... such amazing views of Paris enhanced with the most awesome creatures: the Gargoyles of Notre Dame if you can only do one climb or visit one monument in Paris...this is it!

Beautiful at night and in the daytime!. Worth walking up to, even if you don't go inside (but go inside!)The sheer scale is impressive. We visited the inside at night when there were very few tourists. Rainy days are good as well! The surrounding gardens are very pretty. Good cafés nearby for sandwiches.

Take the Stairs to the Top!. Entrance into the Cathedral is free and as other reviewers have said, the line moves quickly. No luggage and no flash photography allowed. The doors open at 830a but the info desk opens at 930a. If you want to purchase the audio tour for 5 euro, you'll want to wait for the info desk. They'll hold an ID as collateral. (Tip: make sure to bring your own headphones if you don't want to hold the audio tour set up to your ear like a phone... germs germs germs).When you're done with the tour, you can exit the Cathedral and round the corner to the right. There is a separate line to climb the stairs to the top of the tower (387 stairs i believe and no lift). The cost is 8.50 euro each. You purchase the tickets from the first level gift shop with cash or credit card. You cannot buy advanced tickets for the tower. We waited in line for about an hour and we were probably in a line of about 80 people.(Tip: mind the gypsies that prowl the lines. Do not sign any petitions).

Don't give up...get in the long line. They only allow 20 people in every 10 minutes but that allows you to not be on top of other tourists and really see all aspects. This includes views and the actual bells in the tower.

Wonderful views and oh so historic. You must be in good physical condition to do the tower tour of Notre-Dame, which we did as one of the attractions covered by our Musee pass. Expect a queue since a group is only allowed in about once every fifteen minutes. We were in line for an hour (it appears that about 25 people or so enter for each group). Once inside you climb a long spiral staircase typical of medieval towers, in this case with relatively few step outs for catching your breath. You first reach the belfry in what I think is the South tower, then you climb to the top of the opposite tower via another spiral staircase (shorter than the initial climb). You have about 5 minutes to circle around on the cat walk, with many, many nice views of Paris below, gefore descending a long spiral staircase that is the twin of the one you ascended initially. I'm a veteran tower climber (Bath, Yorkshire, Edinburgh, Cologne, etc) and this easily compares with those, but with better gargoyles :-).

Forever beautiful. With two children under 8 we walked across Point Neuf through Il de la Cite early before the crowds moved in to be rewarded by a stress free visit. In the midst of the stream of visitors there it was possible to catch a moment or two of stillness. Much appreciated. Not to be missed.

World class place!. A must see place in Paris. Image sitting in the courtyard of one of the world's great cathedrals and suddenly the bells start to sing! It is a truly magical experience. Go there - you will not regret it, but keep your purse / wallet closed and tight against you. There are many pickpockets about!

Go inside if you have spare time.. Really nice but very crowded. You'd have to wait a long in the queue to go inside. I suggest to go in if you have spare time to wait. Otherwise, go walking around the Cathedral. The gardens are very beautiful.

Notre Dame Cathedral Bell Tower....unbelievable view of Paris. The Bell Tower opens at 10am & a limited number of people are allowed to enter every 15 minutes or so. This is the one European attraction we saw that does NOT allow you to buy tickets to beat the line! We arrived around 10:20 and were beside the bells by 11:50am. I am a senior in good health & I was able to make this climb relatively easily although I did need rest breaks to catch my breath! We lucked out because just when we reached the bells they started ringing for over 10 minutes. It was incredibly moving. Then we climbed to the very top of the tower and the view of Paris was spectacular.... a highlight of our trip to Paris. I have heard it is a superior view than the Eiffel Tower. After we climbed down from the tower, we wandered through the Cathedral. There was no line-up & you could take as much time as you wanted.

Very Impressive. Even if you are not at all religious, this cathedral is worth a visit. The statues alone are outstanding. One thing that is surprising to the North American tourist is the amount of armed military guards at all attractions in France, even this one since the square in front is a tourist mecca. This can be a little shocking, but perfectly normal to the French.Watch out for pickpocket scams at the place. The newest one is people collecting your information for a "survey".

Up There With The Gargoyles. The towers were a real highlight of our Paris visit. We waited over an hour to gain entry to the towers, but it was truly worthwhile, they limit the flow of people, because there isn't a lot of room up top and once you are there it is easy to spend a bit of time admiring the view.The stairs up and down are small spiral ones and it is quite a climb, there are 2 viewing points, one where all the gargoyles are and you get access to the cathedrals bells and then up to the top of the second tower.It is a truly magnificent view across all of Paris.Buy a Museum Pass

worth the long queue. For this who enjoy photography, the towers are a great spot to take pics of the Cathedral's endless details and protuberances. If you thought you would take great pics of Paris, this is not the place. The Q can be quite long ...but hang in there, ultimately it is worth the wait.
Amazing Notre Dame. Beautiful church. We did not climb tower but couldn't believe the architecture and time it took to build this magnificent structure.
More queues!. We didn't get to go into the Notre Dame due to the length of the queues and the horrible weather. Went to a cafe nearby instead, kept dry and ate escargot!

Amazing !. After walking up the 460 steps, you will see incredible views of paris. Being in this tower you feel like being in a movie hunchback of Notre dame. Especially if we are in the tower top. Amazing !
Notre Dame. Visited Notre Dame some 38 years ago and again a a couple of weeks ago and loved every minute. Try to go early so as not to have to queue up too long.

Beautiful view over the cathedral. We arrived at 11 oclock and the line was long. We waited for almost 2 hrs. The Paris Museum Pass gives free entry to the towers. But there is no privileged access with the pass and is clearly mentioned on the pass.The flow up and down the towers is regulated and few are allowed at a time. The climbing was tiring but totally worth it.A short walk up the spiral staircase leads to the ticket counters and souvenir shop and then the spiral staircase.The view from the Chimera gallery is breathtaking- River Seine, the Eiffel Tower, Montmartre, the Arc de Triomphe etc.The huge bell at the top is breathtaking..

A must visit. I visited it as a child 61 years ago and remember it being black from the outside, but mind blowing inside.Now it looks new from the outside having been cleaned and looks even more impressive. Inside it blowed me away again. Just stunning!
Beautiful. Very beautiful buildings especially at night. Didn't go up into the tower but I imagine the views are amazing.
Beautiful!. If you like architecture, this is a beautiful place to see. Among many other reasons, of course! Be prepared to wait in long lines.

amazing cimb. Beware the line to get into the Towers closes about an hour before. The office will send someone to close the line off. It takes about 40-60 min to pay for your tickets, climb to the first level, do some viewing and picture taking and then onto the second and top level. We were lucky to be in the last group for the day as the bells started tolling for the 6 o'clock. Amazing sound!
A Must See. If you are not completely impressed by both the overwhelming size and wonderful stained glass here there is something really wrong. This is a must see in Paris!
Fabulous Gothic Church. Another must see whilst visiting Paris. So much history and the mother of all Gothic cathedrals...it is an amazing monument.

Must Visit. The work on this tower is magnificent. The street that leads to the tower is very beautiful and live. You can go on the tower also by paying a fee. But on the ground floor it is free where there is light.
Go At Night!. Go at night. The towers are awesome when they're lit, and when you're done you can party to the right just across the Seine.
Wow !. The most gorgeous Notre Dame cathedral I have every visited in my life. It is above and beyond any expectation I could have had

Must go!..if you can. this place is awesome! great part of history...had to wait in line to hike to the top..it is ALOT of stairs..and if your overweight may be a bit of a challenge...bcse to get down you have to squeeze between some stone pillars..its not the most spacious place but it is amazing!

A must see.. Very crowded within tourist season, but still a must see. Long line to get in, but the wait was not too long. Did not visit the towers as the line were a lot longer and hardly moved at all.
amazing. beautiful piece of architecture, fantastic history to go with, a big must see when visiting paris, you wont be disapointed
Great view. Amazing view from the top. Get there early and don't wait in line that much. A lot of stairs but keeps you in shape...
Breathtakingly beautiful. This is definately a must see in Paris even for non religious people or of any denomination. The architecture alone is awe-inspiring it has to be seen to believe

Walk off the pastries!. As a family we loved the climb of the narrow staircase to see a magnificent view of Paris. It's a great way to warm up for a December visit, and the kids found the walk a fun challenge. The church itself is stunning, but as far as kids a concerned, the climb was more fun.

Lucky Parisians. The designs inside and outside were incredible. The lifelong commitment of these artists is a true testimony of their devotion to God and their gifts. This is one of the most magnificent Cathedrals in the world.
Thanksgiving in Paris. The weather was superb - the Christmas decorations were just being brought out and I didn't have to worry about cooking a great big Turkey dinner!

Save your feet: be a family hero!. Ok the view is nice but really wanting in line for an hour to walk up the tiny stairs that just keep going....
I suggest you don't do this to yourself or your family. Save your walking for the glorious little cobble stone streets lined with restaurants and patisseries.

Interesting enough from the outside. WOW. Beautiful and majestic, and easy to get to. Not as amazing as the cathedral in Strasbourg in my opinion, but then again we did not opt to wait in line to go inside it. Maybe that would have made the difference. Nice cafes around the metro line that goes to this attraction though. I am glad we went.
Climbing to great views.. Spectacular views over all Paris as good as Eifel Tower or Montparnasse Tower. but in great architecture. A climb but well worth it. 50/60 minutes only but time well spent.

Beautiful. Beautiful,spiritual place. There are priests taking confession. This is a must see when visiting Paris. There are gypsy's outside so beware, they are begging but probably have more money than you. Don't even speak if your American, when they hear your voice they assume you have money and are relentless.
Must See. If visiting the Cathedral, you can't help but see the towers. If in Paris the Cathedral, it's towers and the garden is a must!
Notre Dame. A beautiful church, full of history and faith. So much more impressive than the 'mega' churches we have here in the US

mind the pickpockets and complain to your. Mind the puck pickets all over the place. It is in front if the central police station but the police does not care nor the socialist mayor of Paris. Large number of kids just want your money

Don't miss site. Historic cathedral - don't miss site. The church is open to public, there is a fee to go up the towers (400 + steps) must be in good physical condition and not claustrophobic. Excellent views of gargoyles and Paris from the top.

Never-ending line. We couldn't visit the towers because the line was endless. We wouldn't stay two hours waiting. We had a Paris Museum Pass but in this place, we whould have to wait in the line anyway.

The view. After some time waiting in a queue in front if the towers you are let in and you can start climbing the towers, but you end up in a souvenir shop before you can continue your journey to the top. It's not that bad, but you probably don't like climbing staircase like that fully packed with book and other items. At the end of the trip would be better. Then you habe finally reached the top of the towers and you can enjoy most beautiful views of Paris. You can't stop taking pictures, wondering what people of Paris might be doing at the moment. It is the most beautiful city in the world and from the towers you've got the view you won't forget.

A must see. Located in the center of Paris, it's architecture inside and out is a must see. We arrived in Paris in the evening and saw the building bathed in light. We returned the next day to tour the inside. While there we were fortunate that a choir was performing.

Do the towers!. The towers are the best part of Notre Dame, in my opinion. Even though they are a bit unorganized, it is a fantastic view of the city. You will have to wait in line for a bit, but it was our longest wait in any line for any attraction during our September visit and was only 30 min.Get the Paris Museum Pass ... this attraction is included.
not very interesting. not very interesting apart from the architecture.... the place is too crowed and you need to wait in a queue to get in..

Beautiful. The climb up to the top of the towers is definitely a must but be warned that it is very tiring if you are unfit.However, the view is stunning and you won't be disappointed. Another thing to be aware of when you reach the top, the bells are LOUD!!!!! So those with sensitive ears should get ear plugs (maybe).
Amazing Catheral and a must visit. Great Cathedral very beautiful as well as a must visit in Paris ...also amazing pics when you stand opp side of the Cathedral within the diagonal direction

The views!. The stair climb isn't that difficult, but do chew gum so that you don't get too dehydrated going up. The last wooden stairway into the top of the tower by the bells was a little nerve wracking. Don't do it if you are particularly afraid of heights. The stairs are steep and narrow. But there's plenty to see just looking in at the bells. Plan to get there around 9am so that you aren't waiting for ages in line. It's a great way to start the day.

One to see but don't queue for hours. Ofcourse this is one of those gothic architectural marvels but boy is it full! I went inside many years ago when things weren't quite so busy, so I did not feel the need to stand several hours in the blazing hot sun to go inside again. It is impressionable and an icon but more and more these days I find so many landmarks hugely busy which takes some of the enjoyment out of it. I recommend you come here and see it from the outside then zip around the corner to Sainte-Chapelle, a 10 minute wait and you're in and to my mind its better than Notre Dame.
Over 300 steps. Worth the wait if you are okay with narrow stairs. The bell tower is very interesting and the view is fantastic.

My favorite part of our visit!. This is an optional feature of visiting the famous Notre Dame de Paris. It cost 8-10 Euro to enter the tower, which has its own separate line and entry point (if you stand in front of the cathedral, the tower line runs along the left side of the building). This was easily the highlight of our family trip to France. Climbing the tower stairs was a little like completing a long hike: tiring, but so worth it once you reach the top! Be warned, these stairs are very narrow, and there is no place to stop and take a breather. With people climbing single file both ahead and behind you, it's definitely a test of physical fitness! The views from the top are extraordinary. Looking for that perfect postcard shot to wow your friends? This. Is. It. The climb is broken up into three levels: an entry gift shop, a mid-level with awesome views (and an opportunity to see the famous bells of Notre Dame!), and finally, a climb to the very top of the tower, which made me almost giddy. Though the bell observation area was closed when we visited, hearing them ring while we stood high up on Notre Dame gave me chills. I cannot emphasize this enough: do not be afraid of that climb. It is so worth it.Read more: https://adventuringthegreatwidesomewhere.wordpress.com/2015/05/06/48-hours-in-paris-part-ii/

Center of the civilized world. Sure it's crowded, and everyone, it seems, is trying to pick your pocket, tie a string around your wrist, or is a pregnant gypsy. That aside, this is history folks! If nothing else, put your foot on the brass marker in front of the main entrance and think of what has happened on this very spot.
Worth queueing. We were lucky to be there at the Vesper and spent a serene, spiritual experience in the midst of hundreds of people.

Another must see in Paris!. Another icon in France. A beautiful experience and not to be missed. The history of Notre-Dame is so well know that I am not sure what more to say but take the time to visit you won't regret it.
Do the tour. The story behind the figures on this tower is very interesting and if you take the tour they will cover it.

Free church. I was disappointed that the towers were closed by the time we arrived, however the long lines took only 10-15 minutes for us to get into the cathedral. I would highly recommend visiting since it is free.
The Notre Dame Towers. An amazing sight at Notre Dame. We spent quite a bit of time there and took many pictures from all sides. Very enjoyable afternoon.
Touris trap. Unless you want to climb the stairs, it is free to get into this lovely place, but the queues are rather long, so go early or admire it from a cruise boat..!
Paris 2014. A good place to understand the intricacies of this magnificent cathedral is to stand inside it. I was awed by the beauty and size.

Traditional and elegant. The tower of Notre Dame was beautiful, it left us speechless. It is pure beauty. We weren't able to go inside it was closed for the day but seeing from outside was enough to make us want to go back.

BEAUTIFUL!. Notre Dame!!!....who hasn't heard of it?! It's located on the Ile-de France and most definitely worth seeing! It's history, it's architecture, it's fables...a must-see when visiting Paris!

Good views, but very confined. This is one of the few places where a Museum Pass doesn't get you to the front of the line. Count on at least an hour from the cathedral's north door and porch to the entrance.Everything inside is netted, and progress is controlled, so you have to keep moving. Passages are narrow and low, and there are many stairs, so it will not suit the traditionally built.

Paris Master Piece!!!. One of the famous churches in the world with overwhelming architecture. I have got a souvenir here in the form of a coin which you get from a vending machine inside the tower. A must visit place in Paris

Notre-Dame: feeling the perfume of the past. One of the famous sights of Paris.I got very much impressed by the atmosphere in the cathedral.When climbing the steps in the tower i almost expected to come acrocc Quasimodo...

chilling experience. to see the architecture of this cathedral is simply amazing. The power of chill you get when you enter is aspiring to the soul. So many people taking picture everywhere spoils the scenery

Tribute to heaven. The cathedral reflects a history of craftsmanship from a long by gone era. The stain glass windows captures the light from outside which creates a visual story. The exterior is an amazing feat of carvings and masonry works. There is a real sense of history here of the people who created this amazing task as a tribute to heaven. The tour of the tower allows you to get up close to the gargoyles and a different vantage of the city at a distance.
Loved it! . It's everything you'd expect apart from the crowds. The crowds are massive! I've been here 3 times now and still find it beautiful and spectacular.

Amazing views from the top. We waited for about an hour to enter the tower, but it was totally worth it! The views from the top are absolutely amazing. You have to climb around 400 stairs so it's a bit of work. It can also be pretty crowded depending on what time of year you go up there.

A Must See While In Paris. A master piece! recommend that you take a tour like the City Wonders tour. The tour takes you behind the scenes and and the guide gives an in depth of the history of this magnig=ficant church.
Notre-Dame Cathedral is amazing.. This is a must see when in Paris. Was overwhelmed with the architecture. Must get there early in the morning to spend enough time to see it..

Great view. In doing research for our visit to Paris I found that you could buy tickets to go up top and we did. The line was not too long and the price was reasonable. The view was great and just seemed much better than just seeing it from the ground. This was one of our favourite places we visited.
Must see. Must see. What can I say, its Notre Dame. Way too cool to miss if you visit Paris. We did not do the paid tour. Lines too long, and we did it beofre.

400 steps to the bell tower. The line into the cathedral was short (and free of charge) and the architecture obviously impressive. The line for the bell tower was longer (approx. a 20 min. wait and the museum pass did not allow for priority service - just 'free' no charge). The first 200 steps being you to the gift shop where you wait for the first tour group to depart the towers, then you are allowed to navigate the next 100+ steps to the first ledge to view a spectacular view of Paris. The group must wait here before climbing further up to the bell tower (or if one chooses - to exit, walk down). I did not see notices but please note - you must be in good shape and not afraid of heights to do this. Several people had to stop the catch their breath and there is little room to step aside and rest. The stairwell is spiral and contained. This is an excellent way to work off the delicious French pastries!

No hunchback but lots of tourists. Is there anybody who has not heard of Notre Dame de Paris? Undoubtedly one of the most famous churches in the world. Maybe the only one starring in a novel. We arrived in the early morning, walked right in, took our time, and saw everything. Later in the day the line was at least an hour long. If you do your research, and read the right guide books, you can see almost all of Paris without waiting in line. While viewing Notre Dame don't miss the archeological dig on the property. Very nicely done. The cathedral needs to be seen at least twice -- once in the day when the light will be streaming through the stained glass windows, and once in the evening when the City of Lights illuminates the church in a breathtaking manor.
Paris trip 2015. The photo does not do it justice. One of the most wonderful places in Paris (in the world)! 6 masses a day are still conducted here. Very humbling.
Best tour. Best tour in Paris. For free for european under 26. Quite crowded but super interesting. Sight from up there is just incredible!
Long line for a good view of Paris. My kids wanted to make the climb, so we did, but I'm not sure the long wait (two hours in August) was worth the view.

Light and shadow. The cathedral shows an intriguing mix of light and shadow. A must see when in Paris.
Call me childish, but I could not help but look up the tower in search for Quasimodo, the hunchback of Notre-Dame. Didn't see him though :-)

Great views and History. Fantastic views from the top. Very interesting seeing all the gargoyles and grimaces and learning about the history. Had to queue for awhile to get in even though we did have a museum pass.
Get there early!. We were first in line at 8:30, and while the doors only opened at 10 it was worth the early morning! It's a bit of a walk up, but the gargoyles are worth the climb.
Sister trip. Spur of the moment visit to the towers of Notre-Dame. Went up and the sight was absolutely stunning. Highly recommend to do that.

don't miss this ... food stop on red bus tour. this was a m a z i n g even tho there was a service on at the time they still allowed us to take photos, we did not go up the top in the tours as the queue was a mile long but found a string of amazing little restaurants down the side street so settled for those instead. we did this as part of the red bus tour.

Grand Old Lady Notre Dame. This grand old lady is the heart of Paris and the beggars appear to have been removed from Notre Dame Square. We did not join a tour but in the past my introduction to Notre Dame was with a tour. That was some time ago. For the first visit I strongly suggest a tour gives you a very good insight on the cathedrals origins and history.

Very beautiful church, amazing!. There was no line to enter the church, and it's very huge and beautiful from inside and from the outside. There was a mass going on and a nice music going on: a man chanting and another one play organ. Very recomendable.

very imposing and wonderful. I feared this would be one of those 3 hour queues and that I'll miss the most famous cathedral, but in fact we went there at 8 in the morning, had a coffee at a corner cafe overlooking the cathedral and after that it took us 5 minutes to buy the tickets and go in. its an amazing place to visit!

Great Cathedral and nice view from the top of the Towers. A fantastic Cathedral bot inside and outside. There is a long cue to get in the church, but this usually takes only 15 minutes and then you are in. To climb the towers takes much longer, at least an hour during peak season, and this is a pitty.
A must see..... It should be one of the "7 wonder of the world." It is a must see. It is massive and not able to comprehend until one sees it. Enough said, just do it! Out on an island in the river.

Amazing. Just amazing! It worth it to go to the top. The line are very big, so go there before open. It's free for citizens with less then 25 years old but you need to get your free ticket.
It's included on Paris Museum Card

Exceptional architecture!. Found this place to be not too busy on a Wednesday afternoon about 1:00. We were able to go inside, look the place over, and spend some time sitting and appreciating the massiveness of this architecturally stunning locale. To think this building was completed so long ago, about AD 1345, is stunning. Even with todays technology the detailed construction of this amazing edifice would be difficult to duplicate. A wonderful way to spend an hour o rtwo.

Mesmerizing religious art heritage. If you have a catholic upbringing regardless of whether you are a practicing catholic or not, the beauty and the impression that this cathedral causes in you is one strong reason to come visit this magestic cathedral.

Superb. When in Paris you must see Notre Dame, a magnificent building, stand in awe and look up to its bell towers, imagine the hunchback look down on Esmerelda. Do not miss this superb place of worship.

Worth the queue. You climb up to a lower area that joins the 2 towers and then climb to the very top, which offers spectacular views. They take up groups of about 20 people at a time and it takes about 30min.Even if you have a ticket you have to queue, which is down the left side of the Cathedral. Once admitted you can buy a ticket from the office inside. One thing to note however, is that this doesn't get you into the main Cathedral - the exit of the tour sends you straight outside and you would have to join another queue to get in.
Worth the waiting. Arrive before 10am to queue for the tower visit, then the line moves faster than expected. It feels like the spiral stairs are never ending, but the view is brilliant!

DON'T MISS THIS. You're in Paris; you're at the Notre-Dame Cathedral! It's best to take one of those private tours as the lines can really be long. They're well worth it. I think Fat Tire Tours does one there and if they do, be sure to use them... they're fantastic!

Good for Photos, keep valuable safe. One of the main Cathedrals in Paris , perhaps the most famous. Beware of the crowds and pick pockets, there is always a huge Police presence here but criminals working in gangs float around like Bees to the Honey pot,.
Sturdy the outside. As expected. It is a must see when you visit Paris. To me, the outside is magnificent. The 200 years of construction is evident when you study the architecture of this facility.
Spectacular!!!. Spectacular! Once you walk in you feel at peace and see the grandiosity of this place. It is truly one of the world's gems. Not to be missed.
Worth the visit. Wonderful and peaceful place. The towers are worth the visit. There is always a huge line but it moves very fast.

Experience an Organ Recital. While we're not big fans of organ music, we considered this a once-in-a-life-time opportunity... listening to Beethoven in this grand location. A remarkable site and especially at night when the gargoyles take on an eerie presence. To be assured of a seat, purchase your ticket in advance. We bought ours online. While any seat is great, for best acoustics, sit in the middle of the cathedral. Good value and a unique experience not to be missed!

Great views!. We went on a cold winter day and the lines were extremely short so for us it was definitely worth the wait! It offers great views of the city and isn't super expensive. Definitely worth the visit if the line is not super long.

Visit at noon!. Arriving shortly before 12pm and you can enjoy the sound of the new bells of Notre-Dame, reproduced authentically so you can enjoy the amazing symphony of sound from times gone by. Each portal is another amazing work of art and architecture. Absolutely a world treasure, and should be at the top of the list (but remember, arrive just before noon!!!).
AMAZING VIEW. 422 winding stairs to get to the top but was worth the effort. The view over almost all of Paris was spectacular

Something truly special. The wait can get long and unlike the rest of the cathedral, you have to pay for access to this, but the endless stairs to the top lead to a view that is almost as impressive as that from the top of the Eiffel Tower (not as tall, but nearly as majestic- after all, you're standing atop Notre Dame Cathedral).
Beautiful Cathedral. A must see. Wait is long, but it moves quickly and worth the wait. Light a candle for your family for a donation.

Of course you have to see it when in Paris. Of course if you are in Paris you have to see this but many tourists also have the same idea!I wouldnt stand in a queue just to go inside in the height of the season but the surrounding area is very pleasant
A Historic Icon. No cost to enter Cathedral, Rented the audio-guide, these are wonderful as you learn about things you might miss if you walked through unaided.
beautiful architecture. amazing architecture history and beauty of the notre dame. must see place if you are in paris don't miss here.

must see. excellent architecture and wonderful gravitas. This is a must see in Paris. Go and see the original in Laon as well.
watty
Great views from outside. Looks great from outside. Take some amazing picture. But not worth going at the top of tower. Don't pay for it.

Worth the wait. Thankfully the line is on the shaded north side of the cathedral, but the wait in the sun on the top deck can be long as you wait to descend. But in either case the view of the gargoyles and the bells are worth the wait. The Paris Museum Pass covers the entry fee but won't get you farther ahead in the line. We waited for about 45 minutes. Plenty of shops and cafes nearby if someone wants to duck out of line and get back in after a few minutes.

No Hunchback!. The line to get into the Cathedral moves right along. We didn't attempt the line for the climb to the Towers. It was forever, unfortunately, but that's August. The Hunchback was safe from us!The architecture and the history of the build are amazing.

Long queues - amazing views!. One of our favourite bits of our Paris trip was climbing to the top of the towers, and getting up close to the gargoylesWe got there mid-afternoon with the queues at their worst - would recommend going earlierOnly small groups are let up which is great as it avoids jams on the stairs.We were with our three children (11/9/7) who all managed the narrow, winding stairs well, however this is not for the infirm!The views are amazing from the top, and as not a lover of heights I was actually more comfortable with this that Sacre Couer or the glass floor on the eiffel tower.Would recommend

Doorway to Heaven. I can't even describe the awe this building left me in! The gorgeous glass work and carvings of deities left me dumbstruck, we sat in on a service and although my French is rusty it was just amazing!
One of beautiful cathedral in paris. Good cathedral but costly. If you can afford, must get in. Total about 400 steps but long queue to get in.

Restaurants owner. Be ready for a long line but worth every minute of it . Beautiful cathedral and one of the best worldwide . After visiting the cathedral itself got myself into another long line not really knowing what i was getung myself into ... 387 narrow steps that i had to climb and not having the choice to go back down cause of all the people behind . So be careful once u pay and start going up there is no return ...lol but honestly once u make it to the top it's worth it and the view is splendid

Stunning view,s with the gargoyle's.. A visit to the TOWER'S OF NOTRE DAME CATHEDRAL is a must if your visiting Paris.The cathedral itself look's magnificent viewed from street level but inside ,the cathedral will take your breath away.I know at €8.50c entrance fee,( reduced with Paris card) seem's a little expensive but the price pale's into insignificance with the beauty of the cathedral and the breathtaking view's of Paris from the tower's.Be aware ,there are nearly 400 step's up to it's highest point but the treck and effort are well worth it.The bell room is just superb,you can feel the history in here,the view's of the river are unsurpassed and if your a keen photogragher do not forget your camera,you will take some unbelievably good shot's.Up close the gargoyles look superb .This is a major tourist attraction so expect to queue and be prepared to wait ,the crowd's for this famous monument are huge.Very easy to locate ,just jump the metro to stop CITÉ,you cannot miss the tower's.After our visit we normally go for a meal & drink in the lively Latin Quarter,another great area of Paris.The tower's are open ;Monday to Saturday,7.45am till 6.45pm.Sunday,7.45am till 7.30pm.A must go destination in Paris.
Go in but not up. A beautiful cathedral with typical french style and character. I skipped going up because it was overpriced and worthless.
Go in but not up. A beautiful cathedral with typical french style and character. I skipped going up because it was overpriced and worthless.

Strenuous but Fun!. We climbed the 387 steps of the North Tower to get a view of the gargoyles. This line can get very long quickly, and it took us 2 visits to actually get into the tower. My suggestion is to go early, and do that climb first, providing it is a nice day for viewing. It is so worth the experience and the view, but make sure your knees are good, and you don't mind climbing up almost 400 steps of a spiral staircase.
Face to Face with Gargoyles.... Gargoyles are cool. Go up bell tower, arrive by 10am as line can be long. Great views of Paris. Enjoy.

A must do!. Determined to take our teenage grandchildren here during our visit.We arrived late afternoon, best time. Hardly any queue, and this moved fairly quickly. wandered around the cathedral at our own pace during which time there was a short rehearsal for a concert, and the bells were chiming which was a great bonus.Area around was clean, no harassment from any quarter. Staff were helpful and polite. Result all round.
