Really nice vew. Be prepared for a lot of stairs, but the view is owsome!!!The queue usually is not too big, you don't have to wait too much!!Nice photos to be taken

Worth the wait. My partner and I queued for an hour in the rain to climb the Towers of Notre-Dame but it was worth it. It was really beautiful inside and a breath taking view from the top. I would suggest to anyone planning on visiting Paris to purchase a Paris Pass, which you can find online, as this lets you gain access to many museums and attractions for free.To my knowledge there is no lift for this attraction, just a lot of stairs!!!!

Candle light concert.. Be sure to climb to the top and check to see if there are evening concerts available. We attended a Gregorian Chanting concert held by candlelight. The choir walks around the cathedral so that you can experience the sound echoing off the building. Excellent experience.

The Highlight of our Trip. We hadn't pre-booked tickets and spent just under 2 hours in line. That said I couldn't recommend the Towers highly enough - it was the highlight of my trip to Paris. Great value for money, children go free.The views from the top are spectacular.The gargoyles are close enough to touch - brilliant photo opportunities and the children had great fun trying to find Victor, Hugo & Laverne (from the Disney film).There is a narrow access passage at the very top leading to an old wooden staircase that takes you to the original bell tower. Standing beside the bells gives you a true sense of the scale of this fantastic building.
Beaut. Beautiful architecture even just to walk around you have to go inside during the day though to see the light shining through the stained glass absolutely magnificent architecture

Majestic on the outside cal in on the. Inside. Got here early just as the doors had opened and it was already very busy. Awe inspiring inside with the windows looking beautiful in the morning sun. Well worth a visit and then pop into the Latin Quarter for a drink and something to eat. As we left the queues were getting longer especially as the guided tours were arriving.
A different perspective of Paris. Get a different view of the city and enjoy an experience very people take advantage of while in this area

The Bells.......... Only visited the outside as the queue to get inside was huge.....as with all attractions and unfortunately it was raining the day we went. The outside is impressive and serves for a great photo opportunity. A lot less street hawkers in this area which you need to be aware of at most of the attractions but this may be due to the fact that it is next to the Police Headquarters!
Worth a visit. An amazing building, well worth a visit, just have to put up with the swarms of tourists! worth going later when there are less queues and as dusk sets in the interior is amazing.
Peaceful!. One of the most peaceful places I have visited. Even with hundreds of tourists moving around, this place has a unique calmness.
Nice place. Nice place to enjoy some time here. Children can enjoy here with Big bubble. You can sit inside for a peaceful time.
be fit for the climb to the top.. this climb is not as strenuous as the climb to the top of St. Paul's Cathedral in London but it also has fewer resting places. The view from the top is excellent.
Excellent history. This was an amazing pc. of history. You could actually feel being in Notre Dame. It was fantastic. Don't miss this attraction.

Wonderful morning . It's to immense for words go and be in line for when it's opens lines can be super long and when you're in the church on the right side on entering there is a church exhibit for 5 euros that shows off the crown and jewels so worth it!!!

Worth the trip and wait in line, skip cafes bordering Cathedral. It is crowded but the line moves along pretty quickly. We did not take the time to wait in the separate line to go up in the tower, but I hear that is cool as well. don;t waste your money at any of the restaurants bordering the Cathedral because they are over priced with poor food.

Always nice. Have been in Notre-Dame at least 5 times already and it is always great experience. Make sure to sit for a while and enjoy the view on designs carved in to the wood, rock, gold. And when you go out, make sure to sit on the bench and enjoy the view on this magnificent structure.

Notre Dame a must-see!. A beautiful building and free to enter! You can climb to the top of the towers for a fabulous view around the city. It can be busy but the queue moves quickly. The stained glass windows are spectacular.

Notre Dame Cathedral. NOTRE DAME , always a little nostalgic . Place is good as a tourist spot . The glass painted windows are beautiful. They allow photography but without Flash .even if the queue outside is long , there is not much of a wait as it is a moving line !! well worth going to for anyone visiting Paris ...Easy access through the metro , or the hop on hop off Can take a taxi as well ....

The best thing I did in Paris. I've visited Paris a few times but never climbed the towers before. We had the opportunity this time in the evening when they are open until 11 pm (only certain nights). Although the line was long, it went faster than expected. The climb is long but there is a place to rest after the first 159 steps or so. When we got to the first lookout, at gargoyle level, I was dumbstruck by the sheer beauty and magnificence of the cathedral and the view. Seeing the structure and being able to touch history was inspiring. The Eiffel Tower was lit up in the distance, and you could see Sacre Coeur to the right. The city, in all of it's shimmering glory, spread out before us. It was truly awesome. The next climb takes you to the very top of the towers, where the view is equally wonderful. You see the cathedral from a vantage point that is not possible from the ground. I didn't want to come down, but as it was closing we had to.If you get the chance to climb the towers, don't pass it up. If you can do it at night, with the moonlight behind you, a warm breeze in your face, and the lights of Paris spread out before you, all the better. It's an experience that will live in your heart forever.
Walk to the top. Incredible carvings. Walk up to the top (steep stairs) to see the gargoyles. Beware of pick pockets outside in the square.
Grand, inside and out!. Grand, inside and out! There were cool gargoyles on the outside of the church and the inside of the church is beautiful.

Breathtaking views. Long queue and 300 steps though.. If you don't mind the 1-2 hour queue and can hike up 300 steps, then the views are worth it. Lots of waiting at the top as well. Breathtaking views.

Parents/small children may get to skip the queue. Visiting the bell tower at Notre-Dame ended up being a surprising highlight of our Paris trip! The lines are quite long. A member of the staff pulled us out of line and sent us to the front because we had a small child in a stroller. The gesture was welcome after subjecting our little one to the 3 hour queue at Versailles. Anyway, the hike up the stairs is long and steep but totally worth it if you are physically able. The views from the top were incredible. Seeing the interior of the bell tower was impressive. The top of the bell tower had some very tight squeezes. I'm not large but I commented to my husband that at 7 months pregnant, I would not have been able to squeeze through. So please be aware that the hike up is physically demanding and there are tight spots at the top.

have to go. One of the best cathedral i visit ever, you can spend long time see the details of this old building . and in night a lot of talent people come and do amazing shows . i saw man dance with fire was great

Assumption Day at Notre Dame. Fantastic to visit inside and out. We were there on Assumption Day so there was a well attended service and an enjoyable procession outside afterwards. Did not queue to go to top as wait was approx an hour and a half, advised to arrive at 9.00 am to be amongst the first for opening at 10.00am. Photography should be stopped within the church.
No need to pay for the tower experience. Notre Dame de France was a wonderful experience. We did not pay to climb the tower but we walked around the main cathedral for over an hour.

Spiritual morning. We toured the cathedral on a Sunday morning and was able to attend mass. We opted not to attend the entire mass but what we did experience was wonderful. I could have sat a listened to the soloist and choir for longer, but we did not have the time. Even with all the tourist, it still managed to maintain that spiritual feeling.
Not big, but very artistic. Notre Dame Cathedral is not a big cathedral. But still you would be overwhelmed by its beauty. The towers are the biggest contributor of that beauty. Romantic place.

indescribable for its beauty!!!. It is one of the oldest and most opulent Gothic style French cathedrals is dedicated to Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ (hence the Notre-Dame name - Our Lady), is located in Parvis square, on the small island Ile de la Cité in Paris, France, surrounded by the waters of the River Seine.The cathedral appears closely linked to the Gothic idea in all its splendor, the clear effect of the needs and aspirations of high society, a new approach of the cathedral like building of contact and spiritual ascent.As a result, the Gothic buildings have earned a lighter aspect, and the windows, wider and higher, were decorated with beautiful stained glass windows that filtered natural light, and thereby created a "climate" of mysticism inside.

A work-out and a view!. Sure you'll have to wait in line...but, what is Paris and Notre-Dame, but queues? Don't do this if you have bad knees or are seriously out-of-shape. It's a long, sweaty, trudging climb up hand-cut and sometimes slightly uneven stone stairs. If you can make it...the view is outstanding right in the middle of the Seine, and right in the middle of Paris!

Long wait in line - but it was spectacular from the top. We waited for two hours in the line in early July. But climbing those stairs and looking at the view from the top was pretty amazing. We were lucky that the day was not hot. Highly recommended. If you hate lining up - maybe get down there really early in the day?

Good views but must line up before it opens!. If you plan on climbing towers, note that there isn't a "fast lane" for Paris Museum holders and the line for the towers starts queuing up about 45 minutes before the towers open. I arrived at 9:30 am--about 30 minutes before opening time--and still had to wait until 11 am to finally get a chance to go up. It's a great view of Paris and fun to do if you have time on your trip.
Paris Panoramic View. Climb up to the top of tower to see panoramic view of Paris is fantastic if you have time or short que.

Impressive, awesome building you absolutely have to see.. Impressive cathedral with great sculptures. It's a beautiful, awesome building. Unfortunately, we didn't go inside. There was a large queue to get in.
Stunning views.. Worth the long wait and tiring climb up 422 steps. Views are stunning at the top but it is not for the faint-hearted or unfit.

Make sure you pay the money to walk up the ancient stairs to the roof-top!. Free to go inside, and amazing, must-see views there, but it's also a great location to go to the roof-top via a winding stairwell (entrance North side - left side in this photo) and see a bird's eye view of Paris.

Chatolic seekers in Paris. Notre Dame is very beautiful, well organised for Catholics and tourists. I was both , though mass was in French you get leaflets in different languages . There is also a international mass practically every Sunday.

Good Cathedral!. This was the first structure we saw when coming out of subway. It's a good attraction, and something one would come across often since it's at the heart of Paris. There's a separte queue for going to the top, but it's usually long during summers so we had to skip it.
Priceless!. Such a cool place with endless history. A must see... Plan to wait in line forever... The whole area was very busy and so many others places to visit within walking distance.

Magical. Magical place!
The view from the towers is amazing!
But be aware of queuing. I would recommend a morning visit.
We were there in summer and queuing for about an hour.

Following the footsteps of Quasimodo. The exterior is amazing. The architecture magnificent as is the garden around the Towers. The inside however didn't live up to my expectations. Don't get me wrong it still is quite the view and definitely worth to visit however I must also say I've seen other cathedrals and churches that simply impressed me more.
beautiful church!. its a very beautiful church.. you really feel at peace.. i wish i could go back to paris again n relive the memories!
Treasury room worth the money. An amazing experience, a good tip is the queue moves quite quickly, and do yourself a favour pay the 5euro and go into the treasury room, just wow.

Mesmerizing and beautiful. You must go there to appreciate what man and God created together. This is an awe inspiring, spiritual experience that transports you back in time and you wonder what Esmerlada and her love looked like, you would be moved spiritually no matter what religion you were brought up in. Go see for yourself.
Long wait on line but the views are worth it.. Long wait on line but it is worth it. The views, the bell tower and the gargoyles. Take into account more than 300 stairs in confined winding staircase.
Peace of Mind. My friend recommend to visit this historic place. The experience was truly nice, the architecture is a treat to eyes for the art lovers.
The hunchback wasn't home.. I was highly anticipating Notre Dame. I suppose I had high expectation or a I has seen to many cathedrals in France so I was a bit disappointed. But it is worth seeing.
Beautiful archtecture.. I love the architecture. It is so timeless. The gargoyles have so much personality. Climb to the top towers if time allows.

Impressive building with ignoble history. Architecturally impressive, but the history of the Catholic Church in France and in Europe in that historical epic was as an instrument of oppression of the peasantry and any who were enlightened faced the wrath of the Inquisition and of buring as heretics.

Worth the queue. Magical place but if you want to go up the tower don't queue in the main square go round to the side. I made this mistake the first time around and was looking how to get up from inside the church. The windows and paintings inside are epic and the atmosphere is unreal.

Go to the Top. Go to the top to see the gargoyles up close and personal. Also, hear the bells chime right in your ear. Not to mention the great view you'll get glancing over Paris. Yes, the lines can be long but what line in Paris, isn't and like everything else...it will be totally worth it. It's about $15. To visit inside the church, itself, is free and the line moves fairly quick as well. Stunning, stunning, stunning details inside, as well.

Beautiful Views of the City. I've been to Paris several times but this is the first time I went up into the Towers of Notre Dame. The views were very nice and it was fun to get a closer view of some of the gargoyles. The lines can get very long so we showed up about 30 minutes before the opening to reduce the wait time.

Spiritual awakening anyone?. Hidden gem inside the historical site. Catch Monsieur Em to get the insider scoop besides the weighing story in the last days ...reminds me of the Chinese folklore on judgement days. Stares at you in the middle gate. Go left and be bored or go right and be tormented for eternity.
Beautiful view with full of exercise. Nice view from the top and not an easy climb. Very narrow pass to reach to a top but it's a different experience..

A grand old structure immersed in history. A grand monument in Central Paris next to Champs De Elysee. You will find tourists from all over the world clicking photographs. A great place to visit if you like monuments

Notre-Dame Cathedral. A perfect demonstration of Gothic Architecture. Being a witness to historical events like coronation of Napoleon and canonization of Joan of Arc, must visit Cathedral for history buffs. We went to the cathedral as a part of the River Seine cruise and this helped in saving time.

Wonderful city views from the top. It was a long wait for us before we could climb up the towers. The climb itself was quite tedious so people planning to visit, keep that in mind. if you think you are not physically fir, avoid! Visiting the cathedral alone is also good.
City views from the top were really nice!
Very interesting. Really great place to visit, I went there walking and by renting a bike because there are bike stations across the street. If you go to Paris you must visit Notre Dame.

Never mind the bells..the queues !. Book a ticket before you go at the height of season..queues too long to wait in the blistering heat of a Paris August but a stunning building from outside and from the river..lovely area to wander round

Climb the 387 steps to the Tower. We loved the Cathedral. Take the time and climb the tower, it was the highlight of Cathedral. Take a moment to take in the wear of the stone steps and how many times someone climbed these steps to ring the bells. The view of the city fantastic and getting so close to the gargoyles was worth it!

lots of stairs and worth it. Going to the top of the Cathedral is so worth it, its a lot of stairs so plan your day to not be tired and enjoy what i think is the most beautiful view in the world (at least most beautiful that is not a landscape).

Even if the queue is huge, don't give up! It's worth it!. I guess pretty much everyone would agree Paris is amazing from any perspective, yet there is something awesome in seeing it from above. Whether it's from the Sacre-Coeur, the Eiffel Tour, the Arab Institute or the Arc de Triomphe, the view on the city of love, light and what-nots will amaze. However, the towers of Notre Dame is much more than just a good view.There is something magnificent in being so close to the stones of that masterpiece, being able to take photos of the gargoyles from up close and to have the winds on the top mess up your hair. This place is worth the queue, the money and the workout to get up there! I would not recommend it to people who can't climb up 3 stories of stairs, it is narrow and tough even for the fit!

So worth the climb!. We were so glad we climbed to the stop of the Towers. Simply amazing! But definitely not for those who are afraid of heights or claustrophobic. The stairs going up are steep and very narrow. And lots of them! In the heat of the day, be sure to bring water with you. But once you make it up, the views are incredible. And it was very cool for the kids to see the gargoyles up close and personal. We also went into the small bell area. In the interest of keeping the lines moving, they do only allow you a few minutes up top but it was definitely enough to take in all the views and to get some wonderful pictures. We purchased skip the line tickets which paid off as we were able to get right up. So glad we did this as the lines were long, probably at least a 1 hour wait but we didn't have to wait at all.
european vacation. Beautiful beyond words!! The detail is so indeapth it is increadible. We walk arouund inside and out for hours taking it all in. It is truly breathtaking.

A must see in Paris!!. A must see when in Paris! The Cathedral itself is amazing when you see it in person, it is just enormous! But then once you learn the history of it you will be even more impressed!! The lines to go inside Notre-Dame can get long but don't be put off as it does not take long at all! I highly recommend a Sandemans walking tour of Paris as they tell you loads of history and quirky facts about the main attractions as well as some other random not so well known facts and best of all its FREE!! The only thing is that they don't allow time for you to go inside so try and make time to come back and see the magic inside!

Worth a Visit. The que was fast moving and when inside it is well worth the short wait. The building is fantastic and the history of it is well set out inside. There is no entrance fee to the main part of Notre dame but there is the optional contribution to light a candle if you wish. The whole experience of Notre Dame did not feel like the usual "touristy" thing - it had a more spiritual feel than a tourist attatraction, which was a good thing.
Beautiful Place. The Tour guides that were volunteers had a wealth of knowledge. Beautiful history and architecture. Must see if in Paris.

What is not to love about this place. This cathedral was magnificent. The line was huge and we could barely find the end. You really had to look and stare at a certain place for the carvings, sculptur, paintings to come alive. There was so many of them. Spend some time in the courtyard in the back and sit on a bench and just view. Walk all the way around the cathedral to see what it shows from each angle.
Amazing - Worth the Visit.. This was one of the most outstanding attractions of our whole trip - make sure you go to the side of it, to see the amazing statue of Pope John Paul II - really beautiful.

Another Great Landmark. Again, its not this landmark which is obviously magnificent but the surrounding gullies and the shops / restaurants which makes it most frequented place after Eiffel Tower and Monte mart.

An icon. Revisited after many years. This time I was trying to locate an angel from which a painting had been undertaken in 1890. Very difficult as most of the existing surrounding buildings were not there in 1890?

Amazing and Grand, but expect queues. The actual cathedral may be closed before you can enter it if there is a function. We waited for about 45mins before eventually deciding to do something else.The cathedral itself is so much grander than you would expect and is amazing to behold

Well worth the wait. We arrived at 9,30(it opens at 10hr) and we entered the towers at 11hr.Would recommend getting there between 9,15 and 9,30 otherwise the queue becomes huge.Our wait was well worth once we climbed the towers and saw the magnificent belfry,views and gargoyles.Don't miss the towers if in paris
Gorgeous. The inside of the Notre Dame is beautiful and it's worth paying to go into the side chapel to see all the treasures..
Beautiful. Absolutely magnificent. We were lucky enough to be there when there was a mass, so we were able to also hear the beautiful organ. A must when you are in Paris!

Get there early!. You will queue at any time of the day as only a certain number are admitted at a time, but you should get there early to minimise the wait and take a bottle of water and some sun cream! The wait is worth it though: the gargoyles and grotesques are great to see at close quarters and there are some fabulous views from the top. Recommended.

So beautiful!. Super beautiful and next to lovely gardens which make for a peaceful sit in the sun, if you're waiting for someone that is queuing for a few hours to see the inside! Makes for lovely photographs on the Paris tourist trail, although I would not personally want to waste hours queuing to get inside again when there's other things to do in Paris ☺ ♥

Have to visit.. My first visit to Paris I visited but didn't understand the hype (as I was 14 on a school tour) I visited later with college again (Art college) when I was 20 and had a better perspective and really enjoyed seeing it again with better knowledge!

One of our favorites from Paris. Climbing the towers and seeing the view of the city was amazing. Probably the best view of the city we had. And just really coolBeing up there with the gargoyles, bell tower, etc. worth the climb!

Bob and Michele in Paris. A tremendous experience. When you tour the cathedral make sure to see the crown of thorns behind the red colored glass. Have your guide explain the display in detail. A real lifetime experience for me and my wife as I'm sure it will be for you..

favorite place in all paris.. best thing in all of paris. the wait took about 30 minutes and it probably cost me 8 euro to get to the top (i forget how much exactly), but i loved every minute I was there.
Do it. Such an old and historic building, awesome architecture and such fine detail, it's a must see on your travels.

Spectacular views. I am so glad I did this while in Paris. The view from the top is absolutely incredible! Seeing the gargoyles up close was really cool as well. Expect to have to wait in line for an hour or two in peak times but it is well worth it.
If you have time test it. Despite passing many time in the queue under the hot Sun, it can be a nice experience. Anyway, I personally recommend it in autumn.

Must Visit. Every Chuch, Every Stain Glass window, every holy place has a peaceful feel.... very busy but allow yourself to have faith in your journey through the Cathedral.... steeped in french history
Cool. Very cool architecture. I would definitely go there again if I ever get to go back. Watch for pick pockets here, they target this area. That was the only negative.
Worth the queue!. Spectacular views. Just note that the queues are outside to the left of the Cathedral as we assumed you gained entry to the towers inside.

Prepare for climbing steps. cathedral is beautiful and very historic. You can climb the steps to roof level to get fabulous city views -
TIP you find the entry for these on the left hand side of the cathedral in the side street (not signposted)
Will be going back. Will be going back. Was lovely inside however I didn't have the opportunity to go to the top which I feel is a must so will be done.
tough to get in - long lines. tough to get in - long lines - we stood on line for an hour and then gave up - not sure if it would have been worth the wait???
Notre-Dame Cathdral Tour. Just Amazing.......This place, they are not enought words to express......The people visiting don not adhere to the silence rule but overall you will not mind one bit.

Amazing location and Cathedral. The Cathedral is in an impressive location: you have to walk around the building and admire the location it has been build in, surrounded by the rivers on both sides.
The inside is impressive, the portals, architectural elements, stain glass windows, bells and clocks and the twin cathedral towers. Impressed with the cutural, religious and building sculpture,
Notre-Dame. Be prepared to wait in line to enter this magnificent structure. The day we visited the temperature was in the high thirties but well worth the wait.
Definetily climb to the top. Definitely climb to the top even though it costs some money, the view is amazing from there and you can see the gargoyle's close up! Fun for kids and adults.

Wonderful !!!. No way not to visit Notre Dame.....Wonderful place....U will not have to wait a so long time, and the inside cathedral will make u discover treasures of the french History..... Do no hesitate to pay, inside for the treasure room, it s more than wonderful !
Cathedral in a nice area to spend some time. Notre Dame was nice but what was great we're all the little eateries and restaurants nearby, also many places to have a little shop
Nice Experience. It was a very good experience since it was my first time. It was a drizzling a little still there was a decent crowd to enter into the cathedral.

Cathedral in Paris. You have to visit Notre-Dame it is not only a religious place but also an historical place where Napoléon was crowned where the libération of Paris in 1944 was celebrated whith général de Gaulle and whith a lot of stained glasses, tresure, it is the place where all the greatest. Évents take place. It is also the most visited place by tourists, so be patient.
Historic. It's a must see on your trip to Paris! Go inside and witness mass if you can. Very historic building

Worth the climb. This was well worth the wait to climb the many stairs up the tower of Note Dame Cathedral. I visited in summer so this attraction was very popular. This visit takes about two hours as your is retracted to twenty minutes at the top. There is two levels and can get crowded. There are lots of photo opportunities for selfies with gargoyle or two and Paris as a backdrop. Make sure you have been to the bathroom first and bring comfortable walking shoes, water and a snack (for the queue). I had to pay an entrance fee but my daughter did not as she has a European passport and is under 26 years so lucky her. I am medium fitness, over 55 and managed the towers fine.

gargoyles!. Tha only way to see the gargoyles closer is to get it towers, wich means to wait in sometimes aone-two hours-line and face a lot of steps, but i think it worths not only for the gargoyles but also due to the beautiful view you have from the top, specially on spring time.
Looks nice. We didn't go into cathedral, but looks an excellent building and work of art. Very long queues so skip the line
Notre-Dame. Climbing to the top was a little strenuous - and worth every step! The views are amazing. We were inside the church during an actual mass and everyone was extremely respectful. Beautiful!

Perhaps the most remarkable piece of architecture in Paris. Does not really need any random advertisement, truly amazing, majestic and monumental and yet delicately decorated. Certainly a place to visit in Paris (for me, above most of the other known attractions)

Easy to find and free to enter!. Stopped in here our first day in Paris. Easy to find on the Ile De La Cite, it was about a 15 minute walk from our hotel near the Luxembourg gardens (you can also catch the metro to Cite or st michel-notre dame).Doesn't take a long time to visit if you've got a little time to fill, plus its free to enter the main areas (For a price you can also climb the towers). Be aware though that even though its free, its still controlled entry, so you have to line up. At 10am in early May we were fine, but at peak times the line can get a bit long. As one of the big landmarks of Paris, theres really no reason not to visit!
Paris . The towers of notre dame is hugeWhen I visit it it was close to Christmas time and they put a big tree in front of the main heat I loved it
Must visit it. It is must to visit Notre-Dame Cathedral. It is also very beautiful at night. The queue for the entrance is big, but goes very fast.
beautifull. This is a beautifull building with great architecture. You have to go inside to see how great this was made.

So worth it! . We had a Museum Pass to use for this visit- 3 adults and a 9 year old child. Although it doesn't give you priority access or a separate queue, we still feel it is definitely worth a visit. This is our third Paris visit and we had not climbed the towers before. So glad we did now! We stopped by earlier on a Friday and the queue was very long so we decided to come back at a later time. On Fridays and Saturdays, they close at 11pm. We came back at 9pm on Friday and had a "short" 20 minute queue. Yes, we had to climb tons of stairs and I would question myself why was I doing this. However, once we reached the chimera level (with all the gargoyles), I was so glad to be here. What an awesome view of Paris! I have no words to describe it! We also climbed the tower to see the southern bells and then climbed up the southern tower all the way to the top. Amazing views of the entire city! Please be aware you need to climb hundreds of steps in a spiral, narrow staircase. We are so glad we were able to do this!

The magic feeling of ancient place. I was so exited to see Notre Dame! We been there both during the day, to visit the interior and see the tower, and in the evening,for a romantic pics by the bridge. An advic: never visit Paris in August. We had to queue more then an hour!

Awe-Inspiring. LOVE Notre-Dame. Its beautiful and reverent and even to see it at night when it is lit up is a real treat! I would highly recommend going at night as well as during the day to get the full effect. It is truly awe-inspiring.

if in summer wear something light and take cold refreshments with you as it will be very hot. you have to go extremely early to be able to enter as the waiting line is extremely long and the museum pass is no good here.personally i don't think it's worth the wait.

The view next to the monsters. By the left hand side (facing the Cathedral) you can enjoy an hour queue (if you are lucky). there's not priority access even if you are a museum pass holder. The passages along the way up are very tiny and you feel like you are penetrating the monument being part of it. Then you reach the top where you gonna have a spectacular view of the city standing by the scaring monsters

An amazing, historic landmark but the outside is enough. Once you have seen this from the outside you have seen the best part, don't bother going inside if the queues are long but the outside is spectacular and well worth it.
The Bells!. It's a bit of a hike but worth it.Accessing the bell tower was the main highlight for our family.Yet again,another magical experience in Paris!
Great architecture and must visit for Victor Hugo fans. Beat the queues by getting tickets in advance. The queues are looooong and i can't stress that enough. Once inside though its all worth it.
Worth the climb. Notre dam was amazing. Great history and awesome to think that we actually visited this world famous landmark
Honeymoon. This was great as well. You get to go to the top and the view is beautiful. You get to see everything.
Very peaceful .. Notre-Dame was very peaceful. It can get crowded over weekends. I collected coin as souvenir for 2 Euros

Great Views. We waited in line for about 2 hours but it was well worth it! The views are amazing and seeing the gargoyles up close was mind blowing. My one piece of advice is to get there early to avoid the line.
Not to miss Notre Dame..... You have to spend an afternoon touring the area - the Notre-Dame Cathedral is amazing, and the surrounding areas are a glimpse into time....

Less accessible than we had hoped. The line to ascend the towers runs 1-2 hours, and compared to our experience 20 years ago, it is not possible to get close to the beautiful La Pieta (the altar piece).

Great views. We queued around the side ( Thankfully in the shade ) for about 45 minutes which wasn't too bad really. We started the ascent and omg it was hard work getting to the top for both myself and my 17 year old lad but so worth it once at the top. The views were spectacular and as we didn't get to go up the Eiffel Tower, this was the next best thing. Just be prepared to climb lots of stairs on a narrow spiral case and to squish around corners once on the balcony are up top.. Lovely seeing the gargoyles up close to. My son went into the bell tower and said it was quite a small doorway he had to crouch in. The descent wasn't too bad though almost made you feel dizzy :D

Architecture. This is one of the most amazing buildings in Europe in my opinion. The building took many years to build and there are many intricacies in the architecture to be absorbed by someone with an appreciation for buildings.

Very interesting and historical place.. THe most famous cathedral in the world, teeming with history and the subect of on e of the great childrens stories of all time - The Hunchback of Notre Dame... Very interesting and historical place.

Notre Dame Cathedral did not disappoint. Notre Dame Cathedral is a place of history and imagination. Although Quizimoto was not home, I could see where the story came from. The gothic décor and stature of the structure itself lends itself to the imagination. The actual history of the area around the Cathedral was the thing of legend. In the Crypt below the open courtyard had actual ruins to explore and models of days of yesteryear.

Great for quick in and out. This is a hard review. While everyone should at least view this church, there are by far more grand churches elsewhere (Vienna, Strasbourg) I would not pay to do the towers or the catacombs as they are day wasters.
Beautiful. Stunning architecture and history. Loved loved loved it. Couldn't take enough pictures. It beautiful from far away and close up you can see amazing detail.
Great Panoramas. I always wanted to get a photo of the gargoyles overlooking Paris. This is the place. You won't be disappointed.

Magnificent Structure & Famous Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral in the heart of Paris. Interesting like so many structures in Paris, the locals once abandoned this structure (i.e. Eiffel Tower was a hated structure). Great that people are slow to act.

Tres Bon! A real treat to feast your eyes on. I have seen this magnificent architecturally important landmark of Paris many times on the television. The story of the hunch back told by Disney and Hollywood where fantasy often has a licence to thrill, well this visit took my breath away with the gargoyles and other creations made by masons so many centuries ago.

The problem with climbing the tower is you can no longer see Norte Dame. Lots of steps here. You can imagine why the noted, fictional bell ringer struggled. Good view and interesting gargoyles. I'd say that you should just go inside Norte Dame and leave the towers to be viewed from outside. There are better views and shorter lines.

Wow! Must SEEEEEEEE. We followed someone's advice on here and arrived to the cathedral before 8.30am as it is less busy close to opening time which is 8am. We didn't even have breakfast until after and let me tell you it was definitely worth it! Not many crowds and we noticed when we came out how busy it was starting to get. When there are less crowds you get nicer picture opportunity moments so that’s always a plus! The structure, architecture and every design in there is breath-taking. A place of amazing history, you must make a stop here just to enjoy the sheer beauty of it.

Lovely cathedral. Lovely to visit and a nice area of Paris to wander around (fourth arrondissement). The cathedral is busy with tourists at all times but still worthwhile going to see it - whether you go inside or not.
So beautiful.. We arrived early in the morning and although there was quite a long queue it wasn't too long of a wait and definitely worth while once you're inside. Beautiful inside and out.

The fairytale never ends in Paris. You can almost feel the presence of Quasimodo!! It's a must one for sure :)It is in the island from which Paris was born! It is in the center and it is worthwhile to go on foot!

Go early!. This line moves very slow, as they only let a certain amount of people up the tower at a time. I showed up 1 hour early and was about 5th in line. By the time it opened, the line was around the block. The views of the city are unmatched, and seeing the gargoyles up close is very neat. There are a lot of stairs, so make sure you are in shape before you climb this.
Worth it. The line looks long and intimidating, but it really goes quickly. This is definitely a must see in Paris. The architecture is amazing and you really need to go inside!
Great Church to visi. Great Church to visit in the center of pairs. Go little bit early or you have to be in the long queue.
Very beautiful building and even better inside. Very beautiful building and even better inside, very much worth a visit even the queues were long but were moving at a steady pace.
Beautiful. An excellent location for torusits seeking to take in local culture and architecture. A great historical landmark In Paris and a must see.Great place.

Ques Ques and more Ques. We didn't even bother to try and get into the Notre-Dame Cathedral, the ques were right out the door all the way across the square - it wasn't a complete waste though the outside of the building is stunning and we got some lovely photos of it.

a MUST!. We went first to the Cathedral, around 9am, and then to make the line for the Towers, that opens at 10:00am.All the steps that you need to take to climb to the top are well worthed, the views from here of Paris are amazing, and pictures next to famous gargoles very nice, my teen daughter and I, really enjoy it all, the exquisit, majestic Cathedral and the Towers.I will not recomend this climbing for little kids, older adults, or any person in not good shape, is a lots of stairs, in a very narrow staircase, with lots of people, if you start climbing cannot stop, so make a note of this, is no elevators or lift.Enjoy!

The grand DAME!. Definitely don't need any more introduction to this place. Your visit to Paris is not complete if you failed to visit the grand dame of Paris. One of the most beautiful cathedral that I have ever seen. Do a tour inside (the waiting line is long but its worth it), and be awed by the magnificent architecture details and workmanship. I spent a good 3 hours here. A must visit in Paris.

Overrated. Nice from the outside, but after going 3 times on different trips my take is that its not the most epic of cathedrals (unlike Sagrada Familia or Il Duomo). But, clearly I'm in the minority on this.

The craftsmanship is nice. As the title states the craftsmanship is nice. If these kinds of things suits your fancy then go. My daughter selected this attraction. Oh it is a long line. It was average.

Beautiful. It is free to get into view the Notre Dame- line at the front is the one you get into. If you want to view the towers, you need prior reservation or you will be stuck in a long line. Beautiful views. Walkable from metro. A must visit in paris
Romantic. Amazing Place and romantic, clean city. People are very nice. The place is exquisite. When yo go inside, you can feel peaceful.
Big, Historical. must see, worth visiting, big. the park around is worth a stroll. So many good restaurants around this place and is easily accessible.

Amazing simply amazing. there is some much history here, the windows are awesome, the balconies have a presence about them. I won't forget Notre Dame it ha slept an impression, a must see on yours Paris trip, I don't think I have seen a more eerie cathedral anywhere I the world.
Visit between 3&4pm Stunning.. Stunning - just stunning! Spent extra euros to look inside treasury, unfortunately we missed seeing the crown, which was displayed between 3 & 4 pm.

Breath Taking Experience. It was just breath taking to be standing in front of the Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral. To go inside one could feel the sacredness of the place. There were places where people could sit. Had any number of pictures of saint.

Majestic!. This is the second time I have been here and she never ceases to amaze and impress! So majestic and exquisite! And please don't be put off by the presence of miliatary surrounding her - unfortunately a necessary item for the security of this icon!

Notre Dame Not This Time. Easy to get to by open top tour bus or by metro disappointingly the queues are hours long in the open, (no shade or shelter).
The place is heaving, as we had visited before (earlier in the year) we decided to miss out this time.

Breathe Taking. My sure you have a camera for this site. The architect was astonishing, You'll find yourself snapping pictures of every part of the Notre- Dame. Just Plain Beautiful if your into these things. Amazing

One of the "Must Visit" places in Paris. This is another bucket list item. I know it sounds hokey to say "I've been to Notre Dame" who cares? Enjoy the experience. Don't forget to go to the archaeologic dig in front of the cathedral.
Nice visit. Must see especially if you have kids who love the Disney story. Great view. Very big building with a lot of details

Worth the wait and the climb of the South Tower. My husband and I didn't make it to Notre Dame early enough to skip the lines to get up in the tower. But it was worth the hour wait! The view you get to see once you climb the stairs (there are no elevators, and the stairwell is very skinny so if you are claustrophobic, just be aware!) I have been wanting to climb towers but either time nor the company I went with during previous visits didn't allow the opportunity.) We had only one day to spend in Paris before we flew out and that was my ultimate goal. We loved it! It costs us 14 euros/person. My suggestion is get there before the doors open for the towers so you do not have to wait so long in line. We happened to be in Paris during one of the hotter days. Thank goodness there were vendors right across the street while we waited in line so we can get bottle waters while waiting ;) Another tip: as you exit, instead of going down to exit, go up the stairs to the very top tower.Definitely worth-while to do!!!

Notre-Dame, worth the wait for the tour.. An iconic symbol of the power of the Catholic church in France as well as a favorite source of literary inspiration. A massive structure that is slightly frightening. Crowds abound. Surrounded by good restaurants.

Best views of Paris!. The climb to the top of the towers was one of the highlights of our visit to Paris. The gargoyles and views from the top were spectacular. We took some amazing pics!! Highly recommend!

Prepare for a long wait!. ... but excellent views across the Seine and out into Paris. They only let a small number of people in at a time as you have to wait in a small gift shop to purchase tickets before you get to climb the towers themselves.

Notre Dame Cathedral. Spend at least an hour taking in the serenity of the towers. But go early in the morning before the crowds, then enjoy the chocolate crepes made right outside! Avoid weekends and busy times as you will wait in a long line and be rushed through a beautiful and otherwise serene cathedral.

Don't miss the chance to go inside.. We first saw Notre-Dame from our boat along the River Seine but once you get up and close its breathtaking.The line to go in was super long but does move quiet quickly so don't be too intimidated by this.Inside the cathedral is amazing and not to be missed.
Always great to see while in Paris.. I've been to Paris three times and every time I go to Notre Dame. It's just insanely beautiful. It's a must see while in Paris.

If your only in Paris for one day you must visit. Stunning building and architecture just a shame having to take in the majestic sights and sounds of such an awe of a building with beggars and trinket sellers

Fabulous. Similar to my review of Notre-Dame, the towers being part of it, a quick and easy opportunity to visit historical places. Just walking around the outside of this Cathedral is breath taking. If time is essential, visit the cathedral from just the outside.

Well worth the wait . We waited in the queue for over an hour but that was because we didn't get there early enough but still the wait wasn't that bad. Finally got in and we were asked for ID - we got our tickets for free as we are between 18-25 years old so bear this in mind to take ID as it could save you money! The views from the top were fantastic, really enjoyed it.

Amazing views!. This is beautiful! I was able to climb the tower with only a 90 minute wait. However, we did get in line at 0830 they opened at 0900 and we were able to submit by 1000. The views are worth the wait, in the summer it is best to go early as the wait is long and there is no shade while waiting.
Amazing. The view and experience is certainly worth the climb and the few extra dollars. Some day this climb will be closed and you'll wish you'd done it!
Not to be missed. The towers of the cathedral are an architectural wonder and worth seeing. The queues to get inside we just far too late by so on this trip we did not get inside.
Great place to see for free. Beautiful and historic and so much more. Must see. The history of this Cathedral is amazing. The architecture blew my mind. The stained glass is beautiful. Its free!
H and P take Paris. Waited in line about an hour but well worth it. Don't come if you can't climb stairs. Very crowded even when you get to the top but still a great experience.

DONT MISS THE TOWERS!. Go up to the tower, if you're fit and young! There are around 450 stairs to climb and the place is very narrow, however its totally totally worth visiting! Dont be depressed when you see the long lines, we all felt the same way. Once you reach the top, you'll understand how worth the wait was. P/S try to see the sunset from the top. super beautiful!
Nice bells sounds. I didn't want to go up in beginning, but when been there on top was great time with pictures and great time to hear bells which was great :)
Gothic temple. The cathedral is very somber and dark, and when you go inside you can understand why it is gothic architecture reference. Art is everywhere you look.

Consider a "Skip the Line" Guided tour to save time/add value. We paid for a "skip the line" tour which provides you with a guide; a tour of Ile de la Cite; Notre Dame Cathedral and quick access to the Towers. It's worth the $$ in terms of not wasting time standing in line and the added information from the guide about Paris, Notre Dame and the towers. There are a lot of stone steps to climb in a narrow stairway; but everyone moves pretty slowly. However small children and people with mobility or breathing problems might want to skip it (there's no elevator). At the first level there is a gift shop (which you will not see on the way back down from the towers via a different staircase). Next level up has wonderful views of Paris; you can walk around the narrow parapets at your own pace and get close up views and pictures of the many Gargoyles and Chimera. I think this level has the most interesting panoramic views of the city and the widest assortment of stone creatures. Don't rush to get to the next (highest) level. That next level also has some very good,high 360 views of the city and some gargoyles. Then you descend, without stopping down a different staircase from the very top to the ground. There is also a stop partway up where you can visit the bell tower and see the large bells from close-up.

A very special visit..... A stunning experience.... It is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have visited. What made it just so much more special is that there was a choir practising while we were there - felt as if I was in heaven. An absolute must see if you visit Paris. Unfortunately we did not have time to go up in the towers - will do that next time

Excellent at night, too!. We stayed within walking distance of Notre-Dame Cathedral. You can go up the towers as well. I suggest getting a Paris Pass and it will let you skip the lines in most major attractions. VERY IMPORTANT!Think about going back after dark and see how amazing it looks at night, too.

The Bells of Notre Dame.. Always a thrill, inside and out. Our apt had a view of the Cathedral. By the third day our 10 year old granddaughter said, "you know, after a while those bells are kind of annoying." We howled with laughter.. We won't let her forget that one. And she enjoyed attending an evening organ concert with us two nights later. .
towers of notre dame cathedral. you have to be athletic to get up these towers and the take an overview for Paris. the view is fantastic. you can see everything in Paris.

Wow Factor. This is a must see while in Paris. We were more excited to see Notre Dame than anything else in Paris. Take a lock with you to leave on the gate on the bridge and become part of history. Go early to get in line (very early- approximately 7:00 a.m.) Do not plan a late afternoon trip because you’ll be either frustrated or miss out seeing the inside. The plaza outside is always crowded.
Go early!. Get there when they open at 8:00 - it's one of the earliest things open in Paris, so you can see it before breakfast with no lines and very little security!

Gargoyle sightings. Did the Tower climb - was well worth the wait (maybe 60 or 70 minutes). Two viewing points - from the top of the Chapel, then up to the top of a tower. Great views. Museum pass works here.
We just happened to be on time for the free tour. We have been here twice before, but the tour really explained it very well. We were thankfull for the free admission fee and we donated for the tour.
An amazing building. Tourists can walk around the beautiful Cathederal of Notre Dame while services are being held. Its a dark but mesmerising place. Well worth a visit

So very worth it!. This is something that was on my list of "must-do" and I'm glad we braved the rain and wind and stood in line for an hour before the ticket door opened! The line starts on the left side (if facing the cathedral), there is a small door with a sign (if you're lucky). The lines get long fast and by the time we left, the lines were ridiculously long (both to enter the cathedral and to the tower climb). But, it is so worth it. The views from the towers are amazing and the gargoyles are also really cool! The bells are amazing too! Beyond describable - but highly recommended.There are stairs, narrow walkways and it is windy in certain places. If you are able and healthy - do it - you won't regret it!! It only takes about an hour (not counting the hour in line), but it is so neat!! A little tip: If you are in the line early, there is a little cafe across the street that sells coffee (latte & espresso) and baked goods, there are a couple other walk-up counters that open about 30 mins before the line door opens too.

A must see in Paris. This is one of the must see buildings in paris. most of the time there is a queue for this attraction But it is well worth the wait. Make sure you have some breadcrumbs As you can hand feed the sparrows in the courtyard in front of cathedral ( this was more fun then it sounds).When you have finished make a visit to the small garden around back of cathedral this was a nice place to have some lunch.

Headless saint on Notre-Dame Cathedral - you need to see it!. Great Towers to see inside but as well as outside..You can find there something very unique...there is one saint who is just without head, and he keeps his head in his hands...that is on the left side of towers on the front side just above the left left doors - look carefully and you will see it.

Nice place to visit when you are in Paris. Nice place to go when you plan to visit paris, we visited it more then once and still love to go there.Last time we visited was in the beginning of august 2014
very nice. A must see also , very old and you can go on top of the cathedral and see Paris from the top.I was amazed

great views, long wait. After touring the cathedral, we decided to climb the towers and check out one of the best views of Paris. The line was about 45 minutes long and moved very slowly. We purchased tickets before our trip, but this was the one instance where that didn't really help. You climb several steps then go into the gift shop where you can buy tickets to get to the top.The climb is an adventure... around 325 steps gets you to the main level. Close up views of the gargoils and great views of the crowd below. The best views are from the very top, another 125 or so steps higher. The views from the top are only bested by the Eiffel Tower itself.Don't plan on climbing the steps if you have any mobility issues. They are tightly wound, spiraling marble steps. It was worth the climb to us, even if we had "legs of jello" when we got back to the ground.

One word: AMAZING. I was able to attend service here. I did not understand a word but I could not pass up the opportunity. It was quite difficult to focus as my eyes marveled at the beauty of the cathedral. Once the service was complete, we explored the many carvings and even lit a candle for a loved one. It was the experience of a lifetime.

Up-close view of chimera. Queue up 45 minutes to an hour before the opening time along the left side of the cathedral as you're facing it. You get a great view of the city in all directions AND and an up-close view of the chimera., as well as the bells. It's worth the exertion.
Magnificent. My heart melts thinking about his place. It was such a life changing experience to stand in front of these two towers. The detail on the buildings could bring a grown man to tears.

Great Historic Landmark. Beautiful cathedral - so much history. a stunning historic landmark that you must see!remember to cover up as you wont be allowed in if your not. also get there early as the line can be long.

Went on a Sunday. A very beautiful church of course we wanted to see if more because of the old Hunch back. However we disappointed when we saw the line and that It cost to go up.We went on a Sunday so we could go in during mass which was interesting.

Very crowded but worth the wait.. It was a bit of a wait to get in but once inside the majesty of this tourist trap (in the best possible sense) can not be missed. Light a candle and say a prayer for loved ones.
Aussies in Paris. Nice spot for some great photo opportunities. Paris has so much to see. The hop on hop off bus tours are good value.

Magnificent Church.. This is a magnificent church. Entrance is free and we had to make a line, which moved pretty fast. The stained glass windows are awesome. Around you will find plenty of cafes with pretty good prices. If you want you can go to the top.

Victor Hugo loved it and so did we!. We were in Notre Dame during Mass. It is quite a place! Reverant and beautiful! We sat outside and listened to the bells toll. Beautiful sound! We were told Hugo's masterpiece novel was supposed to be more about the cathedral than Quasimoto. I can see why. It is spectacular!
Amazing to be inside. I would suggest to go early in the am. The crowds and lines just get longer as the day progresses. Once inside its quite amazing to see how talented human hands can be.

Stunningly beautiful but extremely long wait. The price was very reasonable being that eu citizens under 25 go in for free and adults pay just 8 euros each. The views are the best! Priceless! And its so magnificent to see the gargoyles and the massive bells up close! Definitely feels mysterious and wonderful to be so high up over a national treasure of a cathedral <3

An unusual experience. We reached the Cathedral on a Sunday night, and walked into a very nice audio visual presentation. The ambiance was calming and the presentation was very informative. We went back the next day, during day time and climber the tower. A great experience.

Heart-stopping and breathtaking. Notre Dame is purely magical and like no other cathedral. Climbing up the stairs of the towers may be quite a workout but the view is worth it. My favorite part was standing on top of the towers at noon when the bells play songs for 10 minutes. Make sure to arrive in time to hear the bells ring at noon. But watch out for gypsies that hang out in the line for going up the towers. They approach visitors asking if they speak English and pretend to be tourists and cut in line to pickpocket.

Patience rewarded. We stood in line for 2 1/2 hours to go up. The Paris Pass or Fast Track Entry won't get you special treatment, so it's to the back of the line. If you're there with kids, there is a playground round back in the park and you can grab a bottle of water from a store across from where the line is moving along painfully slowly.Going up is a medium level climb, several smaller kids were there and did it with no problem.Once you're up there, things are reasonable on the first landing. You can walk around, see the city, beautiful. After you up to the top level, things are somewhat chaotic because of how the line meanders through some bottle necks. We spent a good half hour up there trying to go downstairs, as did a lot of other people because of those couple of bottle necks.Would I do it again? Yes, but plan to spend a half day.

Wonderful Architecture. It is an amazing architectural building with aesthetic appeal. The bells sound wonderful...just like the movie...and it makes one think of Quasimodo. It is not open everyday and it is important to check that it is before you go there. I went with the tour bus and I liked the idea as the mode of travel is wonderful and you get to see a lot of Paris that way. Get a three day pass...

Worth the long wait in line. Just as all the reviews said, the view from the top is fantastic. One walked through narrow open walkways up and down along the roof, ridges, examining the detailed architecture and roof designs. Unfortunately there is no way to bypass the 1 to 2 hours wait in line.
well worth it. A great experience in a great tourist site the place was very busy and we had to queue for a short time but well worth it

Must to see. It is the most important heritage site in Paris. It is church. Very nostalgic and good place to visit. It comes next to Louvre Museum. It must be added as important place to see. You may take tube or Bus.

Beautiful but couldn't bare the long line.. . However it is so close to shops and restaurants that we still made a day out of it.. So we took some pictures and went to eat in the near by 'Alexander's'
Long lines. Lines were too long to go in, but it is a sight not to be missed for any trip to Paris whether you have the time to go in or not.
Awe inspiring!. Lines were long, but visit is well worth it. Get there early to be able to get in! The paintings were magnificent as was the stained glass.

1 hr line wait after lunchtime. We waited the hour for the tower tour. The line moves slowly, but it only took an hour. We had great views of the city. and it was pretty cool to see the gargoyles on the church up close.
Good visit. It's a pretty and important church, if you have time, do visit but wouldn't recommend going on the top, its expensive, no elevator and view is not that great.

Wonderful View Point. Be prepared for a long line unless you line up by 9:00 am for the 10:00 am opening time. Also be prepared for a climb of 400 stairs if you include the bell tower steps which are found through the two small doors on your left at the upper landing. The views make the climb worthwhile.
Must See. Just an amazing place. A must see when visiting the city of lights. Long line to get in sometimes but worth the wait

Don't miss the bell tower!. Even with the Museum Pass the lines were extremely long, but worth the wait. When you get to the top of the stairs, and get outside, the view is fabulous. Follow along the front of the facade, watch for the turn that brings you to a small door, that leads to the Bell Tower. Follow the wooden stairs to view the framing of the tower and see two beautiful large bells! Such a treat!
Very nice. This was very nice. The narrowness of everything made it much less crowded... there were a lot of steps, but it was worth it. =)
Not as big as you expect. Beautiful building but it wasnt as outstanding as I was expecting it to be. The museum underneath was interesting
Beautiful architecture. Very crowded but worth the wait. Stunning stained glass windows and architechture. Memorabillia on sale inside the church should be sold outside.
A must see!!. Fabulous. You could climb to the top if you wanted. We didn't have time but there was a long line for it.
Anniversay Vacation. inspiring. Beautiful. Reflective. A must visit for persons interested in the history of the church. Prepare to stand in line to enter, but it moves fast.
Magnificent. One can dwell in to history with devotion and appreciate the impressive architecture transformed over the centuries.

The 400 steps to the top are worth it!. Get in line to climb to the top of the bell tower early (like at 9 a.m.) and you'll be in the first groups to go. We did that, and we were finished by 10:30 a.m. and on our way to do other things for the rest of the day.

When in Paris!. Was surprised there was no admission fee! Worth the wait in a hot line but, like I said, when in Paris this is one Cathedral you don't want to miss. Should you get to Bayeux, however, the Cathedral of Notre-Dame Bayeux is even more spectacular!! Amazing actually...Enjoy!!

Long wait, great view. Many reviewers are confusing this with the Cathedral itself. Note that many Trip Advisor contributors think they are reviewing the Cathedral, which is free to enter. The towers are a separate entrance. We were there the last week of June. The doors open at 10 AM. We watched the lines over several days and they always seemed too long. On our last morning in Paris (a Wednesday) we went at 10 AM, the line was already 200 yards/meters down the block. We waited 75 min to pay and enter. The access is very tightly controlled; once inside there is more waiting to be allowed to the first stage, which is where the gargoyles are seen up close, and nice views of the Seine, Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur. Then more waiting to be allowed to the top. We ran out of time and actually descended without getting to the top.My guess is that you should budget 2.5 hours to get in and get to the top in high season. Of course the view is utterly unique and that is why it's worth waiting, but the wait was terrible and so 4 stars, not 5.

Get in touch with the monument. It certainly is worth the hike. Get up there, feel the building and enjoy the spectacular views. I seriously is more interesting than the Eiffel Tower. And read on Viollet-le-Duc first - things will make more sense then.

Awesome. There is a sense of awe about the Cathedral that greats right at its doors, how could anyone have built such an exquisite place. This is genuinely one of the wonders of life, and if anyone's is in Paris don't miss the opportunity.

Amazing. Notre-Dame is steeped in history and is a very impressive building. For such a big tourist attraction it is very reasonably priced and the queue is run with military precision.Because of the steepness of the steps only a small number of people are allowed in at a time which makes sense, it also means that you get longer to admire the gargoyles and the view!I thoroughly enjoyed the view form the top of the tower and would highly recommend this to anyone.
Another Landmark not to miss Free Entry. The stain glass windows in here are the most beautiful i have ever seen. It is free to enter and the line moves quickly so make sure you go inside.

The history and timeline of the constrcution is interesting.. Though it was very hot when we visited and the line was long, it was worth the wait. I had visited before (in 2002), but had to go back again last month. Paid more attention to the history of the construction this time.

Beautiful inside and outside!. This is a must for any trip to Paris! Be sure to look for center of Paris landmark, a marker in the ground just out front to the left hand side of the Church. Pictures are forbidden, too bad, but possible if you are quick and quiet! Watch for pickpockets!!
Amazing. What an amazing structure both inside and out. You cannot but feel but humble as you enter through the grand doors and take in the beauty within.

Just a picturesque peaceful walk through one of the real treasures of Paris. The exterior architecture of the church was really breathtaking. The interior was even more stunning the stained glass on the opposite sides of the alter were incredible. There is a statue of Joan of Arc and a plaque remembering the British troops who fought with France in WW1

This lovely cathedral is a must to see. Inside Notre Dame there is a feeling of intense tranquility, even with the throng of visitors. A must is a climb to the bell tower.Views over Paris incomparable.

Exhilarating hike, beautiful view. The Towers of the Notre-Dame Cathedral is actually a separate entrance outside of the cathedral itself. With over 300 steps, the towers certainly require a sufficient amount of hiking. I would definitely say that the view at the pinnacle of the iconic towers is worth the time and energy it takes to climb to the top.
Magnifique. Its all just WOW...and WOW and WOW.....worth the walk worth the time....You need to experience it yourself.

Beautiful at sunset. Only viewed from the outside this time as it was after hours. Last visit we waited in line forever!!!! If you have a chance go out to Bayaux, france. No lines and just a smaller version of this church, saw it on the way back from Normandy and hands down more enjoyable due to no crowds.

Incredible. Beautiful cathedral, one of the most beautiful in the world. Be prepared to stand in line for at least an hour, it is well worth it! Also, use the guided audio tour it is worth the couple pounds to learn all the history. Do not miss this.
Go to the top! Line starts at a door on the left side of the building.. Go to the top! Its a lot of stairs and you have to pay, but its totally worth it. The view is incredible.

Gothic, Enormous, Stunning!. If there's one thing I can say about the French, it's that they do nothing halfway! The Notre Dame Cathedral is a masterpiece of Gothic craftmanship. A cavernous cathedral that is as mind-blowing both outside and in. During the summer months, in the evenings, they show a documentary about the history of the cathedral in the main sanctuary. The best part, it's free!Be prepared for crowds and watch out for gypsies and pickpockets (they're everywhere).

Breathtaking!. I thought Cathedral in Canada was better. Having seen both this has a much better detail. PS: you must come prepared to queue up to enter as it tends to get busy and you could wait for hours!

I wish Quasimodo was there!. Not catholic, nor am I into big churches, but you have to go and see it and take some pictures. The structure itself is impressive, in terms of sheer size and detail. A lot of the churches in Europe can start to look pretty similar, but this one is definitely worth the trip.

Historic Center Piece in Paris. Upon approaching this beautiful cathedral, the details of the massive workmanship and skills that have been used to create such a place is mind blowing. For it to have survived during the war, it is a miracle into itself. But today, there is still work that is being done to make it even more appealing but the historical events that it has witnessed and a place for worship is it main appeal. This is another "do not miss" while on your Paris visit.

Wonderful part of History. It was majestic inside very tall high ceilings beautiful statues also very dark inside they had a very nice gift shop. We did the tour on our own without a tour guide it was wonderful to see itl

I truly enjoyed my visit to the cathedral and appreciated its rich history.. This is truly a Cathedral you must visit.This venues entrance if free and well worth it.It is close to most of the attractions and on the hop on hop off bus routes.
The best bit!. Definitely the best bit of the cathedral, you can revel in your Disney childhood dreams with gargoyles galore while also enjoying sumptuous view of the city!

A must visit - go early. We started queuing half an hour before the official opening time, and already had more than 100 people ahead of us :). Once they were open the queue moved reasonably fast, and the views from the gallery and top of the towers were worth every single second of the wait!! Our timing was lucky and we were able to watch the fly-past on July 14 - which was amazing, the planes were so very close!
notre dame spouts. It is a challenge to have nice photo of the Paris with detail one of the famous spout. They are really creepy:D

Beautiful church. Very nice, it is huge but on the other hand once you get to see a few churches they all look the same. This one is a bit more interesting as it took over a 100 years to build and is spectacular on the outside.

Excellent!!! A must do attraction. Excellent!!! We loved everything about this attraction and were luck enough to be there when a Sunday Service mass was going on. This is definately a must do attraction
Must see list. The Cathedral is on Must visit list It's gorgeous,you can go to the roof to see the view of Paris but not on the service days.There is bathrooms and Restorants near by

Beautiful cathedral. All this while we see this place was through movies and documentary. We were in awe when we experienced the place first hand. The structure was awesome and majestic in its special way.

Must Visit. Another 'monument' we prefer from the ground these days but did make the trip to the top once a long time ago. The symmetry of the towers and their relation to the rest of the Cathedral are lovely.

Long wait time for the towers. Prepare for a long wait time for the stairs to go up the towers, so get there early. There are no advance priority queues. The stairs are narrow and so are the areas at the top of the towers. This is well worth the wait! It is a beautiful view from the top and if you get lucky like we did, the bells will toll! It costs about 9 Euros, but if you have the Museum Pass it is covered.
Beautiful Cathedral Notre Dame. This was by far one of the nicest cathedrals I have visited. It is well preserved and you will feel quasimoto was present with all the nostalgia.

Lots of stairs but the view is worth it!. There are 2 tours here - the free tour of the main floor of the cathedral and the paid tour of the towers. If you want to walk up the steps to the 2 upper levels, skip the lines in the front of Notre Dame and go to the street side. There is a separate line. For 8 Euros, you walk up to both upper levels and the bell tower. The views are amazing and I got some great pictures!

Beautiful and breathtaking!!!. Such a wonderfully built cathedral. The lines move quick but once you are in, take your time and take it all in. If you have the time, go to the bell towers. The square is loaded with plenty of sight seeing opportunities. If time permits, spend some time around the back of Notre Dame and maybe a live concert will be taking place. Take your time when visiting Notre Dame, you will not be disappointed.
Notre-Dame Visit. A mandatory stop during any visit to Paris. We had the opportunity of watching opera singers outside this Cathedral.

Just like Disney. Its really great! Its exactly like the Disney film, You can go right up into the bell towers. There are a lot of stairs to get to the top, so if you are less then average fitness, prepare for that. There is also a long wait and the museum pass does not avoid this. But it is totally worth it
Beautiful Notre-Dame. Definitely worth seeing while in Paris but to tour or get inside, be ready to wait awhile. Lines are there all the time and there is no quick way to bypass the line.
great. a other new experiance;relax&privit opinionsto learn& findt some more thinks in this world,dont just look at it,but understand it,wisely before you talk about it!

Nice views!. Definitely worth visiting for the best views. Just that the queues are too long, as the climb is through very narrow stairs - so, they can leave only very people at a time. You will need to climb 400+ stairs

Gargoyles!. Possibly the best part of this iconic church is its towers, offering breathtaking views of the city, and featuring the wonderful gargoyles! Stick around until the bells start ringing, it's amazing to hear them up close!

Impressive!. Beautiful architecture oozing with history and splendid appeal. And unlike the other attractions not too crammed with people trying to sell you stuff.Inside is as spectacular as outside and very relaxing believe it or not.

Just get there early. The towers were worth the wait! I am so glad we went back and did them. things to note: 1. Get there early, the line starts to wrap around the building if you don't. 2. The entrance to the towers is on the side of the building not the front. 3. there are a lot of stairs in a tight staircase so claustrophobes beware.

moving place. went in twice on Christmas Eve... once to have a look around and then we went back to the International Service in the night. We are not religious but it was a very moving experience and would urge anyone in Paris at this time to take part in this as you will not forget it in a hurry

You must climb the Tower, even if the line is long. Our first time, 12 years ago, we were in line prior to the opening and were up on top in short time. This time we did not arrive until 11AM and had to wait 90 minutes. Moral of the story - get there early or bring your patience. But even with the long wait, it was fabulous. You get up close and personal with gargoyles. You talk about The Hunchback of Notre Dame, (our 12 year old daughter knew all about Quasimodo from the Disney movie!, but Victor Hugo's original work is a wonderful read). And the views are just spectacular. But do be aware that there are 422 steps and going up is strenuous. You can pause along the way, and if you need to, do not let those behind you intimidate you. There are a few narrow landings where you can step aside and catch your breath. This is covered with your Museum Pass (you can buy online before you even leave on your vacation. The Pass is great for adults and not needed for children), but there is no quicker entry to the Tower. You wait in line with everyone else.

Climb the roof top. Get in line, be prepared to wait for a bit - about 30 mins. But it is very worth it. We've done this twice now and I think the view from Notre Dame is the best in Paris - better than the Eiffel tower or the Monteparnesse tower (but they are both great too). I like this view as it is right in town and not as high so what you can see is the beautiful city of Paris quite close to you. There are quite a few steps up and it is narrow in places so don't bother if you can't do stairs or walk well.

A Must See In Paris. A wonderful monument....go early in the morning or late in the evening when there are no crowds...well maintained, very helpful employees..this is a working church so you can't go into certain areas to take photos

Remarkable view worth the wait. Long, slow moving queue which is accessed from the left of Notre Dame as you look at the front. Separate to the obvious queue entering the front. Get there early in busy times. The view is fantastic and worth the wait in a slow moving queue.. Can jump the queue if part of a tour

Breathtaking!. On a lovely sunny day you have to be patient and queue for some time to get in..but it is worth it - as with all the glorious architecture in Paris, it is breathtaking and abounding in history.
The most historical name. The most important place in Paris to visit . The much admired monument is not to be missed . Keep your walking shoes for long walks here .

This is a MUST DO. My favorite places to visit. take the time to plan on the tower climb. It is interesting - see the bell, wowza views of Paris, Really cool up close and personal look at the gargoles... You really get the feeling of the scope of Notre-Dame and the area and of the age of this wonderful building. We enjoyed warm mull wine while waiting in line and met some great people.
A beautiful place. Yet another must. I enjoyed every minute. Liked everything. Disliked nothing. A piece of history. What a beautiful place.

Can't be in Paris and not visit Notre Dame.. I visit Notre Dame every time I'm in Paris. A few years ago my son and I climbed up the stairs to the bell tower. Think I'm probably too old for that now but still like to visit the beautiful church. This year I also enjoyed walking across the bridge with all the locks. It was a solo trip this year and lock or no lock I will go back to Paris!!
Fun!. Great views, very old - you can feel the steps of pilgrims through the centuries. The belfry was so cool.
