a disappointment. the story is in the history and in the architecture. there is no reason to waste time going inside. try to avoid the many gypsies outside.

History, art and a great view all in one place. Europe is full of history and this is a great place to start. The awe and wonder of this is incredible. The fact it was built a few hundred years ago, the art that is in it and the spirituality of it is second to none. Then to walk up the steps to the top and see the view of the city, the grounds and the area is an added bonus. Cross another off my bucket list!
Beautiful cathedral. It's historical value and the details in the build are awesome. Good place to go with boy/girlfriend, family and friends.
massive queue to get into the towers. go in the afternoon - it closes at 4, I think last lift is around 3,30. good views from the top, but Eiffel tower is best, if you have to choose

Always impactful. One of those places where you can't help but feel your connection to generations of human history. Humbling to imagine the labor that created it. I found the audio tour very informative.

The best way to see Paris. I loved this! Going inside the tower and out onto the roof felt like an adventure back in time. The detailing on the building is beautiful as is the 360 degree view. Really cold up there this time of year but worth it - take a scarf & gloves, but look out for the rust on the handrails in the staircases. I was only in Paris for 4 days & I'm so glad this is one of the things I chose to do.

Go to the top!. It is surreal to get to the balcony and come face to face with the gargoyles that you have seen in movies and in books before. They are well preserved and the views are great as well. We went up to the 2nd balcony which was fun as well but not necessary as the view is the same and just makes more stairs to come down! Definitely worth the wait in line.
Spectacular views. If you go to the top the views are amazing. You can see all the way to the Sacre Coeur. Arrive early
Closed. We were disappointed that the towers were closed due to refurbishing. I had read how amazing the views were from the tower so we were really disappointed that it was not open.
Like a story book. Nice place to get some beautiful pictures out the beautiful cathedral...also take a walk on the river bank...
Must see. A must see stop with so much history and beauty inside. Simply stunning. The architecture is amazing.
Nice to see. Big, authentic and nice!Fun for kids that know the cartoon.Supposed to be very nice inside. But i didn't go inside.

worth the climb. Notre Dame. Just saying it conjours up romance, mystery, and excitement. The cathedral itself is quite beautiful. The stone outsides and the beautiful stained glass inside. It is a sacred place. Go outside and wait in the line to climb the towers. We waited about an hour, and got to the line about 1 1/2 hours after it opened up. The climb is not difficult, but it is a lot of small, narrow stairs. You go up one set, and down another set, so thankfully there aren't people trying to go both ways on the same staircase. Once you get to the top, the view is beautiful! We had a very clear day, and the view was amazing. And the gargoyles! To be eye-to-eye with the gargoyles is an experience I will never forget. The bells started to ring for Mass while we were up there....it is very jarring! Very noisy, and if you hold onto the stone, you actually feel the vibration. The bells are on the same level as you are, so be prepared! There is a walkway all around the front of Notre Dame. At the bridge between the two towers you can turn around and see the back of the cathedral, equally impressive, and a view of statues, etc, that can't be seen from down on the ground. There is no timing, other than waiting on the line. Once you're up top, you can stay as long as you'd like, but it does get crowded up there. That is why the line is so long a wait; they only let 20 people up at one time, so the line lurches. But it was worth it~!

Good views - long wait!. Loved the views and the spiral staircase up to the top. There are no lifts or toilet facilities so once you start theres no going back. It was lovely and sunny the day we visited so the views were fantastic. Large crowds meant a 2 hour wait to get up. It was pretty crowded up there as they can only allow so many people at a time as it is narrow in parts.
Liked it. I have been to Paris about 5 times now and I always like the look of this building. Its different and have got a great history.

AWESOME view of Paris. Be sure to get a guided tour. Go very early in am. Avoid crowds. See if you can find tour guide that does small groups and has access to letting you get in prior to those in line

Gothic beauty. The line was not so long, and certainly worth the wait. The exterior is so detailed that there is much to see as you move forward toward the doors. Inside, even on a cloudy October day, the beauty of the windows is magnificent. On the Sunday morning of our visit there was a service in progress; a reminder that this isn't a museum but a true place of worship. In addition to the art of the interior, and the incredible architecture, a pictorial exhibit shows stages of construction from the mid-1100's until completion in the mid-1800's. Yes, centuries and generations of craftsmen were the cost of this unique cathedral. Please, stop and look, light a candle, say a prayer if that is your way, and recognize and appreciate that this is something more special than any one person can imagine!
Climb to the top. Well worth climbing to the top but watch the handrail. it is dirty! Aside from this a great experience
Good. After visiting the Cathedral take the climb through these structures and see this great city from the center and bask in their great vistas.

Pretty cool, found it by accident. I was wondering around my first night, jet-lag and all, and ended up at the cathedral. It is quite a sight to see. Also there are at least 2 bridges with the locks on them, and I crossed one to get to the cathedral.
Nice cathedral. It's a great place to hang out by the river and people watch. Shopping is pricey in the area, but there is a creme brulee cafe right off the subway exit that's worth it.

A Must Do. It's been my dream to climb the steps of the tower for several years and I finally had enough time to do it this year. It was absolutely wonderful being "up close and personal" to the gargoyles. It was clear enough to see Sacré Cœur which is gorgeous. The view is worth every step!!

climb to heaven. it's like 400 steps but once you get there you won't regret it.The view it's simply spectacularfrom an area different than the Eiffel Tower and The Arc of Triumph or sacred cur .wonderful views and the gargoyles the river will definitely make an impression on you.
Great!. Great history and architecture, lovely old building. The towers are a bit extra $$ to climb to the top and usually aline-up but overall it is a must do!

Must see in Paris. Such a wonderful architecture with a very calm and majestic feel.Good to bring your family to visit this cathedral. Was there on Christmas eve and it was a truly a place to be for that occasion.
We finally did it. We dedicated 2-3 hours to wait in line but the experience was worth it. Not a bad climb up, views are spectacular and it was a treat to see the gargoyles close up.
Beautiful masterpiece. The vista from the top is well worth the 400+ steps to get there. The gargoyles are exquisite. It is amazing to think that this exceptional cathedral is 850 years old.

Gargoyles Galore and Iconic Views of Paris. You've seen the pictures before: a stone gargoyle sitting with his hands under his chin, pensively looking out over the city of Paris. If you take the Tower tour, you can enjoy his view and that of his numerous stone brethren who adorn and guard the two bell towers of Notre Dame Cathedral.The line will be long at this popular attraction, so I recommend going first thing in the morning on one of your sightseeing days (though I hear the evening sunset is particularly stunning from this vantage if you can work out the timing just right). Check the website for hours as they differ on some days. Despite the seemingly interminable line, my husband and I counted this attraction as one of our favorites in Paris. There are no elevators (of course), so be prepared to climb up (and eventually down) steep, winding stone stairs. Once at the top, you and the rest of the tourists who are let up in groups of a certain number will be free to walk and take pictures of the gargoyles and views. It is crowded up there, but people seem to behave congenially and take pictures for one another. You don't feel too rushed, but the ushers will keep you moving along at a steady pace, so that other visitors can take your place once you leave. There is no audio guide, you just relish in the grotesque beauty of the whimsical stone chimeras and the gorgeous view of Paris spreading out beneath you as you walk along the top of the Cathedral and around the towers. A must do in Paris!

Beware of the climb. Firstly you should get to the tower before 10am to get in the lineup early.....because the way the climb works the line can be a slow process....what they do is let in approx. twenty people who climb the stairs part way to the souvenir shop/ticket booth room....after purchasing a ticket or showing your Paris Museum Pass you then go back out the door you used to enter this room and climb many more stairs to the top.....the climb is fairly tough but it is not what I would say to be aware of.....when our turn came in line to enter the Tower and we climbed the stairs to this souvenir/ticket room, we had a PMP in hand and directed to stand off to the side from the ticket booth where it would appear we would then continue to go through to climb further.... but after sometime of being jammed into this room a person in the ticket booth yelled at us in french asking us what we were doing.....all of us looked at him with uncertainty as the sign said this is where we were to be....he berated us and told us we should now be going back out the way we came and to continue our climb....no one in the group felt good of his attitude....now the fun part is that when you are corralled in this ticket room...the exit door is closed so that the group of 20 that was ahead of you and at the top of the Tower can now come down the stairs so that you then can go up the same stairs they came down and have your five minutes at the top.....the view and the awesomeness of the experience is worth the wait but it sure would help knowing their climbing system before hand and to train staff to realize that we don't know their shuffle climbing system before hand

Your patience will be rewarded. Join the end of the line and be prepared to wait for some time. I promise you it will be worthwhile. No-one likes lining up, so grab yourself something to eat and/or something to do. The line moves in large chunks as a bunch of people are admitted at one time to a holding area before ascending. Once you take on the steps to the top you are rewarded with a unique experience, and even get to "meet" two of the most famous gargoyles in the world. Suck it up - the wait is worth it.
brilliant. very nice i loved it .ambiance was good appreciated the work.i would try it the next time againi would refer it to my other friends also

Tauck Discovery Tour. I saw from afar since I have been to Europe several times and have seen lots and lots of cathedral. This cathedral is very nice but I chose not to make the attempt to enter. I can say I saw, walked around the grounds and enjoyed the moment.

Truly unbelievable. Went to mass at 11:30 Sunday and was utterly transformed. The acoustics here are second to none, and the singers sounded like angels! It's an amazingly beautiful cathedral...so much to see and appreciate here.
Must Visit. Historical Centre and atmosphere, get there before the crowds though, also see the Sainte Chapelle with the greatest stained glass in Paris.
Breathtaking. The view is amazing, not for people with heart problem to tackle more than 300 steps on a spiral narrow stairwell, the same stairwell to go down.

Great views, worth the climb. There are always queues at Notre Dame but don't be put off by the queue to climb the towers, it does take a while to go down as only so many people can be allowed up at once. The queue for the towers is down the side of the cathedral not at the front. There are almost 400 steps up a spiral staircase so you need to be reasonably fit but once at the top the panoramic views are excellent and well worth the climb. There are metal fences at the top which effectively cage you in so it gives an added feeling of security for anyone who is slightly worried about heights.

Beautiful Experience. I love visiting the Towers of Notre Dame, it was an amazing experience. The arquitecture was amazing and you can enjoy admiring all the structure of the Tower. Definitely will recommend visiting

Good Place. A very long walk up...............492 steps, to be exact, but worth the work. Amazing view of Paris and the River Seine. The architecture is amazing to see close up, and from above. Worth the time and effort if you can do it!
Worth it. Been here twice already, still unforgettable, even standing in line for an hour in order to get inside but it totally worth it.

History comes alive. We took the Batoboat along the Seinne to Notre-Dame. Approaching the Cathedral from the river was simply amazing. You are able to jump on/off the batoboat all day long so please give it a try. The Cathedral was beautiful. Do yourself a favor and rent the audio tour for 5E so you dont miss out on its rich history. Simply walking through this landmark without context would be a true loss. Enjoy

Wow!. One of the best attractions in Paris. Architecture is amazing on the outside and even better on the inside. Vitrage on the windows is just beautiful. No entrance fee, but an extra long line outside. After you finish visiting it, you just have to sit at some of the beautiful cakes across the street. They have awesome cakes :)
Great!!. A must see in Paris! great place and amazing neighborhood!!Prepare to wait if you want to visit inside.
Wait is too long. To see the steps of Quasimodo you must have an extra day in Paris a they admit about 10 people every 20 minutes. Lines are 2 hours easily.

Queues, queues, queues. Takes forever to get in. Then you have to queue again to get in the church. I recommend the church at the to of Montmatre instead: fantastic views and a beautiful church. Avoid the extreme rip off cafes and restaurants near Notre Dame at all costs - and if you ignore ethos advice check your bill carefully as there is a good chance you will find things you didn't order!

Worth the Trip Alone. Very well organized for tourists. No charge and DO NOT get in the long lines outside unless you are in group. Just walk in. Sitting in Mass at the cathedral lets your mind wander to a 1000+ plus years of people worshiping in the cathedral. Very few people attend church now in France. I have read less than 7%. Most of the attendee's are tourist's. Please people, don't take pictures during the mass. It just bad manners!The statuary, stained glass and outside gardens are beautiful. Do not miss.

Magnificent. Magnificent historical building. On the Big Red Bus stop pick up & drop off route of course! Free entry to the Cathedral. There is a small historical 'treasury' inside which will cost 5 Euro pp, a little overpriced for the experience, but hey, free entry to the church!

Insensitive attendants at Notre-Dame + Unexpected earlier closing time. Even though a lot of brochure said that the Tower of Notre Dame closes at 6:00pm, on the day I visited the tower, they decided to close it earlier at 5:00pm and stopped letting tourists to get into the tower at 3:30pm. Because we couldn't understand a lot of the signs which were in French only, we lined up for the wrong queue and went into the cathedral accidentally. By the time we made it to the tower, it was 3:40pm and yes, the attendant kept yelling at me for getting frustrated of their last minute hour changes. As tourists, we only had limited time in Paris, I think the attendant needed to be more sympathetic to our frustrations. Other than that, we actually asked for help from another attendant earlier when we were looking for the entrance to the tower in the cathedral. We appreciate her help in helping us locate the entrance of the tower but I wish that she could have told me about the last minute change of hours. Then, we would have started lining up at the tower.Overall, I found the attendants at Notre-Dame very insensitive of the need of the tourists.

The Bells....The Bells...!!. ....as Quasimodo often complained. So you really HAVE to queue and climb up to see these impressive pieces of musical metal. BUT......even better are the views over Paris and the Seine, so be sure to take cameras and pick a Good Weather Day . And try NOT to get caught up there as the blessed things ring, or you'll have tinnitus for the rest of the day !

Another Cathedral that wows. You hear so much about these iconic buildings and although the architecture wowed me the inside of the cathedral did not. I think we were spoilt by the visit to St Pauls in London- that was a real wow- but having said that- it is one of those places that when in Paris, you have to see. The queue here was forever long but it disappeared very quickly as we were kept moving along and in to the vast interior. It does make you wonder how these buildings were constructed so long ago.

Great views, crazy stairs. My husband is the one who actually climbed the stairs - the views were awesome. But the traffic on the stairs was a bit crazy. Only one way up and one way down, so you get to stand and wait your turn.

Long queue and loads of steps but worth every minute. Once our family of four got to the top there were gasps of delight at the amazing views. It was rather crowded and the towers weren't built to cope with tourists en masse, so be prepared for a bit of a squash and a squeeze...all in good cause for some of the best views in Paris.

Seeing Paris from gargoyle's perspective!!!. Climbing the 400 steps of the Notre Dame Bell Tower is well worth it the view and the gargoyles are spectacular. Check this item off of the bucket list!!! ;)

Worth the wait.. Don't be put off by the queue, climbing the towers at Notre Dame is not to be missed. We waited approx 1.25 hours, but the average visit length is roughly 45mins, so this is both understandable and reasonable. Small groups are let up and you go to two distinct parts of the towers. The small groups are ideal as it doesn't get too crowded up there and you don't feel trapped in the stairwell. The vistas are outstanding, as is the chance to observe some of the architecture and decoration of the cathedral itself. They have a good explanatory pamphlet available in a number of languages. A side note, the cashier prefers exact money.
Beautiful cathedral. The line up was short to get in which was pleasing, and when we entered we were greeted by the soulful sounds of the choir practicing. Just perfect.

A Must See. Amazing place to see. Beautiful building and so historic. The construction detail on the building is something to see. Don't miss it, especially if you are like me and in the development and construction field.

Not impressed. very plain ... kind of dull ... loads of tourists .... honestly in my opinion a waste of time ... definetly not anything compared to some of the other things you could spend your time doing
A must see.. Everything in Paris is fabulous. You must go just to see the gargoils guarding the cathedral. They were put there to ward off evil spirits.

I can't believe I did that!. Walked up all 400 steps, in this little tiny stairway, but it was well worth the view! Pace yourself. Long line, but it's because they have only a few people up at a time.
Incredible. It was free to go in, it is very packed during mid day , jump in line and don't worry about getting a ticket. A must see . Incredible story about Notre dame and just beautiful inside .

Challenging but rewarding. Walking up and down almost 400 stairs is challenging, but we did it,even if we are not that fit :-). The views from the top were worth it. The only thing that disappointed is the queue to get to the towers - too long and tiring...
Loved the interiors!. Wasn't expecting it, but dunno what hit me but absolutely loved this Gothic architecture! Definitely a must visit, behind which is the love lock bridge!

They spiralled into the air!. It was a spectacular view to walk completely around the cathedral of Notre Dame. There were beautiful gardens and sculptures along the way. And when looked heavenly, you could see the towers majestic for hundreds of years!

Stunning gothic Notre Dame.. One of my favourite buildings anywhere. As spectacular from the outside as it is from inside. You should go around the side and rear of this Gothic gem, via the gardens and view the detail on the outside. Really superb buttresses, statues and gargoyles all around. Makes you wonder if architecture has advanced since buildings like this were made. Very dark and eerie inside, the whole atmosphere of the cathedral is terrific.

Absoltuely spectacular. A must see while in Paris. The cathedral is breathtaking inside and out. The structure is amazing. I truly took in everything and enjoyed my visit. I sat in the Cathedral for a little while and just felt such a peace. Loved it.

LONG queues.. Having been to N Dame years ago, this visit we didn't go in, we didn't want to line up for hours to see it again. The queues were hundreds of metres long twisting around and around in loops on the square and down the side street. But if you are keen, be prepared in the summer months to wait, take a hat and drinks you will be there for some time. A museum pass doesn't work here.

beautifulllllll. i haven't been here for a while and the last time I came, it had scaffolding all over it. so seeing it scaffold free was glorious!!!it's free, FIRST OF ALL, so there's no excuse not to come! ALSO, a lovely stopping point en route to lunch in st germain.the cathedral inside is BEAUTIFUL and you don't have to spend much time - it will take 15 mins if you are a power walker, 45 mins if you insist on taking pictures of everything. I also am not spiritual but I lit a candle in the church and sent out an intention to be more positive, AND im not even kidding but life has been better since i lit that candle.SO, moral of the story is - GO, see a beautiful free place, light a candle & have a better life.

To go by day and night. As every place in this marvelous city. I recommend, if you have the time, to go at least twice.... One at day light and the other at night.You have to see every inch of the structure and go around it... It's beautiful from every point of view... So go around it and enjoy the view. And of course you can't miss to visit the inside of this beautiful cathedral!

Disappointed at Notre Dame. We had read in several travel books and also on line that there was a weekly organ recital at 4 on Sunday at Notre Dame. So yesterday we were there, along with several hundred other people. Shortly after 4 pm we heard organ music - but it wasn't a live recital. Instead, they showed a video (I suspect something that is available on You Tube) in which a group of French organists talk about the Notre Dame organ - in French. The video was displayed on some monitors scattered around the church and was also projected on a very inefficient screen across the nave. I don't know how long the video lasted - we left after more than an hour. Clearly not what was promised.
Love the gargoyles!. My husband and I waited about 45 minutes first thing in the morning to climb the tower with our 7-year-old son. The views were amazing on a clear day.

Great for photography. You can get very interesting pictures up close of the gargoyles and grotesques once you climb the 422 steps. Go early. By 9:15 am the line is beginning to build for 10;00 opening. There is only room for about 30 people at a time and one batch has to go up and come back down before the next group can go up. This is because the staircase is too narrow for two-way traffic. If you are not in the first group, the wait will be quite a long time.
Gothic and Old. Stunning church and very organized getting people in and out. The church has been setup with lots of information and explanations about the architecture and history which I liked.

Be prepared to queue. If you want to go inside be prepared to pay and queue. We didnt think it was worth it and were happy just to look at the outside. Was very happy to the 'the bells' several times.
Best View of Paris!. This is a must! The view is fantastic and probably the best view of Paris! It is a long way up, but totally worth it. Loved every second!

Stairs and queue line. waited for an hour and 15mins to go to the top. exhausting stairs and it get worse when you get close to the top. but the view from top is outstanding. then you enjoy the stairs on your way back down make you dizzy. SUCKS

A view to die for!. We visited Notre Dame Cathedral in September and weren't exactly expecting the long queue we encountered when we got there before 10 am, in order to get to the tower. We ended up waiting for close to 90 minutes, which at first seemed like a waste of our precious time. It wasn't!The view that presented itself to us from the top was nothing short of spectacular!We then also realised that the system of letting only a limited number of people up at any one time, in effect leading to the long queue, has a good reason: It eliminates crowds at the top of the tower and allows visitors to have an unobstructed view over the whole of Paris, and without being jostled all the time.Anyone wanting to see the whole of Paris from above and from the very centre of the city, I can only recommend getting in the queue and climbing up the stairs. It is so worth it!
Must see. The lines look long but move very quickly. So glad I went inside. Doesn't take long as if you are near by you should experience the history. Stained glass alone.

Worth a visit here.... The famous Notre Dame Cathedral, it is just a few meters along the bank of the river Seine, I had the chance to visit it twice and both times in the morning and I had to tag along and wait about 10 minutes to be able to enter because of light security check control at the entrance. The cathedral inside is very wide and beautiful is the Gothic style, but its colorful stained glass windows that make it unique. This is absolutely a must to visit.
Love it.... I just love this place lookingat Notre Dame. It just has been renewed, and a lovely place to be at, on a sunny afternoon.
This is a must see when in Paris.. This is a must see in Paris. We spent 4 hours inside the Cathedral and really didn't want to leave then. So much history. Take your time and don't rush.

Wonderful Experience. Moderate wait but we talked to people in line which made the wait go by fast. The climb is not too strenuous and although you are in some tight spaces near the parapets you feel safe due to the strong wire enclosures. This has long been a goal for me and finally at 67 years old, I did it!!! The views are fabulous and hearing the bells ring is wonderful. We went all the way to the very top. This is a must do for any visited to PRis.

Can't miss. When we visited Paris last I ticked off sights from our list - running through them since I thought it highly possible I'd never get back. This time we took it slow and spent time taking in the atmosphere. We skipped the trip up the tower (the slimy narrow corkscrew steps lived in my memory) but spent more time out in the courtyard and inside.

Best view in Paris!. Brilliant views and definitely worth the walk up the stairs! You are able to see the Eiffel Tower from the Towers and it gives you a true view of the Paris skyline! We got some awesome photos!

Long Wait. No Payoff. 90 minute wait to get up the tower. Plus the admission. Payoff was a meh view. Best part was the crepes from the shop across the street while waiting in line. There are other lines in Paris to wait in. Don;t bother with this one.
Crowded, but beautiful. Lovely cathedral, but be prepared for crowds and queues! Going earlier in the day may mean you skip most of the crowds.

Notre Damme. Loved this, Paris is too beautiful, the old buildings and how they have been cared for give the city a great appeal. The building is majestic, the queue goes really fast, totally worth it!

Awesome. We are Catholic and attended Mass at Notre Dame. It is amazing to think that this structure was designed and built 800 years ago and took 200 years to create. I wouldn't say it is the most beautiful church in Paris (that would be Sacre Coeur in my opinion) but it is certainly the most awe inspiring.

Be prepared to climb steps. We went early in the morning, about 15-minutes before the towers opened to line up. There were already 30 some odd people present, but it was nice because the streets were not too busy, and you get a few minutes to enjoy the atmosphere. Be prepared to walk up tiny steps in a narrow and spiral staircase. Bring some good walking shoes and pants/shorts for the ladies if possible (seeing as you can be pretty tight with other visitors in the narrow/steep spiral case) The steps up to the top of the towers are a pretty good workout, but you are provided two short interim stops between. After the first flight of stairs is the organ room, where you get to rest a few minutes and they check your tickets and there is a few souvenirs that can be purchased. Next you continue the stair climb up, and get to the middle deck where you are next to the gargoyles and statues with a wonderful view of the city and the middle spiral tower with the green apostles - you can see the Eiffel tower in the distance, and also the Sacre-Coeur in the horizon. Great for photos. You next head up another rigorous flight of stairs to the top of the Notre-Dame tower, (the steps get more narrow at this point) and get a wonderful view of the city skyline. However, I much preferred the middle level view as you are next to the wonderful gargoyles which gives a wonderful perspective and reminds you of exactly where you are at while looking at the amazing city. When going into the cathedral, we were lucky that service was just starting. Therefore, we were able to see the progression of the priest to the alter and join in to the mass that was taking place. We stayed outside of the main pews (there is seating outside the mass area) so that we could leave shortly after without disturbing those attending the service. The rose windows are amazing - do make sure to also see saint-chapelle (close by) as well as those windows are also wonderful and different in their own right. Wonderfully clean outside as well, it was cleaned up recent years, so you can really appreciate the architecture. Must see and place to go on a trip to Paris. If you have a few minutes to spare, head over to next island to get some ice-cream (the chocolate is absolutely divine!) in the Rue Saint Louis en I'lle, there's a line up leading to a shop on this street.
Towers of Notre Dame. If you are not interested in the history or anything they are not much to look at, just a big architecture. Behind it building is much nicer.

Plan for a 2-3 Hour Wait, Plus . . .. Do the math: 2-3 hours waiting in line and another hour climbing up and back down the narrow spiral staircases. This is not for everyone but is well worth the time. Avoid this experience on a hot day.

Cleaned up at Last. The last time I was in Paris the towers were covered in scaffolding as they cleaned the stone work. This has been finished and in the sunlight the Cathedral looks stunning. Chose your time to go as the queues can be quite long!

422 steps to a great view. The 422 steps up a narrow spiral staircase will lead you out onto the gallery at the top of Notre Dame where you will see the gargoyles and chimeras of the cathedral and Paris laid out far below. Another few steps takes you to the very top of the tower for an even better view of the city. Well worth the climb. There is no preference given to Paris Museum Pass holders so be prepared to stand in line.

not really worth the wait. The Gargoyles were cool, and the view quite nice, but for the LONG time we waited in line - ho hum. Also, the church itself was not "breath taking". We preferred the St Suplich church which had a certain warmth, and also a magnificent organ and organist.

Wait in the line. You really should pre purchase tickets but if you don't, wait the 30 min. The climb is easy(assuming you are active to some degree) and the view of the plaza below is nice. They do however 'hold you' at both levels. You cannot keep ascending or even decend when you choose; there is one set of stairs at point and you gotta wait.

worth the stairs. Some may reject the towers because of the narrow staircase but it is well worth making the effort. You could almost image Quasimodo ringing the bells if you are up there when they go off. Great views of the city, the river, etc.

I love Notre Dame de Paris. I love this church. My husband was 'all churched out' by the time we got to Notre Dame de Paris having spent a week in Barcelona. This quickly disappeared on the very first sighting of this grand lady. i loved that we saw it nearly everyday from different angles: from the bus looking up to the spires, from a boat on the Seine, from the Velib (almost free bike system) on the other side of the river, while eating cup cakes from Berties Cup Cakery (a must visit - try the pink lemonade!), eating chips down by the river, and finally wandering around the church eating ice cream! Inside of course is wonderful too but you will have to queue. TIP: There are two queues - one for the main internal building and one to the left for the spire. If you can it is best to either do each area on separate days or have a break at one of the many cafe's around the area. We came back very early the next day to do the spire before it was too hot and the queues were too long. The views are spectacular. If you can only do one area i suggest the Spires. There are often concerts in the church - but friends have and say they are fantastic!
Worth it!. It's worth the money to go to the top of the towers! Great sight to see. The cathedral itself was awesome! One of my favs to visit it Paris!

Beautiful catherdral. Easy enough to access from the metro station, but get in early if you intend to go inside. I visited on a Wednesday, and the place was absolutely packed very early.
I recommend walking from here to the Louve, where you will pass through le Marais, an amazing part of paris.

Beautiful. The church itself is spectacular and a must see but the surrounding gardens are also not to be missed. The beggars and homeless are a distraction. Don't visit in August unless you don't mind waiting in line for hours!
Always Gorgeous.. Have to stop and see the Lady EVERY visit. We were astonished at how many people were there this time of year.

Beautiful!. I took a tour using a guide... We did this one late in the afternoon, and despite huge crowds, we were able to avoid waiting in lines. It is a beautiful place surrounded in nice architecture. Take a tour and skip the lines, its worth it!

Towers of Notre Dame Cathedral Amazing Views. Wow !!! What Amazing views of Paris & Surroundings from the top of Cathedral.. If you are not afraid of a bit of exercise, there are two levels to stop at, but what great shots from up there....
so big. so big but so little when you imagined there's a grotte in pyrenees where you can park 10 of those... sorry its beautifull and incridible so magnificient constructions....

Always take my breath away. Does not matter what angle I am coming from, I can always tell where I am in Paris in relation to these towers and they always look epic. See if you have the nerve to do the tour of the towers, themselves, not for the faint of heart as you will be right at the top with very little foot space...

impressive close up. Took loads of picks here, and the famous bells rang too, we didn't bother queuing ten years to get in, but the architecture was amazing, the whole place is on an island in middle of the seine. Its obviously one of the top ten attractions in Paris.
Special. Took my breath away. So much beautiful work put into the carving on the stone. Many people. Lead light windows, sculptor what a beautiful sight. Unimaginable.

Great location at the historic heart of Paris. The plaza and immediate area of the Cathedral are hopping with street performances, bars, restaurants and lines to enter the church. It is at the historic heart of Paris and you can almost feel the history as you stand there.
Fantstic architecture. Really good experince and lots of things to see and do around this building too. The queue to get to the top was very long.

So much history. The Towers of Notre-Dame are like a walk thru time, the climb to the top can be quite intimidating, its almost 400 stairs so if you have any health issues it could be quite difficult. But if your up to it, it is worth the trip, I was lucky enough to hear the bells ring while I was at the top. The size of the towers is amazing and it took over 700 years to complete, it is a must see when in Paris.

Great views, lots of stairs!. If you are able to do this, do it!The views are absolutely amazing. You can book a tour on viator that includes a guided and informative walk through the old Latin quarter and will include the gargoyle and bell tower of Notre Dame.Booking this tour on line can save you a 2-3 hour wait to get into the tower.Be prepared for the.number of stairs and tight spiral staircases, however you can manage this it is well worth it.
very original. the towers are very spooky and they are beautiful from the inside and I was surprised it took more than 700 years to complete.

stunning architecture. There were some extremely long lines pulling up to get into the cathedral so we just walked around outside it and honestly, it's just as interesting for us. The outer architecture is really beautiful. So many sculptures and intricacies to daze off at. If you can see it on a less busy day, then I'm sure the interior is spectacular, but there was a lot more we could do with the hour or so it might of taken to get inside :P5 star for exterior beauty.
Another magnificent cathedral. There was a cue to get inside but was well worth the wait.This was the first cathedral I had visited and was amazed with the interior and the size.

Great views. The lines are long, the stairs (387 of them) are narrow and a little vertigo-inducing, and also a little slippery if it's rainy out - but totally worth the views. If you are not in good shape the climb might be tough. Also, the lines can be long and halting. They let people in a certain number at a time, then wait, then more. So you may stand in line a long time not moving, then all of a sudden move up. Even once you get to one part of the towers, because the space is so small they do it in small groups. So you may wait and wait to get up, you'll get your fill of the views, and then have to wait some more to go all the way to the top. Still, totally worth it - great views of the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, even all the way to La Defense on a clear day, and get up close and personal with the gargoyles.
Beautiful. We got there either too early or late. Next time it will be my no 1 for sure. Great building tons of history. Be sure to pay a visit!

Huge, elegant and at the same time beautiful. This is a must visit place to appreciate massive and beautiful architeture, beautiful paintings, displays inside. Moreover it is "Free."- You can get an audioguide after depositing your ID card.- There is a fee for climbing up the towers.- You can make an easy walking sidetrip/add-on after visit to Lourve, Riverwalk or a visit to St. Germain/Saint Severin area for cheap food, cool buildings and interesting artists there.

Great atmosphere. The lines were long but moved very quickly. Lovely feeling inside and it absolutely beautiful inside. Don't miss this opportunity if you in Paris to visit as you will love it and the design and the glass windows. Loved all the tourist shops outside and the lovely cafés.

💫The most beautiful church💫. You must visit in this amazing church,There are no such things,,,
A beautiful view.Outside the church there is a lot of
restaurants ,cafes ,and markets,,
Required area and ihighly recommended.😊

Wow. Went in April slow season was great no lines but was cold
Just stood staring I was in awe both inside and out nice coffee shop across the street with lovely views and a lot of tourist shops

Overlook the City with Gargoyles. We had the MuseumPass so that we did not have to buy tickets - but we still had to stay in line. Waited about 1.5 hours, but there was a nearby park with some playground equipment so that one of us kept the place in line while the other monitored our child playing. Also, great ice cream at Bertillon on Ile St Louis nearby. Once we climbed up, it was great. The views were wonderful - and being so close to the gargoyles was fun. We found the one with an elephant head, as well as the birds. Anyone with kids should do this for sure.
Very spiritual experience !. Magnificent and awesome place. We happened to visit during a service and it was something I will never forget !
It's Notre Dame! Come on!. No visit to Paris is complete without a visit to Notre Dame. It's beautiful and amazing as one would expect. But, pack your patience, it's quite the tourist hub.

nice view. I went there late on July, it was in the evening and the queue was kind of long, like 30 minutes which is not too bad but the two guys in front of me were smoking the entire time which was bad. There are lots of stairs to climb to get to the top of the towers but the views up there are great.
Spiritual visit.. Though not Catholic, the church is a wonder and oozes spirituality. To learn it took centuries to become what it is today was remarkable. It is a must see on your visit.

One of he most iconic places in Paris. If you're planing on going to Notre Dame on the high season you must get there early, the queue streches a logn way if you wait for those later hours and even being a spectacular place to visit it's not the kidn of place where you would want to wait an hour to enter. The interior is simply breathtaking and the stained galsses are simlply amazing.

A very special place. Just being here, even with the crowds of people, you know you are somewhere special. We were treated to small (30 minute) service - a hymn accompanied by the organ music. Even as a non-Christian, I still felt this a very religious experience (I am Hindu).
Lots of steps!. You have to walk up 420 to get to the top,no lift. The views are amazing,and even better if you get to hear the bells.

Notre Dame. This is a magnificent old building with plenty of history. On the day of the visit we were caught out by bad weather so did spoil it a bit. One word of warning, there did seem to be a lot of what looked like potential pick pockets hanging around so keep your valubles close.
good. Went in by end of day. No queue. Got in quickly.Its free. Spent some 10 mins inside as it was closing time. But i guess it was enough to get the glimpse inside.
Spectacular Architecture. I was awed by the building both on the outside and inside. There is a hushed peace and calm inside Notre Dame which contrasts so sharply with the maddening crowds inside.

Breathtaking view and architecture. I went there in early Aug 2014, there was my second visit in more than 15 years. The view is magnificent and the architecture is just amazing, all the sculptures up at the tower are very interesting and you would wonder what's behind those facial expression. We (together with my 7-year-old daughter) did some serious workout to climb to the top but it worths it.Go there early in the morning to avoid the queue, we went there at 9:30am and we waited for 30 minutes which wasn't too bad. Remember to have the exact amount for the admission because the staff prefers no change.

Busy and crowded. Well, it's the place to visit and certainly historically significant. The line to enter was enormous but we were told it moves quickly. We chose to enter with the free English tour. You meet the guide outside and then walk in with her or him thus avoiding the line! 35 minute tour which is probably enough unless you want to sit for awhile on your own. You can stay as long as you like. We had downloaded a Rick Steve's audio tour and listened to that too.
A must-see site for any tourist.. This was very interesting and historic, but not a place to spend all day. I enjoyed my visit except for the ever-constant begging from all the street-people.
Worth the wait!. We waited for 40 minutes or so, but that was defenitely worth it! The view over the city is magnificent!

Well worth the queues - BUT PLEASE Notre-Dame staff, let the tour include going inside the Cathedral without re-queuing. Whilst in Paris, my husband and I and our two children (age 9 and 7) did some serious workouts and visited and climbed the stairs of the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe and also the towers of Notre-Dame. The views from the Arc de Triomphe are amazing and much better than the Eiffel Tower - and the views from the Towers of Notre-Dame are even MORE breathtaking!!!!. I am so glad we climbed so many stairs of all 3 tourist attractions as each gave a great different perspective on the beautiful views of Paris! The only downside to this attraction is that we queued 1 hour 15 minutes to pay to go up the towers (there was a separate queue to enter the notre Dame itself - this was free) and all you did was go up the towers - you then had to re queue to enter the cathederal. Unfortunately we did not do this as it had had been a long day for the children. I really believe this is something that the staff at Notre-Dame should maybe look into. If you have paid to enter the attraction and already queued once, the could surely look at possibly giving you fast track enterance to view inside the Notre Dame ???

queue of people. we wanted to go up to the tower of this building but the queue was about 3 hrs long not sure if you can buy a ticket before hand ,but didn't feel like waiting that long, shame really...

Excellent View. I got the Paris Museum Pass which included admission to the Tower. I did it, but I must say I had some moments where I got a little claustrophobic, which was unfortunate because once you start up you really just have to continue. Like all old European buildings the stair cases are very steep and narrow with little ventilation, so it can be a little harrowing. However, once you get to the top, the views are great. Be warned, if you do not like tight spaces (or being stuck in them with a wall of people in front of you and behind you), just stick to the Cathedral and skip the tower.

made it up!. The tower was awesome! we made 422 steps to the top and was well worth the wait of 1 1/2 hr. Took amazing photos of Paris from the best view ever! My legs hurt the next day but I got to say "I made it to the top"
Second best view in the city. Have fun walking up these stairs! But it is worth it for the great view! Warning it can get very windy up there, but it is safe!

Loooong queue but worth the view!. Please note before visiting - when facing the Notre-Dame, go to the left of the building for the tower entry - there is no entry to the tower viewing areas from inside. It is free for 25 and unders to go up to the tower levels with valid ID - a UK driving license will suffice here. We went at around 3pm and faced a 1.5 hour queue.There are about 450 steps, and no lifts! There were many many people with prams and young children in line who waited a longtime only to realise they could not go up. The views were really spectacular, i won't spoil it by putting up pictures! Worth the steps and the wait!

Good but tiring. It´s a long long tiring line you have to wait to get up there, no use showing them the museum pass - they send you to the back of the line anyway. But the sight is just beautiful and the gargoiles.... amazing. Seems they´ll come to life in front of you.

This is one of the must see spots.. Not for any religious reasons but from an architectural standpoint "How did they do it?"Wait in line it's free. While waiting slightly to the left and about 30ft out is Paris Point Zero (Center of Paris).Inside is amazing.There's a museum on your right after you go in. Only 5 euros. Only go in if that's how you want to give a donation. 2min in and out and not much to see. This is the church from The Hunchback of Notre dame so that's cool too!We really enjoyed this place.Then a hop and a skip over to the Latin Quarter for a foodie's heaven bite to eat.

Don't get all the hype.. It was a beautiful building and I'm glad we visited. Make sure you are dressed appropriately because they will turn you away if you are not. We waited in line for about 15 minutes to get in and took a quick walk through. Worth a visit but there are so many cool things to see in Paris that I wouldn't spend too much time unless you are really into churches.

My favourite sight in Paris. Love walking around the island of Notre-Dame and taking in all the sights. It's hard to believe that the Cathedral was once going to be pulled down due to cost. Thank god the French are so slow at taking action when decisions are made..

You must climb the towers. I am 60, there are 422 steps to climb. I did it. You can. The views over Paris are to die for. Also you can imagine you are the Hunchback of Notre Dame roaming almost all the gargoyles.

A wonderful experience!. It was my fourth time up there, I always take my friends to see it, the gargoyles, Victor Hugo saving the cathedral from destruction, the medieval touch to the narrow stairs, in other words everything is fascinating there;
Long climb but worth the view. It's quite a few steps to the top, and a long line to wait in to even start climbing but it's definitely worth it. I would highly recommend going.

Recommended. The cathedral is free to enter - once you actually get in - you can opt to go up the towers. I highly recommend it - you do pay a fee for this but you get up high and see the amazing flying buttresses and the gargoyles up close. The queues for the tower were so horrendous this visit being at least an hour, so we didn't bother as we queued almost an hour to get into the main cathedral. If you do have the time and patience go up there as it is worth it. It is very narrow and slow moving but you will get some excellent photos!

Narrow. You pay a charge to go up these. Sounds like a lot of steps but it really isnt too tough. Great view from the top but the one thing that lets it down is that it is narow in places at the top. So much so that only one person can get by at a time. So if you get stuck behind some overtly snap happy people, it can be very slow moving
Spend time just watching people. We decided to climb the towers this year. Allow yourself at least 1 hour just to stand in line and 1 hour to climb and look around. The gargoyles are awesome to see!
So many people. Prepare to stand in line for at least an hour. History of the cathedral very interesting. It was one of the few places there was no fee!

It is spectacular. I don't have anything new to say, except that this is FREE and it is spectacular. This is a must-do and must-see while in Paris. It is stunning on the inside and outside. Expect long lines to get in but the line moves quickly. Don't forget to check out the garden in the back.
South Bell Tower Was Closed. Something you definitely have to do while in Paris, but the south bell tower was closed for renovations which was a disappointing after the long wait in line.
400 Steps. Despite poor health I managed to climb the 400 steps to the top and was really glad I did. The down side is that I qued one and a half hours to do it.

The view. I would definitely recommend giving yourself time for the lineup alone. I was lined up for almost 2 hours to gain entry, with the end of the line almost wrapping around the back end of the cathedral. I am glad I had a book handy. It is worth the wait, though.

Sad to see it crumble. The Notre-Dame is certainly one of those rare buildings that grow on you every time you see it. Unfortunately, the socialist government has allowed this great monument to crumble. Worse, all around the place, one could see human faeces and urine in any nook and corner that is not immediately visible. The cathedral itself was poorly maintained with black stains from smog and pure neglect. How can Paris let this happen to such a monument?

Simply an AWE. It was my first visit. It's symbolic and saintly to be present there. Long queue to go in but we managed to get in within 20 mins. We attended a Sunday Mass in French and it was really quiet an amazing experience.

Also Very Long Lines. With so little time in Paris (three days) we decided to skip the long lines and have a crepe in the Shadow of Notre Dame (right across the street from the entrance to the towers).

Just suck up the line and do it!. My 14-year-old insisted we do this after missing it on our last trip in 2012. As we were staying in the Latin Quarter, we went by Notre Dame several times. Each time the line was longer and longer. We finally committed to being there at 9:30 a.m. (tower climb opens at 10). We brought our pastries and stood in line for about an hour. The climb up is extensive, but broken up. At the top, the views of the city are spectacular. And, the views of the cathedral are even more impressive. Be up close to those gargoyles! Tread the stairs walked upon by countless others before you! Imagine Quasimodo up here! It's the best view I've had of Paris, including Tour Eiffel and Arc de Triomphe. (Not for those afraid of heights or claustrophobic.)

Not for those afraid of heights. Included in the Paris Museum Pass. A long walk up a lot of stairs, but worth it. Get your camera ready, because you don't have unlimited time to take photos. You get about 10 minutes and are constantly, albeit slowly, moving.

Excellent. A wonderful place full of religious wonder.The cathedral was one of my favorait stops in Paris.The size and detail astounds you.When going I would highly recommend seeing every little place in the cathedral because everything makes you adore it even more.
skip the queue. it's free, and the line to get in moves fast, but skip climbing the tower, that queue lasts 2 hours, you'll see pretty much the same view you can see elsewhere and you have to pay

Stunning architecture free entry long queue!. As a gothic cathedral they don't come any better. Even a walk around the outside will,leave you in awe. The famous Pont d'Art is a two minute walk to see all the love padlocks that might soon be gone.
Great Architecture. Beautiful building, you can walk al the way around it on the outside. If you want to go in, get there early due to massive queues.

Nice views. We had extra time during our trip to Paris and decided to pay a second visit. The views are amazing and it is worthwhile. You can see all over Paris and the views of the river Siene were breathtaking. Some things we noticed after the second visit venturing away from the Cathedral (instead of getting back on the bus right away):If you head away from the Siene but still in front of the Cathedral there are a bunch of small restaurants and shops there. We had dinner at a diner that literally had only about six places to sit. They served sandwiches and spirits. Was very nice although I could stand in the middle and touch both walls at the same time. In the front of that same restaurant was a place that sells crepes with nutella and other delectable toppings. There is also the warm wine served on the street. It is literally the best darned thing I ever had. I don't drink, but the boiled wine was not like drinking alcohol.Walk in the other direction and cross the Siene, there are hundreds of shops, restaurants, and bars. Be careful, they have employees in front of some of the restaurants trying to coax you inside. Its ok to politely say no thanks. They have just about any type of food you can think of from Kabobs to Pizza to Chinese food. You could spend an entire night down there. Its amazing, about an hour after dusk it gets quiet for about an hour (still crowds), but then the nightlife wave emerges. Amazing time.
Worth a visit.. Another fine piece of craftsmanship with stunning brick work and well worth seeing. We didn't go inside but just from outside is worth seeing.
Historic and elegant. Wear your running shoes. Try to pre book tickets through the hotel to avoid queues. Move fast and watch the stairs.
Best view of Paris. In our opinion, this is just fantastic. In a clear sunny day, you will have an extraordinary site to visit and a fantastic view of Paris from up there.

the view from the top is amazing. I didn't realize there was a separate TripAdvisor entry for Notre Dame and the TOWERS of Notre Dame, so I'm copying part of my review of Notre Dame here, regarding the towers. If you are physically fit and have the time to spare, I highly recommend climbing the approximately 400 spiral steps up to the top. The view up there is quite amazing. You'll also see lots of gargoyles on the roof. The line to climb starts on the left side of the church. Go about 30 min to an hour before the towers open to wait in line, and expect about a 1-2 hour wait (longer when you go later). They let people climb in batches. Too bad they don't let you dwell up there for too long (because others are also waiting to climb up), but it's worth it.

Loooong wait. Worth visting once.. We went there for the Gargoyles. That simple. We waited exactly 2 hours in line to go in, had to climb quite a few stairs (which makes it a bit dangerous if you have kids with you) but it's totally worth visiting once when in Paris. I don't think I'll be going back any time soon, but I did love the statues and I would recommend to someone that is going to Paris for the first time.
Jaw dropping. Had dreamed of visiting here for years prior to my visit and it did not disappoint not only did I get a tour but I also got a few keep sakes
Lovely, but seen better.. Nice to see and if you're in Paris this is one of the icons. I just wasn't that impressed. I felt I've seen a lot more and better historical buildings.
Walk all the way around!. Be sure to check out the many surprises and impressive architecture all around the outside of this church. Lovely!

Worth a quick visit. Nice stroll around the inside, a lot of tourists of course but that's to be expected. The little island its on is a must visit. Right near to the latin quarter i love for all its reasonably priced food places.Don't need to ear mark alot of time for this one really, half hour is enough to see it all. Unless you pay to get right to the top, must be a crackin view. I didnt bother.

Amazing. One of the best views of Paris. Suggest getting there early and cue for the tower tour first as it seems to have the longest line-up for a beautiful view of the city. Wear comfortable shoes as I found this to be a harder climb than the Eiffel Tower, When finished tour the church and be in awe looking at architecture that took 200 years to build.Don't forget to look for "Point Zero" while outside the entrance to the church and if you have a chance take a tour of the roman city below Notre Dame from the same court yard.
History of the hunchback. Magnificent gargoyles throughout the cathedral, the waiting in line was at least an hour, however once you climb to the top the views are worth the wait.
magnificent. Wonderful building, so beautiful close up, very busy when we arrived mid afternoon very long queues, some nice shops in the area too

Worth the wait!. We waited in line for the towers for about an hour and fifteen minutes after we toured the cathedral. My daughter left to get us a chicken sandwich and a fresh chocolate crepe right across the street and we enjoyed our lunch while we waited in line. That helped pass the time. You do need to be in fairly good physical condition to make the climb because you move pretty quickly up the staircase. Once up top, the view is incredible! The gargoyles are fantastic! I never knew that they were all different (an eagle, elephant, penguin, lion, etc., as well as the ones that are typically pictured). You are so close you can touch some of them which is really cool! There's a pretty large section fenced off for visitors to walk around and take in the view. It can be a "tight squeeze" at some of the corners and the line stops at times, so depending on where you are, it may get uncomfortable for a few minutes. My favorite pictures of my trip to Paris are from the towers and this was my favorite activity of my trip there.
400 Steps to an Amazing View. Worth everyone of the 400 steps up to enjoy the amazing views of Paris. If we'd had the museum pass prior we could have skipped the hour long queue.

What an experience. It was Easter sunday so there were a lot of people walking around out front and some break dancers on the sidewalk. Once we got past all of that we get closer to the entrance and see a small 12x9 sign that read "<--- Tours, Mass ----->" . Wait a minute, Easter sunday mass at the Notre-Dame? Yes please!! We walked in and could not believe how beautiful it was inside. They started mass and we didnt understand a word that they said but it was incredibly moving. That was one of the highlights of my trip. They were doing construction on the outside but the inside was absolutely beautiful. If you are in Paris it is a must see.
Outstanding. So much better than in photos,beautiful and atmospheric,first time had visited and despite the rain,so glad we did

Amazing views. We went to the top of the towers of Notre-Dame. This is something I would definitely recommend. We did wait in line for almost 2 hours but the wait was totally worth it. You can see so much over the city, I would just try to arrive early. The Paris pass works to get you in, you just can not skip the line with it on this tour.

fascinating section of paris, with striking contrasts between the old and the contemporary.. Very rich history, from Paris palaces of kings and courts to the Jewish quarter, mostly before (pre-WWII) to a trendy shopping, club and residential area with one of the city's most vibrant social scenes. Increasing gay influence, but day time atmosphere is not uncomfortable for families with children.
Breath taking. It was a sunning building in it's entirety but I would advise climbing the towers as the view is stunning and well worth it.

Magnificient Sight. You can read all of the books and reviews, but you absolutely must see this magnificent sight in person. The stained glass window is outstanding. Expect long lines, but it is worth the wait.

Skip the line because of small children. We planned to go one by one to the towers, since we have 5 years old and 4 month old boys. But while waiting in the line the employee came and let as go ahead! Skip 100 ppl in front of us. BTW we got there 35 min before opening and there were like 125 ppl in front of us. Our 5 years old did the clime well! All 422 steps up and 422 steps down! Thought it was not easy to carry the baby of 4 mouth. But the view!!! Nice!

The early bird catches the worm!. This is a MUST MUST SEE!! I suggest you arrive early if you want to climb the tower as the line can get very line, even go down a couple blocks or so! Trust me, its worth the wait!
Well worth seeing. Have a boat ride on the Seine to get a different perspective but this is a beautiful building and worth making the effort to see then go to 'Le Comptoir du 5ème' for a great meal
Amazing. Visited this Cathedral on a weekend break to Paris. It's an amazing structure. No picture does it justice.

Spectacular architecture. During the summer holidays make sure you are there pretty early as the queues are very long and the stairwell to the top can become suffocating with so many people trying to get to the top. However, dont let this put you off, Notre Dame is an absolute must see attraction. Spectacular building and the views from the top over the river Seine and Paris is breathtaking!
Really interesting. Such an interesting place to visit lots to see .... Would recommend this if your visiting Paris although the Que was long it's well worth it

Fantastic, a must to do in Paris. We booked this before we left as the lines are very long to go up the tower, the cathedral was superb and the views from the tower were incredible. I recommend that you also book prior to skip the line for the tower, we did a walking tour around ill del la cite which was really worth while, as the guide explained everything about the cathedral inside

Worth the Climb. Amazing views, especially when it's storming in Paris. I would say try to avoid going during super touristy times, but it's always touristy there. Its definitely worth the climb for the views you'll get and the up close looks at the gargoyles!

422 steps to the most beautiful views of Paris. Iconic as the cathedral itself, the towers are majestic. Walking up to the top is both a task and a joy as you know what awaits you once you reach the first landing. If you have the stamina for it, don't pass it up. It is worth the effort. The views from all angles are really special even when the air is not clear.Even people afraid of heights have gone up without much problem. You may be slightly shaky, but it will subside as you admire the sights from way up.

Worth seeing. This Cathedral is very beautiful. We enjoyed walking around and exploring it. We did not wait in line to go to the top as it would have been hours worth of waiting. Don't be fooled by the line out front ot get into the main part of the cathedral. It was very long when we went but it went by very quickly. The line to go up to the top is on the left side of the building when you are looking at the Cathedral. The illustrations showing the progression of the construction from the beginning to it's current state was very interesting.

Amazing view!. First time we were there was on a Sunday and there were waaayy too many people lining up to see the Towers. So we returned on a weekday and arrive early (before 10am. Tho' one of the waiters from the nearby cafe said best time is 9am). The view was well - worth the wait! Amazing amazing view ! There is no toilet facility so be prepared. Wear good walking shoes as the steps are narrow and pretty steep at some places.A must- see!!
a great way to spend an afternoon. love everything about it except the long lines and the price was a bit high but the padlock bridge was close as well so was a awesome day with my wife and i

Memorable and beautiful. Its a long way to the top, but its really worth it. Surrounded by some of the most famous gargoyles with Paris at your feet!
It may seem expensive, but the discounts for children - and Under 25s as well! - are impressive, so that chances are most of your group will get in for next to nothing.
Crazy long line, but worth it.. We had the Paris pass, but this pass only gets you in for free, and does not have a fast track, but we waited and it was worth the wait, you can see the whole city.

Line way too long. The view is definately worth the 420 or so steps, but the line was so long and it was so crowded, that it took a lot of the fun out of the experience. If we would have had to pay we probably would have passed, but since we had free entry with the Paris Pass, we waited and got to see the fantastic view.

A Can't Miss. Other than the Tower and the Museum, what is the most popular attraction. There is also the catacombs and if you are willing to jump on a train to the Castle, you can see the spot where Marie Antoinette was beheaded--but how do you go to Paris and miss Our Lady--right up there with not learning merci. Excellent outdoor photos--easy to reach by boat tour or the metro--plenty of tour guides who will explain the history and most work for tips so they pour their heart into it.--real good when you are on a budget--I think this day we went to Notre D in the morning and then checked out a Turkish Bath house in the afternoon as my girlfriend insisted I see how uninhibited the French were on public nudity. I must say it is so less up tight than the USA--when we were staying at her grandfather and mothers place in Angers - there was not even a frown that myself and girlfriend were sharing the same bed. Here in the USA my deceased Catholic parents would never permit such a thing-I would have had to slept on the couch--anyway, enjoy while you can.
Beautiful. We made the 6:30 mass which was so moving. Get there early to get in and get seated because it fills up fast
Nice views of Paris. The twisty climb is worth the effort. Be forewarned that it is a spiral staircase and about 15 stories tall. Take your time and enjoy the views on the way up.

Great Views. I definitely think the workout and wait are worth the time- the views are outstanding and getting to be next to the gargoyles are just lovely. The things that prevent me from giving this five stars are that the groups come in waves every ten minutes and it becomes a real struggle for space up at the top. At the tip top, you are only given five minutes and are constantly being asked to move- yet somehow stragglers still manage to stand right in front of the hard earned views of paris. I wish this was more regulated so everyone could get an equal chance to see and take pictures in that amount of time.
Notre-Dame. the architect of this was incredible felt so peaceful when inside could spend a lot of time here.............
Magnificant views. Only word of warning, narrow stairwells which can be difficult for the young and elderly. Well worth the climb. This is an attraction that should not be missed

Face to Face with the Gargoyles. This was my second trip to Paris and I missed the opportunity to climb the bell towers the first time, So I was so happy to do it this time. The outside line was long, however it moved pretty fast. They have done a good job of crowd control up the tower. It's not for those who struggle with small spaces, stairs, or heights.

Better churches and cathedrals to visit. It's free in a city where everything is pricey... Large crowds... Good first time visit. If you are keen on visiting cathedrals and churches then Italy offers better and easier spots than Paris. It has a history which requires payment if you want to learn. The architecture is amazing and it took 600+ years to be built what you see today.
Beautiful!. The line into the cathedral wasn't too long. The line for the tower tour was long but well worth the wait. The view was magnificent!

stupendous view but SUCH a long line. This was well worth our money and a must do upon arriving in Paris. The view from the top of the towers was beautiful and gave us a different landscape view of the city aside from the iconic Eiffel Tower. However, we did have to wait in a very long and slow moving line, spent about 2 hours in line, not very pleasant. But the line was well worth it! I recommend it!
Massive and beautiful. The queue is imposing, but moves very fast. 20 mins after we started waiting we were in the door. It's lovely inside. Truly a must see.
Impressive. Great views worth the wait! Fair price and see Paris from above!! Great place to view a beautiful city!!
a long wait. it is a long wait to walk the towers due to the nature of the building, but it is well worth it. the views from the top are stunning

Beautiful..... We spent a few hours at Notre Dame Cathedral on a cold winters day in Paris. Taking lots of beautiful photos of the building and then went inside to experience it. Definitely a must do when in Paris.

Don't be put off by the long line. This was the only line we waited in in Paris, as we had a museum pass. The line was very long but moved very quickly and we only waited 15 minutes. The panels describing the history and how it was built were fascinating. And as we saw it in the rain we got to see the water shooting out of the gargoyles mouths, which was very cool. Nice photo op.

Impressive. Everyone has to see Notre-Dame once. My only complaint is that that the audio tour was not good. There should have been corresponding numbers on each site. It gets very confusing and hardly worth the audio cost.

Architecturally Beautiful. Seeing Notre Dame was high on my list of Paris sites, and it is amazing.They flying buttresses didn't disappoint! However, hold on to your purse/wallet! There were a lot of teenagers swarming around the church with petitions to distract unwary tourists. It's also unfortunate that the view at the top of the tower is marred by a metal "cage" around the walkways. I'm sure its necessary for safety, but it is impossible to get a photo with a person in it without the cables showing. We arrived early to beat the crowds, but its such a popular destination that it was still pretty crowded. All in all, it is worth seeing due to its historic and architectural value.

Don't bother. We went to Notre Dame. It was crowded but it didn't take long to get in. The line to get up to the tower was so long we just left. It probably takes a couple of hours to get in. They did not have "skip the line."
Cathedral of the Hunchback. Very long lines but it is worth it! Such a famous landmark, how can you miss it. Hang out outside and just take in the people and the atmosphere with a nice lunch.

Very interesting thing to do.. i visited Notre-Dame and went up to the Towers a few years ago. it is an impressive place to be. Your in the middle of history and you can feel it. Last few years I walk by on my way to the Left Bank. There will always be hundred and hundreds of people lined up to go in. They come from all over the world to see this Cathedral. If you haven't done it then do try it. It is an amazing experience. Please leave yourself enough time to do it.
Wonderful view. One of the most beautiful views of the city, it's completely worthy to wait the long queue, you wont regret after you go upstairs. Very beautiful
Very interesting art works. I loved the building exterior art work. It is amazing with wonderful details. The inside is not anything less in its majestic workmanship. It's worth every minute to visit

Dark and Foreboding. During this trip I went to St. Paul's in London, Sainte-Chapelle and Notre Dame. Notre Dame was my least favorite of the three. It is very dark inside. If I were Catholic, I expect that the visit would have had religious significance (I probably would have done confession, lit candles, etc.), but I'm not Catholic, so the visit was more about architecture and history for me.

many stairs but worth it. When you get past the long line to get up the stairs the trek begins. My then 76 year old father and law and I climbed the narrow and winding stairs. It was laborius but yet adventurous to reach the unknown. Once on top the view is fanastic and very much a must see and do. There is a fee for the towers but entry into the cathedral is free. Once done here a short walk to the latin quarter or st michael's area with lots of food,drink, and shopping.
The architecture!. The towers look gorgeous. Must visit if you are in Paris. If you take the river boat at night, you can also see the towers at night which equally look as good.

A magnificent building. We saw Notre Dame both at night, which was spectacular, and during the day. It was great see to it at different times to show its true beauty. The day we went to climb the towers the wait was over 2 hours long, next time with two kids in tow we would get there first thing in the morning to guarantee a shorter wait.

The famous gargoyles!. The cues are very long to see the towers, but so very worth it. The museum pass gets you in, but unfortunately no skipping the line here. After the first set of stairs, there is this beautiful gift shop, if you wish to buy some souvenir gargoyles this is the place, but you have to buy them before climbing the rest of the stairs, since there is no way to go back unless cuing again!!! Talking from experience!!! So no gargoyles for me to take back home!!! The view of the city from the towers is just amazing and the gargoyles, so cool! 422 steps from the ground up! Thank you Victor Hugo for saving this beautiful masterpiece!
Great views at the top.. We were in the line to the Tower 45 minutes. The views at the top were fantastic, especially Notre Dame itself.

Nice views of Paris... The towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral are a good place to sightsee over the city. The stairs are quite narrow.. They are well preserved, but they may be a problem for some tourists..

Fantastic View of Paris. Approximately 422 stairs to get to the top. Only little windows in this very narrow winding staircase that can only hold 1 person at a time. You can see all of Paris as you get to walk around the entire area taking pictures. Only one way up and one way down. There is a mess wire covering the entire top so no jumping. Fantastic view of all the famous landmarks.
beautiful view from the top. Lovely. But the trip to the top was tiring. the view was OK. I thinkt he Arc de Triomphe roof top view is better

Well worth a visit. Went here recently and found it to be an outstanding experience .Well worth a visit.The only bad thing is BE AWARE as there are many pick pockets frequenting this area who are experts in stealing your wallets and hand bags

This is a must do- but beware- lots of stairs!. This was a good side trip. We went in the early afternoon and the line was short. You go up as a group and are allowed to stay for a certain amount of time. Just enough to see the Paris sites from up above.

Notre-Dame Tower. Be prepared to walk a long way up the spiral stairways up the tower. But worth it. Have a good view down from the tower. You need a long wait to get in unless you purchase a tour that has priority entry to the tower, otherwise you need to be contended by just entering the cathedral.

Great place to get pictures of the city. We didn't see the inside of the church because quite frankly we were tired of them so we chose to see the towers instead. I recommend you get there early before they open or you will wait in line for hours. They let small groups up at a time but once you are up there you get to walk around the towers and it's a great opportunity to take some pictures of the city skyline.

Awesome views & gargoyles!!. Arrived midday to find insane queues, so we returned around 8am another day. Went into the cathedral to enjoy it in peace and quiet, and by 8:30, queues were forming for the towers (which open at 10am!) No special queues for Museum Pass holders - also, must get paper tickets for kids. Lots of stairs but well worth the climb for the views! Try to get there first thing in the AM!

Long lines. Greatly enjoyed the climb and views including the ability to get close views of the chimeras! Not sure if it was worth the long lines and the 1 hour wait so during peak season, get there before it opens and save the waiting!

A "must" view. I read in the reviews about the long waiting and the difficulty to climb up to the top but also about the little time you are permitted to stay to the top.
