These are all true, however once you are up there, you will enjoy the best city view in comparison to all its competitors (Tour Eiffel, Arch de Tromphe, Grand arch etc). Try to visit early in the morning when the waiting line will be considerably smaller.

Challenging Climb. Views from the top are terrific if your patience copes with lengthy queue times, shoulder to shoulder crowds at the top and the challenging stair climb to get there. Was it worth it........ ABSOLUTELY!!

Great structure.... The cathedral is really beautiful from the inside and outside. Was about to give up by just looking at the queue, but it was worth the wait. The decorations inside the cathedral are just amazing.

Would have a higher rating if not for the wait. Amazing views from the top. Waited an hour to get there. To get up close and see the gargoyles on top was lovely. Would recommend it just a shame that once youre up there you have 5 minutes untill you can either ascend or descend - before another group came up. Take a coat on a blustery day!

Great view.... ... not of Paris but the small monsters that brings Quasimodo to life. Bring the kids but make sure you are fit to handle the stairs and slim enough to squeeze yourself through the narrow passages

Longest wait, but worth it. The towers opened at 10A. We got in line at 9:30 and it was a fairly long line already. Unfortunately, they were doing repairs so we had to leave and come back. We had the museum pass, but there are no cuts for the museum pass. You can try like we saw many people do, but they'll send you to the end of the line. It only gets access to the top for free.The next day we stopped by around 2p and the line was twice as long as it was the morning before at 9:30.The next day it was raining and 4P. I took a chance that people would be discouraged because of the rain and time. The line was about the same as it was at 9:30 the morning before. I wanted to go up, so we waited 45 minutes. By far, this was the longest we waited for anything in Paris during our trip.I'm not sure there is any way of getting out of a 45+ minute wait. I think it would have to be a minimum based upon our experience and during the summer. Even if you get there at 9:15, the line is shorter, but you are still waiting the 45 minutes.It's a slow moving line because there is only one stair case (as far as I could tell). So they let about 40 people up, they look around and then the people at the top come down. Then the next 40 people go up. Once you get in the church you climb some stairs and get to a gift shop. Make sure you buy what you need (although there wasn't much time) because you don't come back through there.Then you start climbing the 387 steps. I had climbed the Eiffel Tower that morning (669 steps), Sacre Couer that afternoon (lots of steps) and then climbed these 387 steps. My legs were a little tired, but it wasn't a big deal. You can stop to rest if you want, but there isn't a lot of room and people are moving behind you. I don't have a problem with tight spaces, but I noticed it. It made me a little dizzy actually with all the steps in a spiral. You get to the top, but there isn't a lot of room. You basically walk along a pathway among the gargoyles. There isn't some big area to spread out like Arc de Triumph or Eiffel. You walk half the way, then you have to wait for the people who are already up there to go down the steps. Then you walk to the other side of the Cathedral, where you can see people to waiting to go into the cathedral. My husband who is scared of heights, was pretty terrified (more so than on Eiffel or Triumph). I was surprised, I wasn't that scared. Then you wait for your turn to go down. You are up top for about 20 minutes and then you have to come down.Seeing the Gargoyles and architecture up close was really worth it. Very Paris thing to see.

Get There Early. It would be wise to come early to the Towers. We arrived half an hour before opening and the line was all the way around the block. The line moved along slowly and we realized later that people had to go in groups and be synched, time wise, so everyone had the same amout of time at the various levels. We bought our Museum Pass on the first level which consisted of a little gift shop and a seating area. Once the stairwell was cleared we were allowed to go up to the next level. Here we saw the gargoyles and a great view of Paris. We had to wait for the stairwell to be cleared of the group coming down from above until it was our turn to go up. At the top, and you truly were at the top of the tower, you were protected by a cage and allowed to walk around. It was a tight squeeze up there with another group coming up behind us. Going down was pretty seamless. If you might be afraid of walking up 800 year old small steps or might be claustraphobic, this might not be for you. Great view of Paris.

Unbelievable!. Visited here in June with my 11 yr old son and was worried that he would be bored, but no way! We had just toured Notre Dame Cathedral so he was ready to climb the towers and boy were they worth it! It costs abt. 8 euro and the wait wasn't bad at all considering it was an amazing sunny June afternoon and the lines looked deceivingly long. The architecture is stunning and the gargoyles fascinated my son, especially after I shared their history with him. This is a must see for all ages!

The Bells and Gargoyles of Notre Dame! Not to be missed!. We were the 15th people in line & we got in line an hour before it opened. By the time it opened the line went all the way down to the end of the cathedral. We were in the first group that went up that morning. We had the Paris Pass, but there is no line jumping privileges for this. You climb a bit, then you are in the gift shop/ticket office. I wish I would have known that you walk down a separate tower & the only chance you have to purchase anything is before you climb. It was a pretty good shop. We have climbed lots of lighthouses and I would say it is a tougher climb than those. Not many places to pull over and stop. I believe it was 400 steps. Since we were there early it wasn't hot inside the towers. Might be different later in the day. Once at the top you are well rewarded with an amazing view and close ups with the gargoyles. We were up top for about an hour and we got to hear the bells play. You can also climb up to a second higher level on one of the bell towers. They don't do a good job of letting people know to go up to the top of the one bell tower. We were headed down & would have missed it if it wasn't for a couple of teenagers yelling to their parents that they were going up. Well worth the wait. Probably one of my favorite things we did in Paris.

Step up to a spectacular view. We waited for an hour before being able to start the climb. I am not a patient man if the result doesn't deliver, but this was a spectacular experience. The views from up top are marvelous. If you can manage the 402 steps, take this trip!!!!

Gorgeous, historic, and nice respite from the heat. The stained glass windows are worth the wait, and some of the most amazing gargoyles in the world outside. The line moves extremely quickly, so don't be intimidated if it's long. (Of course, almost everything in Paris has long lines in July.)
Magnificent architecture. A landmark must see for all visitors.the carvings on the walls and gargoyles are so intricate .International mass for catholic visitors Sundays 11am.Long lines though!

BE RESPECTFUL. Visiting Notre Dame Cathedral on a Sunday morning and taking in a service was very moving. The Cathedral is stunning, less so was the conduct of some visitors who chose to ignore the signs requesting silence. I even observed one person talking on their mobile phone. That aside, a visit here, especially if you can take in a service is a must do in Paris.

Hard to believe this architecture originated in the 1200's.. We walked through the cathedral and enjoyed seeing the beautiful strained glass. Make sure you walk around the entire building to see the flying buttresses. There was a long line to go through the cathedral itself, but the line moved quickly. We went twice to climb to the top, but once the line was all the way down the length of the cathedral and we couldn't wait because we had to meet our group, and we went back to try again on a Monday and the top was closed. (Not sure if that if every Monday or just that day.)
Views are outstanding from the top. After taking many stairs to the top, you will not be disappointed. The views are amazing and unlike other areas in Paris.

Great Gothic church to visit. Great Gothic church to visit, the lines are long but move along. You could go to top of the church to view the gargoyles, many steps to it. The line is long and slow to go into it.

One amazing cathedral. Thus is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in all of Europe. When you add the ability to climb up one of the towers, across the bridge where Lon Chanie hung out with the gargoyles and down the other tower how can you beat it

Gargoyles and View. ... and the experience of having climbed. Would probably wait until evening next time to avoid the lines and enjoy a sunset or city lights view. We were there well prior to opening and still waited close to an hour because the groups move so slowly. Once up there, the views are wonderful. I did not however enjoy waiting on a ledge (literally) for the attendant to allow every one to proceed...

It's a hard climb but worth it. We joined the line thinking it was for the entry to the Cathedral. After an hour waiting and realising the entry to the Cathedral was around the corner and the line being very small, it was too late to quit. So we stayed in line for another 1/2 hour being disappointed for loosing so much time. There are a lot of cafes and little gift shops just across the road. So it's possible to get some take-away and souvenirs while you wait. There was a fee to pay, then we had to climb up hundreds of steps to get to the Towers. But when you see the beautiful views around, you think it was worth the climb. Then you discend going a different way downstairs. We enjoyed the Towers after all thinking that we had gotten there by mistake. My little son was exausted and fell asleep in a taxi straight away. But it's definitely a must see atraction you will remember for ever.

Towers at night. During July and August you can climb the towers until 11PM. My goal this summer was to climb them after dark. We arrived in line at 9:30 and did not wait to go up. Such a change from during the day time! It was as beautiful as I had hoped. I hope I can do this two more times this summer!

Very Difficult to Visit. The grumpy, rude attendant in the main cathedral and the lack of signage made us late to get in the line early enough and we had to give up on going up in the towers to visit the gargoyles and see the bells. Very disappointed.

Breathtaking view from towers!. We were staying in an apartment close to Notre Dame so we were able to get in line early to climb the towers. Arriving a half hour before the opened, we still had quite a few people ahead of us, but it was worth the wait. This was probably the highlight of our trip to Paris. The initial climb is to the the gift shop to buy the tickets and then you climb the tower from there. You don't return the same way so if you want to buy something make sure you get it before you leave that area. The South Tower was closed off when we visited so we weren't able to see the Emmanuel Bell. My daughters grew up watching the Disney classic so it was fun to imagine the gargoyles talking Quasimodo in the towers. A must do when visiting Paris!
Towers of Notre Dame. Climb the towers to view parts of Paris. You can also appreciate the bell tower, gargoyles and imagine Quasimodo in the towers.

Amazing!!. Worth the wait in the queue, cafes opposite to get food and drink to eat in the queue!Your legs will ache after, as its a few hundred steps up and then back down.I love it and would recommend it to anyone.They only take cash :-)
Fantastic. You can never really appreciate the beauty or history until you visit.Just amazing.Take photos from across the street for best angle

Prepare to wait. The lines here can be brutal. If you are visiting with children I hope you have another adult with you so that you can take turns taking the children on walks in and around the cathedral while the other holds a place in line. If you are visiting alone, bring a good book. 20 people are allowed in at once, maybe every 10-15 minutes so you can get a rough estimate of your wait by counting the # of people in line ahead of you and doing some math. We got there 15 minutes before opening time (10:00 am) and waited about 90 minutes to get in. The good news is that I think it's worth it. Even though you have a very limited amount of time (they don't encourage lingering and on the top towers restrict your stay to something like 5 minutes), you get a great view of Paris and also of the cathedral. Plus all those awesome gargoyles/grotesques!

Worth doing. See my review of the cathedral as I didn't know this was a separate entry. Well worth doing if the line is not too long. Get there early if in tourist season. Good views of Paris and the gargoyles on top of the cathedral. Lots of spiral stairs to climb/descend.

Make sure that you are in the right line. We made the mistake of initially getting into the line for the climb to the top of the tower. After getting into the right line - the line moved fast and the cathedral is very impressive.

Best view of Paris!. It is definitely worth waiting in line to go up the towers of Notre Dame after you see the beautiful inside of Notre Dame! Be prepared to climb many steps though, which go up in spiral. I went with a friend who had difficulty going down because of the spiral effect. Once you get up to the top, the view is unbelievable and surpasses the view from Eiffel Tower or arc de triomphe. At the top there is room to go all around the tower to get multiple angle views of Paris. The fee for this is included in the city pass however you cannot cut the line with it. You can also go see underneath Notre Dame after you get the view from the towers.

A must see. I love Notre Dame. It is so beautiful. Climb up to the top if you are able, it is worth the wait on line and the thousand steps up. We were able to attend mass here last time I was in Paris and that was really special. When you are done, check out the beautiful garden behind that cathedral. Also you can walk along the water to do some fun touristy shopping.
See the gargoyles up close. My nieces did the climb and enjoyed seeing the gargoyles up close. They said it was very tight on the steps

The gargoyles are so unique. The 422 steps are forgotten when you get to the top and see the panoramic view of the city. It's not for those scared of heights or have breathing or knee problems, but the trip is worth it for everyone else. Oh and try to include the gorgoyles in your photos... They add a totally different feel to them.

Worth the long queue. The queue to climb the towers is on the north side of the church. It is a long queue as they let tour groups in when the tour arrives. Worth the wait though. You climb up within one of the towers and end up on a walkway face to face with the amazing gargoyles. The view is amazing. Another climb takes you to the top of the south tower. If you have problems climbing stairs this tour is not for you

Highlight of the Trip. My favorite thing during our stay in Paris was climbing up to the towers of Notre Dame. The views of Paris, seeing the gargoyles up close and seeing the roof of the cathedral were all spectacular. Definitely worth waiting in line for. We were able to get in line and grab some lunch from the cafes along the street and eat while we waited. It was perfect.

Great climb for my kids. We went on our first morning in Paris (end of May), arriving at 9:45, but the line was way too long. I asked someone part way back in the line what time she had gotten there, and she said 9am, but there was no one in line, so they went to get an espresso. When they got back at 9:20, the line had a bunch of people in it :) Oops!I went back a few days later at 9:00am and was second in line, just holding a place for my adult kids (arriving at 9:45). I declined to go up since I had just climbed the stairs at the Arc de Triomphe the day before and my knee was rebelling a bit. Instead I went to a cafe directly across the street and had a Cafe Creme and a croissant while watching the tourist traffic headed to the Cathedral. (By the way, that little cafe was my only experience with a snobby French waiter, even though I used all the French niceties. I guess dealing with tourists all day every day was just too much for him LOL!)My kids loved the view and seeing the gargoyles. Be sure you get in the line on the side of the Cathedral, not the line in front that's for entrance to the Cathedral proper. Also, there's a sign that says that exact change is required, but my guess is that if you only have a 10 euro bill, they'll make change.

Love the area! Great garden in the back!. I sometimes have a picnic lunch in the garden area behind the Cathedral. I prefer the impressive buttresses to the front. In fact, they have installed an ugly bleacher area in front of the Cathedral. There is usually a big long line on the north side entrance to get up to the top, but you can go in through the front doors to see the gorgeous stained glass windows. The entrance fee to the towers is 8.50 euro. The climb to the top isn't too hard (I think 387 steps up to each tower) and you can see the Emmanuel Bell which weighs 13 tons! The view from the top is beautiful.

Better bring your walking shoes!. Notre-Dame is amazing and beautiful.If you are planning on visiting the towers, good walking shoes will be appreciated and plan on scaling over 400 steep and narrow steps... Whew!

A great experience and well worth the climb. This tour is great. I loved going up to see the cathedral from up high and also look over Paris.So many steps though! My daughter counted coming down (a mere 394 steps!)Don't let this put you off, as its well worth it when you get to the top and makes you feel you have acheived something! (A good excuse to have some more French wine!)This is not suitable for anyone who has a heart condition, unfit, afraid of heights or has trouble with their knees as the steps will be awful for you.
Free to enter and take in the beauty.. Easy to find and easy to get to. Usually busy and you can enter to get a good view of the inside. We were most fortunate to hear a choir....

A long wait most likely worth it. This has no skip the line type pass, so everyone waits. It was a fun, but tiring climb up the towers. The views are incredible despite the weather, but obviously better on clear days.
impressive. Just as impressive in person as in all the movies you ever saw. Very crowded but that is because it is worth the view.

Worth the climb!. The view from the Notre Dame Towers is one of the best in the city. Be aware that there is no elevator and the stairs are a tight spiral with few places to stop and breathe. For even moderately fit people they shouldn't be any problem. It's great seeing the famous bells and gargoyles up close!

Fascinated by the gargoyles!. I dreaded this climb because I'm a little claustrophobic but it was an easier climb to the top than I expected and the gargoyles and statues were fascinating! It was a clear, beautiful day and our photos were amazing. Had a bit of a traffic jam at the top because there is only one spiral staircase to go up and down to the very top of the 2nd tower. Gorgeous views of Paris!

Beautiful church and grounds . My wife had been to this church a few times before but this was the first time we visited with our children. It is really beautiful old church in the grounds around in a really nice and a great place for picnic. Also nearby is the infamous lock bridge where you can lock away your secret loves etc. We had the Paris pass so I'm not sure what this event cost but it did have a special fast pass entrance. We burned the candles at the same station and basically did the audio tour of the church. I think this took about an hour about you could easily spend three or four hours there. We didn't climb to the top by the bell anything like that as a line was ridiculous.

Review for parents with small kids. Of course, we had to climb up there because of the story about hunchback Quasimodo. Our kids were crazy about visiting "his place" and seeing the chimera sculptures (hybrid beasts) which could talk in the story and were his best friends up there. While I was waiting in the queue - (about hour and a half) my husband took kids to the other side of the cathedral where is a nice playground... OK, It´s more than 400 stairs. It depends on how fit your kids are. If they are at least a bit used to walking and trekking they will certainly manage. My older one is 6 and had absolutely no problem. Little one (3) did great job; we helped her a bit in the last quarter. It was fantastic visit, up there is everything greatly fixed, don´ t need to worry about the safety. :-) but yeah, there was one MAJOR problem. We didn´t know which exact spot did Frolo in the story fall down from :-)
not worth the wait. don't wait that long for going up. go to tour Monparnasse and have a view of Paris WITH Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower.

Magic!. Go there towards four in the afternoon, it's a little less busy and there is a mass and listening to the choir singing whilst visiting brought tears to my eyes, although not a christian it was too beautiful! I highly recommend the visit. Enjoy!

Worth the hike. Not sure why there are seperate Trip Advisor entries for the Notre Dame and the Towers of Notre Dame, but I give them both five stars. My nine and seven year old were quite proud of themselves when climbing the towers, and even my five year old made it up with some help. Incredible views of Paris.

Worth the Climb!. We did a tour with My Parisian Tours; saw important sites near Notre Dame first, toured the cathedral, and then we were able to climb the towers with only a short wait (the normal wait to climb the towers is an hour or two). Lots of steps, so your legs (and heart & lungs) should be in good shape! Great views of Paris from the top! View the Gothic architecture on the outside of the cathedral, including the numerous gargoyles and flying buttresses up close!
Landmark. The Cathedral is beautiful. Did not have time to go inside. Running last and crowd was awful. However, a day trip to Paris was a bridge too far. Go go it is worth the trip.

queue warning. This is one of the queues that is really slow because of the natural low capacity of the tower and the high number of tourists interested in going up. Get there early, it never reduces until it is closed for any more entrants.

Cathedral is a must see. We did not go up in the towers because the line was too long. I estimate 11/2 hours. However, you walk right into the Cathedral, rent an descriptive audio tape, and self tour. Very cool.
Beautiful!. The towers are both beautiful and majestic...the beautiful Gothic architecture was rather breathtaking and like living a fairy tale!
Got wet, but enjoyed. Long slow queue, but enjoyable climb and look at both towers. Views excellent. Not rushed when up there, even though you go up in groups of 20.

Wonderful views of Paris!. Make sure your legs and calves are in good shape before climbing the 388 steps to the top. However, once you get to the top you have amazing views of Paris. The walk down is very easy! :) Enjoy the 30 minutes they allow you at the top. It is worth the pain and the climb up!

Amazing, queue early. Went with our 5&7 year old. I wouldnt take anyone younger than 5. It is a VERY strenuous walk up the stairs for kids. Pro tip: go at 9am or send a family member. Wait on the north side of notre dame near the tower tour entance. If you get there before 9:20 you 're going up very shortly after they open at 10. Otherwise the waits can be hours long. Also cooler in morning. Across the street like 20 feet you can get coffee and food. Or you can send the friends or family to get pastries from a real boulangerie and bring back.

Awestruck. The sheer scale of the Notre Dame is awesome. Beautiful architecture, beautiful cathedral and deafening bell tolls. All in all an amazing experience. Be prepared for long lines and waits. worth the visit.
As in the films!. Very beautiful visit, love the gargoyles and the city views from the roof, but the queue was huge, specially in winter, I almost frozen!
Gorgeous. It was the only inside tour our Cosmos group saw, I loved it, so dark and old and the outside is a marvel.

Awesome and wonderful. The sheer majesty of the buildings architecture. I can scarcely imagine building these towers now, with all ourKnowledge never mind back in the day without motorized equipment and technology of computer programs!The history of these Towers help to enlighten us all about what life was like centuries ago. It also illuminates the need for spirituality by way of awesome tributes to this same God and His Son, Jesus.Humility is impossible to not experience by visiting this site.
Beautiful. Beautiful church like most churches in Europe. This church is a must because of all the History.You should go there if you are in Paris.

Great view. We arrived 30mins before the 10am opening and were sure glad we did given the long lineup that grew behind us. The 300 steps up, or whatever it is, is worth it when you step out and see the chimeras' lonely forever gaze over Paris. It truly is a great vantage point for the other city sights. So much so, we skipped the Eiffel and the massive crowds given we got our fix from the bell tower's lofty and historic view. Highly recommend

446 steps or so..... Ok ready, set, oh my god! Yes the line are big to see the amazing views from the top of the Cathedral... and yes it is worth it to get the 446 steps up in a narrow tower.... and there is none stop just because everybody else is behind you too going up!By the time you are up... you need to catch you breathing and after a few minutes the crazy view and the gargoyles and the feeling is amazing. I don't recommend this tour to any body with back problem or fear of closeness. And BTW you need to go down 446 steps going back to ground.... HAVE FUN it worth a picture taken.

Fantastic - our kids loved it. we have a 6 & 7 year old, who loved every minute of this. (As did we.) 8.5 euros, and takes about an hour or so? We didn't time it, but it was totally fun and a great discovery for them.

close view of the gargoyles. Wanna meet a Gargoyle face-to-face? Then climb up the steep stairs of the tower of Notre Dame. In addition to the unusual encounters, you'll be able to enjoy a stunning view of Paris. The queue is quite long!

BEAUTIFUL - but TONS of people!. Notre Dame is a must see in Paris. We were surprised to see around 500 people waiting in lines that swirl around the plaza in front of the cathedral. We opted to go to mass at the Chapel of the Miraculous Metal in Paris instead. I will return to see the gargoyles up close...

Worth the climb. Arrive early and wait a while in the queue. They let 25 people in at a time. Well organised and the views were superb. A lot if spiral steps so be prepared. It would have been better if they out up the queue barriers earlier as many people tried to join the queue at the beginning and you have to tell them where the back of it is.

A must see Building in Paris. Beautiful building, good to see up and close shame we did not get to go up the stairs to see the view from up there.a lot of coffee shops in the area for good crepe of pastries, you can get a good apple pies in the area.

Love the Gargoyles!. Visiting the Notre Dame Cathedral is a must when visiting Paris however unless you have time to wait in line, are in good shape and don't mind closed spaces you will want to admire the towers from the ground. Having said this if you do make the trek the view is spectacular! I am fascinated with the gargoyles so climbing the tower offers close up views. They also have magnified viewers from the ground for a euro for those who stay at ground level. The stained glass is also incredible if you venture inside the cathedral

Breathtaking views. Just love the gargoyles' POV of Paris. Well worth the 384 step climb (plus you can have a crepe in one of the cafes when you've finished the climb). The bells rang while we were up there and sent chills through my body- amazing.

380+ Steps!. No joke, you have to be in good shape to climb up these long and winding narrow steps to get up to the towers. Once you're there, the view is quite beautiful! The passageways are quite narrow though, from one landing to the topmost part of the towers. Families should make sure to keep their kids nearby, one mum had her hands full managing 4 active children running around ahead of everyone at the viewing landings. Also, note that there is quite a wait to get in as they only let in a small group at a time, and wait until they have finished certain viewing levels, and until that group goes down to exit the tower (there is only one staircase going up or down) but it was worth it. Go early to beat the crowd! We were there at around 1045am and only waited 45-55 minutes to get in.

Beautiful. You can climb the Bell Tower but beware there is a long line and it moves very slow. The steps are steep and you will feel the burn but the views from the top are amazimg. Beware once you are up there it can be very cramped.

Scary and Demanding. Best be in good shape for this long climb up a never-ending narrow spiral staircase. If you're not fit, claustrophobic, or afraid of heights, you might want to pass. And they don't warn you before you go. I'm glad I did it but I would not have gone had I known what I was in for before hand. I don't like heights.

Nice to do at least once. Great views on top but you do have to work for it. There are about 400 steps and no elevator. And of course the long lines. The gargoyles were impressive being so close to them. It opens at 10am but people star lining up around 9am and the line stays long all day long. They only let so many people in and it takes time to come down there is only the one spiral staircase to go up and down but worth the wait.
best freebee in Paris. the outside figure that lost his head and then found it , extremely crowded even on off season, that is aprl!
Beautiful!. Didn't get to go in. Wasn't ever time and the line was always too long. Hopefully I will get to return and go inside.

Beautiful. Great view and beautiful building. The que was quite long to go to the top.I think the cathedral could be more informative about the history but overall, amazing!LONG LONG climb to the top but so worth it!!

I have visited a couple of times. The sight of the gargoyles is not to be missed, unfortunately the wait in the summer for me was three and a half hours long. It is best to go in June or September, maybe in August, but in July, the place was mobbed. If you don't have time to wait, just visit the inside of the cathedral.

The Hunchback knew what he was doing. I too would live in the towers of Notre-Dame if given the opportunity. Regretfully I was not able to walk up to the towers as I had broken my foot and it was a bit uncomfortable. The cathedral is stunning and Isle Cite is charming, busy, busy with people, but still charming.

A must see location. four of us used the Metro (subway) to go to Notre Dame (St. Michael). The line to go inside was about 300 ft long but went fast (we were in within 10 minutes) as there is no charge for going into the church. We saw them commence the Noon mass. Decided NOT to go up the bell tower, as the line was very long. John it turns out (we think) they are removing the old non functional big bells and installing new smaller ones that actually work (Quasi-moto would be upset). We stopped at a little café for some wine and French Onion soup (had a slight sauer flavor) at a small restaurant and it started to lightly sprinkle (rain) on and off.As we tried to get back to the Eiffel tower subway station we took the wrong line and ended up spending a little extra time getting on the right train (“Did he ever return and he never returned and his fate is still unknown”). Oh by the way a one-way ticket on the subway for any location inside the city cost 1.70 Euro and an all day pass is 10.7 Euro.Check out the bride at the East end of the garden = Full of padlocks = Bring your own or buy one!

Great view from the Pompidou. I was entreated to an unexpected delight atop of the Pompiduo Centre. An amazing view of Norte Dame. Be sure to look for and don't cheat yourself out of this special moment to view Paris.

WOW! Do not miss this.. So, I visited in 2010 and forgot to review. Do not miss this site. We were lucky to enjoy some music outside, and when a crazy storm blew in, we went inside just as Mass began. The architecture is incredible and simply must be admired.

Arrive early. My husband and I came on a Friday morning 15 minutes after opening time and the line was already down the block. We waited for about half an hour without making much progress, and when it started to rain we left. We returned the following morning 20 minutes before opening and still, the line was down the block. It wasn't quite as long this time, but we did have to wait for nearly half an hour to get in.Once you're in, there's more waiting. We had to buy tickets and then start another line for our group to be admitted to the towers. The first level was amazing, with gargoyles in the foreground and an incredible view of the city in the background. We snapped pictures for about 15 minutes, and then there was more waiting until our group was admitted to the top tower. We were on the first level for 45 minutes and I actually started to get a little claustrophobic because we were stuck in a big crowd and couldn't leave.The time limit on the top level is 5 minutes, but by the time we finally got up there we were ready to leave anyway, so we snapped a few more pictures and then left.As other reviewers have mentioned, there are a ton of stairs, and they're all in small winding staircases. Coming down from the top tower all the way to bottom left us a little dizzy.Total time, from initially getting in line until we left, was about 2 hours. Tickets cost 8.50 euro, and we were able to pay with credit card. Entry time when we went was 10 am.
Massive. Absolutely amazing architecture!! A line to get in that moves fast. No cost to enter. A must see. Take your time once inside to look at all the alcoves.
A lot of steps. Worth a visit if you can cope with the 425 steps and the delays waiting for the other visitors to leave the top of the towers.
Loved Notre-Dame Catherdral. Absolutely loved this part of Paris.....our favourite of our trip......quaint.......lovey shops and restaurants and the cathedral is beautiful.
a must see. You can walk to the top or take a lift - once at the top the views are magnificent and so is the opportunity to see up close the gargoyles.

Long line but good views. We waited in line for about 45 minutes, but we were entertained by a street performer which helped the time to pass. Small groups of people are allowed into the towers. Once inside, you buy your ticket and then walk up a lot of stairs (spiral staircase) to get to the top. The views were good but you also get to see some of the gargoyles up close which was nice.
landmark of Paris. this is a place everyone should visit when in Paris.There are always lots of people waiting in the queue to get in but it is definately worth it!
Most amazing place. This was the most spectacular place I have ever seen. The gargoyles are so cool and gothic looking. You can tour inside for free.

No go. Super boring! If you want to waste half of your stay in Paris on a queue than this is the place to go to. Longue queues, high prices and super overrated views. You have a much better view FOR FREE outside Sacre Coeur on butte Montmartre. Go there (Metro line 12 to Abbesses) then walk and you will see some sights and also the incredibly charming, lovely, gorgeous village of Montmartre. There also many more things to see in Montmartre or anywhere alse in Paris rather than wait long hours on a queue outside Sacre Coeur.

Amazing Experience. It does not matter if you went up to Effiel or no, each place in Paris has its own view, they are 400+ stairs so you must be of good fit. The line was the largest we saw in Paris and it took us 2 hours to get up. We were rewarded with the views from first and second level. Look up when you are in the first level

Quasimoto's home. Bell tower has a view and there are gargoyle raingutters on the roof. When i asked about them, the guide says they show that god even uses creatures of the deep for his own purposes!

Stunning panorama of Paris. Visiting Notre Dame in Paris is one of the MUST-DO things while in Paris, especially getting up on in the towers and on the roof...one can see the beauty of Paris in all lights of a bright day or the shades of a cloudy one or even at dusk where the sunset emphasize the mystery of city's streets.No matter how many times I've been visiting Paris, I never missed Notre Dame. Hearing the bells ringing was breathtaking, one of my luckiest moments of one of my trips.

What did you expect????. Wow wow wow. Of I could just fill this comment box with wow's... I would..... But if you visit paris and don't go here you are cheating yourself. Many people know the history, but this place blew me away. We actually got a tuck tuck from the centre of paris here that cost us €25 and was so impressive and romantic. You have to visit here. The history, those building, will speak for itself.
Grand. This is such an amazing and grand. Such unique architecture combined with beauty and stature. Not to be missed

Notre Dame in May. Busy area around the Cathedral this weekend with a bread festival taking place. The Cathedral is very beautiful indeed and being so close to the river banks it was also lovely to be able to enjoy a walk along the river itself.

13th Century. It is Awsome. Don't even have the words to describe this beautiful, breathtaking. Crucifix of Napoleon lll, stain glass windows,Statues, sculptures. Give yourself plenty of time to take in all of the Cathedral.
Top of the city. If you can walk to the top. The gargoyles are wonderful. The view is spectacular. Go at lunch because the tour groups will be eating.

Must see in Paris.. You must see this beautiful and astounding piece of architecture. The flying buttresses, and sheer size of the structure is amazing. Our timing was perfect. We were there for 10:30 Mass on Palm Sunday. The grand procession and pageantry, in these surroundings, will be unforgettable.

Slowest moving line in Paris, but worth it for the views. We visited the Notre-Dame towers on April 29, 2014. When we arrived, we made directly for the tower line, which is to the left side when you are facing the cathedral. There were maybe 50 people in front of us, and we had about 30 minutes until the 10:00 a.m. opening. They limit the number of visitors to around 10(?), and it seems takes forever to move forward. This is also because there is no real queue along the side of the cathedral, so many people were line-jumping ahead of us. (Beware bus-tour groups, because they have a habit of cutting in line, even if the location does not give them priority. It's just something they are able to do because of the sheer size of the groups. If you are an independent tourist, you will begin to loudly curse tour buses every time you see one approaching in Paris. They can completely ruin your visit and very often do.) Once you finally make it into the 10 or so people allowed inside, you then climb to the first level in a gift shop to buy your tickets, and then you wait again. Unfortunately, when you finally start up, the first person in line on the stairs will stop to take photos on every other step, and it will take you another 15 minutes or so to get to the top. Then, you will be behind the previous 50 or so people who went ahead of you who want to get the perfect photo of a gargoyle. You will have no choice but to wait until they are finished. The views, however, really are splendid. PLEASE NOTE: if you visit the cathedral towers in the morning, the sun will be from behind, throwing all of the gargoyles into deep shadow. So if you are one of the 2.5 billion people who must have the perfect Notre-Dame gargoyle photo, visit in the afternoon or evening. The light will be directly on them.
Beautiful structure. Outside workmanship was stunning. But manic with so many there and queue just too long this time. Avoid Easter weekend!
Interesting.... The mass of the Cathedral is impressive, more so on the inside than out. I'm not religious, but if you have time do see this.

Notre-Dame Cathedral. A must do when in Paris, the queue can be long but moves fairly quickly, once inside the grandeur and architecture is just as amazing as the outside. We sat and spent a little time just taking in our surroundings and reflecting. Afterwards we went to the cafe just next to the Shakespeare Book Company, had a glass of wine whilst enjoying the view of Notre-Dame.

Very impressive. We went here on our first day in Paris. I was very excited to visit such a famous church and see just what it was all about. There is so much detail in everything and is a beautiful church on the inside. The crypt on the outside costs to go underground and see and in my opinion it was a waste of money so do not bother going in. Also, there are girls walking around asking you to sign a sheet of paper and donate to their cause for blind and deaf people. I gave a little change to one girl and the other who was asking my husband to sign acted very ride towards him when he told her he didn't have any money and that I had already given some to the other woman. All in all, it is more than likely that a first timer will always visit the church so go and enjoy it but watch out for the women asking you to sign something... Pretty sure it is a scam

Beautiful!. The Cathedral is a must-see when you visit Paris! We visited on a Friday afternoon and only needed to wait about 20 minutes for entrance. It was beautiful in all it's glory on a Friday afternoon. You can walk at your own pace and to see the stained glass is worth the visit alone.
Wonderful, and beautiful. the line moves really fast..... don't let that stop you from going in.Very beautiful church. Amazing when you consider the era it was built

A Surprise Just Around a Corner. Finding Notre-Dame Cathedral is a little bit of a challenge but you walk around a corner and there it is in all its glory and fame. Even though it is not as big as you would think, you need to walk around it slowly to see it from all angles to appreciate the towers and flying buttresses. It has a small garden in the back that was an enjoyable place to sit or eat a snack. The spring flowers were an added delight. Again, get there early since the ques are often long. There are two different lines, one for the hike up the towers, which cost and one to get into the front of the cathedral, no fee.
Amazing. I definitely recommend going there. You will find it to be a great experience!One of the best churches of the middle age and in such a conservation state! i was feeling in the terror movie

Good. It's pretty impressive outside, but not really inside. What I don't like in cathedrals in Paris - machines, where you can buy souvenir coins. They could put it outside, it doesn't look nice in such places.Very impressive room with treasures.If you travel without guide, be there at 10 am the lastest. After 11 am queue for enter becomes very very long.

Crowded, but cool. Free entrance for people under the age of 25=nice. Opens at 10.00 in the morning so show up before that because we were there at about 9.50 and waited 1-1,5 hours to go up the towers. Ate breakfast whilst waiting and it was totally worth it because the Notre Dame is simply great. Wonderful view and astounding architecture. Worth a visit.
Worth a visit. This might not be as high as some places but is a great way to see the city, standing among the gargoyles. Only downside is sometimes there is a long queue.
Spectacular building. A must see in Paris and free of charge to look inside. Also not far from other attractions like love lock bridge and the louvre.
How can you miss this. It's all about gargoyles. Great photo and views. But go in afternoon lines are smaller and yes there is. Line

Very tight Stairwells. Going into notre-dame i knew i would be in for a treat, in the main cathedral, there was a chior praticing not sure what for but it sure added to the experience, made every hair on the back of my neck stand up. the place is beautifully maintained, absolutley stunning. going up the towers there are a lot of narrow stairwells, with lots and lots of steps, older people and young childern bewear once at the top the views are amazing.

Exceeded my Expectation. I knew Notre Dame would be amazing, but I was surprised how much it moved me as a place. Beautiful and magnificent. The only thing that could make it better was if people observed the "silence" signs.
Alot of stairs!. As most things in Paris you seem to climb a lot of stairs, amazing views and the Gargoyles are really worth a picture.

Fantastic views. It was worth the wait, like most great place to visit you have to que, to gain entry. We had to wait about 1 hour to get to the star of the towers. It was not to bad a wait, as it was a cool day, but in the summer heat might be different. The spiral stairs to get up to the viewing area, is certainly a work out, and not for the claustrophobic in some places.the best view in paris a must do.

Get in line early because the lines are long, but the wait (and the climb) is worth it. Many visitors may not realize it, but there are at least 3 lines on any given day to Notre Dame: 1.) a relatively short line to access the interior of the cathedral (free; from the West side of the church);2.) a much longer line (on the North side of the church) to access the towers (tickets purchased at end of line); 3.) an intermediate line to access the towers but for GROUPS ONLY - do not get in this line! As is always the case in Paris, it helps to confirm that you are in the right line (and that you are at the end of it, so you don't start a riot by trying to cut as happened to a German family who refused to budge until the booing grew loud enough - they left to widespread applause). Also: always make sure you carry something for the children to read or play during those long waits to maintain family sanity. The wait is worth it, and in many ways, the wait-to-view ratio is probably more favorable (and less expensive) than the Eiffel Tower. Be prepared to walk, climbing over 400 steps, but there are two levels, so you get to rest a bit, enjoying the first view, then climb all the way to the top to see the climax. The gargoyles are wild and great entertainment for kids tired of waiting. Some of the passageways are quite narrow, so heavier American visitors used to lots of space might feel both claustrophobic and acrophobic at the same time, but it's great exercise! The Paris Pass does not allow you to cut the line, unfortunately.

Beautiful views. This was my third trip to Paris but the first time climbing the towers and I'm so glad I finally did it. The views of Paris were stunning, in spite of the rain, and it was cool to see the gargoyles up close. One point of warning - if you want anything from the gift shop, buy it before you go up because you don't come through it again on the way back down.

Ancient Greatness....... My wife and I was "blown away" by this ancient greatness.... It is really amazing how someone actually can build such a perefect divine building.... And that for soooooo many hundreds year ago.... Incredible... If you are into details you should take some time to study the smaller, and larger, perfect sculptures attached to this overwhelming construction.... We wandered outside the bulding for quite a long time... Sooo much to study....If possible: you should even take one of the canal boats... Then you will see the Greatness of this ancient building from other angles and from distance you' ll see how great Notre Dame actually is... T

get there before 10. be prepared to wait, get early to get ahead quickly. The views are worth it.quirky tip: if you are buying the paris museum pass from the towers you can go right up. Having a pass bought elsewhere would still need you to wait in the line.

Great views - Many steps. The climb to the towers is tiring on the legs, a good cardio workout. Don't do this if you are not in good physical condition.That being said, the views are worth the climb. It should be a must do in Paris.As a caution, once at the top you are held there until they choose to allow you to exit the tower. The day we went it was cold and rainy, thus a little uncomfortable.Get tickets online and arrive to get in line by 8:30 if you don't want to stand in the street for hours.

Amazing!. It's totally worth waiting for about 10 min in a line outside the cathedral to enter and go up a lot of stairs to see the beautiful view from there. You can't miss the gothic style of it and its unique gargoyles!

Good views, but long queues!. Wonderful views, but you do queue a long time for it.When we went the queue was along the north side of the cathedral and the wind blew along the queue and made it particularly cold as well. You get warm climbing up the towers though.If you are under 25 (or it might be 26) and are a resident of the EU you can get in free.You don't get lots of time at the top, but you need a lot of time for your visit for the queue.
very narrow steps. que was over an hour for the bell tower and you can not take your time to take in the view as there is only on way up and down at the top….although worth the view
Good place visit but expected more gothic. I had always envisioned notre dame as a bit more gothic than I found it. I liked the visit and it is a free place to go see which is bonus

One of the "Disneylands" of Cathedrals.. We visited the Towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral in April of 2000 when Europe was spit-and-polished for the Millennium. This is one of the "Disneylands" of Cathedrals. To actually be standing in front of this storied cathedral was enough but then to go inside was even more awesome.

Great view but a little crowded. We waited on line for about 45 minutes before we started climbing. I'm reasonably fit and had spent four weeks prior climbing various towers through Europe; I found this a hard climb. Perhaps due to the number of people climbing behind, so the pressure to move fast, and there aren't places to rest on the way up. The view was beautiful and good to see Paris from that height, different from seeing it from all the way up the Eiffel Tower for instance. Loved seeing the gargoyles up close. Included on the Paris Museum Pass, but unlike other attractions you don't get in any faster with the pass.
Take a Tour. To really get the history of this little village you need to take a tour. The Cathedral was beautiful and you can skip the line to the tower with a tour.
Amazing!. A must for all Victor Hugo readers, Quasimodo and Esmerelda become alive and real on this visit, fantastic architecture

Notre Dame. Great views from the top of the towers!! The cathedral was hard to see inside due to all of the visitors. If you like churches of this style, I'd highly recommend going to see the cathedral in Reims! It is a 45 minute ride on the TGV - and it is truly stunning!
Amazing experience!. Already reviewed under the cathedral. Plan ahead! Beautiful views and photo pops. Queues are minimum 1 hour.

Use your Paris Pass!. As soon as you get to the location, get in line! This line covered a great deal of the front lot, however it does move quickly. Very somber and respectful, most visitors adhered to the policy of no flash, talking, etc so those in prayer were not disturbed. Did not do the tower steps as the line was long and along the street....very nice to see and great pictures in time for Easter.

make sure to skip the line for this. We signed up for the Ile de la Cite tour and Notre Dame Cathedral. Both were good. The highlight was while we were touring Notre Dame a choir was practicing. I hope everyone else is as lucky on their visit.

Long queues but great view. After a long wait in queue we climbed up to the top. Despite wobbly legs it was well worth it. Stunning views on a beautiful day. If you have under 18s make sure you have ID otherwise you will have to pay full price. Teenagers were disappointed not to see Quasimodo...although plenty of gargoyles to take photos of.
Beautiful. So gorgeous. I actually stayed for mass and it was such a better experience than just walking through it.
Gorgeous. Beautiful sight. very overcrowded in the Summer months. Better off going in the evening. Enjoyed the Cathedral and lock bridge.
Long lines, but beautiful. Found this to be a bit touristy for my tastes. And, long lines around the block. Fortunately, the lines move relatively quickly but beware of the hordes of people visiting.

Worth the climb. We climbed up to the towers and the view is spectacular. You will have to wait in a line and they only allow so many people up at one time. You are able to see a great view of Paris. You also get close to the gargoyles sitting up there. Spiral stairs which are narrow but take your time it is worth the effort.

Worth the effort. We had to wait a while in the cold before we could get started and then go up a lot of stairs. But when you get to the top and see the views across Paris and the river it is spectacular and the various gargoyles up there are worth the stairs on their own. I never see so may different ones (don't want to give anything away).
Special!. It is worth going to just for the upper gallery views alone. So many places to see and vist in Paris but a MUST SEE are the Towers of Notre-Dame...you will regret not going!

Be prepared for the climb and amazing views. We went in December using the Musuem pass and the queue was alright. Only about 30 minutes before we started the climb. There is a middle level where you can take pictures of the famous gargoyles and Paris sights. After that, you climb all the way to the top for some amazing views of the Notre Dame rooftops and Paris. They did allow us lots of time to take pictures - we were the last group up. Well worth the long climb up and down the narrow winding stairs.
Stop for photo taken. If you haven't been to Vatican or any other Cathedrals in Florence, then it is worth to go inside. You must go to the upper gallery. The view is amazing.
Interesting Cathedral. Once again be prepared to queue, very impressive when you get in, however was not impressed with the speakers telling you to be quiet, it came over as very spooky

400 steps to amazing views. The 400 steps to the top can be a challenge but the trip is worth it. There is no other way up, so if the steps are an issue, don't attempt it. Once you start, there is no way but up. If you have a Paris Museum Pass, it will cover the cost but it will not let you skip the very long line that builds up early. Only about 20 people are let in at any one time and you have to wait until the previous group is headed out the other side just to get in. The same line is where you wait to buy tickets which are bought at the first stop on the climb. We arrived shortly after it opened and waited about an hour and a half. All that being said, the views from the top are amazing. You can see in all directions and see every major landmark in Paris. You have ample time at the top to take lots of pictures and enjoy the phenomenal views. At the top, the area where you stand is narrow and it will be crowded with just your group. Some of the passageways get very narrow. You end at the very top of the right tower, far above the city. If you are up to it, I would not miss this opportunity. I felt it was more impressive and enjoyable than the Eiffel tower or the Arc de Triomphe but the other two have an elevator.

Worth the challenge. Celebrating my 60 the birthday in Paris, loved the tower steps challenge. I am fit so not a problem, but 30 something's in front of me set a fast pace! At times I had doubt because I don't like tight spaces or heights, but carried on with goal in mind! Views are heavenly and gets you oriented in the city, but only go if you work out regularly!
The Bells!. Beautiful cathedral. English speaking tour Saturday at 2.30. Didn't go up the towers but lots of people did and enjoyed the views

Beautiful views and gargoyles. Worth the effort of the steep climb of over 400 steps and the queue of often over an hour just after 9am. Although the steps are also narrow and circular, so if you have difficulties with balance and movement it may be best to give this a miss.
Beautiful view of the city. Great view of the city and the famous gargoyles. it's a long journey up the winding stairs and it's a very narrow pathway around the tower. You may have to squeeze.
the best free location in Paris. Amazing place. One does not have to belong to any religion to enjoy the serenity of this place and the stained glass is amazing

Too tiring. I dont think its worth climbing up the towers if you have seen a lot of views in your travels. The stairs going up were clustrophobic, no big windows and very tight inside. Too tiring to go up as well.
Sanctuary!!. The towers are the best part of Notre-Dame and worth the wait and the climb... which is substantial.
A Must when in France. Very impressive... This is certainly one place you don't want to miss when travelling to France the architecture is incredible and the history behind it majestic.

Good but..... it was nice, but not as nice as expected as one of the towers is closed for renovation. too bad we will need to come back.
And the stairs (400) are quite steep !

The most frequented visited site in Paris by tourists.. From the water, the street in front, on the side, in the back, at night or day a visit to the Cathedral is on the list of the Eiffel Tower of must sees in Paris.
a really special. a really special, in and out. It was really magic and special to come back in evening when the lights on . walk to st micheal near the river - just magical time

"The lines were so long we never made it". I really wanted to go to the top to see the view. But we had been to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe so when we saw the line for this on a Saturday afternoon we just decided to head to the Latin Quarter and have a drink.

Spectacular..... It's a must see in Paris. Notre-Dame is spectacular! The climb up into the towers is well worth it. The gargoyles are a must see. The view is awesome. The cathedral is incredible. The flying buttresses are an architectural feat. Take the climb, if the towers are open.
Amazing history. It is amazing to see this piece of history and work of art that in in theaters. Please go in and share in history and the art of the structure. You will be amazed
do it!. take the steps all the way up, the view and the architectural details will blow your mind! Amazing! Cool! Just do it!

Breathtaking. Wanted to see Esmeralda and the hunchback. But seriously the church is beautiful. Being the first church in France and seeing the history and the place where they changed Joan of arc from heretic to saint was very interesting.
Beautiful church.
breathtaking!. truly a masterpiece! The cathedral itself is free of charge, you've got to pay extra to go up the towers. Take a walk to Latin quarter from there :)

The Notre-Dame. Fantastic visit on ash- wednesday and were lucky to walk in during mass.
great atmosphere and the joy of listening to the choir.

Provides INCREDIBLE photography opportunities. A highlight of our trip!. It's a bit of a wait and trek to get up there (not recommended for anyone who has difficulty with climbing stairs), but the stairs are quite manageable. The towers provide incredible views all around the city - I was able to take some great frame-worthy photos. Seeing the bell tower was also a real treat. It was a great experience to simply be in such a beautiful and historic building as well. My husband and I enjoyed walking around the whole area surrounding Notre Dame to relax and people-watch. It's also worth buying some ice cream from Berthillon nearby for a snack.I can't say enough good things about it - visiting was a highlight of our trip and one of our top must-see's in Paris.

Beautiful views even on a grey winters day. We were lucky enough to be on the first tour of the day so virtually no queuing! Loved being up so close to the gargoyles. Would recommend getting here early as they by let about 20 people up in each group so you only get about 20 min on each if the 2 levels, which is plenty of time o take in the views and get those photos! The steps were quite narrow and You need to be prepared for the climb of the 400 plus steps!

nice view. It took a lot of steps to get up but the view in good. It's included in the museum pass. I liked the view and liked the approach, the personnel are not very kind - maybe due to the rainy weather?

Not worth the queue. We got in the queue 30mins before opening time and we were in the queue for about 90 mins. It wasn't worth it. The gargoyles were great, the Parisian view was fine but I think that my time could have been better spent in a cafe chilling out.
'Wonderful. 26 years since I've been inside, still has tranquility and peacefullness. Stayed for Mass, even though it was in French, it was inspiring.

Outstanding. Just go and see his magnificent structure. A must see in Paris and I was advised, after we went to go at night and during the day. We only saw it inside during the day but viewed it from the Seine River cruise at night.
stunning. A very famous icon , such incredible archictecthure , we spent a couple of hours looking , not so many tourists , great for photographs .

Quasi you can feel him there. You look in awe at this building The oldest I have ever been in and you feel the presence of God I`am a believer but if you not don't worry Quasi is there and he's looooking ,

check top level is open. Climbing the towers of Notre Dame is absolutely worth the wait in line. You may feel like you're waiting a while because they aren't constantly letting people up, they let groups of 10-20 up every 10ish minutes which means you stand around in the same spot in line for about 10 minutes so you feel like you're getting nowhere. Be patient though, the view is spectacular and it's a great experience to see the gargoyles up close with the Paris skyline in the background.There are two levels you climb up to and if they decide it's particularly windy they'll close the top level so check before you get in line that both levels are open. Unfortunately it's the same cost and same wait in line even if the top is closed. Once they make the decision to close the top we noticed the decision often remained for the rest of the day even if the wind died down.

A must do...... You could easily miss this because it's around the left corner on the street side of the Cathedral.WMy wife and I love to climb cathedral towers - there are such great views and while climbing you just have to marvel at how this was all built hundreds of years ago before modern techniques and equipment - AND how it is still standing!! Compare this to highrises and stadiums that have to be renovated and/or torn down after 30/40 years.Up at the top you get another magnificent perspective on Paris - even if it includes the Monolith of Montparnasse!Higly recommended, worth every Euro. Take your time to the top - there are two towers to visit!

exquisite. Paris has some really nice architecture. The Notre-Dame cathedral is no exception. I especially enjoyed the stained glass and I recommend going there when it's sunny and in the morning because it gets very busy.

A Classic must to be. The isla in the senna river is one of a king. The church, one of a kind, the trip to the tower and the bell OK. inside the church after the celebrations of sundays evening is a Organ solo that make you trembling deep in to the bones. One of a kind

Magnificent view. This is a "have to" when you are in Paris!If you are at the front of the building facing the entrance, go left and there's another queue leading in to one of the towers. Once you're inside there is a lot of stairs before you get to the roof! But once you're up there it's worth all the effort! Here you have magnificent views of Paris and now you get a great opportunity to take photos of the different stone creatures of Notre Dame.You can even get to the top of one of the towers and here you get panoramic views of Paris.But for me and others with claustrophobia be aware of the narrow staircases! When you have people both ahead and behind you and you realize that if something would happen you can't get nowhere. That got me really uncomfortable.

Go up to the top. You won't regret taking the time to go up the side tower to see the best panoramic view of Paris. Totally worth climbing the 300+ steps. Probably do this at the start of your day........not at the end as if you are tired you will feel it for sure. Best view of all of Paris.

SPECTACULAR!. My favourite tourist attraction! Free to get in, intricate and inspiring on the outside, beautiful example of architecture and stained glass inside.It was so lovely and a working place of prayer, I had to go round twice.Photography is permitted but no flashes.

Beautiful and awe inspiring!. Of course the Notre Dame is gorgeous and well worth the visit. Sadly, everyone thinks so, so the place is absolutely heaving with tourists! However, as we were tourists, we persevered! It is free to enter and then the donation is up to you. We didn't stay long as it was so full but I am very glad we went. Worth the trouble.
Beautiful!. A must see in Paris! Free entry to this stunning Cathedral. Although always busy its a must see and worth it.

Nice To Visit. Long wait for a Tower visit, so we left that out. Trip around inside was very good and we recommend that You do go inside. Don't take a case if your travelling home that day, you won't be allowed admittance.
great views. You should take the 400 steps up to the top! Beautiful views and you get to spend time with the famous gargoils :)!

Hard on the knees and long queues. Very disappointed that having paid for Paris Museum passes, these did not allow one to skip the queue for the towers. Fortunately we arrived early so the queue was only about 100m long, but it started to rain and wasn't a lot of fun. The view from the top was not exceptional compared with that from the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. Our grandson enjoyed it but his knees are younger than ours, although he was disappointed that the bell couldn't be viewed as it was being renovated. Inside the cathedral was much better, and that was free!

Dream finally came true!. I just love the dancing gypsy of Disney’s Hunchback of Notre-Dame and I just fulfilled my childhood dream of being in a live Disney related attraction. There were a lot of tourists when I visited the grand cathedral. The cathedral had very beautiful stone sculptures. Very beautiful architecture and the place itself is a magnificent work of art. Never forget to get your picture taken with the famous Notre-Dame. Admission rates would vary with your age.

Great Views. I've been to Paris several times now, but this is the first that I have visited the Notre Dame towers. The line is always so long! This time though, I decided to give in and waited in line. Entrance to the towers is on the left side of the cathedral (not to be mistaken with the entrance to the church itself, which is in front). As the sign states, about 20-25 people are admitted every 10 minutes. This is a pretty accurate description. I waited about 1 hour to be admitted.Once you are permitted inside the church, you must climb a flight of stairs to the kiosk where you pay. There is a small gift shop here as well. Once everyone in your "group has paid", you can climb the remaining stairs to the top.The spiral staircases are quite narrow and there are many stairs, so be prepared to walk!You have access to the landing between the two towers AND on the very top of the two towers.Views are great. Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coeur in view.

See Notre-Dame Differently. Don't take the same old pictures that everybody else does. Go get a new perspective of this unique and beautiful building. I did and got some memorable photos that everyone admires.

A must See. Regardless of your faith, the Norte Dam cathedral is a must see, if not for its history, but to see this massive structure (warning, it can be very busy).A great paris journey for a rainy day, or the start of your day (as it closes early).

Knee breaking ..... The cathedral is a short walk from the metro and an even shorter walk from the RER line.The gothic architecture is wonderful.There was'nt a queue when we got there for 9am,the church is open from about 8 0'clock.entry to the cathedral is free and the audio guide is available for purchase for 5 euros.The cathedral is amazing,with wonderful glass work.There is a further counter to purchase tickets to view the treasury and it's definitely worth the 5 euros.There is a small gift shop before you exit.To the right of the cathedral is where you queue to climb up about 50 steps to reach a counter to purchase the ticket for the tower tour and the queue had about 20 people at 0900 hours.The climb of the cathedral towers is not for people who are cardivascularly challenged ;long ,winding stairs and at any given time only 5steps are visible.Once you get to the top the view is amazing. Worth the climb.
Nice Cathedral. It's a beautiful cathedral, although we did not like those loooong line ups to get there. It wasn't like that in 1999 when we first time visited.
Just as impressive in person. Loved seeing the stained glass from the inside. The organ was magnificent. There was a group singing while we were there. Stunning!

An Adventure You MUST Experience. Go early. Have coffee across the street. Get in line along the (facing the cathedral) left wall (right across the street from the coffee shop). When they open you're in the first group to go in and up. And what a trip! Stone stairs hundreds of years old, well-worn with the passage of time. Up and up and into the room where the bells are located. Not stone any more but old timbers (and wooden stairs). A great place for a picture PLUS it kind of takes you by surprise. Never expected extensive wood construction. The out on a walkway along the roof and...THE VIEWS! Gargoyles with the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The Seine River. Every tall cathedral in Paris. Yeah. If you go to Notre Dame and don't do the climb you are making a mistake. If you do skip the towers go back and do them another day - just the towers - and move on. You won't be sorry.

Incredible architecture - amazingly beautiful.. Notre Dame Cathedral is certainly one of the highlight landmarks of Paris. We visited twice during our stay, words cannot describe its elegance. You simply must visit if you have the opportunity, it's breathtaking.
Chilling. This place is beautiful both outside and in. It really was spectacular and although the visit didn't take long, it was one of the best places we visited in Paris. Do not miss it out.
Beautiful. Another must do in Paris. This is an amazing experience. The building looks awsome from the river but up close it doesn't dissapoint.

Marvellous Architecture.. Read about this place in school...french lessons. Breathtaking architecture. Lines are long in Summer. The cathedral itself is magnificient.Very Humbling experience. Restaurants in the area are few and very crowded.Super photo op.

Spectacular view. Usually you have to wait for a while before you can get in. They let around 20 people at one time and you have to climb the 400 steps to reach to the top. All that is worthwhile once you reached the top. Fantastic view with the gargouille in foreground, absolutely beautiful.

Gothic Cathedral. The Cathedral itself is a sight to see, the stained glass windows are so extraordinary! I've been there three times now and not until my last visit did I realize there was a line outside for the towers attached to the left side of the building where you can go up. We did this only the last time, but I did not think the wait was really worth it to be honest. The cathedral itself has individual nooks off to the side of the walking path where you can sit, pray, or light a candle. There was many displays inside explaining the past of this building and it is just one of those things you look in amazement once you realize people volunteered their lives to build this entire building. On faith and devout to their religion they built these beautiful architecturally designed buildings from ground up without compensation in most cases. It was just truly worth seeing.
what a detailing. this heritage cathedral towers are just too beautifully carved to be admired. carry ur own binoculars to see the details at ur comfort and ease.

Fantastic views. A must do really great views and all made the better by the gargoyles in the foreground of your pictures 422 steps but well worth it. Well managed queues meant not too much of a wait for us.

Amazing. This was hands down my favourite experience of our trip to Paris. The architecture of Notre Dame is stunning, and seeing it from this vantage point is incredible. Although a Paris museum pass doesn't allow you to skip the line, it does include the cost of admission.We got in line at about 9:00 am, and there were about 30 people ahead of us. We waited about an hour in total, but by the time we got back down the line was much longer so going early worked out well. You have a limited time to enjoy the view once you get up there, so enjoy it! The photo opportunities are fantastic!If I'm ever lucky enough to get back to Paris, I will be making a beeline to go back up to the top of Notre Dame! It's definitely a must do on any trip to Paris.

Iconic Paris. Top of "must visit" list right after la tour Eiffel while in Paris. Go early to avoid crowds. Long lines to enter can be intimidating, but moves quite quickly and efficiently. Will need to battle noisy, rude, pushy and loud tourists from the US, Russia, mainland China, and South America, but can't be avoided. Tolerate the rudeness to enjoy the beauty and history of Notre Dame.

Lots of stairs. Kind of narrow circular stone stairway and it's steep. A lot of overweight tourists were having a hard time -- all we could hear was heavy breathing all the way up! There's a real cheesy gift shop at the halfway point. Not sure I would have gone here without the museum pass but the view was worth the effort.

Amazing - Must Do in Paris!. We visited in January, this was this first thing we did and we were so glad we did it! The climb is quite knackering but the views are well-worth it! You wont see views of Paris like this from anywhere else! I cant remember how uch it was to get in but was no more €8-10 each so well worth the money. Very close to the underground too.

Great Views. Climb the 387 steps to the top. But beware, the walls close in on you the higher you go up. Several people I went with had a hard time. But it's well worth the effort. So amazing they could build a structure like this so long ago.

Cathedral quirkiness: notes and tips on visiting the Towers.. Anyone visiting the cathedral of Notre-Dame will want to carve out a trip to the towers in their itinerary. The entrance is located next to the north tower on the Rue du Cloitre-Notre-Dame; just look for the line of people and get behind the last one. Groups are led in about twenty at a time, and you are ushered up about a hundred stairs to an impressive but enclosed rib-vaulted room. As opposed to the fee-free cathedral, a visit to the towers will cost 8.50 Euro at the time of this writing and is paid at this point. After being allowed to browse the shop for a few minutes the group finally ascends to the lower ledge of the north tower.The Chimera gallery greets you at the top of the stairs and it’s here where the fun begins. A 19th Century creation by Viollet-le-Duc, the group of mythical hybrid beasts, birds, and monsters are just plain cool to look at. There are some nice views to the west of the city as well. After appreciating the stone animals for a few minutes everyone is led to the south tower belfry to the cathedral’s largest bell, then it’s up another flight of stairs to the top of the south tower for panoramic views of the city. After about ten minutes up here it’s about a 400-step descent to the ground and the completion of the visit.In summary, a visit here is worth the time and effort spent. From joining the waiting line to departure at the end was a little over an hour, although certainly longer in the peak season. The uniqueness of the carvings balances out the imposing “Gothic-ness” of the cathedral itself and the views of the surroundings are on par with the Eiffel tower. I visited the towers for the first time in 2008 and it was a bit of a mess: a three hour wait, people crashing into each other on the top, a direct ascent with no break, etc. Whoever runs the show here really seems to have smoothed out the process and made it very tourist-friendly. This is all the more impressive when you realize this was done on what has to be one of the world’s most visited attractions. Recommended highly and without reservation.Tips:*As this is a paid attraction with limited visitors attached to one of the world's most visited structures, timing your visit either during the day (get in line early) or seasonally (visit off-peak or shoulder) is key.*If you are visiting in the winter months be sure and dress for warmth. This was by far the coldest I felt in Paris during my four days.*There is a free green pamphlet at the entrance that functions as an excellent tour guide for the visit. This is highly recommended as there is no audio guide available and the attendants along the way function more as sentries and not docents.
Light a candle .... Beautiful church with lots of amazing mosaic work. Light a candle and think of all your love once. Unlike some churches you are allowed to take pictures inside the church.

Fantastic. Be sure to climb the towers of Notre Dame! For a little work, you will be rewarded with a fantastic view across Paris. You'll enjoy pointing out landmarks (even Sacre Coeur is easily visible!) and taking great photos. Well worth it!
Beautiful. A must visit. Beautiful church with lots of stories. Light a candel inside and enoy the beauty. Free entry. Near metro.

Going up!. Once you get to the steps, be ready for narrow circular steps. It is so worth it once you hit the top, but you have to be in a bit of shape. Otherwise you will have to stop along the way, and it is VERY narrow.The view and the closeness to the building, gargoyles, and bells is unbelievable.

Amazing place love the cafe at the left. There was a waiter there that he spoke Spanish Italian english young guy that was super nice
Eventhough French people from Paris does not really smile a lot thus guy was amazing server and also did not stop smiling
Don't remember his name
My bad just he has light hair
