Woth the time and stair climbing to see the gargoyles up close and great views of the city. See all the gargoyles close-up. It takes a decent amount of walking up stairs and navigating some narrow terraces. But, it's great once you get up there. Go early in the morning to avoid a long line/wait.

Worth the lineup. Try to beat the lineup by getting there early in am. Caution: not for those who don't like climbing stairs - also the upper levels are quite narrow in parts so not a trip for the wide in girth. The view from the north and south towers of Paris and of the gargoyles are incredible - worth the climb and the wait.
A MUST SEE!. You just have to go in and see for yourself...stay for mass if you can, but this is a beauty. Plan on spending time here. Need I say more?

View from the towers is worth the wait.. Skip the Arc de Triomphe terrace and see Paris from this viewpoint. The incredible stonework detail on the cathedral at this level and of course the gargoyles is amazing.
Lines can be long!. Arrive early or you will wait in line for one to two hours. The view of Paris and City Island should not be missed though.

Breathtaking views!. We waited in a queue for 2 hours which was very tiring, especially for moaning teenagers! We paid €8.50 for adults and children 18 & under are free. Steps were a little narrow but safe. Once up and out the views were fantastic and breathtaking. Well worth it! Take you time going up as there are lots!

A memorable Afternoon. Sit on the steps and dream, walk inside and feel history. A must for anyone who has a few hours in the afternoon. Walk along the Seine, and be captured by a time that is still here and now. Continue a your stroll across the bridge to Ile St. Loius and have an excellent ice cream, at Berthillon! A true Paris afternoon as you continue through the parks and statues of St. Louis and the West Bank.

A beautiful place to visit. An imposing edifice beside the Seine, Notre-Dame is a must see that you will never forget. A place so full of history that the hair on the back of your neck will stand up. The only dislike was the huge number of heavily armed police in and around the cathedral, very un-nerving.

Beautiful Church! Free Admission!. I really liked the concept of donate with what you believe is worth. The church is beautiful - it has a combination of nicely designed glass, some sculptures, nice paintings .it's a must see if you're in Paris. If you're lucky, you may get to attend a mass.. Don't forget to donate to the Church .. this is how they keep it free!

Beautiful views, a trip highlight. The views from the top are stunning. We went just before sunset which was lovely. The only down side is the long wait to get into the tower. We had tried a couple other times and found the lines too long. This time we got lucky and arrived after a sudden downpour which may have scattered the crowds. The lines are slow for a good reason - they limit the number of people in the tower at one time which means that you have more space to move around when you are on the tower, and it is possible to get some great photographs. They also stay open later on some summer nights which is great.

Peaceful and Gorgeous. How can you not stop here? It is such an iconic symbol of Paris.There were long lines just to get inside if you said you were a visiter, but if you when in the mass attendance door there was no line at all. Both doors take you to the same exact place.I did actually attend mass, but I really think anyone could go in the mass door and avoid lines.If you are interested in a mass where there is some English, 11:30am on Sunday is the International Mass. Most of the mass is in French, but there is some in English. I found it very interesting.

Paris Pass Saves Notre-Dame Tour. The line to see Notre Dame Cathedral circled around Paris...or it seemed. Our Paris Pass let us right in without waiting. Had it not been for the Pass, we might have passed on this incredible landmark. We spent five hours viewing ever nook and cranny. Believe me, even if you don't have a Paris Pass, the wait is worth it!

Spectacular Building. I liked the fact that when we visited Notre dame thee was a Tiered viewing stand. I was great for just sitting there & admiring all the fine details of the face of the Cathedral. FREE ADMISSION. You only have to pay if you want to go up into the Towers. We decided not to this day as the queues that day were too long.

great climb. The visit to the towers is a must but you need to stand in a long queue again outside the cathedral to get in there. Great view of Paris from the top and admire the classic french Gothic architecture. takes around 15mins to climb - decent fitness level.
Must see while in Paris. Just a wonderful church and structure. Will just floor you at how it was accomplished as old as it is.
Climb Upstairs for a nice view of Paris!. This is another nice place to visit. We climbed the stairs to go to the top of the Cathedral and enjoy the beautiful views of the City.

Grand facade!!. The cathedral is beautiful but overrun with tourists during high season.We chose to eat lunch across the street and enjoy the amazing view! Be prepared to wait in line at least 1.5 hours.

Cathedral with Character. I have visited, more grander and impressive ones than the Notre Dame in Paris, but this one, still has the best charm and character, Love the Notre Dame in Paris, Lots of history in this building. Take an hr or 2 and pay it a visit, climb the stairs, visit the outside & top, not just the inside, sit on the roofs, not a lot of cathedrals allow you to visit the places that this one does.

The line was enormous but worth it. You can't go to Paris and not go to Nortre Dame. The line moved at a decent pace and once I got in, I just found a pew in which to sit and enjoyed the people and what I could see from where I was sitting. My husband did walk all around the behind the altar, but said it was so crowded that he could only see what was above people's heads. We did not go up the towers because we had already been to the Eiffel Tower. There are people outside feeding birds that will land on your arms and hover over your head to be fed. There is a playground behind and to the right towards the Seine if you kids need to run around for a bit. It really is a must see.
Lovely. I didn't climb the towers as the queues to get in were too long but will be doing next time it's beautiful!

Queues!. This is a fabulous Cathedral on the banks of the Seine. We have been before, in October, and had no difficulty accessing the interior. In August, however, the queues were probably a quarter of a mile long - too much for us. Well worth a visit though.
notre-dame. It's a church it's interesting but I've seen betterLooks very impressive from the outside This was the smallest queue of our trip to Paris

Worth waiting for. Climbing the towers was a highlight of my visit. While there are better views of Paris, the detail in the carvings, and the expressions on the gargoyles was fantastic. Yes you have to pay, and yes you have to line up, but I would climb the towers before visiting the inside of the cathederal again!
Spectacular. Could have spent a full day at the cathedral. The architecture alone was mind boggling. Definitely a must see in Paris

The glorius Notre Dame de Paris. Notre Dame, the heart of old Paris. The beautiful and glorious cathedral is the gem of Paris. If you visit it, warning, there are lots of stairs until you reach the roof!

Worth the wait. It was almost an hour wait on a cloudy weekday morning. The staff will only allow small groups of people to go inside at a time because the stairs are narrow. It wasn't too difficult to climb up for young people I believe. The view was gorgeous with the gargoyles just in front of you.

Pretty. Large and pretty cathedral. The architecture was especially detailed. Very beautiful indeed. There's also a secluded little park at the back of the cathedral not many know about, very peaceful to just chill back.

Long lines and lots of stairs, but view is worth it!. Would definitely recommend this for those who brought the museum pass, however get there early since the pass doesn't allow you to skip the line. We got there around lunch time in May and it took us a hour and a half to get to the front of the line. There was a lot of stairs that you had to walk both up and down, but the view was worth it! The gargoyles looked just like the ones from the Hunchback of Notre Dame movie and at the top of the tower you could see a 360 degree view of Paris! Well worth the wait and the stairs!

850 years of greatness. Celebrating 850 years of existence, this cathedral is in the center of the city - literally. Outside the entrance of Notre Dame is a landmark circle that is the basis of all streets in the City of Lights.
For the cathedral itself, the architecture and history is well worth the visit.

Fun with a lovely view. It does not get better than this--up close with the gargoyles, images of Notre-Dame de Paris by Hugo, and great views of the cathedral and city. Get there early--the lines can be long.

Great views of Paris. Ok, you do need to be patient as the lines are very long to go up to the Towers of the Notre Dame but then you won't regret it. It is like going backstage of Notre Dame, you can see the bells of Notre Dame and imagine Quasimodo ringing them. Once outside, the views of Paris over the Seine and the Eiffel Tower are beautiful. Highly recommended!
Outstanding. Not to be missed. You can walk the interior and the architecture inside as well as the stained glass windows are breath-taking.

Let someone else climb those stairs. I suppose there are those who find it exciting to squeeze up the stairs to claim they've claimed the towers of Notre-Dame. If you've always wished you'd been named Quasimodo, then go ahead. Frankly, I'll watch. The wait is too long, it's too hot, it's too difficult, and it's not worth it to me.

It's a beautiful Cathedral but in the summer there are thousands trying to get in. Try off season, it's quieter .. Too many people that time of the year. The queues where too long and limited restrooms. ................................
Lovely. Not for people with claustrophobia, the stairs gets narrower and narrower the higher you go. Wonderful view and architecture!
Norte dame mighttime. We loved hanging out in the evenings at the Norte dame. Great atmosphere with loads of entertainment.

Such detail. There are a few hundred stairs to climb, so do it only if you are capable. Your reward is grand views of the surrounding area. Don't forget to take your camera for some memorable photo's. one lady forgot hers, but I did e- mail her a few like I promised.

Long wait but well worth it.. I'm into gargoyles and the highligh of my visit to Paris was to be able to climb the towers and get up close to the gargoyles. Lucky it was a nice day and my pictures came out great. It gets very crowded when walking the narrow walk way between the towers.

Beautiful towers, steep stairs. The stairs to the top are steep, but once you go up you can see it was worth it. The tower is a beautiful piece of Gothic architecture that is well-preserved and carries a lot of history in its walls. The view is beautiful but there are better views from higher places elsewhere - enjoy the Gothic architecture and its many statues (including the famous gargoyles and chimeras), because that's what really makes this place shine.Unfortunately, part of the tower was closed due to maintenance so I couldn't see the bells. If this is a deal break to you, be sure to check if they are open to visit beforehand.One last thing - be careful on the stairs, specially when going down. They are very narrow and steep; if you slip and fall... it won't be pretty.

A must see. Marvel at the amazing structure that is Notre Dame. This was a must do on our visit to Paris and we were not disappointed. If you are into history/architecture then you will be in for a visual spectacular.
Lots of stairs. Ha,ha, I'm terrified of heights so I totally freaked out. However other family members really enjoyed this although the long wait in a queue and the many stairs were not so good.

Worth the wait!. We waited in line mid afternoon for about 1.5 hours to go up to the top. The view was certainly worth it! Warning: The stairs going up are very narrow, very windy, and many! Not for those with bad knees or the old or claustrophobic!

Love the gargoyles. Even with the Paris Museum Pass, we had to wait in line for at least an hour to climb to the top of the bell towers. They can only take so many people up to the top at a time. It can be very cramped, so if you like personal space I don't recommend. I loved this, though, because I have always wanted my own pictures of gargoyles staring whimsically onto the Paris city sights, and now I have them. If you are a larger person, there are some tight spaces. My husband is 6' 2" and fit, but he had to squeeze through a few tight quarters! You have to option to go to the first level or to the very top - since you're already up there, take the few extra stairs to see the very top. It will be a slow shuffle of a lot of bodies, but so worth it for the views!

Lines way too long! South tower was closed.. If you like gargoyles and want to climb 384 steps to see them, then go do this. We weren't able to actually see any of the bells and there are other buildings in Paris with nice views as well (such as Eiffel Tower or Arc de Triomphe)

A must see in Paris. Climb to the top. Walk around the grounds. Hopefully its during a service. Only downside is the wait to get it, but that just cant be helped. Also, beware of pickpockets in the area.
Breathtaking and spectacular. The ultimate view of the entire city of Paris. The gargoyles are a treat to behold! Spend the time and wait in line for this attraction, not to be missed!
Unreal. Dont go during peak seasons you will wait for two hours to get in,, on sundays after mass you get to hear the bells of Notre Dame!

SO BEAUTIFUL. the detail on the cathedral and how it connects so much to the stories of the bible is breath taking. many people just go to take pictures but its so much more to know the history of the place and its more sentimental to know what your actually looking at and actually understand why its an attraction. the tour inside is free, you walk around the church and see all the old statues and the story of jesus christ. brush up on the bible and its stories before you go or else it wont have any meaning and you'll just be another tourist taking pictures of something that doesnt make sense to you.

get there early!. We got in line at 9:30 AM and were second in line when the towers opened at 10. By that time the line was about 200 people long. This was at the end of june. There is a limited number of people that can be in the towers at one time and so I would highly recommend getting in line early , grab a chocolate croissant and coffee while you’re waiting at your total time wasted waiting to get in is very short (comparatively speaking). The view is from the towers are wonderful - highly recommend climbing the towers.

Beautifull Cathedral. Loved this cathedral arrived about 10.30 on the Sunday, no queue to get in as opposed to the previous day, was very surprised to see a service going on with all those tourists wandering round the out skirts, well worth a visit, just wish I had the energy to climb the 422 stairs up to the bell tower.
Nice if you can get in. The famous towers are very nice unfortunately the wait is really long to get in, the museum pass does not allow you to bypass the lines in this location.

Great views, but get there to line up early. The views were great and it was fun to get up close and personal with the gargoyles. We got there about 20 minutes before it opened to line up and got inside fairly fast. Everyone, including the kids thought it was worth the wait even though it can be a little tight going up all those steps (it was build for much smaller people).

Plan your visit.. Well... be there early in the morning (around 8 a.m) or book a tour in advance. Otherwise, you will probably spend up to 2 hours in the line, which can be very consuming in the summer. Nevertheless, it is a "must see" place due to the views and architecture itself.

Gorgeous building. we loved walking around and understanding the history behind this building, however, when we were there, unfortunately it was very crowded as they were celebrating their 80th anniversary! otherwise, it would have been perfect.. I didn't like the fact that there were no toilets that you can access to in the cathedral!

Massive Delays May Not be Worth it. The views from the towers are ok, but I do not know if it is worth the 90 minute wait in the morning sun to go up there. The other frustrating aspect is the large number of tour groups who are given priority entry to the towers which means the wait for the average person travelling alone blows out again and again. Quite frustrating and I feel there are other places which will provide more spectacular views without the wait.

wowow. I saw a bunch of churches on our 10 day trip through Europe but this has to be one of the biggies! Free to the public, some fast moving but long lines and impressive site. The area around is quite nice and if you can get a driving tour, you will really appreciate Paris much more.
Great attraction. Awesome building and the inner area was magnificent. Get there early to beat the crowds though. Cannot really describe how nice it was in words.

'Our Lady of Paris' in French. Notre Dame Cathedral is widely considered one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture in the world. It was restored and saved from destruction by Eugène Viollet-le-Duc, one of France's most famous architects. The name Notre Dame means "Our Lady" in French, and is frequently used in the names of Catholic church buildings in Francophone countries.

So worth all those stairs!. Get there early to avoid the queues, or you can pass the time by eating a baguette while you wait. The stairs are so worn from people walking on them that they dip in, which is really impressive. There are a lot of stairs, so wear comfortable shoes and take water and any winter layers you may be wearing, remove them before you start. Once you've reached the top, the viewing space is limited so they only let up a few groups at a time ( the reason why there's a queue). Try plan your visit on a clear day so you can really see the views of Paris and how the gargoyles casually glare over their city. Be sure to take a fully charged camera!

Visit in early morning best. No lines if you go early. Beautiful gothic architecture. Amazing to experience the enormity of these old cathedrals. You can tour yourself or pay for a guided tour. Large viewing stands in front of cathedral to rest a bit.

Jaw droppingly stunning!!. On a recent trip to Paris with my wife and daughter we visited all the popular places to see, The Louvre, Eiffel Tower etc, etc, Notre Dame was easily the best, just stunning. We're not a religious family but you can't help appreciate the beauty of the cathedral. Paris is an expensive city and it came as a lovely surprise that it is free to visit, just lovely.

Worth the return visit. A great opportunity to see the architecture and structures that are the Notre dame!Please check the times of your visit. they close at 18h30 according to the brochures, but last entry is at 17h30. if you do miss it, then walk around the corner and check the queue for the cathedral. we were lucky, there were only a few people ahead of us, and the bonus ws that a chruch service was in progress. quite humbling.
Great view. We waited over an hour in the queue but it was worth it. The towers provide a great view of the city as well as the gargoyles and the cathedral itself.

Eye level with the gargoyles!. It is a long wait in line to make the long climb to the towers, but it was one of the highlights of our trip to Paris. The up close view of the gargoyles, the bells tolling, and the view of the city spread out below made this a not to be missed experience!

Towers of Notre Dame Cathedral. The Towers were great after the massive climb of the stairs not recommended if you have trouble walking the stairs are narrow and steep and a lot of them. The view is magnificent but once up there they make you queue to get to the next level and then wait to go back down. The queues to get into the Towers were crazy long.

You'll need a ticket (free) for kids. The wait to get up the towers is at least 1 hr in the summer (you have to get there at least an hour before it opens to be first in line, so that doesn't help), but it's well worth the wait. It's been over 30 years since we were there, and they've added a stop at the mezzanine level that has a little shop. My husband and I had Paris Museum passes but we had to get our two boys tickets at that shop before entering the stairs to the next level of the towers. It was free, but we were caught unawares since that wasn't written anywhere that I've found. There's a nice video on the history of the cathedral while you wait for your turn to go up. It was a bit sad to see the deteriorating state of the stone-- (the gargoyles, chimera and carvings look more melted than 30 years ago) but it's still a breath-taking, must do site.

go to the top. Make sure you wait in line and go up to the top of Notre Dame. It has excellent views of the city including views with the Eiffel tower. You can see the bell tower and the wonderful carved monsters watching over the city.
You must climb!. What a spectacular view, its definitely worth the side-splitting stitch youll have from climbing all of those winding stairs!

Worth the wait..... After you visit the actual Cathedral, you have to go outside to the left and wait on yet another line. They say they let 40 people in every 10 minutes but... I take umbrage with that. Several times a group walks up and... in they go. Our wait was about an hour and a half so... if you have small kids... be prepared for crying. I wanted to cry. There are also 327 steps to the top... and an equal amount coming down... ALL that being said... Wow. The views are phenomenal. The history... undeniable.

A lovely ancient Cathedral. I loved my journey inside the Notre dame Cathedral, its very beautiful with so much details on the walls. the journey inside is also lovely, u see a statue of Jeanne d'arc.

Plan to arrive EARLY. LONG cue to get into Notre-Dame but this line moves fast. Museum Pass does NOT work here!Line to climb the stairs is LONG! Because the stairs are narrow and it's the same up/down..limited amount of people can be let in at a time. We waited 1 1/2 hours in line. Well worth the wait and climbing the stairs was a good workout. History and view from the top was worth the wait.
Gargoyles. Well worth the climb and the admission price. Stunning "gargoyle's eye" views, as well as a close up look at the fascinating gargoyles.

Amazing views from the top and don't forget to visit the crypt!. There's no better reward for climbing an extremely narrow and uneven spiraling staircase than the amazing views of Paris from the top of the Notre Dame. The lines tend to get long around tourist season, but be patient - they allow groups to go up at a time and so once a group leaves the line moves pretty quickly. Keep in mind though that the staircase is extremely narrow and long so it does take a little bit of endurance to make it all the way up there. I went in the summer which was probably not a good idea as the stairs are only moderately ventilated and walking behind a sweaty person the entire way up was definitely no fun for my nose.
Line move fast. Don't be scared by the line. It moves fast and it's the best view of Paris. Plus, you can get the best view of the gargoyles of Notre Dame from this vantage point.

Amazing... We went to see this Cathedral in evening around 5PM and it was closing time there, so we could not go inside. But there was amazing crowd outside it. It is situated just adjacent to Seine River and was a perfect place to spend time. Its beauty can be seen at night too while on cruise when it get lightened up !! I found this simply amazing and would love to visit it again but from inside this time :)
Wonderful work of art. We were on a City Tour and just loved stopping here to see this beautiful Catherdral on it's own island.
The Family loved this. It is worth the wait and climb to see the gargoyles eye to eye. the views of Paris are wonderful. Go early and the line may be better.

Don't miss this!. To come face-to-face with those wonderful and silly gargoyles (they call them chimeras) was worth the entire vacation. Don't be too afraid of the 422 steps up. I am 50, overweight, and out of shape. The steps are short and I managed fine. So glad I did. These are the best photographs and memories of the vacation. We were allowed to linger much longer than I expected given that they only allow a certain number up at a time. There is a cost as the towers are run by the museaum association, not the church. I think we paid 8 or 8,50 Euros each. Well worth it. We did wait for a bit in line, but arrive early and it won't be bad at all.

Spend the evenin in this area across the water / bridge. Some very good restaurants very close to Notre Dame just across the bridge. The church itsell is AS beautiful inside as outside. Then again, Paris has a lot more to offer than Notre Dame Tower so I would not use the money and skip the waiting queue. Outside is more than enough. Just my 2 cents.

Beautiful inside and out!. The Notre-Dame is an obvious attraction to visit while in Paris, but the beauty is magnified when you examine the exterior roofline and towers. A walk around the rear of the building reveals a lot more of this impressive attraction (and a hidden bathroom in the adjoining park!) The architecture is phenomenal but the best part is not even at the Cathedral, it is at the Crypt Archaeology in front of the Notre-Dame. The Crypt has interactive 3D models of the Cathedral in stages as it was being built! Avoid Blue Shuttle at all costs, they abandoned my family and I at the airport and refused to refund my prepaid fare. Air France caused us an 8 hour delay and lost our luggage for 6 days, ensure you pack necessities in your carry-on!

Beautiful place to visit. I visited on a Sunday morning, taking place was a service in the grounds outside the cathedral with video screens for the public to view. The whole building is stunning.One downside is lots of people, and lots of pickpockets.
Where is the bellringer. With my mind on the well known story I wanted to also see the bells only you cannot see them from outside. So much for Quasimodo

What a great workout and look out!. I loved the trip to the top of the cathedral and I am grateful that I had the stamina and good health to make the trip. I felt the passage of those before me in each step I took. The gargoyles were incredible!
Great church. It is a really nice church. Different for the others of Paris and some other places in the world. It is really nice to see all the windows and specially the history behind it.
Get there early. The line only seems to get longer during the day. They regulate the number of people which is nice because they are narrow walkways.

Stunning views but get in line early!. We arrived early on a Friday morning, toured the cathedral and then got in line about 9:30am. We were the very last people to go up in the first group so it's worth arriving first thing. My husband and I are both around 50, in moderately good shape and while we were breathing pretty hard on the way up, it's totally worth it for the views. Just stunning!

An absolute wonder. Used the hop on hop off bus while in Paris. We did get off at Notre-Dame and it is magnificant!. Well worth taking the time to admire the splendor and architecture of this Church. Over the road are numerous little restaurants, eateries, and souvenir shops that are also worth exploring.

Excellent views, but only if you're physically able!. Overall, this was a wonderful experience and if I am ever in Paris again I would probably do it again. We got in line more than an hour before it opened, and by opening time the line was very long. We were about tenth in line and once the stairs opened, we still had to wait about 20 more minutes to enter because other school/tour groups were let in first. Once we were let in, we started the great climb! The stairs were wide at first, but then got a bit more narrow; I would not recommend this if you are particularly claustrophobic. About halfway up, you reached a small gift shop were you purchased your ticket (included in the Paris Museum Pass, free for those under 17 with ID, and 10 euros otherwise) and waited about five more minutes to continue to the top. By the end of the climb, I was a little tired but quickly recovered.The views were spectacular!!! When I went, it was a bit overcast but it was still magnificent! I really enjoyed that you were not only given an excellent view of the city, but also of the top parts of the Cathedral itself. There was plenty of time to take photos and enjoy the view before being given the option to continue to climb a little bit higher or go back down. The further climb was very easy and the views were excellent as well.When going down the spiral staircase, it was very hard not to get dizzy! But it was completely worth the trip, and I would recommend for most.

Worth waiting in line. OK it was Day 5 in Paris, day 9 in France and the hour wait and the 422 steps almost stopped us but we are glad we did. Close up with the Gargoyles and the great views of Paris. This is a must do with your museum pass. Yes, get the pass.
Worth it for the climb. We queued for an hour and had to climb a few hundred flights of stairs but the view was really worth it! Great view of Paris.
Superb views. A long stair climb but well worth it. Highly recommended. Views are amazing and incredible to see the gargoyles up so close...

Words cannot describe. This was the most spectacular place I visited in all of Paris. I could of spend hours here. It was so beautiful. Only downside was that the bell tower was closed when we went and we missed mass (in English) by about 15 minutes. :(There was aline to get in but it moved quickly. The architecture was incredible. I was simply amazed at the size of the church itself. The detail outside was limitless. Inside the stain glass and the organ pipes were beautiful. i cannot even find the words to describe how incredibly wonderful this place was. I was simply in awe at the size and detail in everything that was here. I could of stayed here for the entire day. I think we were there for about 2 hours and we saw all that we could but you must simply just take in the beauty of it all to truly enjoy this magnificent building. By far the best church I have ever seen.
many steps to climb, but it totally worth it. Wonderful view. It was very cold, windy, but still I could not resist the gargoyles. So many great pictures

We Sat in Wonder and Enjoyed the View. On a beautiful spring afternoon we sat in front of the towers of Notre-Dame Cathedral and were transfixed by the beauty of the sight. What history, what amazing architecture! We walked behind to a lovely park and then along the Seine. The crowds seemed to fade away as all our attention was upon this amazing experience we hope to repeat someday.

worth the queuing and the climb!!!. wow, great views of Paris but wish there was a speaking machine that could pinpoint whats where of the various church roofs etc.. great thing was I got there for 12oclock and the chimes were amazing ,you are right next to the bells going off!! Ans you can see the massive bell through cracks in brickwork

Towers. The only reason we went up was because it was free for 18-25's from the EU. The view is good but it is very narrow at the top plus with it being so hot it was a bit claustrophobic. Worth a trip up though, the staircases are narrow but I just had to block that out.
Beautiful place. Beautiful church, a must see for everyone in Paris. The scenery is very nice and in sunset the amber sun casts a beautiful color on the two towers of the Notre Dame.

850 years old, wow!. This is a must see. We are not religious at all but the building is amazing. We just happened to show up when the bells were going off and got inside to see some activity. What an incredible place to check out. Very crowded when we were there though and I wouldn't recommend more than an hour to see the whole thing.

Long wait but worth it. I was so lucky to be a student in EU so I got a chance to go up to the tower for free. Waiting almost one and half hour to go up, walking through steep stairs, the view up there was incredible!!! It was my favorite view point of Paris :)

Don't skip the gargoyles!. OK, they're actually chimeras, since they are just scary statues and not downspouts that gargle ("gargouille" in French). And I can't give it 5 stars because the line is hideous; try to get there right before it opens. I have made the climb many times in my 14 visits and one stint living in Paris, and I can't manage it any longer due to my claustrophobia. It gets VERY tight at the top of the many spiral stairs, and all I can think the whole time I'm up there is that I'll have to do it again to get down! But I am glad I saw those iconic statues and climbed all the way to the top of the towers for an incredible view of Paris, and I encourage all my students to go each time I bring a group. Do it at least once in your life!
Breathtaking. We both loved how much work went into building this great Cathedral.It was sad that we could not go to the top of the Cathedral as there is no lifts for people with walking problems
I've seen better gothic cathedrals in Europe. It's true the cathedral is large, but there are much better looking cathedrals in Europe. I was not impressed.

Everything History Says it Is!. Sheer awe, a marvel of engineering and faith. Caution, the Paris Pass is useless here. Hour wait on line with pass, walked in 10 minutes later with free line admission. A must stop and very close to the museum of the middle ages (Moyen). Notre Dame is a testament to our belief in God.
must see. Magical place with beautiful architecture and it worth waiting to get inside. The cathedral will leave you speechless and try to get there for the service it is an amazing experience.

Crowded, but a must see. Always very crowded, but a must see while in Paris. Take some time and look at the intriguing stone carvings around entrance doors. They tell a story and if I had not been with a guide I would have missed all this interesting information.

Norte-Dame Cathedral. We went on a Sunday and the line was not bad. Going in there was free but the tower was not. It was a must see and you should plan to spend a whole day in that area to tour other attractions such as the Ste Chapelle, , Pantheon, musee Cluny, Luxembourg garden and the quarter Latin nearby as well. I wanted to share with all the ladies out there about the public toilette nearby the cathedra. The cleaning ladies would show people in line a one euro coin in their hands prompting people to tip them. They misled people to do that but in fact, you don't need to. I saw most people did that (and for what? They did not even give you a paper towel to dry your hand.) there was a sign on the wall said (gratuity/ free) so people were confused. Those ladies must have a hefty income collecting from people.
Wonderful. It was quite something to stand in front of something you had heard so much about lovely building, well worth a vist.
This climb will give you astounding views of Paris. Unless you have a health issue, this should be a must-do. You will see views of Paris that are priceless. There's a line, but it's not too bad.

Great view. Wear good shoes! It's quite a climb but well worth it. We got there late morning and there was a queue for approximately 40mins, however once you are up there you forget that and enjoy the fantastic views!

Very long wait ........ We got in the line outside and it was moving very slow. I started taking pictures outside and it's an amazing structure. After about an hour we decided not to continue to wait and moved on. But I bet the views from the top will be amazing.

A must see!. This is the heart of historical Paris. You need to queue (on the left hand side when in front of the cathedral, btw) to get up there, but it is definitely worth it. Even Parisians, like myself, go there occasionnally.

What a work out. Walking up the stairs in the towers seemed never-ending. Once we arrived at the top, however, loved the views and the architect's work on the chimeras (monsters or mythical creatures) that boldly stare down at the city.
Crowds. There was a line to get into the cathederal but it mopved quickly. Getting out was another story as there was a non moving bottleneck at the exit.

Great view, limited to where we could go. waited a good hour to get in, thankfully had passport with me so we didnt need to pay for entry, loads of stairs to top (not too bad, little steep). AMAZING views from top. wasnt told that the towers to very top were closed, so was very disapointed that we couldnt see the bells etc. i think it would deffo be worth a visit, just make sure you can go to the very top :)

the view makes its all worth it!!!. a must do if you are visiting Notredam. however, please make sure you are physically fit to challenge the stairs that lie ahead as it is quite a climb up. the tower also gets narrower as you get closer to the top. there is a gift shop mid way so you can take a break and or buy some souvenirs. once you reach the top the view makes its all worth it!!! not recommended if your travelling with toddlers.
Go there. A lot of steps but it's worth climbing. Great feeling when you climb up and see Paris. And also, it's great to see the gargoyles up close.

a must...if you're in shape. this is one of those Paris must-do things. Make sure your legs are up to it. I held up the ascending line on the the narrow circular stairs as I huffed and puffed my way to the top (worth it) and just about crawled out the access door to the viewing area (my husband captured the moment on film, naturally). Once back down in the church, our little girl whispered to me "Mommy, is that God shaking my legs?". Get in shape and do it!

To visit for a fantastic view over Paris. A reference punch of world tourism. To visit for a fantastic view over Paris. Attention to who does not have a good physical condition to climb stairs for the tower.

Amazing. The most amazing view of Paris. It was raining that day and a queue was much shorter. Also it was my birthday and it was great start for celebrating. Long way up, but on the way down The bell started to ring. I was absolutely impressed.

Tall tower, long queue. We waited 45 minutes to climb to the first level then 10 minutes to climb to the next (time around midday). Yes there is a nice view but the views from Tour Montparnesse, or the top floor of Printemps store or at Sacre Coeur are just as good. There are a lot so steps so not for those who are unfit, over weight or have a heart condition!

Notre-Dame - Towers Above All. Breathtakingly beautiful, inside and outside! I was moved to tears just being there. Many, many tourists - beware of pick-pockets, in the guise of guileless teens out for a good time. I had no trouble at all. Lots of walking about so be prepared to spend a lot of time on your feet. A splendid, magnificent vision!
Must see. Of course this is a must see. It's in one of my favorite areas of Paris. Very nice for walking. Don't miss it.

Terrific holy experience. Visited the Cathedral with my wife and three children who are 14, 11 and 5. Had a chance to quietly explain a few things to each of my children and watched my youngest one light a candle and kneel and pray for our safe journey. I was also pleased when they took a real interest in knowing more about the passion of Christ and the crown of thorns. Excellent attraction, a must visit for any Christian visiting Paris.

You don't have to go in to enjoy. If you want to go into the cathedral and climb up for the view skip this review.This is cathedral that is best viewed from afar. If you cross the Seine you can get some great photos.Take your time and walk all the way around.Some good photos can be taken between the Kiosks along the Seine.
Awesome. What a beautiful Cathedral. Just make sure you are there early in the day so as not to have ithe church close the interior on you. Another bucket list idea!
Loved the Tour. What an experience! Great view and great architecture! Well worth the wait. I love Paris! i enjoyed our tour and the wonderful history.
A real death march!. Definitely worth the view but was a killer after having just done all the steps at the Arc de Triomphe. We ached for the next two days.
Worth the wait. The wait is long but when you get to the top you are awarded with great views and you get to enjoy the argoyles and other architectural features
Great Tour!. THE most famous, IMO, church in the town. Worth the wait and time to tour this amazing church! Architechture/History abounds.
Notre Dame. Saw these when passing by on the river cruise, yet again another place with long queues if you arrive late in the day, still enjoyed the atmosphere though.

Worth the 275 steps. Outstanding views of Gargoyles, Paris and an understanding and feel for the history of this siginificant church. The lines will be long but they should more quickly....people will try to cut into the lines, just let them know that it is unacceptable. going to Notre Dame without this tour will not give you an understanding of this great church. you won't be sorry

Good, but not great. We visited the towers because we queued at the wrong line. We actually wanted to see the inside of the cathedral. The queue was horrible: spend more an hour in the hot sun. You are not actually visiting the cathedral, you just climb a few hundred stairs to get a beautiful view of the city(which is not panoramic by the way). I think, if you plan to visit the Eiffel tower, there is no point in spending the time and money on this. The cathedral itself it's a another topic(and free by the way). The cathedral I strongly recommend. You don't get too see both on the same tour. You have to queue for both the towers and the cathedral.

from outside. we went early in the morning and the line was very very long. So we just took some pictures from the outside. We tried again next day but the line was still very very long, so we never went inside.

Up close with the gargoyles. Great views of the city, up close to the gargoyles. Annoying queuing time (45mins) at the bottom, then mini-queues at various points of the trip to get up and down at other points. Free with museum pass, but stil have to queue with everyone else.

Come face to face with Charles Laughton. "The bells, the bells". Just take the staircase to the towers and enjoy the view of the square below. You can even touch the gargoyle surrounding the cathedral. Don't miss this opportunity to experience a great heretical sight.

Loved the view - watch the time. Really enjoyed the view here.Becareful of the times though: they close the line about 1hr before they close the tower. Also, it's only open late in July and August (NOT June as some guides will say). We squeezed in as the last people by sweet-talking the guard, but everyone else was turned away. Even so, we still didn't get into the bellfry, but did see all levels of the tower.Note there are lots of steps and spiral up inside the tower. There's not a lot of space and few places to allow other to pass.Buy a museum pass to skip the line for tickets which is part way up.
Celebrating 850 years !. ... and getting a needed clean up on the venerable cathedral.Be there early to beat the huge summer crowd!

Much better views than from the Eifel Tower. Worth the wait and the money. You can see the city over rooftops as well as the sculptures (gargoyles) of the Notre-Dame Cathedral. In my opinion ... the views are better than from the Eifel tower...

Why & how to climb the steps. The view is the best in Paris. The top of the Montparnasse Tower and the Eiffel Towers are great for counting square miles, but too high to see what's going on. The Arc de Triomphe has a great view of the Champs-'Elysees, but the ND Tower view is the best because it's high enough to see the city but low enough to see the people. AND it has those awesome gargoyles to frame your views or see up close. On June 5th (Wednesday) I got to the entrance 10 minutes before opening (10 daily) and waited 30 minutes. Later is worse until 430 or so. The early light is better for viewing & photos, so go before 10 AM. Next: If you don't want to take the final south tower climb, which does not add a whole lot, especially if you've looked down from Eifell or Montparnasse, there is NO WAIT to decend from the main viewpoint between the towers. Nobody seems to know this, but the waiting line is for the south tower only, and the guy holding the rope over the exit will let you by if you just point down.

second time visiting this famous cathedral, but first time up the tower. we went to see the cathedral quite early in the morning, so no line at all. afterwards found the line for up to tower, is outside the cathedral on your left hand side if you facing the main entrance. it was rainning a bit, luckily we got umbrela, can not image in wintor time waiting outside for long. tower open for visiting 930 am (april), took us only 15 min. suggest go to bathroom before you lie up, as no bathroom facilities( or not easy to find) and nearly 400 narrow circular stairs you have to go up once you start, not easy to back off. view at top is spectaculars, you can take great photos but without yourself in the picture as the safty bars there. there are two layers for visitor, after first one, you can choose go down directly (i saw a lady had to go down, because she needs bathroom) or go one level up, if you want to go one more level, you need wait, we waited for about 20 min. afterwards talked to a couple, they did not know there is another level, just coming down with the crowd. cathedral is free, only towers need entrance fee, including in museum pass, worth it, if not may skip it. PS: you only can see the bell after august.
Didnt see Quasimodo. Lovely picturesque Cathedral with so much History but didnt see Quasimodo. Must have got the hump!!!

Amazing. This is truly a magnificent attraction. The intricate workmanship is unbelievable. The lines move swiftly and there is a surreal presence when you are inside this cathedral. There is no admission fee to enter which was unusual as I would have willingly paid a fee as it is definitely worth it.

Breathtakingly beautiful!. We loved this cathedral built on a small island. We walked around it and went inside it and loved each bit of it. The windows with stained glass look amazing from inside. A great piece of gothic architecture.

Worth every step to see the views. This was my first visit to Paris and it was on my list of course!Upon arriving there were so many people but the line up went quickly to go inside this Cathedral.I took my pictures and before you know it I was outside again. To visit this you must and I do say Must go up to the towers to see the views. A bit of a wait but you know if this might be your only time then I suggest please wait. The line up is on the left hand side when you face Notre-Dame. I waiting at least 1 hour and again once inside after you pay you wait again in room. I think its because there are only a certain amount of people at a time going up the stairs to the outside views. Of course they are winding and you might get a bit dizzy so take your time.I was so excited to see the huge gargoyles and the views of couse . Don't miss the opportunity of a lifetime.

Spectacular. Be sure and make the climb to the top - the views are amazing. I spend nearly four hours there and could have stayed longer. And you get to take pictures inside (unlike Sacre Coeur - which is also worth a visit).

Great View and Experience worth the 400+ steps. If a great view of Paris from one of it's most iconic locations excites you, the Towers at Notre-Dame is a must.Get to see the smiling gargoyle up close.Be forewarned - you have to be ready for the 400+ steps up and 400+ steps down.

Breathtaking. You can't go to Paris without visiting Norte dame. The rose window is breathtaking. You can spend at least an hour walking along the outside taking in all its gothic gargoyles and famed saints.

Worth waiting in line. This was my second short trip to Paris. I had the chance to spend a few hours without a rush. If this is your case. Go for it!The 360° view of the city is worth breathtaking. The gargoyles are beautiful and you get to see them some centimeters away.

A spectacular view from one of the world's essential sites. My wife and I journeyed up the steps here yesterday, not for the faint of heart or the creaky of knee. But the climb and the 30 minute wait at 3 PM were well worth it. The view of Paris from the heights overlooking the Seine was terrific. Too bad the bell tower was closed, but it will re-open in September. And it is included in the Museum Pass.

Best views of Paris!. The inside of the cathedral is spectacular, but as you climb the 422 spiraling stone steps to the top of the towers you keep thinking, they built this without machinery. And many hundreds of years ago. Then you hit daylight and a view of Paris that is the post card shot. Additionally, you see the gargoyles and statues that you had been zoomin in on from the ground. Now you can touch them. This was our last planned activity in Paris and it was one for the memories.

A must place to see inParis. The cathedral by itself is magnificent inside and out. The paintings of the glass panes that adorned the walls are awesome to look at and the altar is so grand, You don't have to be religious to appreciate the work of art within its confines. It also helps in appreciating the place that it was the backdrop used in "The Hunchback of Notre Dame".

notre dame cathedral. You must put Notre Dame cathedral on your must see list. To say it is beautiful does not do it justice. It is incredible from the outside and the inside. The stained glass windows are stunningly beautiful and intricate.
A stunning view of the center of Paris. If you are prepared to climb more stairs than you are likely to remember, some of which are in fairly tight quarters, this is well worth the time. Beautiful

Excellent Masterpiece. Front is Equally amazing on the back , Inside of the church is pure diving with the paintings in the glasses are just awesome. A must visit place in paris and Of course dont forget to buy a Souvenir for the memory

We went there quit late becouse of rain :( queue was very very long , maybe 300 people , I swear !! But it was worth it to wait . We went there quit late becouse of rain :( queue was very very long , maybe 300 people , I swear !! But it was worth it to wait in the rain . There is also a sign " no pictures " but everyone was with camera :) to avoid the queue better to go in the morning before 10 am :)

Great View of the City. We went there an hour before it opened at 10 a.m. There were three people in line already. Prepare to wait for longer otherwise. The climb was effortless compared to the one at Sacre Coeur because you have a chance to rest at the ticket level and then at the bottom of the towers. What you will be awarded for your effort is a great view of the city and close encounter of gargoyles. Each gargoyle is different but look for the bored gargoyle.
Must see attraction!. Above all other attractions and incredible sights this is my favorite in Paris. A must see. Go early to avoid the crowds. Architecture is quite incredible.

Expected to see more. After visiting the inside of the cathedral, i had to come back the next day to climb the towers. The stairs were long and narrow, just like I imagined but when we reached the top, we were a little dissapointed, we thought there's more to see. The view is superb, but after being on top of the Eiffel tower, nothing compares. A good attraction, but if you're short on time simply visit the cathedral from inside and forget about the towers.

Notre-Dame De Paris 2013. I visitied Notre Dame last month and also joined a free walking tour onsite. Coincidentally, Notre-Dame is celebrating its 850 years anniversary this year and it was quite crowded even at 3pm. The Cathedral is really quite awesome and the details of the carvings and metal works on the cathedral are really quite out of the world. I joined a local walking tour while in Notre-Dame and the guide, a local Parisian, talked us through the little stories and myths of the Cathedral and even brought us through some of the alleys beside the Cathedral. The visit was both inspiring and humbling. Just beside Notre-Dame, the is a street with quite a number of shops selling souvenirs like scarfs, t-shirts, key chains etc. so you can squeeze in some shopping if necessary. There are also some little cafes that sells hot wine and crepes (with Nutella) out of the windows, interesting option for a quick lunch!

Best View of Paris from Degree Zero. I had been to Paris 3 times, in and out of Notre Dame and St. Chapelle before taking the time to wait in line to climb to the top of the towers. It's time-consuming but well worth the wait. Wonderful clear shots of the city in panorama.

A Must See Attraction. It is hard to come up with the appropriate words for this place- spectacular, breathtaking, amazing all come to mind but don't really do the place justice. Crowds are heavy, but well worth the time.
Notre-Dame. I was in Paris twice and each time visited Notre-Dame. It is especially exciting to walk by it's corners, imaging the actions, described by Victor Hugo.

Great. Its doesn't take long time in the queque. I visited it twice, once was 800 hundres anniversay of somethings, looks cool. It s nice to have a coffee in the café accross the bridge, the vue is great! But the waiters there are asxholes.

Visit with small kids . Well worth the 1 Hour wait. First stop in the shop where you can buy the tickets. Then to the balcony, where you'll have sufficient time to get all impressions. Then up to the south tower for a panoramic view. Long climb of 422 steps.

Not a cathedral person, but wow, what a view!. I am of the philosophy that if you have seen one gothic cathedral, you have seen them all. Even though Gothic architecture is to allow more light, I find them dark. But that is just me. It is beautiful and amazing the blood, sweat, tears and years that went into their construction given the time period. I do appreciate that. The angles, gargoyles and plays of light make for wonderful photo opportunities. I don't know if it was temporary or permanent, but there was a structure by the crypt entrance, a walkway and steps/seats in front of the cathedral that took away from the beauty of the outside of the cathedral. What makes this cathedral stand out for me though is the hike up 402 steps to the top of the bell tower. The entrance to the tower is on the left side of the cathedral. The line is long and it will take you an hour or so of standing. They take you up in groups. Get there early, they close at 4pm and close the line sometimes as early as 2:30 depending on how many people are waiting. You hike partially up (I did not count the steps) to an area when you buy your pass to the top. If you have the paris museum pass, you don't have to stop, however, this is a good opportunity to take a little breather before you head up higher. I had the museum pass, but I will admit I stood in line, pretending I needed to buy a ticket just to catch my breath. There are little landing area's every now and then as you hike up. I did take another couple minute breather at one of the landings, but it was not that bad. I imagine though if you have any problems walking up steps or do not do any aerobic exercise ever, this could be very difficult. Once you get to the top it opens up to a beautiful view of the city, all the way around. It can get crowded, but there will be plenty of time and opportunities for pictures, so just take your time and enjoy the view and take as many picutures as you can. It is amazing. There was a group of school children up there when we got there so it was a little more crowded for us, I think. Once we made our way around, there was a staff member that held us up before we could go down the steps, or so I thought. It was a little frustrating there as once you get to that point, you can't move and people were getting a bit too close for comfort and irrational thoughts start running through my mind. This thing has stood the test of time for over 700 years, been through multiple wars, but now I am thinking the weight of the 30 or so people standing there is going to bring it toppling down and we will all crash to our untimely deaths. Here I am safe and sound typing up my review so... no worries. The staff member opened the door for us to go down, or so I thought....nope, more steps up!! We were only on the bottom of the bell tower, you actually climb more steps and walk around the top of the right bell tower. Now I though the view was beautiful before... that was nothing compared to now. You actually are looking down on all the buildings. Simply amazing. It was a very nice sunny day and about 50 degrees. I imagine it can get cold, but it was nice when we were up there. You can see everything. It was a better view than the Eiffel tower, in my opinion. You can even see the locks sparkle on the Pont des Arts bridge, it looks like gold. I would highly recommend the hike to the top for those that can do it. It makes just another gothic cathedral a spectacular memory.

A brilliant View well worth the climb. You will not regret making the climb up the hundreds of stairs to the towers of the Notre Dame, once you are over the beauty of the internal Cathedral you can then pay to go up the to the spire and you'll get a stunning view over Paris. Great photo opportunities.
Notre Dame. what can I say? very impressive and i was waiting for Quasimodo to come leaping down the side of the towers. a very beautiful building
My favorite thing!!. We loved this place. Make sure to walk to the top for awesome pics. The Chimeras were so cool!! The views of Paris were unbelievable. I highly recommend going to this cathedral.

Amazing Views. Was able to go to the top of Notre Dame with the Paris Pass for free. Be advised that there are 422 steps that you will climb up/down on this tour. We wait about 30-45 mins to do this but it was worth it. The 360 degree views of Paris are amazing. Great spot to take pictures of the Eiffel Tower, Sacre-Coeur and the district of Montmartre. When you get down you may want to sit for a bit, as your legs get a little jiggly and you might get a little dizzy from the circular steps.

Amazing building. This is an Amazing building but you really need to be there early as the queue can become massive !The windows are remarkable and it is clear that this still impresses the visitors still today.

Gargoyles and a fantastic view. climbing up the towers of Notre Dame offers a wonderful view of Paris and the opportunity to get an up close look at the gargoyles and some of the intricate details of the outside of this historic Paris landmark.
Not for the faint hearted. This was well worth the long wait to get to the top amongst the gargoyles, fantastic views but not for the unfit or faint hearted

The twin spires and flying buttresses!. The towers are a landmark when walking Paris. WHen you spot them, you know where you are. While the towers I personally find less inspired than the flying buttresses and back side of Notre Dame, they are synonymous with this famous and lovely area of Paris.
Notable. Got there on Palm Sunday, which made it even better. Grand cathedral, though a bit overrated. Strasbourg is even better.

Long lines, long climb, but worth it. We came at a poor time so we had to wait in line for over an hour before entering, even with our Paris Passes. The 422 step climb was intense, but there were points where you could take a break. The top is very small and there isn't much room to maneuver, but the views are worth it.
Must See!. The interiior of the church stunning. The view after your stair climb Worth IT! Get in line early for your stair climb. Stunning views and Amazing architecture.

Worth seeing the stained glass windows. Loved the history associated with this great architecture & also loved the stained glass windows. Get a guided tour if history is your interest.Sometimes there is a long wait and there is no place to stand outside if it were to rain. But real nice to walk around...a few cafes & small curio shops around.

A stunning view of Paris and it's hidden gems. For 8,50 euros and maybe a queue of one hour you get an amazing view of the city and the many creatures of the towers. The bells ringing add to the drama but you cannot resist the amazing photos over the city with some stone-clad friends overseeing the city. The steps are tough going so be prepared for 400 odd steps and beware the tricky bit is actually coming down the stairs while others are going up. But this is only to ascend the very top tower, not for the faint hearted!

Great, but too crowded. I'd say it is a must to visit the Notre Dame south tower. So you have to accept that everybody does the same - hence long waiting lines, even after entering and on your way up. Guards tell you where to wait, where to stand and when to proceed. Nevertheless, it's worth the effort and discomfort - you haven't been in Paris if you've missed out on this!!

Fantastic view, worth the wait (lots of windy stairs!). I waited in line in the freezing cold for two hours but it was definitely worth it. The view is incredible but be aware there are a lot of stairs to climb and they are qite narrow and windy so this may not be for everyone. Also, the line moves VERY slowly so it may not appear long but it may take a while.

Worth the wait!. We went on Good Friday, and there was quite a crowd when we arrived, but thanks to a review I found on Trip Advisor, we knew exactly where to go to get in line! The line was quite long, and in the morning was protected from the sun by the church (NOT a good thing when it's cold outside!) The line does move very slowly, but those with a Museum Pass can bypass the lines.Once you start the climb of 487 steps, the pace was slow and steady. You go up about 100 steps to the gift shop, where you buy your tickets if you don't already have them. Then you start your climb in earnest. It's not too bad, though. You stop at the first balcony and can walk most of the way around the church to enjoy views from all angles (until August, 2013, one side is closed for maintenance :( - too bad!) and take your pictures of the gargoyles up close and personal! There is an opportunity at this point to climb an additional staircase to the very top of the cathedral to catch some breathtaking views!.
Nice view, could be a long wait. Worth seeing at least in one of your visits to Paris. Make sure that you are in decent shape to be able to make it to the top since there isn't an elevator up.

Worth the Line, Worth the Climb, Worth the Wait!!!. Before I review the visit, I must first stress that you SHOULD NOT wait until the end of the day to visit the towers. The listed closing time is 5:30 I believe, but they started turning people away around 4 PM. They must have turned away 60+ people who wanted to climb the tower but were too late, so make sure this does not happen to you because you will be missing out on an incredible experience.Step 1. The Line. The line is long and no you cannot skip it, but it's worth it! Plus you can go pick up some food from the nearby vendors to make the wait go by quickly!Step 2. The Climb. Long and dizzying, perhaps skip this attraction if you tend to suffer from vertigo because it's a long and winding climb. Still, it's all part of the experience and I actually found the climb to be kind of fun and entertaining.Step 3. Showtime. You wait in line, you climb the stairs, and all the while you are hoping that it'll be worth it. Well, rest assured, it is worth it! To see the gargoyles up close, to see different angles of Notre Dame, and to see Paris sprawled out before you... it's just beautiful! The towers and gargoyles are obviously famous thanks to Victor Hugo (or Disney) and are worth the climb to see up close as it is, but when you add in an unparalleled view of Paris, climbing the Towers of Notre Dame becomes an absolute must! Being atop the towers, taking in the views with my fiancée was one of my favorite moments in Paris. It was very, very special and I encourage everyone to climb the towers and take in Paris from this magnificent vantage point!

Great Experience But Be Prepared to Climb Stairs!. I didn't really researched what I was IN for when we went to the South Tower. So was kind of in a shock when I realised the circular stairway looks like its endless. There are 387 steps. No elevator whether you going up or coming down - so make sure you are fit. We queued for about an hour before we get in. Once you reach the top, the view is amazing. A little squeezy though as there were many people during out visit.

Nice views, long wait. So this is worth the ?7.50 if you want another great view of the city. It was feezing the day we went, so that distracted me from what have otherwise been an novel experience. Watch the time though. Saturday the closed the line over 1hr early (@ 3:45pm). They let groups of about 20 people up every 10min so the line moves in spurts. No food or drink allowed, no bathrooms either.
so much history, so many emotions.... A must see....but don't expect too much. our guide was super and told us lot of interesting stories...of course some related to Napoleon....
interesting. Though i am nota christian but this cathedral is a delight to look at. The way it has been built and teh level of detail that has been given to each tower is amazing. Must do in Paris

One of the must sees of Paris if you can stand the lines. Impressive and beautiful. Best to visit off season but of course that isn't always an option. Be sure to walk around the church. Beautiful gardens at the back and you will see all the padlocks on the bridge... this is where the practice first started even though you will see padlocks on other bridges.

Must Wait For The Walk To The Top. We used our Paris Pass here, but couldnt skip the lines.It is worth the wait after the long narrow walk upstairs to see the magnificent view.They also have a souvenier shop half way up, seems like a scam, but when you buy something, they let you continue up to the top, otherwise you have to wait 10mins.

Amazing. This church " notre dame de Paris " is one of the mots beautiful monument in the world.
In the heart of Paris just near the Seine .
Inside notre dame It s fantastic .

Must see !!. This monument is one of the "must see" landmarks of Paris! You can't visit Paris without at least once visit this Cathedral! It's amazing and beautiful! Try to visit the towers (not very expensive, free if under 18), you'll have a beautiful view of Paris!!Beware you can wait a long time before being able to go up and visit the top

Amazing!!!!. I didn't expect this place to be so huuuuge!! Amazing building outside and even better inside. The gargoyles around the building makes you believe that they are going to be alive... Just amazing. A MUST visit!!!

Another worthwhile view. The views of the city with the close ups of the gargoyles was unique. Make sure to get there early as they let in 20 people every 10 minutes, and the line gets long late in the day.
amazing view!!. amazing cathedral to see, and even a better view from above. The gargoyle and statues around the cathedral are

Be prepared to wait. The line is usually long for the towers, so be prepared to wait. Fortunately, there are a lot of food vendors nearby, so if you get hungry, you can always send someone from your group to pick up some food.

Towers of Notre Dame offer iconic views of Paris. Yes, the cathedral was beautiful, but separate is the tour of the towers which offers perhaps the most spectacular views of Paris. There is a small admission fee, and this tour is not for anyone who cannot climb many many small stairs easily. We lost count around 300 up and that's 300 down also. Once you arrive at the top you'll have plenty of time to look out over Paris in all directions. Just need to be patient if you want to linger to let other groups pass you by. You'll even get to tour the famous bell tower from the Hunchback of Notre Dame tale. The famed gargoyles of Notre Dame are impressive as well. This is one of my favorite attractions in Paris and is well worth the climb if you're able.

Beautiful chapel. This is a beautiful chapel, the queue moves pretty fast. It is very touristy so you cant really appreciate being in the church to pray or meditate. There is a good gallery that you can sit on outside and just take in the view. Its not far from the Louvre, a 10min walk quite enjoyable along side the siene river

All the way up!!!!!. Over 500 steps to climb but the views are amazing. I went on a Monday right before lunch and the waiting time is between 30 to 45 min. (I suggest to start falling in line just before lunchtime to avoid the long wait.) Once on top, the views are spectacular.

Come see the new bells in 2013. After 400 years or so, 9 new bells are being installed as part of the 850 anniversary of this famous cathedral. The year is full of celebrations and everyone should take part!

Lots of staris. We visited towers 1.2.2013 ~2pm. Waited in line like 20 minutes witch was longer than in eiffel tower or Arc de Triomphe. Shorly said lots of stairs but awsome view when you get up :) Free for under 25 year old EU-citizens ;)

Excellent views but avoid AVIATOR or Paris Vision. Excellent view of the old town, roof and gargoyles. Everytime I go to Paris I visit Notre-Dame (already 3 times). I'm in love with the gothic architecture and gargoyles.
With AViator or Paris Vision, are tours that you can do yourself, they don't give much service and the customer service is not existent.

paris with children.QUESTION. Hello, we are planing going to paris this summer, can anyone help me and suggest the best places to live ?
we are thinking in book an appartment at Sain germain de pres, in front of notre Dame cathedral.
Is a good place for children?
what can we do with them ?

Worth the stair climb!. Just a warning, lots of small stairs to climb to get to the top... but you're well rewarded with gorgeous views when you get there. Get there early as the queue is very long every day!

Scenic, lots of stairs. It's a very long wait in line, so get a crepe or a drink from the stand from across the street. Make small talk with other people in the line to make the wait more tolerable. The amount of stairs that this attraction contains is a test of your endurance. The spiral staircase is very narrow and steps are small, so take note of this prior to going. Wear sensible shoes, of course. Definitely an attraction to bring your camera along to, as the view from the top is just amazing. You will get many different perspectives as you can walk along the path and take pictures from many different angles.

Very Humbling!. 850 years old this year, this cathedral is magnificent. It has been present through every major event in the history of Paris. Quite awe inspiring! Take time to really appreciate this cathedral.
stairs. a good effort to have a close lock of the beauty of gothic arts. they towers are the the other side of interior of the cathedral

One of the symbols of Paris. Notre-Damés first stone was laid in 1163 in the presence of Pope Alexander III . It is a Gothic style cathedral. The South Rose window is amazing, so much light. There are 3 organs in the Cathedral: the great organ, the choir organ and a positive organ.

Simply must-see. The architecture of the building was simply amazing. One cannot imagine how the church was built then.I also attended the Sunday Mass there and was bowled over when I heard the sound of the pipe organ. You just have to visit it to see this magnificent building for yourself.

Beautiful Architecture and History. Our visit was very brief as it was part of a trip around the main attractions in France. I wish we could have spent longer there, it is an amazing building and making a huge mark on the area. Didn't see the hunchback of Notre Dame....may be next time

Climb into the Legend. Notre Dame lives up to its legendary, iconic stature—and there’s no better way to feel like you are actually a part of the cathedral’s legend than by taking the climb up its famous towers. Here, at the top of the cathedral towers, with Paris spread around the island in all directions, you can almost feel the pulse of the cathedral’s heart and soul beneath your feet. It’s easy to imagine the centuries of populations, architecture and history growing out from the very spot where you stand. The sense of history and spirit on top of the towers vastly surpasses the climb up any other Parisian monument (excluding the Eiffel Tower, of course). Not only will you have a stunning view of the city, but also access to the church’s bells (think Quasimodo from HUNCHBACK OF NOTRE DAME) and you will be able to pet the gargoyles that line the cathedral. The climb is not easy (402 steps), but if you do take the challenge, halfway up there is a convenient giftshop where you can catch your breath and buy a souvenir. The climb down has no such rest-stop. Just take your time and be careful on the stairs. TIP: The line to climb the Notre Dame Towers can get long during any and all seasons. Start lining up perhaps 10 minutes before the towers open, which will give you sufficient time to take pictures of the cathedral while in line and beat the crowds. Besides, the morning view from the towers is likely the best! Also, beware of gypsies since many aim to scam the line-up of tourists here.

Very spiritual place. This is a special year for the cathedral of Notre Dame because it is its 850 th anniversary. It is 850 years that it is the spiritual heart of Paris. We went there on the 24th of December and it was a perfect time, just at Christmas. There was a mass in the afternoon but you could just walked around and visit while the mass was going on. In a big area there was the most beautiful "creche" (Nativity) I ever saw and, with the music and the choir, it was a very special moment, very spiritual.
Lovely views. Climbed to the top where of course there is a cracking view!! Quite a quick queue as well...and very interesting inside

This was spectacular. We'd been to Notre Dame before but never up the towers. Not sure why as it was unreal. Despite the queue, rain and construction on top, this is one trip I would do again. The kids handled the stairs just fine (much to my surprise), and the view from the top was spectacular!

Great!. Yes, the line sucked, however I have waited longer to get on a rollercoaster ride. Before I joined the line I got a crepe from across the street, and I was content! The visit was worth it. Students get in for free (woot). Of course this is a popular spot so people are shuffled along the top of the tower...I didnt really like this feeling but I understand why it is necessary. The stairs are not fun to climb, but luckily I was at the back so I could stop on the stairwell to catch my breath. If it is foggy outside, do not go because you will not be able to see anything!
Amazing architecture. Great place to visit, in the evening with its lights it looks something out of a book, people chill in the near park and the view from the river takes your breath away

Worth the Wait!. It was my last day in Paris and I had one thing left to do - Climb the towers of Notre Dame. After two days of stunning Autumn weather, the day had dawned with a thick fog shrouding the city. I had intended joining/starting the queue at 9am to get up there early but decided to wait to see if the fog lifted. I queued for around 45 minutes (while people kept pushing in to the queue...that is very annoying and something that happens everywhere!) I followed the instructions to have the correct change 8 E 50 (although when you finally get in there, you can get change from the cashier or even use a credit card!) The whole church is amazing, but taking the time to climb the towers is a must. The first flight of stairs is interesting, and then you pop out in to the foyer which is a stunning room with a soaring Gothic ceiling and huge paintings on the walls. This is where you buy your tickets and contains the gift shop. Buy something now if you want it, because you don't come back to this room. Then you are herded up the stairs. They get tighter and narrower as you near the top, but the walk and the claustrophobia is worth it for the VIEW! (having said that, it would not be good for someone who is large in size, very narrow passages. There is NO access for prams, buggy's or wheelchairs of any description). Paris is such a low-rise city and this view gives you a brilliant overview of the city. It is all one-way, and sadly I missed the east view. Be sure to turn left before heading west (towards the Eiffel Tower). I could have stayed here all day, but they do keep you moving and only allow each group 5 minutes at the summit. Definately a must-see, even for someone who has visited Paris many times. This was my 5th visit and the only time I have ever done this so I was very glad I finally did! If you only have 1 day in Paris, do this!

Better if people read signs. There was a service going on while I toured this church. My personal feeling is that the tour could have been held off, or people actually obeyed the multiple, multi-lingual "Silence" signs - and realized they apply to cameras too.Architecture, chapels and stained glass are all amazing.

A must!. Took a while to get in, about 45min queue when we were there, but it's worth the wait. The spiralling small stairs going up are interesting, then you're hit with the view when you step out at the top. Great fun and fantastic views.

Even the Gargoyles are Gorgeous here!. It was 2009 and we were visiting Paris yet again. I wanted to take my sister there - she lives in Australia now. When we got there, I could see that Notre Dame took her breath away - just as it had taken mine away in 2007. Even the Gaorgoyles are gorgeous. We sat on a bench in the square and just gazed and gazed at this monstrous - yet beautiful - cathedral. Inside, it is fantastically atmospheric too.

Tainted by the queue. We queued for an hour and a half in the chilly, wet off-season of November and it didn't really make up for it. Only 20 people can enter at a time so it really is a painstaking process. Aside front the bell there really isn't a lot to see and the although the views are great the Eiffel tower is twice as nice in that respect. If you really want to do it then arrive early in the morning and bring a seat.

Better come early... I arrived in Notre-Dame by taking metro 4 and stop at Cite. It was 10.30 am, and people were lining to enter the tower.. so I would suggest for travellers to arrive earlier.
